Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience -Renovations”
Reviews.Author: kleal
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the weekend for a birthday and we frequently stay here 4-5 times per year. We arrived at 5:45pm and the room was not ready for check in and we had a 6:30 dinner reservation we had to get ready for. This was just unacceptable. They gave us free breakfast for the trouble, but this is not good enough for a hotel of this standard. We were put on the 25th Floor to be awaken by the noise from the renovations, which were extremely loud. We had to nearly yell to hear eachother. I went to complaint but there were other people already complaining as well. As far as I am concerned I will not stay here again. Why charge full rates for rooms affected by the noise form the renovations? the Grand hyatt New york offered rooms at 50% that were affected by renovation noise. I had to pay full rates to have a LATE CHECK IN and A NOISY ROOM!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel. Good location.”
Reviews.Author: clausglogg
Reviews.Content: Sydney always nice to visit. The Hilton Sydney is a great hotel, with a nice executive lounge and a big gym. We enjoyed the "king suite" on 37th floor with views great views to 3 sides. Can recommend the Jewfish at the Glass Restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ErWei001
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Rooms are clean and beds were extremely comfortable. The location is also great with shopping and restaurants just outside the hotel. Breakfast is quite expensive but has a good variety of choices.

Reviews.Title: “If you were planning to stay here in the next few months... DON'T!”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly H
Reviews.Content: The Hilton, which is usually a nice option for travelers visiting Sydney, is now a place to avoid. They are currently going through renovations, and unfortunately they have not closed the room affected. I just stayed one night in what felt like a construction zone. At 7:00 AM on Saturday I woke the sound of hammers and drills. When I called to complain they said they knew it was bad and "frankly would not stay in some of the rooms themselves"... yet somehow it is okay to put paying customers in these rooms. If you are looking for a quite relaxing stay, please learn from my experience and go somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bill W
Reviews.Content: Easy to reach using train from the airport. Smallish but well appointed room and a truly large selection in the breakfasr buffet. Paid extra to have access to the Executive lounge but felt it was worth it. Staff were efficient and friendly. Will use again.

Reviews.Title: “Competent and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Bigozpete
Reviews.Content: The Hilton is well situated and an easy walk down to Darling Harbour and great dining places. Rooms are a little on the small side but very well appointed and modern. Service was great and staff very friendly and helpful. Other similar options to consider in the area are Sheraton on the Park or 4 Points Sheraton. Both very nice. 4 Points situated closer right on Darling Harbour. Check pricing in the day as they differ wildly. My stay at the Hilton was $230 for the 1st night and $340 for the next. This was consecutive midweek nights, so just make sure you check the rates for each nights stay.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: myvoyager
Reviews.Content: Excellent rooms, great service and location. Outstanding gym!

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast is a must!”
Reviews.Author: AusGirl84
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very conveniently located across from the QVB and Pitt Street Mall. Service is excellent, beds are so comfortable and large, clean, fresh room and breakfast is AMAZING! Get it on special and its a bargain at about AU$270 with breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Time for a bit of a makeover”
Reviews.Author: patch4750
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights before heading north to the Hunter Valley. We have been to this hotel before and are used to the general Hilton experience, HHonors members etc. This stay was disappointing. Several relatively small matters irked us, but they added up to an overall feeling that some changes are needed. We upgraded to a relaxation suite, which has the large bath in the middle of the bedroom/bathroom area with a very good toilet, shower, vanity layout. Here are the things that we found annoying...room not ready at 3 pm, a couple of large stains on the sole rug, a very uncomfortable chaise longue which meant the two of us had to use the separate chairs to watch TV, noisy air conditioners, even when turned off, strange phenomenon at 6 pm in the Exec Lounge, where there's a mad rush for the "free" drinks and canapÃ©s, and a bedside clock that couldn't be adjusted for the daylight savings change. Come to think of it, all the furniture was farly uncomfortable. We might give it a miss for a while, there was a sign in the lobby asking for forgiveness while an upgrade occurred. One final thing..the lobby valets were very attentive when we arrived in a taxi but couldn't be bothered when we left in our rental car..not good.

Reviews.Title: “Very Central”
Reviews.Author: OzSooty
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here after a night out with friends. Its location is ideal for for this or if you want to be able to walk to the main city attractions. We had a standard room, which was excellent - nice king bed, soft pillow, good bathroom with separate shower and bath. And we took the high floor option for only $9 extra - worth it. The Glass Wine Bar was excellent for a late night drink - a bit noisy but modern, sleek and a great selection of wines. We would have preferred the more atmospheric Marble Bar, but there was quite a queue. The hotel is centrally located between George and Pitt Streets and across the road from the Queen Victoria Building (QVB), and less than a block from Pitt St Mall, with no shortage of dining or breakfast options within a very easy walk if you prefer to get out of the hotel. There is a pedestrian entrance in George St but the car entrance is at 255 Pitt St.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID the Hilton hotel Sydney!!”
Reviews.Author: Stephen T
Reviews.Content: Myself, my wife and two children travelled to Sydney to have a "relaxing" four day break, and being a frequent traveller, the Hilton hotel with their reputable location in George street Sydney seemed the perfect place to stay in Sydney! Apon a late arrival to Sydney Friday night, I booked a table at the resturant where I was told I was certain to get a table, however when I took my family to the resturant Apon arrival I was told there were simply "no more tables" available! After being spoken to by extremely rude weighting staff, the resturant manager ensured us he had a table and apologized for the RUDE greeting by the female weighters! Friday and Saturday night were complely disastrous,with my family barely having one hour of sleep due to the noise from outside and the elevators! When talking to the manager, simply giving my feedback, I returned to my hotel room to find packets of ear plugs on our beds!!!! On the arrival back to our home (Adelaide) my wife and teenage daughters have had to undergo physeo to correct their backs due the uncomfortable beds which the Hilton provide, and catch up on sleep!! THERE WAS NOTHING RELAXING ABOUT THIS SO CALLED BREAK AT THE HILTON HOTEL SYDNEY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Reliable Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: anecessaryevil
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel food in Glass. Expensive, but wonderful wine list and food presentation. Dislikes- unreliable key system. Likes- staff, gym, breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for Sydney visitors”
Reviews.Author: Aussiebw
Reviews.Content: I'm a Sydney born and raised Aussie, but currently living in the USA. This is the hotel I recommend for all my friends in the USA looking for a great hotel in the Sydney CBD, with easy access to everything. Top notch service, and excellent staff. Have stayed here several times when coming back to Sydney with friends and family members. The hotel has never disappointed me. I recommend a "relaxation room", rather than just a standard room if you can afford it. They are really nice and it makes a difference to your overall trip. Also a very nice buffet. I have an upcoming stay in May and have 3 rooms reserved. Will provide an updated review then, and let everyone know how the rooms are this year. As a Diamond, i really hope to get an upgrade. Feel free to contact me if you have questions.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful high quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: RhyBee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights on business in March 2012. The room was very comfortable, clean and top quality. Very nice and clean bathroom. Amazing breakfast buffet with plenty to choose from. Dinner at the restaurant on the 2nd floor was also very nice however slightly expensive. I ordered dessert from the room service menu and unfortunately was very disappointed- was nothing as described and over baked. Despite this I would rate this hotel very high. Very friendly staff and a pleasure to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JTP7
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Sydney in Jan 2012 for 4 days and had a really great time. The room assigned to me had a great view of the city and the Sydney Harbor bridge. The room was very neat, bathroom and eminities were more than adequate. It was within walking distance to lot of restaurants and attractions. Had no issues at all with the stay. The staff was very friendly starting with the check-in process to final check-out. I will definitely stay here again on my next trip. Thank you, Hilton Sydney for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with breakfast to die for!”
Reviews.Author: willywonka09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton over an Easter long weekend last year, and despite being very busy the hotel's service was excellent. The hotel itself is very nicely appointed, and is in an excellent location in the heart of Sydney. The best part however was the breakfast buffet. Not your usual fare, this was the most expansive buffet have ever seen in any hotel or resort. Watch out for the Custard and Chocolate donuts fresh each day, they are to die for!

Reviews.Title: “Good location.”
Reviews.Author: DaMonk13
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for over a week. We were upgraded to the executive floor with access to the executive lounge, which is a nice benefit. The saff is nice and friendly and the room is nice. The executive lounge is nice with good drinks, food, and friendly staff. The location is just about a five minute walk to Darling Harbour and about twelve minutes to the Circular Quay. Right next to the city hall train station. Its central location is key.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Amazing management!”
Reviews.Author: Raman_1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled it Australia for two weeks in February. We stayed at the Hilton Sydney from Feb 5-8, 2012. On our trip we stayed at the Intercontinental Sydney, the Jupiters Gold Coast and the Meriton in Brisbane. The Hilton Sydney beat them all, and we would happily stay there again! The staff were very courteous and delightful to deal with. The check-in process was seamless, we were able to check in early in the morning even though normal check-in was at 3:00p. The room was very clean. Do get the breakfast package with the executive room, it saves so much time and money. The complimentary evening drinks and afternoon tea was an unexpected bonus!! Now for the service: The mark of great service staff is not determined by whether or not they get your requests wrong, but how they recover from them. We as human beings inherently make mistakes. As happened on our stay. I had brought and AC voltage transformer with me from Canada, and accidentally put it on the wrong setting, burning it. Much to my wife's dismay whose hair straightener was supposed to be plugged into it. I asked the "Magic" staff for a transformer, but the person accidentally brought up an "adapter" ... needless to say my wife's hair straightener met its demise. I noticed what the problem was, but I opted to go purchase my wife a new (cheaper) hair straightener before I went to complain to the front desk. They immediately fetched Sei, the manager, who was absolutely amazing in rectifying the situation. She investigated the issue with the Magic staff, researched how much my wife's hair straightener cost and immediately gave us a cash equivalent for it. No protest, no fuss, just an apology and pleasent service. Prompt service, understanding of a customer's concern and immediately rectifying an error is what was great about this hotel staff. This is something out of the ordinary that I have not seen any hotel staff in Canada or US do. The rest of our stay was very pleasant. Although the only thing I can complain about is something that I found to be a problem at every hotel in Australia; the Internet service fees of $29/day is ridiculous ( I pay that as my Monthly fee in Canada).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a short city break or business trip.”
Reviews.Author: MBMT2003
Reviews.Content: I stayed for five nights on a business trip and the hotel was perfect. Great location, bright, clean and well appointed rooms, friendly and very efficient service. My only gripe was the very poor value breakfast - 25 AUSD for toast and pastries, not even a juice!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service!!!”
Reviews.Author: Peter S
Reviews.Content: Slick, speedy, friendly service. Rooms were modern and clean. Air Con could have been a bit cooler.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Good”
Reviews.Author: Katejp99
Reviews.Content: The best of locations, modern rooms, and an excellent in-house restaurant make this my location of choice when in Sydney. Extra bonus is two great bars and decent room service.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: biggunsbetty
Reviews.Content: Arrived from the airport via taxi and the porter did not assist me with my luggage from the vehicle. Upon check-in I a carried my bags to my room. Room was small but clean. There is a TV in the shower area and that is different but good. Bed was too soft however staff were helpful and provided a board to firm up the mattress. Buffet breakfast food quality was average. Good customer service at the buffet breakfast especially from a Chinese girl working there that greeted me daily. I Chose to use the express check-out option to avoid the queues. 5 days after checkout my credit card was billed an amount inconsistent with my records. I called the Hilton and queried the bill and the lady said she would reverse the additional charge. 20 days later there had not be any reverse of charges so I called and another lady said she would take care of it and took my number to inform me of what is going on. Still no response so I have decided to tell it how it is. My advice, always check your bill if using express check out. I have never had a problem with this service prior to the Hilton Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning location in the centre of the City but rooms just OK”
Reviews.Author: Coorong
Reviews.Content: Modern rooms. stunning location in the centre of the action, but it just missed it for me. I had a room on the 43rd floor - so stunning view. I was woken by rain on the window during the night. Not the hotel's fault but it was quite noisy. The rooms are renovated and modern but felt a bit cramped. The shower was great but the rest of the bathroom also felt cramped. Ia ma Hilton Honours member and like Hiltons. This room was the size I'd expect in Paris. Food was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dreaming303
Reviews.Content: For business or holiday the Hilton know how to treat their guests. Shopping accross the road, public transport close by. Food around the corner. Business lounge staff couldn't be more helpfull. Thanks Hilton you did a great job again

Reviews.Title: “Good Central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheNomad0
Reviews.Content: Good Central hotel, average size rooms, nice pool and sauna! Large Gym. Shoppimng area directly across from the hotel. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing at Best”
Reviews.Author: MLORD13
Reviews.Content: Normally on business when staying at the Hilton Sydney but his weekend my son was competing at the junior athletics championships so my wife and i did a night at the Novotel Homebush and then a night at the Hilton to enjoy the CBD and Darling Harbour. I honestly thought we'd be ok after all I stay there regularly and am a diamond club member. All we heard last night was the 'doof doof doof' of the music from some club (probably the Zeta Bar) until the small hours of Sunday morning. Tried to check out this morning from the exec lounge but the staff were MAI (missing in action) and ended up waiting in a single line downstairs in reception with 5 other couples as we tried to check out. Wasn't a great experience and if I'm honest the Novotel was better all round (god that hurt to say that but it's true).

Reviews.Title: “Good central hotel”
Reviews.Author: WendyGoldCoast
Reviews.Content: Very central, close to all city attractions. Rooms are quite small though. Gym was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “1.5% extra charge for paying by credit card in this hotel - You may want to consider staying elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: CharlesMA
Reviews.Content: While this is a nice hotel with state-of-the -art amenities including automatic window blinds, a modern bathroom with TV in the shower stall, and complimentary slippers, I was bothered by the fact that they charged an extra 1.5% when paying by credit card. Don't know when is the last time I paid for hotel charges by cash. Room service was good, but the pizza leaves a lot to be desired. Location is excellent with the monorail a few steps around the corner. All in all, a very nice stay but still irked with the additional fee. I've recently left the Bank of America for them passing on such additional fees to their customers. Will feel the same way if more Hilton hotels begin to implement such fees.

Reviews.Title: “Far better than expected”
Reviews.Author: FionaJLinlithgow
Reviews.Content: 1 night stay only and did not have breakfast. The hotel is stylish and our room a good size, with chaise lounge, very well laid out bathroom with big shower area. Very comfortable bed, and great blackout blinds, we slept like logs! I would definitely recommend this hotel for its central location, polite and friendly staff, excellent restaurant, Glass (see separate review) but it is very busy and has a large amount of rooms so it may not be for everyone

Reviews.Title: “Perfect central city location”
Reviews.Author: lbwno
Reviews.Content: Ideally situated on George street, Queen Victoria building shopping precinct across the road.A short walk one block to Westfield, Myer and David Jones. The Town Hall train station can be accessed by the Galleries Victoria, next door under ground walk way for the train to the International and Domestic Airport terminals. $15.20 pp each way. The Monorail is just outside the rear entrance at Galleries Victoria taking you to Darling Harbour and restaurants. Safe secure clean tidy. A five star hotel lived up to its rating.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect city hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Mlfoley
Reviews.Content: An overnight stay in the Hilton was wonderful. The staff, the hotel itself and particularly the location....right in the heart of the city, near the new Westfield and across from the QVB. The guest room plus room is lovely, with modern bathroom. Although the room is quite small in size. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Flawless, but expensive.”
Reviews.Author: 4sure86
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in April 2011 Pros - Perfectly located in the CBD, good service and friendly staff, outstanding buffet breakfast with a lot of variety, particularly comfortable bed, nice building design, perfectly clean, great view. Cons - The king hilton guest room was small. - Rooms don't block out noise very well. I was awoken by people in the hall one night. - Price It's a very good hotel but I think my holiday experience would be more optimal staying in a cheaper hotel and spending the difference seeing Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stopover, in first class location in middle of Sydney after a Cruise”
Reviews.Author: Ken050
Reviews.Content: Another high quality Hilton in an excellent location in heart of city. We stayed here after a cruise with Princess to the Pacific Islands. We are regular Hilton patrons and find this hotel provides excellent and warm service. Location is excellent with ready access to underground station and the mono-rail around to Darling Harbour. Check in even mid morning was efficient and friendly with our room available as HHonors members. Rooms are as described of medium size with modern fittings and excellent facilities. Bed just so comfortable and excellent clean bathroom. Great view down George Street and across to Darling Harbour. Great gym. An enjoyable stay and we look forward to returning in July 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Pure luxury!!!”
Reviews.Author: ThePotatoHeeds
Reviews.Content: We were given a night here as a gift for arriving in Australia after a long flight from the UK and wow were we happy. What a comfortable bed after the journey. The hotel is amazing. We had access to the exceutive lounge as well and would fully recommend this too. The location is so central, perfect.

Reviews.Title: “It just works”
Reviews.Author: Suitcasewarrior
Reviews.Content: The atypical meet and greet by the concierge is all Hilton. Minimal wait at check in who has everything sorted and the keys were mine. A great view down George street and I was off to the gym. If your a gym freak this is the place for you- it has everything from free weights to pump classes to PT's. With a decent appetite it put on a collar and dined in Luke Magnum's Glass restaurant. The Hapuka with a freychnet Reisling was simple, sophisticated and well priced. PS The Glass team is sensational, well trained and know you are on business and big pleasure. Headed back to what is a smallest room but well appointed and immaculately clean. One point of discontent is no external fresh air though at the 27th floor I would be prudent as a hotel owner! Well done H. Your Magic model works so well and irrespective of the location, it is always the best home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “A very typical Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eric H
Reviews.Content: The Hilton is situated at the heart of Sydney CBD. Its definitely the best location Hilton in Sydney. The parking is very expensive if you need it. Best thing about the hotel, the breakfast is mouthwatering and breathless.. Aside from that, the rooms are your typical 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Groovychickkm
Reviews.Content: Loved the room, the staff and the location. Perfect. Already recommended to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Swe80
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at a very nice spot to look around. Also the staff was very nice! I stayed here for business and my kid sister who is traveling around Australia at the moment came up to visit me in Sydney. A really big thanks to the staff for letting my sister check in already 8 am! Good breakfast and the executive lounge was great. Will for sure stay here on my next business visit in April.

Reviews.Title: “An upgrade to an upgrade - WOW”
Reviews.Author: Pelorojo13
Reviews.Content: What an amazing surprise for the last day in OZ. We were treated like royalty and upgraded to a corner Executive Suite with an amazing view of the city. We took in the Executive Lounge for the afternoon tea and then returned for the evening canapes and drinks. Lovely staff, excellent food, and once again a great view. The room was spectacular - they gave us free wifi, a massive room with two bathrooms, dining area, two desk, three tvs...and on and on. The gym and swimming pool are second to none - so well equipped and not what you typically get any any hotel...and gratis - no less. At least three staff came up to greet up and speak to us about their gym - they are very proud of this facility and the staff show this to the guest. We went by the Marble Bar - it is gorgeous and the Manager greeted us personally - what a nice touch. After two plus weeks in Sydney and beyond, we were sad we had to leave as this hotel was fantastic. I highly recommend and thank the Hilton for giving us the best last night in this beautiful city and wonderful country.

Reviews.Title: “Great Short Stay”
Reviews.Author: flyingjaffas
Reviews.Content: Extremely central location, great for a bit of shopping indulgence. if you stay here you MUST try the buffet breakfast it is simply delicious and massive choice. The room was also excellent very tidy!

Reviews.Title: “Great affordable location.”
Reviews.Author: ballyfarnon
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights recently, Service very friendly. Food good value. Great location in the heart of Sydney. I would return!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Jason W
Reviews.Content: Great location, fantastic service. The Hilton is within walking distance to most places you'd want to visit as a tourist. The rooms are quiet comfortable and I always get a great night's sleep here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Calvinhobbes10
Reviews.Content: Overall experience was a pleasant one. Staff helped me with smooth check in process and room was functional and comfortable. Best part of this hotel is it's location. Just rightvand close to all major attraction in the city. It is right next to sky train which makes it more accessible. Had breakfast and lunch in The Glass restaurant. Awesome food and great service. We will come back again

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: rrlondon500
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on 2 occasions in feb both times very please. Gold with hh got me free breakfast. Rooms small but fine. Make sure you don't get room close to lift they ate noisy all night.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: zaraza77
Reviews.Content: Great stay, Breakfast buffet was amazing, best I've had in Australia. Access to a fitness centre in the basement, with a pool. Great location, Town Hall station very close by.

Reviews.Title: “Met expectations.”
Reviews.Author: khrisered_9
Reviews.Content: We state overnight just before christmas. Beautiful room with great views of Sydney skyline. Made for a romantic evening.

Reviews.Title: “Low 3 star masquerading as a 5 star!! Terrible...”
Reviews.Author: E B
Reviews.Content: Honestly, where to begin.... This is the worst Hilton we've ever stayed at, and we've stayed at a few around the world. We would normally overlook one or two bad points about a hotel, and I have never gone out of my way to write a detailed review before. However this hotel just continued to go from bad to worse & worse and hopefully this saves you from a similar experience! THE CLUB LOUNGE - Don't waste your time or money upgrading to the club lounge. If you're used to the high standard of food & service at most 5 star executive lounges, you will be seriously disappointed. - You are NOT provided with a full buffet breakfast in the main restaurant like every other hotel. You are only entitled to a cold continental breakfast in the lounge (stale, cold pastries, tasteless cheese, serve yourself coffee machine, sliced white bread etc) No eggs, no hot food whatsoever!! The little "Yalla" yoghurt pots where the only nice food option! - "Afternoon tea" included cold, stale scones, the Nespresso machine & a couple of apples. When I asked if it were possible to have them warmed i was told "we have no microwave"! We also asked for some cream to go with them, so a staff member went out the back & brought out a can of whipped cream & said "where do you want it?"!! OK?! - On arrival to the evening club lounge drinks, we (and several other patrons) were told that there were no tables left & asked to wait for a table to become available....what? You only have a window of time that the club lounge is open. How hard is it to count the amount of club lounge guest rooms & provide a sufficient amount of tables? - Only two of the club lounge staff, greeted us, smiled / were attentive. I don't blame them, it's just blaringly obvious that they have had zero training. ROOMS - We stayed on the club floor (level 35) & unfortunately (for us) the rooms appeared to have little or no sound proofing! - We could hear the pumping dance music & whistle blowing (a la Mykonos beach party!) coming from the club in another building on street level, throughout the night. - Other patrons coming and going, talking in the hallway etc (noises you usually hardly ever hear in other hotels) were loud! - Also, BEWARE of the "lift & pay" trays/fridge in the rooms! They have mini bar items that have some kind of sensor system where if you even pick up the item to look at it, you will be immediately charged the full price of the item!!! Total Entrapment, as they don't have a clear sign informing you of this. On check in we overheard a poor girl trying to dispute a apple juice charge on her bill, sounded strange at the time, but makes complete sense now. STAFF - Apart from the two friendly club lounge staff members (a really nice young Asian man, who always had a smile and was running around keeping things organised, and another male staff member who I'd guess was the club lounge manager) all the other staff looked morose & depressed... -To add insult to injury, on check out, we were told that we had been wrongly charged $84 for the buffet breakfast (the buffet breakfast we should have been entitled to with the club lounge package) But unfortunately had not received. So I complained about this & mentioned some of the other issues weâ€™d had with our stay. This front desk attendant was rude & patronising, not following standard customer service protocol, he repeatedly talked over me, and clearly didnâ€™t want to take on board any constructive feedback. So in the end he did not address our concerns, leaving us even more annoyed about the stay. This attendant, also refused to confirm that the wrongful charge would be removed from our bill, so fingers crossed we dont receive any other nasty surpises on the credit card bill....!! MY TIP! Save yourself the hassle and aggravation & stay at the SHANGRI-LA Sydney, not only is it the same price, but the VALUE you'll enjoy is on another level, this is a true 5 star. We stayed here a few months ago & it really is SUPERB!!!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alexios6
Reviews.Content: A modern hotel with tonnes of great features but also some great traditional elements. The rooms are brilliantly appointed and very comfortable. The location is very central and worth the money. The staff were very accommodating and helpful. Make sure you go to the Marble Bar!! It's absolutely a must see in Sydney. It's like stepping into another era. The pool area is nothing special, but the spas and saunas are quite good. I don't think this is necessarily a great hotel for families, but if you're there on business or a couple then it's definitely worth staying there.

Reviews.Title: “A very good location and place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JeremyC-99
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights across a weekend. We had a Deluxe Room on the 42nd Floor. The Hilton is in a great central city location next to the QVB and near the Pitt Street Mall. This puts it in easy walking distance of Darling Harbour, the main shopping strip, China Town, the Art Gallery of NSW etc. It is the first time I have stayed here for many years and the first time since the Hotel was refurbished. Service was very good throughout our stay - we did not put many demands on it but everyone we encountered was professional, smiling and helpful. The Hotel decor is smart and sophisticated throughout. Our room felt a little on the small side for a double with king size bed but this was partly attributable to the way the desk stands out into the room. The decor in the room was modern and smart throughout with almost all functions controllable from the bed (eg all lights, the TV, electronically controlled blinds, etc). The room airconditioning was good. The soaps, shampoos etc are good quality. The shower was great. Depending on the rate available I would definitely stay again. My qualifications that hold me back from an excellent rating are: 1) The room size - felt a little small; 2) WiFi is available but I gather there is a charge (I am not sure of the cost because I used my own WiFi modem) I do think that WiFi should now be free but find most Sydney Hotels still charge for it; 3) Car parking is on the high side - it cost us $149 for two nights whereas my experience is that CBD Hotel Parking is typically between $45 and $65 per night. On the latter point, to be fair, I should note that the car parking access directly under the hotel is very easy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: dmdriedi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights on Dec29 & 30. Nice hotel, good service and helpful staff. The bed was so comfortable. State of the art fitness and pool area. We couldn't get an early check in without paying extra but they allowed us to use the pool area which was very nice after a long flight. Great latte in the coffee shop downstairs and a nice lunch. Wish I could have stayed her for our whole visit over new years but the price jumped 3 times the regular cost so we went to another hotel for the rest of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: T A
Reviews.Content: We were impressed. Clean rooms. Nice views. Good location. Very friendly staff. A cleaner/room service guy even voluntarily went out of his way to press the elevator buttons with a smile for me. The only semi down-side was that it took 14 days for our incidentals deposit to be unfrozen (although there were three public holidays in that period.) But I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Class and quality”
Reviews.Author: LouMelbourne11
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel. I travelled for work and was very impressed by the entry, location, rooms, service and decor. It has recently been refurbished and has a fantastic feel. Perfect location for shopping and a walk to anywhere else. The zeta bar is great - wine list extensive- and Glass brasserie is fabulous! Impeccable service and menu. The only small issue is the size of the room- I had a king room, but I did find it a bit small - and my 'king' bed was 2 singles. I would definitely stay here again! Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “great location for work and play”
Reviews.Author: wendywelding
Reviews.Content: Hilton Sydney is located directly opposite QVB on George St. which makes it perfect for shopping and just a few minutes walk away from the financial and business districts. Coles and Woolies are located within 2 mins walk from the hotel. The rooms were refurbished a couple of years ago and still look brand new. I like that there are plenty of lights in the room and the shower is very well designed (Love the tv in the shower!) There's free wifi in the lobby. I arrived early on a monday morning and was delighted that the room was ready. Check-in and check-out was fast and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service and hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: chandler68
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic. The location was great, the service and the attentive hotel staff were impressive. I highly recommend this hotel and you will feel very taken care of

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel for work and play”
Reviews.Author: Liz E
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for taking in all the sights of Sydney. It is set amongst many top bars, restaurants and shops so everything is on your door step. The hotel itself is modern and clean. Rooms are a decent size but not huge. Rooms on floors 23 and above have been refitted so make sure you get oe of these. Bathrooms in lower floors are quite outdated with trickly showers. Electric blackout blinds are featured in each room, as well as flat screen tv with dvd player. Restaurants in this hotel are all of a very high standard but the prices do reflect this. Breakfast is the most extensive buffet I have ever seen and is full of fresh and flavoursome dishes. Only downside is $40. Staff are helpful and one touch 'magic' service very efficient. Concierge all very knowledgeable on local area and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Good value luxury hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: sigosling
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a Standard King room. I was on floor 26. See my video for what the room looked like. It was modern and clean, and a good size. The bed was very comfortable and there is a pillow menu. There was a shower but no bath. Complimentary toiletries were superb. The floor-to ceiling windows let lots of light into the room and there are loads of lights and dimmer switches to get room looking how you would like in the evening. There is a mini-bar and complimentary tea and making facilities in the room. The complimentary bottle of mineral water and piece of fruit each day was a nice touch. The desk was a good size. Hotel service is excellent. People always offer to help with luggage etc. and will do what they can to make your stay as comfortable as possible. All the staff were very welcoming and friendly. The service is 5*. Complimentary WiFi in the hotel lobby was very useful for checking the occasional emails etc. Breakfast each morning was superb, but not cheap, at around $AUD 42 per person. The selection of food was excellent; pastries, eggs, breads, sausages, bacon, fruits, muselis, cereals, teas, coffees, for instance. The hotel is well located. It is a about a 20 minute walk to Darling Harbour. Hyde Park is a 5 minute walk away. The Royal Botanic Gardens were a 20 minute walk away. Two train stations are within a 5 minute walk of the hotel too. I would definitely stay here again in the future. For the quality of room and service I received, I thought the room rate (around Â£115 per night) was very good value for Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Better Hotels”
Reviews.Author: beejem
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Funky vibe, beautiful rooms, and probably the most central location in Sydney. Can't fault the hotel or the associated restaurants and bars. Its a gem of a hotel and reasonable value... at least for Sydney!!

Reviews.Title: “It is a big Hotel with all you need to can relaxe”
Reviews.Author: siegfried b
Reviews.Content: Everything is fine,but the old Hotel before the restauration had been even familiar.

Reviews.Title: “Just a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: nixgreen
Reviews.Content: If you're after a hotel with a nice room, fantastic location, spotlessly clean and well trained staff, that exactly what you'll get and I don't think you will be disappointed. The plus of staying at the Hilton is you know what you'll get... but if you're after that lil' bit more, try a boutique hotel. It costs a pretty penny to stay here. Add each day $29 for Internet, $29 for breakfast and $48 for parking, and a mini-bar that charges $6.50 for a bottle of water (Mt Franklin), it is a bit disappointing to see the direction Hilton hospitality is taking. Great for the business traveller not paying their own bill. Personally, I'll be supporting a boutique hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and facilities but intrusive.”
Reviews.Author: Twentyk
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and found the location very convenient. The deluxe room was a little small but the bed was very comfortable. The fitness centre and pool are great. The house keeping staff were intrusive as they only knocked once and then proceeded to insert their keycard to unlock the door without giving us a chance to respond and go to the door! This is very annoying in the morning especially when we like to sleep-in. Even after we have turned on the 'do not disturb' light, it doesn't seem to mean anything. Becareful of touching anything from the mini bar and outside the mini bar as it will be charged to the room automatically as soon as you lift the item off its designated location, even if you are just having a look! Hilton needs to chill out a little and it would have been a better experience for us.

Reviews.Title: “a comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Nomadus
Reviews.Content: Sydney Hilton is centrally located, well maintained hotel. Rooms are smaller than one would expect from a Hilton standard, with bathrooms especially tiny. Glass restaurant is impressing, serves great breakfast. Exec lounge offeres a variety of warm and cold snacks, but only certain hours in late afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: imbarron
Reviews.Content: Staff polite and friendly at all times and went out of their way to help. Hotel modern, lots of places to grab a bite or drink if you wanted, room very clean and well organized. Never a wait for lifts. Breakfast was v. good, nice selection to choose from. If you want to be closer to the harbour, this is a bit further away but it's a nice walk down George St and you are across from the QVB. Only quibble - I ended up with an 'attached' room and the wall was obviously not soundproof - but I did get the room on a great sale, so can't complain. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but not the best”
Reviews.Author: Trezatraveller
Reviews.Content: There is a lot to commend the Hilton, but it has its drawbacks, too. We had a Business Room with access to the Business Lounge; the room was made smaller by the desk which was too big for the room size, though the bed was of a good size and very comfortable. A small point about the room was that the TV reception was very snowy - we moved later in our holiday to a different hotel about 700m away and the TV was crystal clear and showed almost double the number of channels. The Lounge was rather impersonal, with the staff insisting on serving drinks rather than allowing us to pour our own. The breakfast was good and the evening drinks and canapes were fine, with the reservation mentioned above. The staff were very helpful at all times, particularly those in the Lobby, Concierge and Outside Staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: AandHSydney
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from 2 nights at the Sydney Hilton, and it is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at. The bed was so comfortable with an assortment of pillows to choose from. The room was also impeccable clean. The view from the 26th floor was fantastic, and I spent some time drinking a cup of coffee sitting on the window sill watching the activity on the streets below.. The small touches were appreciated, like the complimentary apple and water each day. The room service menu was extensive and the food was quickly delivered with lovely staff. I would definitely stay here again and would happily recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite Hilton property”
Reviews.Author: GavinP12
Reviews.Content: The hilton Sydney is probably my favourite Hilton property i have stayed in. The rooms are typically sized for an inner city hotel but they are very clean, comfortable and provide everything in easy reach. They have over 40 floors, with 6 lifts servicing them and there is never a long wait even when you are on the 42-43rd floors. Amenities are plentyful, i never run out of anything there and if i forget my shaver or Shaving cream, i can ring concierge and they will provide dental kits (toothbrush and toothpaste) or shaving kits immediately. Towels are clean, fluffy and always more than i actually need. Internet is easy to access, although i would prefer they had WIFI in their rooms, its only available on some floors. The bed is comfortable, pillows are really soft but you have 5 of them to stack if you need more support, or better yet you can actually choose a pillow from the pillow menu. They always have a Magazine or 2 for you to read and the rooms are very peaceful with great sound proofing. The rooms near the elevator are probably the only ones with issues, and i would strongly recommend picking the rooms away from lifts in ANY hotel anyway. They also provide complimentary drinking water in the rooms and usually this is accompanied with a fresh apple. I cant really say anything bad about this place, the staff also make a great effort to remember your name. I was pleasantly surpirsed to be greeted by name stepping out of the cab one day after months of not coming to sydney by the bell boy who opened the door, and the cafe' staff near the main doors also make an effort to remember my preference in caffine! He didnt remember my name but i was only interested in coffee at 7am! The ONE thing i have noticed, (and this could be for eco friendly purposes) is that they have stopped providing the fabric carry bags in the rooms, and they have also stopped the personalised welcome cards. I used those bags to keep dirty laundry etc seperated in my luggage etc.. its not a big deal but I am clutching at straws to say anything negative. Price wise, they competitive and very marginally more expensive. I would say the $20-$30 premium is worth it for a good nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located but standard Room”
Reviews.Author: JackyYC
Reviews.Content: Very modern hotel beautifully located opposite Queen Victoria Building Mall. Room is comfortable for Hilton Standard. Got a gd rate through priceline bidding in otherwise an expensive hotel in a great (and expensive) city.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and staff and a GREAT gym!!”
Reviews.Author: husaisa
Reviews.Content: I was on a business trip and this was the next building over from my office, so it worked great. The staff was very accomodating and the breakfast buffet was also good. The rooms were adequate, although I feel the TV controls can be better (am being picky!!). All in all, I would stay there again, but I am biased due to the location of my office. But the Gym which is really a commercial gym in the basement is just outstanding with the classes and the machines among the best available. It is very convenient and the vibe just gets to you. I feel if you are the types who cannot get by a week without a decent workout - look no further!

Reviews.Title: “Long time ago - still in the memory”
Reviews.Author: BetoCarvalho
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hilton property during New Year break in 2007-2008. I still remember the hotel. It was very nice, although pricey (it was New Years break, it is understandable). Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business, less for leisure”
Reviews.Author: GRSHonolulu
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 days at the Sydney Hilton in mid-January 2012 while on vacation. We chose the hotel for its location, and the large indoor pool. The service and staff were excellent. The rooms were small and nicely renovated; suitable by urban standards. The large glass shower (there was no tub) leaked a bit, as did the sink. But the TV inside it was a convenient touch. This was an excellent base from which to tour and see key sites - all of which were walkable. Tour companies stop at the hotel and the metro rail and tram were minutes away. The large indoor pool and health club, which is a separate entity but which guests can access, was ideal. After each long day our 6 year old unwound at the pool, as did we. The restaurants were not kid friendly, but the McDonalds down the street was. So all good, but clearly a business hotel and not for leisure travel. Like everything in Sydney the hotel was expensive, but that was expected. Would consider it again, or the nearby Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton - Relaxation Suite”
Reviews.Author: MPS15485
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable room. My partner and I loved it. We could have stayed longer. We spent two nights as it was her birthday. I booked a suite, as I had heard rooms were quite small. It didn't disappoint. I even used wotif to get a cheaper rate. Also, we had access to the executive lounge. Hence, food was mostly included - canapÃ©s in the evening and breakfast. The staff are great too. We ordered fancy things that were extras. The staff were most accomodating and didn't forget a thing. A top hotel from my experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great Concierge team”
Reviews.Author: Dnevillecantact
Reviews.Content: I have recently stayed at the Hilton Sydney and although my stay was short it was most enjoyable I found all the staff extremely friendly and quick to respond to my needs especially the concierge. Nothing was a problem for them they had great inside knowledge and tips on most questions I asked.. Overall will be back when I'm in this part of the world again

Reviews.Title: “Quite pricey but usually great service.”
Reviews.Author: Pipnrita
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a few times and I've always been pretty pleased with the service. The sataff are always polite and knowledgable. There was once instance when our room wasn't ready by the allocated timeslot and they upgraded our standard room to a suite which was a nice touch! The standard rooms are modern and very clean, but they're also quite small- so if you're looking for somewhere with a bit of space- you'll definately need to go for the suite, in saying that it'd usually much more expensive. The breakfast buffet caters for all nationalities which is good and the coffee(unlike a lot of chain hotels) is great. Although usually quite expensive, i'd recommend the hilton in sydney over many other commercial hotels in sydney i.e novatel/crown plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton is the model of consistency”
Reviews.Author: driver37
Reviews.Content: Once again my trip was made more enjoyable throught the excellent service and facilities offered by this outstanding Sydney CBD Hotel. From check in to room and lounge facilities this Hotel manages to preserve its standards in ensuring guests have a memorable and comfortable stay. Keep it up. Cheers John Aexander

Reviews.Title: “Hilton for Business-rooms small”
Reviews.Author: Coza
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel many times for business meetings not my choice, I prefer the Shangri-La or Sofitel for Sydney. The hotel is in a central location close to the major city shopping precinct and the mono-rail, the service is fine around the hotel and it has a couple of nice bar's the marble bar and the one on level 4 with an open air area. The hotel lifts can be very slow when the hotel is full stopping at many levels on the way up and down, can be a problem on the higher floors! The only drawback to the hotel is the size of the rooms very small and the bathroom in particular is quite small otherwise the hotel is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite as good as expected”
Reviews.Author: CanberraCaro
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night, for work. It was ok, although nothing exceptional. The twin room felt crammed. I didn't particularly light the "heavily frosted window" that served as a wall to the shower; especially since the light shining through revealed far too much between colleagues. This would have been fine if travelling with a partner, or even with friends. Barely had any interaction with the staff; which is great for me. Room-service was quick and efficient. Just beware that everything in the fridge is on a pressure plate - so you can't put anything of your own in there! Stayed on level 30, view wasn't great. Lifts take forever to come, especially at busy times. Bear this in mind when checking out!

Reviews.Title: “shop, rest, eat and relaxation”
Reviews.Author: Priscilla W
Reviews.Content: Just prior to a hectic Christmas I was treated to a stay in one of the relaxation rooms - what a treat! It was really like a suite, with a lounge area and the room was open plan with a huge spa bath but separate shower and toilet. Not only was I impressed by the room but also the beautiful products to use in the bathroom. We had dinner at 'Glass', which was a special night with exceptional food and service. We spent the afternoon shopping for last minute gifts and we were revived by the coffee at Cafe Cino in the foyer area. We found out that this coffee is produced by a small boutique supplier in Sydney and I can say that I truly 'hummed' after the coffee, with one not being enough! Again all the staff, without exception, bent over backwards to make our stay the prefect retreat and I felt restored and revived. My only complaint is that my stay was too short!!!

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Rosscoe68
Reviews.Content: A great hotel, amazing views for all the rooms. Great beds, pillows. Breakfast buffet is outstanding, lounge staff are wonderful. Close to everything in Sydney. A great Hilton hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but rooms on small side”
Reviews.Author: Dee271
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 39th floor in a deluxe room and were surprised that the room wasn't as spacious as other Hiltons we've stayed in. The decor is modern and has been designed to fit snugly in the limited room space, which is the same for the bathroom. The bed, linen and towels were all of the highest Hilton standard. Beware of parking fees in the Secure Parking below. It cost us $48 for one night's parking but it's handy. Also, if you are using a GPS make sure you program in 255 Pitt Street (not the George Street address) as you can't access parking from the front of the hotel. As we didn't use any of the restaurants or other facilities, I can't comment on them, however I would consider staying here again if I needed to be in the heart of the city but the parking fees added onto the nightly rate make it expensive for the few hours we stayed in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: KathyT_221
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in December and booked a deluxe room for 3 nights. When I arrived in the room, I found it to be quite compact and the tv was very small when watching from bed. The bathroom was tiny as I wasn't even able to swing my arms around without hitting something. I also found the windows quite small with not enough natural coming in to the room. On the bright side, the location is hard to beat with a minute walk to Westfield Sydney and across from QVB shopping. The decor is modern and the lobby had free wi-fi which came in handy. The buffet breakfast was $43 however, reception offer discount vouchers for $29. I feel breakfast should be included in the room rate.

Reviews.Title: “What you'd expect of a Hilton in a world class city”
Reviews.Author: SunTrekker
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the last week of our trip to Australia. The hotel is centrally located in the business center near the Galleries Victoria, Strand Arcade, and Sydney Tower, just a 10-minute stroll to popular Darling Harbour, and maybe double that to the sites around Sydney Harbour. Our executive-level room on the 38th floor had a great view of the Sydney Tower, with an excellent bed, though as others have written, the room and bathroom were noticeably on the small side. While this Hilton doesn't have the history of the Istanbul Hilton, and the executive lounge (with hardworking staff) is much less formal than that of the Tokyo Hilton (a few too many crying babies one morning), it has a generally high level of service (great concierge) and vibrancy. In addition to the Sydney Harbour and CBD attractions, other highlights for us were the cliff walk from Bondi Beach to Bronte Beach, the ferry to Manly, and the Sydney Harbour BridgeClimb.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent with good staff”
Reviews.Author: accipitor
Reviews.Content: We just stayed here at the start and end of our Australian trip and chose the hotel as we are HH Diamond members. We had an executive room that was well designed with good amenities, although a little small. The staff are helpful and friendly for a busy city centre hotel that has a lot of air crew staying. I have reviewed Glass, its signature restaurant separately. There are two negatives for us, firstly charging a 1.5% fee on credit card transactions - unbelievable! Second the Executive lounge was rammed each night and allows children who are invariably screaming. Not the place for a quite drink or work. All that said this is a good hotel and served us well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Upgraded Room and Excellent Value.”
Reviews.Author: kaotic363
Reviews.Content: Only stayed here for 1 night as a pre-paid special and was upgraded to a executive level room and was quite pleased with this. Slept good and the bed was very comfortable, no noise was heard from any of the adjacent rooms. Breakfast the next morning was quite good with excellent service and food quality. The price for Internet was a bit on the high side but not unexpected for the location. Overall I was quite pleased with the stay and would certainly look to come visit here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but very small”
Reviews.Author: aLf99999
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Sydney is in a great location. The hotel is typical big city-Hilton. Elegant and nice. The room was way too small for me. Bathroom was tiny too. That said the veiw was great, the people extremly nice and the exercise facilty was a "10". The executive lounge was OK, the folks there tried really hard. I found the food selections kind of--blah. Their internet (wireless) had glitches but worked. You had to continually sign in. For the money, I thought the entire package was a bit over priced. I found Sydney to be expensive so the Hilton was probably no worse than others.

Reviews.Title: “Has been better...”
Reviews.Author: bwsSydney
Reviews.Content: We have a sentimental attachment to the Sydney HIlton as it was where we spent our Honeymoon 33 years ago! We have dined and stayed there many times over the years and have never been disappointed. It certainly was in need of refurbishment but features such as the Marketplace Restaurant and rooftop pool are a loss. Anyway, when we discovered a family acquaintance had become CEO, we gladly returned. As another reviewer noted, even the KIng suite rooms are smaller than many international hotels of the same or similar standard. The room amenities are comfortable and functional. The recent "Magic" on call service is exceptional and unlike any room service/reception service we have encountered. Now to the real downside...the Zeta Bar advertises a rooftop experience-it is on the 4th level and views the QVB-not a feature to write home about and does have dress code that is NOT openly advertised...now for the sad news, the glass brasserie-believe the majority of the reviews! We booked this for our Anniversary and were more than prepared for an expensive treat. We have dined at a number of 4 and 5 star Hilton restaurants around the world but were stunned at the inflated(even for Sydney)prices for both main meals and wine list. This is NOT typical dining in this city or as one waitress openly stated, one of the few restaurants in the immediate area. Agreed, there is a not huge choice in the Pitt/George St. area, but across Pitt St. is City Tattersalls Club, which offers superb meals and you are a short monorail ride from Darling Harbour/Cockle Bay with an amazing variety of dining options. Sadly we discovered our CEO family friend has moved onto Hong Kong and this could explain the unfortunate changes to the Sydney Hilton dining/entertainment experiences. As HH members we have experienced and expect better-Michael, read the reviews and lift your game!!

Reviews.Title: “Expected more”
Reviews.Author: TwoTravellers57
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Sydney just after New Years and we were really expecting something special. We had read the reviews and must say the noise in the rooms really is a factor. It really diminshes the feel of all the rooms when you hear water rushing through the pipes. Being HHDiamond members we thought that while the lounge here had so much variety, our experience with the Executive lounge in Cairns by far gave us the best experience on this trip. Where as there the staff really do go above and beyond, here in Sydney the ladies just seem to talk to each other more than the guests leaving us to do pretty much what we like. Overall if you can get past the noise and accept that this is the busiest city in Australia, the location is great you wont have trouble getting around, the staff will help if you ask them to and you do get a Hilton Standard bed which was comfortable for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: Damo041284
Reviews.Content: i have stayed here a few times now and always enjoy coming back. Located right in the heart of the city. Rooms are very elegant and well designed. Staff always friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Urban retreat”
Reviews.Author: Florence07
Reviews.Content: I have stayed twice at the Hilon and loved both stays. It has surpised me though that it. Much less of a business travellr hotel than I expected it to be, the guests are very mixed! The service is always friendly and professional and I love having the restaurant or cafe option for dining. In fact the Cafe Cino coffee is excellent, with a very friendly service for a busy cafe. The rooms are very spacious and modern a great retreat from the hustle an bustle of Sydney. My only gripe would be the magnetic door keys... These easily demagnitise which is a nuisance. Top stay in a top city!

Reviews.Title: “Well located city hotel........ very very small rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Jet-Set-Greg
Reviews.Content: Service: Fair to Good Facilities: Satisfactory to Good Feel of Luxury: Fair Relaxation Factor: Satisfactory Food: Satisfactory to Good Location: Very Good, very accessible Beach & Pools: No beach as it is a city hotel! The pool is small and located in the basement so no natural light, it has a separate whirlpool/Jacuzzi pool and steam/saunas rooms and is Satisfactory for a short city stay. The hotel is very busy all the time (as I would expect a city hotel to be) it is brilliantly located if visiting to explore Sydney and the surrounding areas from a tourist point of view; you can easily walk to the Westfield Centre, Darlings harbour, Sydney Harbour bridge, the opera house and botanical gardens etc...... There is also a Sky Train Station 2 minutes from the hotel door if you want to be lazy like me! The service is polite/good but impersonal (again nothing unusual for a city hotel). The Hilton Breakfast was very very yummy, (every morning) and all the waiting staff very friendly and helpful (especially Ken, Thank You). The rooms are tiny. We had to ask for an additional interconnecting room to put the kids in because it was so tight. That said........ The rooms are nicely appointed and have been fitted/furnished to make the most of the space. The view from the windows is also not great because they are small and inverted (I have attached a picture showing the windows). Overall though the room was ok and I would stay here again for a 3 or 4 night visit it is acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Creaky Pipes and a Herd of Elephants Above Me”
Reviews.Author: ducheau
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two night this past November. I am a gold member of HHonors so I was given a room on the executive floor. My first impression of the the room was that it was very modern, sleek, beautifully furnished and very clean. After dropping off my luggage I went to the executive lounge, it was about 2 pm and they had some snacks out (little cakes, maybe some veggies, and soft drinks). I went back to the room for a little snooze. I noticed that you could hear noise from above. Mostly walking, and dropping of things. I snoozed for a little while and then headed down to the gym. The private gym is located in the basement was a huge. All guests have free access. The gym is quite large and has a great assortment of equipment. Later the evening I visited the executive lounge again, it was quite crowded but they had a nice assortment of appetizers and drinks. I went back to my room to relax. There was still a lot of noise from above. In addition I could hear water running and pipes creaking in the walls next to me. I had enough of it, so I called the front desk and they agreed to change my room. The manager seemed aware that the hotel has insulation problems. The new room they gave me was much nicer but again I had problems with noise. The people above me sounded like a herd of elephants. The hotel was thoroughly renovated, but I believe the internal structures were not. For the price I paid I would not expect to hear the amount of noise from above that I did. In addition, creaky pipes and water running, come on, for a five star hotel, this should not be happening. Overall the executive lounge was ok but does hold a candle to the one at the Hilton Arc De Triomphe in Paris. The breakfast is continental and very limited. The lounge staff were somewhat helpful, but seemed preoccupied. This is Sydney, so I guess I was just lucky to just be there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but expected more after the renovation”
Reviews.Author: WeekendHussler
Reviews.Content: The rooms are indeed quite small; but still adequate for a short stay and you cannot fault the cleanliness or modern appearance. One thing that does stand out after the renovation is the carpet: either the designer was avant-garde; or they have left the old green carpet behind. But this is admittedly a trivial complaint when the prime concern is a nice clean place to have a sleep. One positive note would be that there is a separate bath and shower. There is nothing that quite brings a hotel room down a few notches like a shower over the the bath. I cannot fault the service - no problems here. We didn't have breakfast so I can't comment on the food. Overall, I would recommend it but only if you got a great deal on the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/Small Room & Uncomfortable Bed”
Reviews.Author: OZMIK
Reviews.Content: My wife & I were looking forward to our first time staying in this hotel especially after so many wonderful experience in other Hilton hotels like the magnificent Melbourne South Wharf and in Cairns where their staff in the Executive Lounge were always warm, helpful & remembered their guests by their names. We were checked into an Executive King Room on 27th floor. I was informed by the check in staff that $100 will be charged on the credit card for incidentals. This is new to me as all hotels which I have stayed normally just take down my credit card details. The room was very compact with 2 single beds put together to form a King bed which we found very uncomfortable. The room was clean except my wife found writing & chewing gum on the pages of the service directory. She contacted "Magic" & it was later replaced with a clean one. The staff in the Executive Lounge were courteous. We were surprised that everything was self service. My wife was intimidated by the coffee machine as there were no instructions. A staff named Chi quickly came to the rescue & made a coffee for her. Later it became very busy during evening drinks and there were many people lined up waiting for a table. The Living Well Health Club was great with good facility & long opening hours 5:30am to 9:30pm. Unfortunately the hotel restaurant was closed but there were plenty of good restaurants nearby. In general we had a reasonable stay but not a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Blisssssss”
Reviews.Author: Gin_Goh
Reviews.Content: The best sleep in our 10 day Cairns and Sydney trip! Our TV screen was flickering and the maintenance guy came within minutes. He couldn't fix the problem so he changed the TV and all was fine after that. Love the room, the bed, the pillows, the late check-out and the upgrade! :)

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lszutoo
Reviews.Content: Australia in January in a fantastic hotel is beyond fantastic. As you drive into Hilton's property, you will know what I mean. It's busy with lots of other travelers and locals having business connections. As we checked in (great customer service) and entered our room, it was beautiful and contemporary. Everything was in order from cleanliness of the room, to the movable desk, and the lovely view of the city. Besides the room, the gym is also amazing with free entry if you're staying at Hilton. This hotel is conveniently located in the heart of the city which is near Darling Harbour and not too far from Sydney Opera House (about 10 blocks). Lots of restaurants, shops and convenient stores around. You must venture out!!! In the evening, there are 2 bars/clubs which are part of the hotel. Try it out but watch out for the cost of each drink. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Small room, bad design, on going issues”
Reviews.Author: jenjenrossco
Reviews.Content: I have stayed 3 times in 4 weeks at Sydney Hilton but no one says welcome back except the business lounge staff, who are exceptional. Rest of the hotel is ordinary, but business club makes every stay a winner. Even though there are several systemic problems, the club lounge keeps getting e back

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Les005
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms, although a bit too modern for my liking. Nice bathroom, greats bed and fantastic sheets. My personal preference is a more homely / country feel room - but a great hotel. The breakfast was amazing, great buffet, eggs cooked to your liking, fresh espresso coffee, wheat grass shots etc

Reviews.Title: “Near faultless”
Reviews.Author: PoosieMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We had a great time again at the Sydney Hilton - not only did we get our room for a great price, but because we arrived just after the craziness of NYE in Sydney, things had quietened down so we got a room upgrade - bonus!! Everyone was so helpful during our stay, our room was spotless, the swimming pool/sauna/ steam room was refreshing, breakfast was delicious (though Glass was closed for renovations during our stay) and the location is bang on for all the major sights in Sydney - what more could you ask for? Our only 'constructive' comment: better coffee is needed at breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 star but not bad”
Reviews.Author: LBriggs
Reviews.Content: The good The rooms have been refurbed recently so things are in good condition and it feels very clean. I arrived very early in the morning and the gave me early check in even though they had to upgrade me to do so. The staff are friendly albeit badly trained. The position is quite good but not as good as the Sofitel or the intercontinental but this hotel isn't in the same league as those. The bad I asked for a top sheet three times to be delivered to my room. In the end it did arrive but it was a single sheet so totally useless to me. Then I couldn't get through to anyone. Connecting to the free wifi in the lobby is a complete and utter nightmare. The staff on reception gave me the wrong log in code twice and when I finally got it from one of the other guests it still wouldn't connect. Apparently they have loads of problems with iPads but I couldn't use my phone either. The feel is a bit of a tourist hotel a good 3 star or maybe just a 4 star. The bedding isn't changed daily. The bathrooms are set out really weirdly so you can barely get to the sink although You do have a walk in shower. The business centre is quite outdated and the computers v slow. The bed was a king which consisted of two single beds pushed together, they didn't even have a mattress protector across both so it was quite uncomfortable. As it was just a sheet over the top. And the beds weren't secured together. They also only had feather pillow which I don't like at all and no pillow menu I ordered a wake up call which i kept answered and it kept going off again and again.

Reviews.Title: “what a beautiful hotel to stay at and the staff are very wounderful”
Reviews.Author: Allen M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sydney Hilton for New Years Eve at it was just perfect to start with. We got upgrade to the Master Suite on the top floor and man what a beautiful set of room they where the whole experiences was just too hard to explain this was a special trip for my Partner so she could see the NYE fireworks on the Harbour and have a special time, well the Hilton deliver their part without any problem at all. I would tell anybody that was looking for great places to stay then think of the Hilton. We have stayed at other hotels in Sydney like the Westin and it was very nice but we have to say the Hilton was a step above add to this the staff were just so helpful and always happy even at 3am when requesting a softer pillow it was no problem and the pillows arrived with a smile and a happy new year cheer from the young man (Kaz) the whole experices was just great the room. The in room dinning everything no fauths at all THANK YOU SO MUCH TO THE MANAGEMENT OF THE HILTON AND THE WOUNDERFUL STAFF

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Faith N
Reviews.Content: Other recent reviews really say it all. This is a centrally located hotel with easy access to major shopping areas, The Rocks, Darling Harbour and Sydney Harbour. We enjoyed the the Executive Lounge services - very nice breakfast and happy hour! The staff were very pleasant. We had a lovely room on the Executive Floor however it felt a bit small for two people for seven nights but we were there during a very busy time and were happy to get a room on the Executive Floor. I have reviewed the restaurant, the Glass Brasserie, separately and do recommend it for a great dinner. We also had a light meal in the Marble Bar one evening. This is a beautiful room but it is unfortunate that it cannot be used as a 'lounge/bar' for drinks / cocktails as it was intended. The stage set-up just didn't feel right in that grand room. Finally, the gym was really excellent - all your workout needs and more!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, small rooms, disappointing service”
Reviews.Author: Kanwalkwilltravel
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location in Sydney CBD - shopping, restaurants, the park, the harbor, etc. are all within walking distanceâ€¦ but there are other hotels in Sydney that have a good location as well (e.g. the Westin â€“ we stayed there in the previous leg of our visit, and while not overly impressed by that either, much preferred it to the Hilton). We stayed for a couple of nights, including New Yearâ€™s Eve â€“ as expected the hotel was probably running at full capacity â€“ but Iâ€™m sure that happens every year and should be planned for! We stayed on the executive floorâ€¦ and the room cost about AUD 800 per nightâ€¦ would have expected a better room and better service at that kind of a price. Room: The room was also very small, as most other reviewers have noted. They only provide 1 complimentary bottle of water a day, and charge you for any extra ones that you request. So I guess executive floors donâ€™t offer anything extra besides access to the executive lounge, which offers breakfast, till 11, drinks throughout the day and snacks around tea time. On the positive side, the toiletries provided â€“ especially the shower gel and body lotion were really nice. Service: They have a button on the phone called â€œmagicâ€� which is what you call in case you need anything. Sadly, every time we requested for something, the service was excruciatingly slowâ€¦ asked for a nail clipper â€“ they sent a pair of tweezers after about 20 minutes. Another 25 minutes before we finally received the clippers. It took well over an hour for our room service order to be delivered (we got a complimentary pack of 4 cookies to make up for that). Every time the excuse was â€“ â€œsorry it is very busy todayâ€�. Their guest services menu mentioned that the hotel could provide a picnic hamper (including cutlery, blanket, etc.) for a deposit of $50. We requested for that, and the person who answered our call didnâ€™t seem aware of thisâ€¦ we were told that they would need to â€œlocateâ€� the picnic basket and call us back. Anyways, we did finally receive a nice picnic basket â€“ but once we returned and called for someone to collect it back, no one showed up. AND while checking out the next day, we discovered that they hadnâ€™t reversed the $50 charge! All in all, the service was all but â€œmagicalâ€�! I would have probably rated the hotel an average. But with the kind of prices we were charged, poor seems more appropriate.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in the heart of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Stormeh
Reviews.Content: Hilton Sydney is in a great location above Town Hall station. Hotel was crowded but check-in quick and room ready early which is a pleasant surprise in Sydney. I stayed in an exec room and whilst it's true that even these are smaller than some other nearby hotels, it's more than adequate with king bed, decent size tv with plenty of channels, desk & office chair, & a good size bathroom with great shower. Next time I'll be sure to ask for a better view though. The fitness centre which includes gym, indoor heated 25m swimming pool and lockers is extensive & certainly adds value to the stay. Executive lounge is also great value with free wifi, regular light meals throughout the day finishing off with drinks & canapes in the evening. In the morning it was completely full so rather than waiting for continental brekky the lovely staff offered a comp upgrade to hot buffet breakfast at the Glass restaurant. It was also very crowded but staff were mostly very efficient apart from a half hour wait for an omelette! There's a huge range of food available to cater for everyone's tastes so you won't need lunch. Little extras are included without asking such as fluffy robes, newspaper, slippers, bottle of water, etc. Staff were very quick to assist when dialing the 'Magic' hotline e.g. toiletries can be arranged if you have forgotten to pack anything. It was great to be able to relax with a comp late checkout, concierge were helpful, & the HHonors staff were quick to resolve an account issue. Overall this is a top luxury hotel in the harbour city & I'd suggest it's worth sacrificing a bit extra space for the superior service & facilities that are on offer here.

Reviews.Title: “A great 6 days in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: jonsean
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very central with access to George and Pitt Streets. It sits opposite the Queen Victoria Building and only metres away from the pedestrianized part of Pitt Street. We'd recommend it highly and the breakfast was spectacular. Also has a wonderful gym for the use of guests and walking to the harbor (Circular Quay) is only 15-20 mins + Darling Harbour is even closer. Thanks for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: emily w
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Sydney for 3 nights. While the rooms are a little small they are very modern, clean, and nicely done. It rained on us one night so we decided to stay at the hotel and we enjoyed dinner at the Wine bar and some cocktails at the Marble Bar. The food was great along with the views. The Marble Bar was beautiful and we had a great night without even leaving the hotel. We were able to use the Executive Lounge and enjoyed a decent continental breakfast every morning. The happy hour in the evenings was enjoyable and a fun way to start the evenings. The views from the executive lounge were awesome. Most importantly it is centered for easy access to all the Syndey sites.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: BirdPinoTrollFin
