Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Sydney for one night after Christmas in 2011. The hotel has one of the best locations in Sydney, opposite QVB and near Pitt Street Mall. Rooms have very high standard amenities. We had access to its executive lounge which is located on Level 36. It is one of the best business lounge in town, with excellent quality of food and beverages served every day, i.e. breakfast, morning and afternoon tea, everning cocktail. Staff are professional and very helpful. This hotel is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great start to our trip”
Reviews.Author: gormansimon
Reviews.Content: Only stayed for 4 nights but from start to finish the hotels staff provided excellent service from arriving to the morning of departure. We arrived to find we had been upgraded. The room was a decent size, clean, modern and refurbished. Comfy bed, great shower and a handy mini fridge. The congeries were always willing to help and the chamber maids were always in a good mood. The only downside was the cost of the breakfast. 42 bucks each a little excessive. All in all great stay, knocked the socks off the last hilton I stayed in London. Cheers

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Small rooms”
Reviews.Author: slufin2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Sydney from Dec 25 - Dec 30 using HHonors points. We arrived at 11 a.m. since our flight got in around 10 a.m. and we were informed that our room was ready, so we unloaded and went out and about. The rooms are rather small for having 4 suitcases. We didn't have a lot of extra room to walk around and we had to use every piece of furniture just to have a spot for our luggage (we were in Sydney a total of 12 nights). The rooms have the mini bars as stated in the other reviews where you lift something off and the amount is immediately charged with no ifs ands or buts. There wasn't much selection on TV, but that just may be the city. The location was excellent. It was a 15 minute walk to Circular Quay, 10 minutes to Darling Harbour, and the Sydney Tower is just around the corner. We stayed over Boxing Day which is apparently like Black Friday in Sydney. The hotel is situated within a shopping district. There were crowds and crowds of people just outside the entrance and it was hard to get around. The Executive Lounge is on the 36th floor and serves canapÃ©s, alcoholic drinks, soft drinks, and juices each night from 6-8 p.m. The staff was super friendly and everyone we came across is Australia has been extremely friendly. The food is high quality and could be enough for a light dinner. As a Diamond member, we had complimentary breakfast in Glass Brassiere which was fantastic. The spread included muffins, breads, eggs, omelets, yoghurt, french toast, and much much more. The Marble Bar was classy and a relaxing place to grab a drink. We found the menus throughout the hotel somewhat amusing, however. The 'Australian Cheese Plate' was complimentary up in the Executive Lounge from 6-8 p.m., $18 when we purchased in the Marble Bar, and $27 if you were to purchase it outside the hours of 6-8 p.m. Aside from the room size, we enjoyed our stay here and would stay again if we ever come back to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great Christmas experience”
Reviews.Author: banditspikealfie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton for three nights post-cruise. They had our room ready for us in the morning of our arrival (a great bonus), and because I am a Gold Hilton Honors member, the extras (buffet breakfast and internet) were lovely. GREAT location for everything in central Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great location down-town, excellent breakfast, Internet use costs a fortune”
Reviews.Author: Gabrielle16
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 8 nights' stay at the Hilton in Sydney 20-29 november a lot. The rooms could be larger but they are very well equipped and the bathroom, which would better be equipped - and larger - without bathtub, has great toileteries. Th knocking on the door to clean the room should not start at 8.30 am on a Sunday morning. This is our only complaint which should have been taken a little bit more seriously. For the rest we had a great time. Enjoyed several massages and the fitness center. Reception and rest of staff was very friendly. Breakfast was excellent - choice superbe and varied. Order your last cappuccino in time! We got used to it. Last check-in at breakfast is 10.00. Internet costs a fortune a day! This is ridiculous and for Europeans beyond understanding. There will be free internet use in the lobby (!!!) as from 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Jasminette
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a weekend seminar. My husband and I arrived from different parts of Australia, so my husbands plane landed in the morning and mine didn't arrive till that night. My husband does not have a credit card, so they wouldn't allow him into the room, even though I had arranged all this when making the booking. I was in transit during the day, so when I finally got his call about this, I had to ring the hotel, remind them I had given them all my credit card details and demand they let him into the room, otherwise he would have spent 10 hours wondering around. When I finally arrived at around 9pm, the hotel restaurant was no longer serving meals, so we asked the concierge where we would find a nice restaurant open. He directed us to somewhere open at that time, but they were closed, and though we walked around quite a few blocks around the hotel, we couldn't find anywhere that was still serving meals. It felt as though the whole city had closed down. I couldn't believe we were actually in sydney. The hotel room itself was quite nice, and there was actually a TV screen in the shower. (see pic). This was really a fantastic novelty. The speakers were in the bathroom, so it was a bit difficult to hear the sound over the water running, but it was still really great. At some stage during our visit, our room card stopped working for some reason and we had to wait for reception to bring us up another card to get into the room. The breakfast buffet was really delicious. The hotel is very conveniently located near a train station. But we found the concierge desk not overly helpful. We felt a bit like pests when we asked anything. We love Sydney but are very unlikely to stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for looking after us so well”
Reviews.Author: SYDmelp
Reviews.Content: My apologies for submitting this review a little late. I stayed here for one night with my two girls for a pre Christmas shopping and girly treat. The location is perfect for city shopping and at the new Westfield one is spoilt for great dining choices. The room was on the small side, particularly for three however perfectly adequate. What impressed me was the warm welcome and attention from the staff. Everyone was so friendly and helpful and nothing was too much of a bother. Trust me, the service standards here exceeded my expectations and at the end of the day that's what makes a fine hotel and one that you would choose to return to. I had a little trouble with my room key accessing the elevator and a staff member rode down and up with me to see that I was ok and then later upon check out they offered compensation for my trouble and reduced my room service dinner charge by 50 percent. Honestly I would not have thought twice about this minor inconvenience but to have the staff note it in my profile was beyond exceptional. The breakfast is also particularly good for an Australian Hotel Buffet, great selection of juices, hot meals cooked to order and not overcrowded. So despite the fact that the rooms were small and average, the location and exceptional service made for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: happytravelpal
Reviews.Content: Rooms were very small as mentioned by previous reviewers but I found them to be functional and fine for one or two individuals. I was not terribly impressed by the staff other than the lady on reception at the executive lounge during breakfast Use of the adjacent gym was convenient. A pleasant stay with room for improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Good location.”
Reviews.Author: Peter-Mckie
Reviews.Content: Stayed on business and found the hotel staff attentive and the room comfortable. Been comfortable and room quiet. Got in too late to enjoy the lounge, but breakfast was excellent and the staff friendly. Good deal with the December sale as well. Great location in the CBD and minutes from Town Hall station.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: JackKooringal
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Sydney is located in the centre of the city. On arrival the concierge staff and front desk are most welcoming and always helpful. The rooms are modern and comfortable with quality bedding and and furnishings. The Executive lounge has a very pleasant ambience and the hostesses/hosts there are just the best. The Glass restaurant is superb - with a great menu, extensive wine list and attentive staff. The senior management have this hotel really humming - it is a real home away from home. Nearby are numerous great shopping centres, restaurants and easy transport links for exploring Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Cliche maybe but excellence guaranteed”
Reviews.Author: leicawineortwo
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel, Physical attributes are superb. But staff are even better. Nothing's a problem, from concierge and reception to room service and, in particular, the bar and restaurant staff who are simply superb. We might rule a place like the Hilton out assuming corporate level pricing but choose your moments and the room rates are stunning value. Superb!

Reviews.Title: “Great modern interior room in the city”
Reviews.Author: winton_of_jakarta
Reviews.Content: Good: 1. great modern interior room (standard hilton I guess) 2. location is awesome in the heart of cbd 3. great fitness center + indoor swimming pool and jacuzzi 4. free parking Not so good: 1. There is a side with no view at all.. like you see other building's wall

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: cobba19
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 2 night stay. Very welcoming staff, in fact I'd go so far to say the staff at the Hilton made our stay a great one. Whoever is in charge of hiring staff needs a pay rise. The room was good but as for the mini bar...don't open the fridge, especially if you have children staying. I accidently knocked one of the cans over & it came up on our bill, although when this was explained to the receptionist she happily removed the cost. The breakfast was excellent. The location is very good. The only negative thing was that the bed wasn't the greatest & on the second night one of the blackout blinds wasn't working.

Reviews.Title: “Great conference venue”
Reviews.Author: fastakoala
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a conference here. The Hilton is a great venue, food and service very good, our conference dinner was the best ever. Accommodation is excellent. As this is such a central location it was very good for delegates or their partners who wanted a bit of retail therapy or to visit some of the other attractions in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service and fantastic hotel location”
Reviews.Author: Acworld
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Sydney was a superb hotel. I attended a conference and was impressed by the ease with which over 600 delegates were accommodated. Lunches were eclectic and well presented. The rooms were so functional and the food and service in the Executive Lounge was one of the best I have experienced. The staff were able to manage every request quickly and with great efficiency. Every staff member was so enthusiastic that the management is definitely doing something very right! While I will not be back in Sydney I will certainly stay at a Hilton again.

Reviews.Title: “nice location”
Reviews.Author: Dinesh_Valani
Reviews.Content: its nice. ..situated at very good location , very nice decoration and service didn't like the food much but outside options were good so no need to have it inside. little bit costly but overall ok experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good but expensive...”
Reviews.Author: Mike D
Reviews.Content: I been busting for an excuse to check out the Sydney Hilton. So when the opportunity arose I took it. Great hotel and I probably don't have much new to add but I just thought that I was a little too pricey and not enough reward.

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Camerong
Reviews.Content: Hilton is a great hotel but one fault. The room are so small for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: 200Kris
Reviews.Content: Three people stayed 3 nights in 2 rooms recently. The rooms are small but function well. Glass Restaurant was a disappointment - expensive but the food did not match the prices. I should have asked for a sheet but only remembered it once I was in be each night - I found the doona too warm - my fault though. Any staff I met were great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: FussyGuest2008
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in October in a King Executive Room. It was well presented, clean and the bed was very comfortable, however we found the room to be small (probably OK for solo travellers). We had considered our niece staying with us on a roll-out bed for one night - but there wouldn't have been enough space. The bathroom has a separate shower and bath - which we liked - but there was very little shelf-space for toiletries. The Club was worth paying extra for - the breakfast and nibbles/drinks at night were very good. The Luke Mangan restaurant was superb - ambience, food and service. The location of the Hilton is right in the centre of the shopping district so it is an excellent location if that is where you want to be. Overall the rooms were too small for us - but other than that we were happy with the hotel and service.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay room very small”
Reviews.Author: Mauriciodv
Reviews.Content: as soon as I landed in Sydney las Tuesday 29th/11/2011 from a 14 hours flight I checked Hilton availability and it was fine so I head down straight there rather than book through my hilton honours account, due how tired I was and needing a shower and bed. Once there everything wetn fine, quite fast check in, and I head to floor 34 to my room, for my surprise the room was tiny, despite the rate AUD400 plus, I know is HIlton because I use it all the time anywhere where I am in the world, and together witht he Hilton Metropole in London this were the smalles rooms ever, cleanliness good and good bed, but once again very small thats all.

Reviews.Title: “Can Not Fault”
Reviews.Author: Drjye
Reviews.Content: You cant fault this Hilton. I travel to hilton properties all over the world and this is one hilton that i look foward to staying in. To start the bathrooms are just stunning i had a tv in the shower and the ammenities are very luxurious, the rooms are small but functional and tastefully furnished, the bed is amazing as all hilton beds are and the electronic blinds are a nice touch. The glass buffet is fantastic and fairly priced. ($49). The service is stupendous, the staff best interest is always in you, the concierge could not be more helpful. The hilton sydney is centrally located and a short walk away from everything. And finnaly the lobby smells amaizing, i dont know what it is but wow.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Katejp99
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located to Sydney's CBD right on the doorstep of QVB and Pitt St for shopping. Rooms are refurbished and well appointed, and hotel has a great restaurant by Luke Mangan that does great value fixed price menu for hotel guests. Fantastic room service burgers if you're a burger lover. I've stayed there at least half a dozen times and never been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “always a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: philleahy
Reviews.Content: Consistent product and I love the bed and pillows

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: margnmike
Reviews.Content: Only stayed here because Sydney was just about booked out that night. I expected more for the price. The room was fairly ordinary and not that big. It was quiet so that was a bonus. The exec lounge was handy but staff were a bit police-like. Location is great, parking at hotel is expensive, no views to speak of, lots of places to eat nearby and close to main shopping areas.

Reviews.Title: “Could be Better”
Reviews.Author: Great_Explorer
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a king room on the 31st floor for one night. The view was great but the room had marks on the wall and floor, the office chair had the cushion damaged, one window blind was damaged and dirty and the bathroom blind providing privacy between the bathroom and bedroom was missing. All of these suggest the rooms need a little more tender loving care. Rather than dwell on the negative, the room was a good size, the check in and check out was fast and friendly, the breakfast was great.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the money paid”
Reviews.Author: JennTravelRN
Reviews.Content: We had an alright stay here, nothing went wrong.. but the room is very tiny and cramped. I feel this property is way overpriced. I've stayed in many hotels in the downtown Sydney area, and this was the most expensive room and my least favorite. I would go back to the Sebel pier one and radisson blu again before I would entertain the thought of coming here again. King sized bed is two twins pushed together with an uncomfortable divider in between that you can feel.

Reviews.Title: “Buffet is the highlight”
Reviews.Author: ladyfitch
Reviews.Content: Amazing buffet, cannot fault it. Service is cold compared to other hiltons, rooms are small, room design is horrible even in suites. Unsure why people seem proud of it? Restaurant is good but unmemorable, zeta is another boring hotel bar. Showers too small. Gym is good, but not the best. Convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings...”
Reviews.Author: Michael C
Reviews.Content: OK, since started a new job a few months ago, I started travelling to Sydney for work regularly. Have stayed at this hotel 4 times already, and getting quite used to the hotel. THE GOOD: Location, nice and central, right at the heart of Sydney CBD. Buffet breakfast was fantastic, probably the best I've had thus far. It's not cheap though. Highly recommend becoming HHonors member, which entitled you for $29 buffet breakfast (rather than the usual $43). Room is very clean and modern Fully-equipped gym and nice indoor 25m lap pool Housekeeping service is very prompt Complimentary apple every day THE BAD Room is quite small for the price Traffic in/out is horrendous. Pitt St is always jammed, George St side is exit only. So, DON'T drive if you can help it. Only get a small complimentary bottled water, not the usual 600ml bottle

Reviews.Title: “A glimpse of chimpanzees”
Reviews.Author: Raymondteh
Reviews.Content: Room - Standard room @ 30sqm is small but not nasty. Pricing - Good @ A$370/day Hilton Honors Benefits - Reasonable. Diamond Hilton Honors member but unable to secure upgrade room. That's perhaps the hotel way of revenge for cheapskates like myself who booked the room from cheapskate third party websites. Did get broadband for free which nominally retail for $29.95/day Executive club lounge at 36th floor - Bad. Admittedly, used it once. There was no food whatsoever at 5.30p.m and 1 staff genuflecting on the ethereal beauty of her desktop i.e no one serving the 10 or so guests. Unsure when the time for "happy hour" is. Services clearly inferior to Westin lounge. Parking - Bad. It's reasonably priced at $42/day. Was however stuck at the carpark on one occasion for extended period. The hotel has no room for big coach buses. An Emirates Airlines coach bus carrying festively ugly chimpanzees to Tanzania blocked my way out of the carpark for extended period, extended enough for me to finish 2 cigarettes in the car and in sinning as a socially unconscious tosser twice. Bring Miss Universe coach buses to block my way mate...... if you are short staff for vehicles control! Overall a fair experience in a fair hotel

Reviews.Title: “Promised a lot, delivered a lot.”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaFamilyMan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at $350 WOTIF booking for executive deluxe room with access to executive lounge for drinks and breakfast. ROOM was equal to the best I have experienced. Bed very comfy. Service par excellence. Automated Block Out blinds welcome. The only disappointment was the Executive Lounge (included in tariff) did not offer hot food for breakfast. Whilst I did not expect full buffet, a few poached eggs would have been welcome. When I asked this was another $27. Annoying as sometime you just want eggs on toast but, yes there was everything else cold you could imagine On the upside the Lounge did offer full spirits and waiter service at pre-dinner drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Busy business-focussed hotel but convenient for work and pleasure”
Reviews.Author: JMarpleInc
Reviews.Content: A very busy hotel which looks like a rather grey tower block from the outside but has a brighter interior. We arrived on a Saturday when there were two weddings and at least one black tie dinner so it was heaving with people putting a strain on the 6 elevators. Rooms are rather small - we had a King Executive which would have been fine for one person on a business trip - luckily we didn't plan to spend much time at the hotel! There is also an Executive Lounge but this seems unable to cope with the demand and people were queueing to be seated with fraught staff. The hotel recommends travel to/from the airport via the city link train line, leaving at Town Hall. Fine if your cases are not too heavy but it's about 15 mins walk from the station to the hotel on George Street [or back entrance on Pitt Street] via the Galleries shopping centre. Cost abot ASS15.50 pp each way and takes about 25 mins. Oera House/Botanical Gardens/Bridge are about 40 mins walk away or the hop-on-hop-off City Sightseeing Bus passes the door.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: Lizzy K
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Hilton in Sydney regularly for work and always find the staff friendly and helpful and the rooms comfortable and clean. There are some nice, homely touches in the room and I always sleep like a baby in their very comfortable beds! Thanks Hilton Sydney xox

Reviews.Title: “It delivers”
Reviews.Author: Keenefleet
Reviews.Content: Top tier business hotel. Roooms are very comfortable. Executive Lounge is among the best I have been in. Health club is very well equipped. Meeting facilities are well done. Banquet food is merely average. Glass Braserie and Zeta Bar are both excellent. Marble Bar is worth a look, but is not really to my taste and very crowded and loud on weekend evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven”
Reviews.Author: GarnettSD
Reviews.Content: Hilton Sydney is indeed a Heaven. After arriving from a long cruise we were worried that our room will not be ready. With a surprise we got a room instantly and gave us a wow factor! Staff are all friendly specially the concierge Jason and Ron who are extremely helpful and friendly. This hotel is truly a five star and can' fault in any way! It's memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “great motel”
Reviews.Author: jmathes5000
Reviews.Content: 1.very clean 2.great breakfast 3.great vue 4.close to the CBD 5.great room 6.you will seep like a babe 7.great bathroom 8.great services to your room 9.friendly check in

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in syd”
Reviews.Author: bylife
Reviews.Content: I lived there for only one night. feel very good and comfortable, clean, quiet. I like its breakfast on the second floor.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in a Beautiful City”
Reviews.Author: FunkyIngy
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in the heart of Sydney City. Checkin was easy and the room was comfortable with a beautiful bathroom. Fantastic location for all around Sydney. Easy walk to pitt street mall, across the road from QVB and a short walk to Darling Harbour. It is also very close to Town Hall station if you would like to go site seeing outside of the city. Staff are very helpful. Great restaurants nearby and in cockle bay wharf / darling harbour or king street wharf. There is also level 4 and 5 of the new westfields in Pitt Street. If you are up for a walk .. stroll down to Haymarket and Chinatown and check out the restaurants there from japanese to chinese the choice is endless.

Reviews.Title: “50th Stay.”
Reviews.Author: empty186
Reviews.Content: Arrived in suite to find letter from the General Manager thanking me for my 50th stay at this Hotel. Suite - Food - Wine - Lovely. I live less than 8km (5ml) from this Hilton Hotel, so why do I stay here so often? Outstanding staff, many of whom seem to stay for years. At the risk of sounding parochial, the staff at this hotel are consistently first rate. In the last year or so I've stayed at the NY Waldorf and The Versailles Palace - not even a comparison. Are there more economical hotels in the CBD? Yes, but Iâ€™ll stay here every time. Outstanding hotel in central Sydney CBD location.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant executive rooms”
Reviews.Author: BisousJohannesburg
Reviews.Content: We had a one night stay on our way to a cruise and were overwhelmed by the size of our upgraded room on the 36th floor. It had a huge lounge/dining area in which we comfortably entertained family before dinner, a vast bathroom with sunken bath and gorgeous bath salts, and a separate bedroom with enormous beds, comfy pillows and fine bedlinen and spectacular views of Sydney's roof tops. One of the best features was the electric shutters at all windows which completely blocks out the light. There is a half Olympic pool in the basement and full use of the gym with executive rooms. In addition there are 2 of the coolest bars in town, the Marble Bar is a historic space in the basement while the Zeta bar has the hippest barmen and clientele and an outdoor terrace. We returned for a 3 night stay and we had a relaxation room. WOW! A really well thought out space with a bathroom open to the bedroom and a jacuzzi bath. It was hip, modern and comfortable with the same wonderful views. The hotel is really well situated for exploring Sydney and the Zeta bar looks onto the roof of the QVB next door. We loved this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No free wifi?”
Reviews.Author: 99shippo
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious and lovely (with TV in the shower, how about that!), great location, and we were at the 28th floor. However, the amount you paid per night at this hotel, you would think WiFi/Internet should be included. There is no complimentary WiFi in the lobby either!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but impersonal and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: SazLondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location with Sydney on your doorstep. The standard's high, but even for the Hilton it was vastly overpriced the night we stayed due to the long weekend. The room was nice, the pillow menu and the TV in the shower seemed a tad indulgent, but we were comfy and relaxed. The only thing I'd say was that due to the size of the hotel, it was very impersonal. It was massive and you moved around the building feeling like another number. At breakfast we really felt this and it was obvious the staff wanted us in and out. A shame because we were really looking forward to the breakfast and it was delicious but it fell a bit flat because of the staff's abrupt manner, trying to move things from under your nose when you hadn't even finished. We wanted to treat ourselves at the Hilton but in retrospect, wished we had spent out money at a nice boutique hotel with a bit more soul.

Reviews.Title: “Is this the best breakfast ever?”
Reviews.Author: NiaNat
Reviews.Content: Lots to say about this hotel. As a regular Hilton traveller this was my first visit to the Sydney outfit. Breakfasts - amazing choice. Eggs benedict, gluten free options, probiotics, soya milk and made to order freshly squeezed juices - all as standard. Breakfast here easily could keep you going for most of the day. Good quality, fresh and pretty quick service. I think this is one of the best I've had outside the Maldives. Rooms - these were on the compact side and there seemed to be little difference on the Exec floors. The negative features were the narrow space between wardrobe doors and the wall which meant you couldn't have the doors open and walk past. Also the glass doors of the cupboards caused some nasty bangs to the head - being at awkward heights. For one person they were fine, but as a couple I think we would be pushed to stay more than a night or two. My previous experience at Blue Sydney had much more spacious accommodation. On a positive note, the beds were comfy, pillow menu improved sleep and dark blinds were good. internet connection was excellent and lighting spot on - range of low lights, desk lights and room switches. Gym - this is by Living Well and well done to Hilton for getting an arrangement with a proper gym! This makes such a difference to those of us who want to continue to work out whilst working abroad. Classes on offer great, particularly Tim's "HardCore" and Erin's spin. Pool and steam rooms also nice to relax in after a work out. I wish more Hilton's would follow suit. Housekeeping - reasonably good, although my fresh milk was left to sit out for a day or two until I requested it removed. (You cant put it in the fridge as it charges for everything removed). Laundry service pretty prompt although the charges were pretty extortionate - $6 for one underwear item. Staff - reception were pretty friendly, although I had to queue both times on checking in and out as there was no dedicated Hilton Honours desk at reception. Overall, I'd choice Hilton again for work due to the gym and breakfasts, however if I was on holiday the space issue would probably lead me back to the Blue.

Reviews.Title: “Not Quite On The Mark !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: gl0ryb0y
Reviews.Content: i have just had my 5th stay at this hotel. i am a diamond club member that gives me nice little upgrades etc. (a nice touch). However the rooms are not quite up to scratch. the room keys are very touchy and i have been locked out of my room about 3 times during different stays and always have to go back to front office for new keys. i have not been able to use the safe in all of the rooms. the batteries are flat. i had maintenance come and get one going but it took so long the first time i didnt bother with all the other safes that didnt work. the rooms are clean but again not spotless. i think the housekeeper needs some better floor supervisors. the breakfast in glass (the restaurant) is one of the best breakfasts i have seen in a hotel. ( very similiar to kitchen at the W hotel in hong kong.

Reviews.Title: “True Hilton Diamond Experience”
Reviews.Author: wockinwod
Reviews.Content: I had not been back to the Hilton Sydney since its refurbishment, which I know was some years ago. Reviews here were mixed in terms of the rooms and service. I was pleased to be greeted by a very friendly and welcoming check in team member and were pleased to welcome me back. As a Diamond member I received an Executive Room upgrade which was great. To top it off i received a wonderful corner room which was a great size and a lovely view across the city. Nice touch was the welcome letter and some melting moment cookies. The bathroom is quite small but fine for my purposes. I was too late to try the Executive Lounge drinks and canapes but did use it for breakfast. I was also offered the option of the full breakfast in the main restaurant but elected to remain in a relatively quiet lounge. The food offereing was truly continental. Tasty and fresh. Good Nespresso machine for coffee and nice enough staff. Overall a pretty good stay and good size room....just remembered that the TV did seem a little small for the size of the room!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, modern, stylish hotel: watch for location tho?”
Reviews.Author: Eyes_Wide_Open01
Reviews.Content: Hilton Hotel, Sydney City Wow. Stylish from the outside and the inside; You enter the revamped, renovated rooms and quite frankly, someone spent some serious dollars on styling them. Impressive looking. From the moment you enter the property, it says classy without being over the top. Staff is attentive and helpful. Room (that I was in at least) was notably clean. They also tend to helpful towards early check in if rooms are available, which is a positive. Putting customers first with this sort of attitude is well worth mentioning in my view. However, remember you pay for the privelege: the property is not exactly top when it comes to economics. That said, there is quite a bit in the area food-wise as well as a good size, upmarket mall next door. Queen Victoria Building â€“ one of my fav Sydney buldings â€“ and all it has to offer is across the street. Cab from the airport shld run you to around AUD$40. There are several subway stations nearby with the major bus station across the road. So, lets get to it: The good? a) Stylish. I like my hotel rooms to look and feel modern. And these foot the bill easily. Well thought out, impressively presented rooms. Flat screen TV, TV in the shower (nope, not making that up: IN the shower) toiletries are also more upmarket, which is always a nice, well thought out touch. b) Location: it was good for me, so Iâ€™ll put it in the plus column but beware: it is not near the major Sydney waterfont attractions. c) Executive Lounge. If you (somehow) qualify for access, this is most definitely worth checking out. d) Staff: very friendly and professional. Not intrusive at all. Which whilst yes, we should expect that, is unfortunately not always ubiquitious. A nice touch. e) Rooms are off a good size, as are the bathrooms. They do not try to jam too much bulky furniture into a too small a room. Someone clearly had a good think about what shld go into the room and how that shld be achieved. It worked in my case. The bad? a) They have one of those automatic â€œpick up and its charged to your hotel billâ€� type arrangements which I find really, really annoying to the point of being pointless. If you have young kids who like to touch things, you could find your bill tripling. How many times have I seen couples arguing at check out claiming not to have had the Pringles. I am not sure why these are here, but I am sure there are better ways at internal control over your staff. b) Cost of internet comes to approx 10~12% of the room PER 24 HOURS. I know the argument can be made both ways (ie: itâ€™s a service that is provided and thus shld be paid for) but I am firmly in the â€œbuild it into the cost of the roomâ€� camp. When you spend serious money on a seriously stylish room, you do not expect to spend 55 cents PER MINUTE upto $29 for 24 hrs of OK internet access. c) Location: Itâ€™s good and bad: remember this is NOT near Circular Quay/the Rocks and northern part of the CBD. Its is closer to Central Station than it is to Circular Quay. If you are here for tourist reasons, they are a managable 10~15 min walk away. Parking is available but I did not use it. The hotel also has a lot of food options, but I did not avail myself of them so cannot offer an honest opinion on them. Overall? Solid. Nice. The hotel is one of the more modern Hilton hotels in the chain and this is easily reflected in what is around you. It looks and feels fresh. The bad points are not necessarily only with this hotel â€“ they are common and often, the more you pay for a hotel, the dearer these things become â€“ so I do not hold it against the property. A pleasant experience all round. I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jamie M
Reviews.Content: Really good location if you are wanting to be in the heart of the city, right near Pitt St Mall and the new Westfields. Close to Circular Quay (5-10min walk). Basically a good base to be in town. Rooms are lovely and clean, breakfast was great too!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: tc1707
Reviews.Content: Great location, great staff and one of the best exec. lounges I have seen so far.

Reviews.Title: “50th stay at Hilton Sydney”
Reviews.Author: BMOL
Reviews.Content: Recently had the great pleasure of celebrating my 50th stay at the wonderful Hilton Sydney. This hotel just goes from strength to strength in my observations of staying there, over the last 2 years. Incredibly, it just keeps getting better and better! I have also found that once I did stay regularly, and frequently, the hotel and all its staff really went above and beyond recognising my loyalty. The Hilton Hhnours reward programme provides great benefits across all Hilton properties, especially as a Diamond member. I found that as I was staying reasonably regularly at times at Hilton Sydney, and the service as a regular guest has been truly exceptional and outstanding.Everyone, in every department, from the great little caffe in the lobby, to the restaurant, to the exec lounge, to the reception, have always gone out of their way to make me feel like I'm at a second home. To be honest, I have felt so lucky to have such wonderful times with friends, family and loved ones in this beautiful hotel, with such amazing quality in its bars, restaurants, and also especially its rooms and accommodations. The Hilton Hhonours representative / manager for the hotel, originally Sae Yi, and now Juliette, have been two exceptionally warm and helpful hospitality professionals, and are always so nice and welcoming. They have really suprised me many times with their care and attention to detail, especially as I can imagine they must have many regular guests who would stay more than I have. Anke in the executive lounge and all her staff are always a wonderful welcome back to the hotel, and really add a touch of class, and wow all the guests in the lounge. I have really enjoyed spoiling some of my friends with the lovely sophisticated ambience and calm, high above the busy traffic of George St below in the evenings, when staying at the Hilton Sydney. There really are so many staff that I could mention, who have been so charming, and exceptional, and really been a big part of why I have loved staying at this hotel so much. The other reason I would definately give the Hilton Sydney the top hotel in Sydney billing, are the really exceptional bars and restaurant, which will definately leave all the other 5 star hotels for dead. An example was on my 50th stay, having a live snake 'kissing' my face at the "Extreme Cabaret" in the Zeta night club! I certainly won't forget that! So thank you Hilton Sydney, for so many great memories, and also as a reasonably regular guest, for the outstanding service.... really perfect and 10/10! For those looking for a regular top hotel in Sydney, look no further! Have a look at some of the amazing rooms I have stayed in, and been upgraded to at times while staying at Hilton Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection and Class”
Reviews.Author: aussieagent1
Reviews.Content: The pictures looked good, but it was better then good, it was perfect. From the entrance, to the checkin, to the lifts,to the room, this property had everything and is a true 5 star hotel. I have stayed in alot of properties worldwide and this one would be in my top 5. I would definently return, even just for the most comfortable bed ive ever slept in.

Reviews.Title: “You never quite know what Hiltons are going to by like - but this is a good one”
Reviews.Author: A449
Reviews.Content: In my experience, Hilton's can be great or they can be pretty disappointing. I found this one to be up there with the better ones. It certainly exceeded my expectations. The hotel is in a good location. I had several meetings in various parts of the city, and most of them were in walking distance. So I certainly found the hotel to be in a good location for business. There were plenty of shops in walking distance too. I was impressed by the upgrade I got with my HHonors Diamond Membership. Technically, I think it provides an upgrade to an Executive level floor. But form time to time, a hotel goes a bit further. In this case, I got a very impressive corner suite, complete with a whirlpool bath large enough for at least two people! The Executive Lounge is very nice. And the staff were as helpful as I could expect anyone to be. The lounge has nice views across the city. Breakfast in the lounge was excellent. I only spent one night at the hotel, and didnâ€™t have time to try any of the restaurants. One thing to watch out for is taxi availability. I left about 5pm on Friday night, and getting a taxi was a real problem. In fact, I've never seen anything like it in a hotel. I'd say there was a 40 minute wait. In the end, I shared a limo to the airport with another guest (who still missed his flight). This problem is clearly not in the hotel's control, but I would have appreciated it if someone had told me that I should book a cab beforehand! All in all, it was an very good experience, and I will be very happy to stay at the Hilton next time I'm in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: tnc2u
Reviews.Content: You can't go wrong staying here. You can walk to many shops, restaurants, and attractions. It is not located on the harbor, but that is not an issue. Sydney is such a great city with many things to do. What more can I say!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ctew2
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5days on Business and was very happy with all aspects of my stay. The executive lounge proved a great help. Very comfortable bed, terrific service.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lil H
Reviews.Content: I love the Hilton Sydney and have stayed there many times for work. Breakfast is a real treat and the hotel is modern, clean and stylish. The location is perfect. My only gripe is with the size of the rooms - all very small. When travelling for business I choose this hotel (price permitting - it can get very expensive in peak periods) but with the family I simply couldn't manage in the small spaces. If you are looking for a smart business hotel with excellent food and service look no further. The Hilton Sydney really is a fantastic experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: nick_catephores
Reviews.Content: A very comfortable stay and a great location from which to explore. Rooms are modern but comfortable - however, it was overpriced in general. However, I would probably stay again despite the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: d t
Reviews.Content: Service - my husband was made to wait in reception for 2 hours awaiting my arrival as the room was booked in my name (no option to book in 2 names online). Noting that the room was booked for 2 people and he has the same surname and address as me. This has never happened at any other of the many city hotels we have stayed at. Rooms - no matter how fancy the decor is, you just can't get past the lack of space. The bathroom layout in particular is terrible. There is no room to put your toileteries and you can't help bumping into the toilet or bath when trying to dry off. Also, if you expect to put anything of your own in the fridge (like water that I require for medical reasons) you will need to order a 2nd fridge to the room. We had a show to get to so would not have had time to wait for the fridge to arrive to put our water in it. We had to empty the contents of the filled fridge and then argue about the bill in the morning (it automatically charges you if you remove something from the fridge). Bars - Glass Bar is not a bar. It is a bunch of chairs and tables in a walkway to the restaurant. We sat in one of the chairs and waited 20 minutes for service (they were not that busy) and then left.

Reviews.Title: “Small Exec Room and unimpressive Exec service”
Reviews.Author: suetz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here past week for 2 nights. Room was very small and more suited for 1 pax but this was an exec room with king size bed at AUD400 plus per night. Toliet was not practically laid out and I believe no thought was given to landing space for woman toiletries and make up. There was ansolutely to space to put anything without constantly knocking them into the basin. Also the magnifying mirror was placed on the wall next to small area so you keep knocking into it and I keep knocking into the shower door while trying to look into the mirror and apply my make up. Mind you I am a small sized woman! Also was unfortunately given the room next to the lifts which was very loud and moving up and down all the time which made sleeping extremely difficult. (think this area should not be used as a room!) I could ask for a new room but I generally do not like to repack and I was only staying two days. (I somehow had to wait quite some time for lifts whether going up or down which was really awkward for a 5 star hotel) The closet door was also weirdly sized/placed. The doors opens out so once you do that, you cant pass through as there was only a few inches between the door and the wall. The exec lounge had exactly the same cake and scones for the two afternoons that I was there (at about 4pm) and no one seem to care if you came or left. No one smiled or said hello/goodbye/good day (/) save for the girls clearing my tables who at least smiled. This is really awkward for an exec lounge as I expected better people service especially from a gloabl brand like Hilton. Didnt feel staff where that genuine save for staff at the breakfast lounge. Dont think I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Small, expensive "executive" rooms. Westin is a far better value and hotel”
Reviews.Author: Greg R
Reviews.Content: As a modern day "road warrior", loyalty programs mean a lot to me - I've flown my family to exotic vacation destinations, put them up in first-rate hotels and enjoyed the additional perk of buying "free stuff" like golf clubs, electronics, etc. When booking a flight or hotel, it's always about the points â€“ and yes, the movie Up In The Air could have been based on my traveling life. That's why it is always disappointing when one of the companies that you patronize let's you down â€“ as was just the case at the Hilton Sydney. My wife, Stef, and I had been looking forward to returning to Sydney to speak at a conference, and when making our hotel arrangements, there was no doubt that we would book the Hilton Sydney. We had stayed there together a few years ago and I've made it my regular hotel for any trips to Sydney ever since. This time, the rate was steeper than usual ($449 AUD), but as a Diamond member, breakfast was included (and for the uninitiated, breakfast in hotels is generally a small fortune), and access to the lounge provides a nice, quiet (and scenic) place to work. We arrived in high-spirits shortly before noon, only to be informed that our room was not yet available. However, we were informed by the young lady working the reception desk that she would "call housekeeping and put a rush on the room". In the meantime, we were offered use of the lounge. We decided instead to simply check our bags and head out for some lunch. The young lady assured us "by the time you return, I'm certain your room will be ready". When we returned an hour and 25 minutes later, we were told that our room was still not available and were ushered up to the lounge to wait. An hour later, a brief check with the lounge receptionist was greeted with "I will call and check on it â€“ what was your name again?" Mind you, there were only two other people in the lounge at the time, and the same young lady had written my name down when we arrived. Another hour passed without a word, at which point I inquired again and was told "I'm not sure â€“ let me call housekeeping for you". I asked her if they had not talked to her an hour ago, and was told that "they are very busy because the hotel is fully booked". I asked her if that meant that no rooms were being cleaned. Her response was, "well, your room is on one of the executive floors". "So, you are telling me that not a single person staying on the executive floors has checked out today? Because, if they have, then I would think a room with a 'rush' on it would take priority over cleaning rooms for people who are not checking out." I was again told that she would call housekeeping and get back to me. Less than 5 minutes later, she magically appeared with our room keys. Sadly, upon arriving at our room, I realized that travelling alone is very different from travelling with someone. The rooms at the Hilton are perfectly adequate for a single individual, but definitely not for two people with luggage. Stef had her large suitcase and a small toiletry suitcase, and I had my standard 22" roll-aboard. In addition, we both had our computer bags. We had barely entered the room before Stef was complaining about the lack space to put the suitcases and lack of drawers to unpack her stuff â€“ there are two drawers and the closet. The bathroom is tiny and poorly laid out â€“ so tiny in fact that two people can not stand in front of the mirror together. There is almost no room for a woman's toiletries near the sink unless you take all of the usual hotel "amenities" and put them out in the hall on the counter above the minibar. Frustrated, I returned to the front desk to ask about another room. I was informed that the hotel was completely full. I asked about an upgrade â€“ to which I was informed "you are already on the executive floor and that's all we ever upgrade people to". I found this odd, because as a Diamond member, I have regularly been upgraded to junior suites, and even to the occasional full suite. Nowhere on hilton.com does it say that your Diamond status upgrades are "limited" to the executive level. I mentioned that on the previous stay in the hotel with my wife that we had a lovely room â€“ which I found out was one of their "relaxation rooms". I asked about availability of one of these and was again told it was booked. I inquired about availability later in our stay and was informed that I could, in fact, have one of those rooms for an additional $80/night or to the "relaxation suite" for an additional $150/night. But when you are already paying in excess of $400/night, that is simply ridiculous. Again, I inquired about upgrading as a Diamond member and was again told "we don't upgrade past the standard executive floor room". For breakfast the next morning, we headed to the lounge, only to find that it is a continental only breakfast. We headed down to the restaurant and definitely enjoyed the breakfast buffet there. Following breakfast, we made the decision to walk the two blocks down to the Westin and check their availability. I had previously stayed in the Westin and loved the hotel. Not only did the staff greet us warmly, they allowed us to have a quick look at the two different room types they had available. In chatting, they even informed us that they had heard from others about the size of the rooms at the Hilton. The "standard" Deluxe room at the Westin is 1.5 times the size of the Hilton, and the Deluxe Executive room is almost twice the size. The rooms all feel even larger thanks to the floor-to-ceiling windows, compared to a rather dark feel at the Hilton. And the kicker was, their standard room rate was just almost $150 less than the Hilton. We opted for the executive room so that we could use the lounge during our stay â€“ even though working in the room is a definite option at the Westin â€“ and we still came in $75/night cheaper than the Hilton. We headed back, packed up our bags and went to check out. At the reception desk, the young lady asked me if I was headed home early â€“ strange I would think since she could clearly see that I had just arrived yesterday and was supposed to stay for a week. I told her "no, I'm actually moving down the street." She seemed puzzled by this answer, so I told her that I was dissatisfied â€“ recounting the three and a half hour wait the previous day. She replied that the hotel was fully booked, so that might have been the reason for the delay. I went through the whole "logic" thing again â€“ asking how a "rush" on a room meant that we ended up in our room at the standard check-in time. I was then informed that "we have a lot of flight crews that check in and out at odd hours". I'm not really sure what that had to do with my situation, but oh well. I then said, irregardless of the wait, the room was simply too small for us to live in for a week. She then informed me that "our rooms are standard size rooms for hotels in Sydney." I responded that she might want to take a walk down to the Westin and ask to view one of their "standard sized rooms" so as to be better informed.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed by the value for money”
Reviews.Author: coralkiwi
Reviews.Content: My first visit to the Sydney Hilton impressed me. Having stayed at several other 5 star Sydney hotels on business I can say I would go back to the Hilton without hesitation next time around. My room didn't make a huge impression at first - they are fairly simple in decor, as opposed to some of the more ornate older style hotels around town. But what made a real impact was the 'little bit extra' that seemed to come with the service and facilities. For example, DVD players in the rooms. Quality and service seemed one step above other places I went to at a similar price range. For a location right in the heart of George St, fairly close to town, Circular Quay and the Harbour Bridge, this hit all the right notes for me. As an added surprise, the gym in the basement was superb - a big facility open to public with group fitness and huge range of equipment. Room service is very expensive, which would be the one downside. The automated minibars also made me a bit nervous as they charge you even if you do so much as lift an item off its sensor. And I guess I would comment on the pillows, which are just too soft if you prefer a harder pillow.

Reviews.Title: “I've slept in Heaven, and it is this”
Reviews.Author: I-heart-Travel
Reviews.Content: Never have I stayed at a property that is so well-organized, friendly-staffed, nicely managed as this one. The room was modern and hyper-clean. The restaurant "Glass" offered a sumptuous-buffet for breakfast. The hotel is literally just a few steps from Town Hall City Rail station making it very convenient to get around. I HEART SYDNEY; I Love this hotel. There are only three minor scrapes in an otherwise flawless performance, but nothing so damaging as to remove a point - perhaps all told these would remove one-half point, total. 1: There was a desk in the room, but no lamp on it or for it. The other lamps in the room were ineffective in getting the desk surface illuminated properly. 2: The television screen was smaller than I expected. Unless you were lounged directly in front of the screen, it was a tad difficult to enjoy the show. 3: As one business reviewer mentioned for this property - the Internet rate is quite high. I should point out that I had the opportunity to select a free breakfast coupon or free Internet. As I was on Holiday and did not have my laptop with me, I never expected to need the Internet - until the airline called and said my flight was late.... The Business Centre is not 24 hours (being open only from 0800-1700), the charge is $10AUD for 30 minutes of Internet time and 45 cents to print a single piece of paper. I was shocked. If these minor issues are addressed by Management sometime, then Hilton truly has a Diamond property in an already-great city.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, expensive parking.”
Reviews.Author: Yana1203
Reviews.Content: Room: If staying at this hotel, I suggest booking the junior suite to get better city view or else all u will see is another office building. Suite is quite spacious, very clean, comfortable bed, tv in bathroom & access to Executive Lounge for evening canapes & drinks - which was excellent! Parking: So expensive, at $47 self-parking per night it should be complimentary to suite guests at least! Buffet breakfast: was quite disappointing - no pancakes, bacon was so greasy and looked like it was deep-fried in used oil & sausages tasted strange, I only took a bite of it & couldn't get myself to swallow it! Limited choice in both hot & cold food. For what we paid for buffet breakfast, it was actually a rip off! I have to say Sydney Harbour Marriott has better buffet breakfast. Location: Hilton Sydney is right across Queen Victoria Building & quite accessible to main train station (Town Hall) & buses. Also only 10 minutes to Chinatown BUT being on George Street don't expect a quiet night in the hotel. If you like the hustle & bustle of city nightlife and don't mind the homeless individuals that likes squatting outside the hotel, then this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel but wouldn't stay again.”
Reviews.Author: TheSalfordOne
Reviews.Content: Okay, let's get this in perspective. The hotel is generally excellent but when there's something fundamental which puts you off revisiting, you have to just come out and say it. I'm even thinking of giving up my HHonors membership if this is a real Hilton trend (my second experience of this issue at a Hilton). The bathroom has no door. The sliding panel in the same frosted glass as the wall closes most of the gap where the door should be but it isn't a door. And you'll note the reference to 'most' of the gap. You can't actually see very well through the frosted glass but you can certainly see through the thin air where the sliding panel doesn't quite align with the neighbouring panel. Seriously, what designer thought that we all want to share our bathroom activities with others in the room? Call me old fashioned but when did having a door to shut suddenly stop being a good idea? It's enough to put me off going back but the experience in the Glass Brasserie probably would too. Limited options for vegetarians but the gruyere souffle was just sensational. The problem was the wait for the drinks, which we really needed after a long day. The original waiter had apparently forgotten and we had to ask another one who served all the food. And he was great. When we came to pay the bill, we left a cash tip for the excellent service we had from waiter number two but who should suddenly appear at the table but the original guy with no memory, who snapped up the cash. That was really annoying. Having said all that, if you find yourself in the restaurant, the signature dessert 'Liquorice Parfait' is nothing short of sublime. Maybe worth going for that but bring your own bathroom door. All in all, it's frustrating for a brand to be most of the way there in accommodation and catering but shoot themselves in the foot by daft shortfalls.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service in a great location”
Reviews.Author: emmals23
Reviews.Content: Stay here once a year for business reasns and am always completely satisfied with everything. Service is always excellent and rooms are spacious and clean with sensational views. The breakfast at the Glass Brasserie is one of the best in Sydney, and the Executive Lounge is also worth trying out

Reviews.Title: “For when you need to feel special.”
Reviews.Author: JoJoZBrisbane
Reviews.Content: Love the staff at Hilton Sydney they always make you feel like your number one. A1 service all the time. I recommend an up grade to executive level so you get to enjoy the benefits of the executive lounge privileges. Dreamy king size beds, we stayed in a junior suite and got to see some famous people. I could go on & on... but just book it and try it for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “reilable”
Reviews.Author: Moby-Wan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Sept 2011 for three nights. Reliable in that it is what you would expect at this level, expense etc. No rela surprises except that the Marble Bar underneath is very special and quite awesome if you haven't seen it before. TV's could do with an udate to 1080p.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped and Cluttered”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn_WA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Sydney earlier this month for business. While in a great location with easy access to the airport train and 20 minutes walking distance to the wharf, the overall experience was disappointing. My room was very small, and for a business room, the layout was disappointing. The glass desk was dysfunctional with little surface area for work papers and a laptop. The chair backed up to the bathroom wall, so not much space for movement and there was no desk light! The bathroom was a small glass cube inserted into a corner of the room, the width of a bathtub (see pictures), too small for 2 people and not much room for personal articles. The closet was filled with the safe and an ironing board, so my suitcase sat out, giving the room a cluttered look. Major peeve: I borrowed a converter from hotel services, they charged me a deposit of $30 Australian and the concierge did not remove it from the bill at checkout when asked, even though I returned it in person. Overall, a big price for a little room. With the exception of the concierge, the staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: jj-ridick
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hilton Sydney many times and I'm amazed at seeing the same smiling faces everytime I come back. This must be a credit to the General Manager in being able to retain quality proffessionals. On my latest stay I needed some documents printed off my email address late at night the main concierge with the golden keys made me feel welcomed and was kind enough to help me access my email on his iphone as his terminal didnt have access to hotmail. I didnt expect this type of care and i was very impressed in his quick thinking in using his iphone and emailing the documents to his email address and printing them out for me so i was ready for my morning meeting. This is just one of many good stays i have had at the Hilton and I will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, great room”
Reviews.Author: parischris2007
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at this Hilton, as a birthday treat. I paid for an 'on-arrival' upgrade to a King Relaxation Room, which was fantastic - the room layout is excellent, with a light, airy feel to it. My only gripe is the same one I have with pretty much every hotel in Sydney - the duvet on the bed is just too warm to comfortably sleep under without setting the aircon to 12 degrees celsius. There didn't seem to be a spare blanket provided, so the only way managed to sleep at a reasonable temperature was to stick my feet under the duvet and use the bathrobe as a blanket.

Reviews.Title: “I love the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Edward56_11
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Sydney is right in the heart of the central business district. I first stayed here when my company sent me to work in one of the offices just two blocks away from there. To me the standard rooms are comfortable enough. The furniture inside is new since this hotel is just a few years old after major renovation. By day it's streets are bustling with office workers making their way to work by night it turns out on a completely different feeling. Third time round I styed again with my wife and they consistently delivered high service standards. There are plenty of sights to see and places to eat and best of all the concierge Jason and Ron are both fantastic in suggesting/recomending.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic food”
Reviews.Author: tipoestap
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference in this great establishment. Unfortunately my government accommodation allocation prevented me from staying here, I thoroughly enjoyed the excellent catering provided over three days. Specifically they cated so well for special dietary requirements. The venue is fantastic - right in the middle of the CBD. I had a fabulous coffee in the coffee shop in the lobby area,

Reviews.Title: “Great Lodging, Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: Willingtowrite
Reviews.Content: Let's try to keep this short: The Hilton Sydney is exactly what I expect of pricey city accommodations. Often Americans think that 4 star in another country is equal to that in the States: not true, if you think this way you will often be disappointed. The Hilton Sydney is the exception. From check-in and throughout our stay the service was impeccable. The concierge was always happy to help (mailing postcards, giving directions and even helping us negotiate the subway to see a footy match at Oly Park). The room was exceptionally clean, both at arrival and daily. And, the location is perfect for Sydney tourism: Darling Harbour is a 5 minute walk (for oodles of choices to dine or drink or visit the Aquarium) and Circular Quay is around 10 minutes on foot to launch onto the ferry system (don't forget to visit the market at the Rocks right next door). Only pointer: don't leave out extra coins (anything smaller than a fiver is a coin) as housekeeping will think it's their tip for the day. Overall, if you're on-the-fence about spending the money for Hilton Sydney, please be advised that it's well worth it here!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent fresh and efficient business hotel”
Reviews.Author: RatmanKL
Reviews.Content: Rooms might be a bit smallish but they are highly functional, brand new, fresh and stylish with a large working desk and very pleasant staff. Very early check-in was no issue, gut upgrade but without even asking. Convenient CBD location, fairly prized. Rather faultless and I'm a critical reviewer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and Amedities”
Reviews.Author: threezacrowd
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hilton and thoroughly enjoyed the experience, however it was not cheap accommodation! The room is well appointed with fine furnishings and lots of gadgets, it has the works. As we were only in the room to sleep as we were attending a function, we booked a basic room. When we checked in, they kindly upgraded our room. We were prepared for a small room as we had read the dimensions on the website, but this room was smaller than what we expected, however it was well laid out, not missing a thing. We would definitely stay here again to fully appreciate the beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “CBD Luxury”
Reviews.Author: solotrvllr
Reviews.Content: This will be a long but detailed review. This was a last minute booking due to unforeseen changes in travel plans; I decided to splurge and stay the last two nights of my stay in Sydney at the Hilton. I'm glad that I did, although the strong A$ lightened my wallet significantly. Booking experience: Quick, and once I quoted my HHonors number, booking over the phone was a breeze. Check-in experience: Again, the dedicated check-in for HHonors members made checking in quick, painless and efficient. However, the person responsible for checking me in decided to make me feel important and told me that I had been upgraded to the next class of rooms, but that really wasn't the case. They gave me what I had asked for during the booking, so why they felt the need to tell me I was upgraded is somewhat odd. Room: Much smaller than what I expected. The bathroom was also rather small. The Amora hotel in Wynyard easily has a much bigger room for a comparable price. The bathrooms are bigger at the Amora as well. Nevertheless, the bathroom in my room was very clean, the towels large and plush, the toiletries generous and fragrant, and generous water pressure with ample hot water. The bed, as always, was fantastic and I could easily say that I had the best two nights of sleep during the overall stay, here. The TV (though flat screen), was a bit of a joke, and felt more like a 19" computer monitor than a TV, and there wasn't much to watch on the TV anyway. What I really liked: The breakfast buffet at the Glass Brasserie at A$42 for a full breakfast is a bit much, but this is easily the best breakfast I've had in the city. The hot food, coffee, cold cuts, bread, fruit, yogurt and juice choices are plentiful and I must have spent about 2-2.5 hours having "breakfast" at my leisure and reading the complimentary newspapers. I also had drinks at the Glass Brasserie in the evening, and while one needs a reservation for food, I just walked in to the bar area, and was quickly seated in about 5 minutes at a nearby table. This place has some good (but expensive) wines. Location: Cannot get more central than this. Opposite the QVB, a short walk to the Town Hall train line, and can get pretty much anywhere from here. What I did not like: 1. The automatic bar and snack counter (which automatically deducts the cost of a snack / drink when removed, even if not consumed), was rather odd and symptomatic of a management that assumes that guests are going to steal. 2. Additionally, the fact that one has to call the front desk and get a separate fridge delivered to the room if one has things to put in the fridge is preposterous. 3. The concierge I interacted with was a bit snooty and wasn't very helpful when I asked for a map of the CBD or list of things to do for someone staying in the area only for a day and a half. 4. Finally, the elevator/ lift to the guest rooms is not the easiest to operate. You need to insert and remove the room key in a slot and quickly select your floor when a light turns green (which it does for about 1 second, after which your floor selection is not recognized.) If you're doing this for the first time, and haven't got the technique down, you might end up taking a couple of trips up and down in the lift - as I did - before getting to your floor. 5. The 1.5% surcharge on payment of the bill with a credit card is robbery. There is absolutely no reason or justification for this, and it appears to be some sort of a de-facto policy with hotels in Sydney (with surcharges ranging anywhere from 1.5% to 3.8%). For the Hilton to do this also, is just cheap... like taking a "to-go" bag and stuffing it with all the food one can take from the all-you-can-eat breakfast buffet. Checkout experience: Not as quick as checking in, but relatively painless. I had an early flight and needed to check out by 5:30AM. WIth this being about the peak time when the Emirates and Singapore Airlines crew (who are also put up at the Hilton) checkout, having just one person manning the front-desk was strange. However, another staff member showed up after he saw the queue growing and then it was quick. Overall stay: Very comfortable, although for the price, I expected a bigger room, a bathroom with a window, and an actual upgrade when told that I was upgraded.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Lizard7275
Reviews.Content: The Hilton is a good city trip hotel, not expensive for Sydney and still comfortable and convenient. Great view room view. I was in Sydney for 2 days and got exactly what I wanted from it. There is even a very good hairdresser on th ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: garyroberts
Reviews.Content: I hadn't stayed at The Hilton for over a decade but after this visit I will be back. The room was fabulous. I was upgraded to a suite as a member of the Honours club( i joined in London on a recent trip) and it was brilliant. Check in and out was smooth, taxis were freely available and the Glass Brassiere for breakfast was excellent. It really was a 5 star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - second stay and will be back!”
Reviews.Author: peard
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic. The location is superb for the shoppers and people wanting to be close to the centre of the city. We walked from the hotel to Wesfield Sydney at Pitt Street without any issues and it is also across from Queen Victoria Building and close to Galeries Victoria so all the main shopping areas you would want to go in Sydney are covered. The service at this hotel is phenomenal. Our porter was amazing and brought us and our luggage to our room and explained all the key features/ tech things. We stayed in the cheapest room so I was definitely not expecting this service! The rooms are still looking brand new with nothing looking tired or worn.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Hotel??”
Reviews.Author: CambridgeCats
Reviews.Content: I cannot fault this Hotel. We stayed the night after our wedding and spoiled ourselves. Everything you would expect from the Hilton enterprise. A pristine, comfortable hotel in prime Sydney location. The major highlight for us was the food (and especially the breakfast) at in the restaurant. Breakfast for us included a free newspaper, a veritable plethora of choices for breakfast (I've never in my life seen such a spread of breakfast food!!) Our dinner the evening previous was absolutely amazing. Highly recommended. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Matt F
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, new, and fresh. The staff was great, the rooms were very clean, well appointed, new, and with a great sense of style. You can't go wrong with location either, near all the shopping, train station, and sites of the city.

Reviews.Title: “The best on the best”
Reviews.Author: Dave L
Reviews.Content: Best place I've stayed in Sydney, just wish my work would send me here more often!!! Had a fantastic time, room was great and the restaurant exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Good option for central Sydney stay”
Reviews.Author: thepolarbeer
Reviews.Content: Friendly service wrapped around a modern, well located hotel. Would return again.

Reviews.Title: “A good Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Vikrant
Reviews.Content: I think the outstanding thing about the Hilton in Sydney was the Hilton Club Sandwich. It was dinner for 2 nights, and it was still great. Overall, can't really complain about the service, the room, the amenities. The 29 $ fee for internet was a bit of a bummer Run very efficiently. Across Australia, I found the practice to charge 1.5% for using your credit card a little strange, though it varied from hotel to hotel Would I stay here again, yes probably, not only on business but with family - if I were visiting Sydney- even though it's not got the best views like say the Marriott, but then again it's close to everything, and seems to be in a really nice part of the CBD

Reviews.Title: “Space is used very carefully - you just don't get that much of it”
Reviews.Author: ghfatw
Reviews.Content: This hotel has gone through a very careful and thoughtful remodelling. And as part of this space is used efficiently -- the rooms are not small, small like the W rooms - and there is still a bathtub in the room -- but the modern rooms certainly look and feel relatively small. Even the lobby has only a managed amount of space. The executive lounge is great and the health club in the basement is really great. The only thing that really does not work so well is the elevators. First, they can get really crowded and slow in the morning -- I counted no fewer than 8 stops coming down from my room one morning. Second, the elevators seem to have some software issues (on two occasions they went in the wrong direction and did funny things). Overall this is a really fine and effective hotel with what appears to be very effective service. I'm not sure it's a family hotel -- it strikes me because of the way it is designed and set up to be primarily a business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: EatBeast
Reviews.Content: Came here for long weekend for a conference. The room is small, but this is definately a luxe hotel. Pros: The bathroom is excellent - like a "bathroom engineer" fixed it up; it has everything I dream of in a nice bathroom. The shower power head pressure was super, there are rails everywhere for my towels (inside the shower!!) & various toiletries thingies, There are plenty of place to put your things, not like some hotels, where space is limited. Te soaps and shampoos are crabtree & evelyn- LOVELY Concierge & other staff are super - helpful like anything! Great pillows They have a "magic" button for you to get all kinds of help from your room Central- right next to train station that takes you to airport Cons: Its got 43 floors- so lift travelling can be a pain as they are tonnes of other people Hotel breakfast looks appetizing but doesn't quite taste as good as it looks Room small but OK No free wi-fi...why do we have to pay for it when we've already paid so much for the hotel room?? I can get free wi-fi in Starbucks, shouldn't it be free in my bedroom??? TV is not clear - not HD I think Will come back...

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in the CBD”
Reviews.Author: ChristofvdH
Reviews.Content: Sydney has an issue with high prices for business hotels. The hotel has everything you can expected from a Hilton hotel. The location is convenient in the CBD. In my experience it was the best that I stayed in over a 6 months period in Sydney compared with other main hotels / serviced apartment within the same price range.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hilton in downtown Sydney - Full Review”
Reviews.Author: travel_junkie3000
Reviews.Content: The location here is great, located in downtown Sydney about a 10-15 min walk to Darling Harbour and the Sydney Convention center. Darling Harbour is a very touristy area so itâ€™s nice to be close to the restaurants and activities without having to be stuck right in the middle of it. The overall feel of the Hilton is very contemporary. The lobby has a coffee shop and access to several restaurants and bars located within the hotel. The Glass Brasserie restaurant and Zeta Bar are both worth a visit. The rooms are clean and adequate but a bit boxy and small. I was there for a 5 night stay and was very glad to have access to the Executive Lounge (floor 36), otherwise my room would have begun to feel very claustrophobic. A few other challenges of the room â€“ 1.) there is little to no room in the sink area of the bathroom to place any toiletries or cosmetics. I had to keep these in my suitcase and pull them out as needed to use in the bathroom. 2.) Iâ€™m not sure if this was an issue with my room (but Iâ€™ve had the same issue on 2 different stays with 2 different rooms). The electric plug in the bathroom does not accommodate a hair dryer or curling iron. To use a hair dryer/curling iron you must use a plug in the bedroom and perform acrobatics to actually see yourself in the mirror. Itâ€™s doable but not exactly convenient or easy. 3.) The room is dark â€“ some more functional lighting would be really nice. 4.) Upgrade the Crabtree and Evelyn products provided. Nothing wrong with Crabtree and Evelyn, but for such a contemporary hotel â€“ the scent is reminiscent of an old man â€“ think â€˜Old Spiceâ€™. Ok â€“ enough of the challenges, this is actually a very nice hotel. The beds are luscious, filled with wonderful fluffy pillows. My rate included breakfast and the buffet provided was outstanding â€“ healthy and international options available along with all the traditional breakfast foods. I had a completely different breakfast each day I was there and still didnâ€™t exhaust all the options. The Executive lounge is one of the best Iâ€™ve visitied. The US Hiltons could learn a thing or two from the Hiltons in Australia â€“ in the evening, the Executive Lounge provided complimentary drinks, with partial bar, crudite, dips, soup, crackers and cheese, and a variety of appetizers. In the morning, they hosted a continental breakfast â€“ which looked very good. And all day long there were sweets, coffee, and tea available.
