With all the great food â€“ visits to the fitness center were mandatory. The hotel has an arrangement with a full fitness center and spa located in the basement of the hotel building. There are plenty of cardio, weights, classes, and a lap pool available to please even the most diligent fitness enthusiast. The staff at the Hilton is wonderfully trained, they are courteous, friendly, and helpful. Kudos to this team at the Hilton. I have stayed here before and would stay again because of the following benefits: the fabulous breakfast, access to the Exec Lounge, and free access to the fitness center and spa.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped and dingy rooms”
Reviews.Author: NigelBacon
Reviews.Content: I stayed on the executive floor and was disappointed, dingy cramped and uninviting room. There is not much sense that you are staying in an hotel ,more a load of rooms joined by public corridors. The Westin is far better.!!

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean and modern room”
Reviews.Author: lucidlilies
Reviews.Content: After numerous attempts over the years to find a hotel in Sydney that was priced well, centrally located and clean, I finally had a stay at the Hilton. So glad I did since this hotel met all my expectations, although my views might be skewed by my many awful experiences with Sydney hotels (yes you Amora!). The hotel is very centrally located, across the street from the QVB and one block from the new Westfield Pitt Street mall. Very easy to walk everywhere from here. The staff was pleasant and everyone was friendly, even despite how much traffic comes through the lobby. If you are looking for a spacious room, you might want to get a deluxe room or suite at this hotel. The guestrooms are small compared to other hotels I've stayed in Sydney. I can't imagine having more than 2 people in the room - and with 2 people it would be a squeeze especially with luggage. The bathroom is small too - you can't open the bathroom door all the way since the shower is right behind it. The try to offset the size of the room with lots of very big mirrors to make it appear bigger. Despite the size, the room is clean and modern. The shower has a TV inside - kinda cool and also kinda weird. Not really necessary but cool to watch the morning news while having a nice warm wake up shower. There are also automatic blinds where they, with a push of a button, block out most of the light. It is very dark with them down so make sure to set the alarm! The bed is a little stiff since their feather bed topper is not thick enough to be too luxurious. One tip, ask for a room on the side of the hotel that faces the QVB. Otherwise you'll be facing this massive Grocon construction site happening right outside your window! Unless you're over the 40th floor, you will be waking up to hammering, metal clanging and pounding at 7am. I had this unfortunate experience but the Hilton was kind enough to move me to another room the next day which resolved this issue. I enjoyed my stay and would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel but be wary”
Reviews.Author: mekanoid
Reviews.Content: Just checked in for 5 nights and finding it hard to sleep as I have two twin singles placed together with double/queen sheets on top. According to their highly responsive "magic" staff ALL rooms have twin singles stuck together except twin rooms and suites so unless you are shelling out for a suite be prepared.

Reviews.Title: “Top Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Little_Stalky
Reviews.Content: As a special treat I booked a night in an Executive Suite at the Hilton. I had high expectations of the Hilton and I certainly wasn't disappointed. The hotel is beautiful, modern and efficient. Our room was on the 41st floor and we had views of the city. The room itself was deliciously luxurious and I enjoyed the simple touches such as classical music playing as we walked in. The bed was huge and quite possibly the most comfortable thing I've ever slept in. The pillows were heavenly. By booking an Executive Suite we also had access to the Exectuive Lounge, which served complimentary drinks and canapÃ©s. We enjoyed a drink and a nibble before heading out to watch a show. The staff were all wonderfully helpful, polite and attentive. I honestly can't fault a single aspect of our stay. It was brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Overall nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Fishandchong
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the Hilton for a long weekend. Great location. We booked a deluxe room, it was a little small for the two of us (as expected) Next time I will book a suite. The fitness facility is well equipped. Room service was prompt and enjoyable. Glass Brasserie restaurant is worth a visit, had a wonderful dinner. Breakfast is good too. The staff are professional and helpful. If you want a massage at the spa, book early. They had nothing available during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but VERY busy”
Reviews.Author: xbioman
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Sydney is a good quality Hilton in a great location, but be aware that it is a bustling, extremely busy hotel in the middle of downtown. During our stay the lobby was always packed, even at 1AM. The staff was very friendly and helpful, but there was always a line of people waiting to be helped. Room service was a bit slow because they were always backed up. The rooms are nice but a little on the small side. Ample for one person but a bit cramped for 2. Toilet/shower areas are very nice. It rained constantly the entire time we were there, so we could not enjoy the view we would have had. We did not eat at any of the restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LaruzoH H
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights during transit to home, as soon as we walked in the concierge greeted us with a smile. Check in was fast and efficient, our room is modern and clean. We didn't dine in at the restaurant but the concierge recommended a few nice relaxed restaurant. Jason at concierge was excellent in finding us places to go to and very polite and freindly. Overall we would stay here again. It really the best!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Cliff-Ange
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Sydney for a weekend getaway. My husband and I stayed on the executive level which gave us access to the club lounge. Room was clean and spacious with great views. Rooms were quiet except for the teenage party down the hallway which was stopped by hotel staff quickly. Excellent service from hotel staff. breakfast and evening canapÃ©s with drinks were also great. Hotel is across the road from the main shopping mall and 10 minute walk to circular quay (opera house). I will be staying there again .

Reviews.Title: “Good quality and central business hotel - can be good value”
Reviews.Author: 20clicks
Reviews.Content: A good business hotel in a central location - whilst the rooms are a little small (fine for one - maybe a squeeze at times for two), the whole hotel has been renovated in the past few years so both hotel and room facilities are good (although not always that quiet). They have the usual rip-off internet (albeit both cable and wi-fi), small fridge with little spare room, and the tv channels are fairly limited, but I guess no different to most other business hotels. Despite the renno, the basement bar retains some character and the restaurant Glass has a great buffet breakfast and good lunch and dinner deals. If you can get lounge access for a reasonable price, it does a basic breakfast (no hot foods) but drinks and great nibbles nibbles at night. Overall, the staff are quite good and seem keen to assist if there are problems, and at times the hotel can be quite good value ($199 to $249 is not uncommon at present on their website - but can go over $500 at short notice or at peak times).

Reviews.Title: “Reliable Hilton style”
Reviews.Author: sdwylie
Reviews.Content: There are some bad Hiltons in the bunch - those that were built in the 60's/70's/80's and haven't seen much love since... But fortunately, this isn't one of them. The Hilton Sydney has that familiar feel, right down to the scent, and those Evelyn and Crabtree amenities. What I like about the new generation of Hilton hotels are their reliability - you know you'll get an efficient, speedy check-in/out, you know there will be someone on call to help you with your bags or navigate the city, and you know the room service, bedding, work-desk, and amenities will all get you through a comfortable night for a business trip in the CBD. The difference between Hilton and some of the other 5-star hotel brands, for me, is that Hilton seem to strip away some of the opulence and luxury in place of chic style and practical convenience - and for a business trip, I'd much prefer an ergonomic work-desk and a menu of healthy home-style room service options, than gold-leafed walls and tasselled curtains.

Reviews.Title: “Charming modern business upscale hotel in Old Sydney”
Reviews.Author: DaPheonix
Reviews.Content: Surprisingly charming modern business upscale hotel in downtown Sydney. Room, bathroom and amenities met the Hilton Five Star Standards. The lobby, restaurant, spa, and conference rooms was first class. The executive lounge was great, and well worth the price...a great feature at Hilton Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BearsTravels
Reviews.Content: Booked into this hotel through an internet site. When I came to look at reviews I got a little worried about the room size. Ended up being fine. Standard sized well equipped rooms. The service at this hotel is top notch. Had several issues that were immediately taken care of by incredibly helpful staff. The location is excellent. The prices were high but that is more representative of Sydney than the hotel. I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and small rooms. There are much better options in Sydney.”
Reviews.Author: MDavidson1
Reviews.Content: You can here people turning on the light switches in the next room, toilets flushing and showers. Hallway noise comes straight into the room. Street noise is very noticeable - windows are not double glazed. All round it's a refurbished "old" hotel and it shows. Stay at the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: midwicket
Reviews.Content: Since the Hilton underwent it's multimillion dollar renovation, they have somehow shrunk the rooms. They've filled the standard room with glass tables to give a sense of space, but these are deadly to manoeuvre around at night. The bed was comfortable. The mini bar system is painful. If you like to buy a few items and stash them in your minibar, you can't.They have a system where all drinks and nibbles are on a pressure pad. Once you lift the drink, it automatically gets charged to your room. So combat this, you are supposed to call housekeeping, who will bring another bar fridge to your room (like there is enough room anyway). All other aspects of my stay was as per a Hilton. Very clean and polished. The lifts, however, still take forever if you stay on an upper floor.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, not spectacular”
Reviews.Author: likecomfy
Reviews.Content: We loved the four nights we spent at Mariott Circular Quay, but on our return to Sydney we decided to try a different area of the city. It was a very nice hotel, the staff were all polite and helpful, the room was clean and well equipped. Unfortunately our room was right behind the elevators which made it hard for me to sleep. The bed was not as comfortable as I would expect for $280/nt, much less comfortable than the Mariott bed. This location was close to Darling Harbor (not worth seeing) Hyde Park, St Mary's cathedral, and museums. Also, most of the upscale shopping is in this area. The location of the Mariott was much better(Circular Quay, ferries, Opera house, The Rocks, more restaurants) Also the price was $80 more per room, than I paid at the Mariott. The breakfast at the Hilton was huge, and delicious with a wide variety of foods. Unfortunately I requested an omelet at the omelet station which never made it to the table. The breakfast was very crowded and busy, so I am not surprised. Overall a very nice hotel, but I definitely reccomend the Mariott over this Hilton. The Mariott is less expensive, same service, better location, more comfortable bed and less crowded feeling.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Sydney has set the benchmark”
Reviews.Author: Dukem2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed in their presidential suite. It is so comfortable and amazing that all your stress and tiredness will melt away. Super massive bathroom. Includes a decent sized conference table. Hilton has set the benchmark for us, if its not at least their standard we won't consider it.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated Hilton opposite main shopping areas”
Reviews.Author: enemy01
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Sydney has been renovated relatively recently and the rooms I stayed in were small but clean and comfortable. The views from the higher floors are great, although the Hilton is not located on the harbour, it is in the middle of the central business and shopping district. I only stayed for one night and didn't use any of the restaurants in the hotel. Check in was efficient and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: rlazzara
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. The rooms are modern and look great. Plenty of space, comfy bed and motorised roller shutters on the windows so the room gets nice and dark even during the day. Bathroom is also nice with a good shower. There are good amenities in the room such as a nice flat screen TV and well stocked bar fridge but be careful as the bar fridge has an automatic system which charges to your room as soon as you pick something up. Staff are friendly and attentive but the best thing about this hotel is its location which is in a great part of the city and nearby everything (shopping, restaurants and bars). Price is a little high but expected for this calibre of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “luxury for special occasion”
Reviews.Author: travelcool1
Reviews.Content: We booked a five star mystery hotel deal on wotif and lucky us scored the Hilton. Our room was not large but it was quiet and very comfortable and the room appointments were very modern. We found the staff to be cheerful and very helpful. On arrival we were asked if our stay was for a special occasion and when they learned it was my birthday, room service delivered some delicious chocolates and a birthday balloon. We walked to Darling Harbour to see a show in about 20 minutes from the hotel.The king size bed was fantastic and I slept like a babe. This hotel is certainly worthy of it's "self rated" five stars.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel, extremely satisfied!”
Reviews.Author: jaylonmartin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during our honeymoon and loved every minute of it. The hotel looks amazing and the service is second to none! We absolutely loved the Hilton breakfast, the best buffet breakfast we have had so far. We stayed in a deluxe guest room and loved it, we thought it was going to be small but it was perfect for us. They maintain the hotel at 5 star standards, it is always so clean. One of our favourite parts of the hotel was the room service, my wife and I were tired after a big day in the city so we decided to order room service expecting our food to just be delivered on a tray. It comes to you on a table beautifully set for two with bread, dip and water included, almost felt like we were dining in a nice restaurant in our room! The only small downside was when we checked out and needed a cab to the airport, the first concierge person was nice, but the guy who grabbed our luggage and got the cab for us rushed us to the cab, we were in the moment of leaving the nice hotel, it was raining at the time so the concierge person grabbed out an umbrella which we thought he was going to use for us, but instead he rushed to the cab and we had to quickly follow him, we got wet, but he stayed nice and dry. Other than that we could not fault this wonderful place. We will definitely be staying here whenever we come to Sydney, thank you Hilton Sydney for making our honeymoon perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel in Sydney!”
Reviews.Author: ilovetotravel888
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had a horrible and stressful experience at Hilton in Sydney. Checked in for the weekend to have a relaxing time to celebrate an occasion and our experience was completely opposite due to the following reasons: 1. Room was very small and we can hear the people from the other room. Unfortunately, there was a baby crying for most of the night which is probably not the parents' fault but it would have been good if we were at least transferred to a more quiet room. 2. Front desk was not helpful at all - very poor customer service. It was around 10pm and we went down to request for a room change. It did not be on a top floor as long as it relatively quiet with a single bed for us. The person spoke with her manager and they said they cannot offer another room due to high occupancy. If we want our only option was to stay in a room with twin bed for my partner and myself. Clearly, it would not make sense. 3. Rules and policies everywhere in the room which made me feel uncomfortable. Examples are: strict on 11am check out, otherwise $30 will be charged for the next few hours. If you open the fridge, bar charges will apply. There were so many rules that we both didn't feel comfortable. Finally, we informed management of the experience we had but to our surprise (and considering we paid premium price for our stay), no action was taken nor did any of them provided a good customer service. I have stayed in quite a number of hotels in Sydney but this hotel, I will not recommend to any one.

Reviews.Title: “Expected much better”
Reviews.Author: Penesloppy
Reviews.Content: My just turned 21 year old daughter and I attended Ballet Revolucion at the State theatre and stayed at the Hilton because, well, she'd just turned 21 and it was a bit of a treat! Besides, it's just around the corner from the theatre. Our room was on the 31st floor, quite dizzying to travel to in the lift, as well as to look down from the window to the street below. The view out to the edges of the city was amazing! However the room was not. Our twin beds were very close together and due to fixed furnishings there was no way to move them further apart. Thank goodness I was with my daughter and not a work colleague (which the room is well decked out to support in every other way). As well, the room was minuscule and had the appearance of an office rather than a bedroom. Our included breakfast was fabulous except for the queues and the crowds which made one feel as if one was scrambling for food. The final insult came upon receiving my statement following fast checkout which listed a minibar purchase that we didn't make. I rang the hotel and they promised to correct this immediately, but to date this hasn't occurred. If you need to stay in the centre of the city and you can get a good price for this hotel I would recommend it, but for its rack rate I think there is better on offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with an Excellent Restauarant”
Reviews.Author: BenBritAustralia
Reviews.Content: We were in Sydney for an awards presentation & decided to take our children with us as it was school holidays. Although the rooms are small, our overall experience with the Hotel was very good. Glass the Hotel restaurant provided excellent service & meals for both dinner & breakfast. We also had breakfast in the foyer cafe & it was also great. You can't beat the location, as it is very close to all the CBD's attractions including shopping. There was only one disappointing aspect, & that was the knowledge of the reception staff. They were confused at time of check in & at check out.

Reviews.Title: “Well.......”
Reviews.Author: Jonno82
Reviews.Content: I only had to spend one night in Sydney so I have decided to spend a bit more in a nice hotel. So I have picked Hilton for its brand and central location. The hotel is very centrally located and within proximity of transport and food. The lobby is very nice, all staff I have encountered during my stay had been very professional and friendly, all requests were dealt with very quickly. Check in was very quick and opt for the express check out. The service of the staff provided are definitely of a 5 star hotel standard. The room however, is less than a 5 star feel/standard. The room was modern, but very small. The twin/double room was fitted with 2 single beds, which in my opinion was very substandard for a 5 star hotel. I thought room of this size only existed in Hong Kong or Singapore where land is scarce. I'm only 176cm tall, hard to imagine how someone over 180cm can enjoy their sleep in those beds. When I showed hotel photos to friends, they could not believe that the room belonged to Hilton! Final thought, the staff and service is great, but the price paid does not justify the room size, especially the lack of a big comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, very modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: MumDadAndTwoKids
Reviews.Content: Checkin - easy, very polite and efficient Room - high room as requested, space age bathroom that makes excellent use of small space. Overall very comfortable Food - I had breakfast included - a vast buffet of the typical Hilton variety. Pleasant but the coffee was a bit crap (luke warm - though I believe I could have ordered cappucino etc) and the bacon overcooked and wrinkled. Service was excellent OVERALL - a very good stay with minor annoyances at breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Top Class all the way. Well trained staff.”
Reviews.Author: NeverBloodyHome
Reviews.Content: I suppose you pay for what you get in life. Great service from th emoment i arrived with other business collegues. Concierge to front desk staff look to be well trained to ensure you are heading in the right direction. Room was amazing, very central location and didnt really want to leave. Exceptional breakfast but same goes, pay more and get more.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great central location”
Reviews.Author: Zaidhimself
Reviews.Content: The room was compact yet functional which was perfect given that we were out most of the time in around Sydney and Bondi. The breakfast spread was great as was the room service.Only dislike was the pool which was indoors but didn't really care as Bondi more than made up for it ! The hotel is right in the middle of George Street so central and a 5 min walk down to the harbour and the malls where you have a selection of all different types of great restaurants. The stay here was ideal and definitely worth it

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: LaPortuguesa
Reviews.Content: The nicest Hilton I have ever stayed in. Great central location for shopping, within walking distance to Circular Quay and The Rocks (15-20 min) and Darling Harbour (5 min). Breakfast buffet is not worth it for AUS29 per person (I thought the quality was nothing special). Comfortable beds, great shower (hot water with strong pressure). A/C was blasting in my room and no matter what could not get it to turn off. Had a problem connecting to the wireless in my room - both the outside vendor and the internal IT person were super helpful in resolving the issue (they even brought me my own router to enhance the signal!) I was overcharged for some dry cleaning, and when I called to complain (bracing myself for a fight), I was promptly offered free breakfast for the remainder of my stay (customer service wowed me). I was overcharged for internet on my final bill and did not notice until I got home - it took a couple weeks of emailing back and forth but finally over $80 was credited to my card. The Concierge team was very helpful (they even found someone to accompany me to a rugby game at the last minute!)

Reviews.Title: “Great location but ....”
Reviews.Author: ILuv2Travel
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival the lobby was bustling and a little stressful. Apparently there were 3 conferences in house during our stay. The receptionist was very professional and had a lovely welcoming smile. We were generously upgraded to a deluxe room on the 30th floor. Thank goodness, as this room was still quite small (and ordinary!). I wouldn't bother getting a high floor unless it is a room facing the harbour. I would also try to stay away from any room categories below this one as they might be a bit small. We are probably used to the Westin/Sheraton heavenly beds - but our bed at the Hilton was a little uncomfortable, plus the sheets felt very rough. We were also bothered by the guest in the room above us stomping/running around. It was really loud at 6am in the morning! Bathroom was tiny, but clean with lovely products. Every staff member we encountered was wonderful and the location is so great and close to the mall, so we'd probably consider staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and gojod quality - a bit too sanitised for my liking”
Reviews.Author: paulhb
Reviews.Content: Not really anything to complain about here - really just an issue of personal taste. I prefer a homely type of hotel, whereas this one felt more "sanitised" to me. Having said that, the staff were helpful, room was clean and really well appointed. Everything worked well, and I definitely loved the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but pricey...”
Reviews.Author: eponline
Reviews.Content: Stayed in one of the relaxation suites because I wanted somewhere with an amazing bath tub, and I have to say the place certainly delivered room wise. The only thing that was hugely disappointing was that despite check in being supposed to be available from 3pm, when I arrived I was told I would need to wait another hour until at least 4pm as house keeping had not yet cleaned the room! Normally this type of thing wouldn't bother me too much, but when paying $800 per night in one of the top rooms, it doesn't feel like too much to ask to have the room ready on time. Also the front desk service is very slow. Not enough desks and not enough staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay - recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: BBarnett255060
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from 10 years abroad and needed somewhere to stay for a week while we got back on our feet. After hours of travelling and needing some good R&R, we couldn't have picked a better place! Great rooms, food and service. A definite for anyone that comes to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great place v relaxed, would def be back”
Reviews.Author: Geordies186478
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at the Hilton, and it was great. Being centrally located made seeing the best of Sydney very simple. Overall the hotel was everything I hoped, the staff were excellent, very friendly and always keen to help. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney getaway”
Reviews.Author: nikw32
Reviews.Content: A great, central location. Lovely corner room upgraded to 35th floor, nice views, lovely, comfy sleep. Dinner at Glass was delicious, ordered the $95 osso bucco to share. Lovely flavours. Also came away with the Luke Mangan cookbook! Extensive, interesting winelist. Was intending to go to Marble Bar after, but we were too tired! Breakfast was a huge disappointment, most average experienced ever in a hotel - and $42 each totally wasted. Ordered runny poached eggs that were delivered hard boiled. Finally got them right, but tomatoes and over-herbed mushrooms were cold, sausages tasteless and tough. Pastries were stale, coffee cold (and ordered flat whites, not filter coffee). Room itself cozy and romantic for dinner, but dark and gloomy for breakfast, no view. My advice, stay here, have dinner, but take a stroll to Novotel Darling Harbour for brekkie- $25 ea, stunning view and delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Good central location, nice modern hotel; will be back”
Reviews.Author: voyager9999
Reviews.Content: Had an overnight stay in Sydney before heading back, and decided on the Hilton on George Street. Although further away from the bridge and the opera than the Marriott and other hotels, it turned out to be a good choice. The hotel is modern, rooms are clean and the bed was great. Good breakfast in the executive lounge as well. About a 15 min walk to the bridge, the ferries and the opera house. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice makeover, but the rooms are still small”
Reviews.Author: Vossy3207
Reviews.Content: The Hiton has undergone a refurbshment, and the result is a modern, contemporary, open hotel lobby and meeting areas. The problem I have with the hotel is the rooms - they are refurbished well, but they are still very small. I am guessing this is a carryover of a building constructed more than 40 years ago. The rooms don't seem to isolate the nice from the corridors or outside as well as a recently built hotel. The TV was still re-transmitting an analogue signal, making for a less than ideal picture.

Reviews.Title: “Little disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: totaloff
Reviews.Content: My wife and had a 2 night stay at the hotel as part of our annual Sydney getaway. It's the second time we have stayed at the hotel but will more then likely be our last. The hotel foyer is less then inviting and just doesn't have the grand & inviting feeling that you would expect from a 5 star hotel or a Hilton hotel for that fact. The rooms are quite small but well appointed. Although this trip was for leisure I do often travel for business and feel that this hotel may be better suited towards the business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “A World Class Hotel for Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: ErichBTampa_Florida
Reviews.Content: In the heart of Sydney's CBD, an easy walk from the Town Hall Train Station, or on major Bus routes on both George and Pitt Streets, this hotel really shines because of it employees. Every person we encountered during our 7 night stay were exceptionally friendly, professional and genuine in their desire to be of assistance. We were made to feel like VIP's, beginning with our check-in with Owen at an early 730am in the morning. Polished and professional this young man made a great first impression for the hotel and a welcome to Australia. Our further interactions with staff in the Executive Lounge, Concierge, Glass and Marble Bar reflected the same professional and personable manner. In particular we want to mention Jason, Ron and Felipe at Concierge went out of their way assisting with tours, and where to go and what to do and how to get around. Rooms are decorated in a contemporary style and high floor rooms offer great views of Darling Harbor or sweeping views down George Street. Excellent housekeeping of the room. Food and beverage service is available throughout the day in the Executive Lounge and well worth the additional cost or if an upgrade option, and the Breakfast Buffet in the Glass Restaurant is one of the best breakfast meals we have ever encountered. It is ranked as the best breakfast buffet in Sydney! Try the fresh juice beverages...you'll never drink another smoothie! I am a HiltonHonors Diamond member so I have stayed in a fair amount of hotels throughout the Hilton network.....from New York, to London, San Francisco, Paris, Amsterdam, Brussels and many others. Without any doubt, and the Hilton in Paris had previously held this honor and distinction, I think the Sydney Hilton is a 5-Star, 5-Diamond gem in the Hilton network. Our sincere Thanks to everyone at Sydney Hilton for helping make our trip to Australia so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely deserving of its reputation as top class hotel”
Reviews.Author: CazzieH
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here off and on over last 2 weeks I've had plenty of time to observe the operation of this hotel. On a daily basis I have been amazed and delighted by the friendliness and professionalism of all the staff I encounter - at the counters, concierge desk, the cleaners, anyone you encounter in lift, corridor, remarkably friendly and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, perfect rooms, service a bit impersonal”
Reviews.Author: SanThom2000
Reviews.Content: We have stayed for a long weekend in the Hilton in Sydney. The location couldn't be better opposite the QVB and in walking distance from all great sites. We got a corner room with great views and a great bed. The breakfast was not included and was quite pricy. And extremely cold. My wife had to wear a sweater to enjoy breakfast. We were locked out of the room and we were treated like we didn't stay at the hotel and had to prove with our id (which were in the room) that we were properly staying at the hotel. Probably this is to prevent theft, but could have been done in a nicer way.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Sydney CBD”
Reviews.Author: Robbie191
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a lot of Sydney CBD hotels and the Hilton is by far the best. It is in a good location opposite the beautiful Queen Victoria Building but I think what makes it stand out is that it is newer than all the other CBD Hotels. It's clean and comfortable and every room I've stayed in has had a good view. If you like a good gym, guests of the Hilton use Living Well gym which is open to the public so it is a full sized proper gym with loads of machines and classes. The gym is never too busy. The gym also has a pool but it's nothing special, but functional if you want to swim laps. The small cafe in the lobby is also quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way”
Reviews.Author: DJB0770
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our Wedding Anniversary and everything was perfect. We were upgraded to a King Relaxation room and the room was fanastic. There were chocolates and a 'Happy Anniversary' balloon in the room when we arrived. We also had access to the Executive lounge where we could go for afternoon tea and drinks and canapes before dinner. We also went there for breakfast the next morning. The location was perfect, right in the centre of the city and right near the new Westfield shopping centre. It was the best hotel we have stayed at in Sydney. Even the service was excellent, we were treated like gold members. We will definitely be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Very fresh and modern, oustanding location”
Reviews.Author: braddeluca
Reviews.Content: Satyed as option over Shangri La from previous trip.... would have to say that on some fronts preferred, on others didnt. Room was smaller, bed firmer (not a good thing for me, but a personal preference) and more pricey. Good things were the location and the breakfast is probably the best hotel breakfast I have had in Sydney. I had room service desert, and I must say it was probably the best desert I have ever had. Very expensive hotel, but Sydney is in general.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish but charmless”
Reviews.Author: bpemt
Reviews.Content: It is different to the usual Hilton offering and very stylish in its own way but it felt charmless and impersonal. Service was just OKand quite expensive overall. Cannot beat the location and bar was great but this place is not everyones taste.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Concierge”
Reviews.Author: JVand_11
Reviews.Content: Our Hilton Experience did not let us down, the room the location and the service is perfect. Staff are very freindly, concierge are exceptional they go out of their way to meet our needs. We think the concierge is the strong point of this hotel. We will be back again

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Hiltons...”
Reviews.Author: benboyd5
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the middle of it all. Close to everything. We actually never ate at the hotel due to all of the choices around, but we heard the food was fantastic. The service and concierge were great as well, and our room was perfect. I actually like rooms without carpet because of allergies, so the rooms with hardwood floors were great. The only downside was the $400/night price, but it was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarkDWUK
Reviews.Content: Situated near Sydney Town Hall in the centre of Town, and this is perfectly situated for the Darling park area. This is a wonderful modern hotel, excellent facilities particularly the Gym & swim pool.. Staff are very courtious and welcoming. I would certainly use this hotel again on future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wofflerv
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed a great stay at the Hilton Sydney, all the staff were extremely happy and helpful. Breakfast was excellent and the room was really modern. Concierge was very good also.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I look for in a 5 Star Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: countryweekender
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have a tradition that whenever he comes back to this country (he travels backwards and forwards to Asia and the UK), we get away for a romantic, but luxurious break. So, in the past 12 months he's probably stayed in 12 different 5 star hotels, I have been in about 6. Of all of them, we would both say the Hilton was our least favourite. The bad impression begins at the Foyer. When I stay at a luxury hotel, I want the Foyer to exude class and finesse. The Hilton Sydney is the exact opposite - you might as well check into one of the nearby office blocks. Friendly enough staff - but confusing and chaotic layout. The rooms are below average - very modern, but soulless and small. We even visited a suite, but you wouldn't notice it was a suite - again small and no style. We also had a bad experience at the Zeta Bar where we were charged a $20 cover charge, despite being guests. That has NEVER happened to us anywhere in the world - it just seems cheap and nasty. So, to summarise - the Hilton Sydney leaves me with a bad taste in my mouth. Not recommended. Stay at the Sheraton on the Park instead if you want class, lovely rooms and luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Msjsong
Reviews.Content: Maybe I stayed in a cheaper room but it was pretty small and didn't have the theme of the pictures displayed - perhaps the old rooms? Nonetheless, it's clean and in a great location. Bathroom is lovely - one very annoying thing is that the opaque glass wall of the bathroom faces the bed so whenever my partner would go to the loo at night he would wake me once he turned the light on. There should be a curtain or something to cover the wall. Breakfast buffet was average but I don't know if any Sydney hotels have fantastic buffets - if you know one, please let me know. There must have been a sudden rush for breakfast because we waited a bit under 10 minutes to be seated and the staff were flustered. One of the waiters forgot my waffles even after 2 reminders and in the end I told him to not worry about them. They were so busy and I was getting full anyway. The couple at the table next to us struggled having the coffees delivered also. It's a nice hotel in a fantastic location but I would personally try somewhere else next time, probably shangrila or intercon.

Reviews.Title: “Second time. Great stay we'll be back again.”
Reviews.Author: eClaireK_4
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 3 nights at the Hilton in Sydney and loved our stay. We were in an executive room on the 38th floor which also gave us lounge access. In the weeks before I'd been in contact with the hotel to try an arrange a surprise for my man for our anniversary which was on the second day. I didn't end up using any of their suggestions but the hotel staff were very helpful. When we arrived there was a Happy Anniversary balloon in the room and later that night when they did turn down we were left a box of chocolates and a card from the manager wishing us a happy anniversary. Whenever we asked for anything it arrived very quickly. The room was clean and modern and the hotel is very well kept.

Reviews.Title: “Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: Vardomannen
Reviews.Content: The Hilton is about 100 metres from Town Hall railway station, making it easy to get to and from the airport (20 minutes by train). I stayed in an executive room on the 34th (?) floor, with all the amenities I needed. Loved the bed! Slept like a log. No traffic disturbance, even though you are smack bang in the middle of a city with over 4 million inhabitants. It is an easy and enjoyable 15 minute walk to Circular Quay, or 15 minutes in the opposite direction to Cockle Bay Wharf. The executive lounge was not busy while I was there, and was a relaxing spot to enjoy a glass or two of wine and take in the evening views of the city while the sun set. Thoroughly recommended. Great staff.

Reviews.Title: “How can they claim they're 5star”
Reviews.Author: MyHomeIsMyself
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights on business. The only thing I can praise is the friendliness of the staff in the restaurant. The reception staff didn't know what they were talking about and the customer service was appalling - and still is. Two months later they have yet to resolve a very simple problem resulting from a mistake on their behalf. The room was small compared to other hotels in a similar location. I was disgusted and won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed - some good, some bad”
Reviews.Author: Nedflanders4
Reviews.Content: 1.Stayed on Sat 21 May '11 for wife's birthday. We had booked & rec'd back written confirmation of a Smoking Room for my better half. 2. You guessed it - upon arrival & settling in our room on 27th floor, it was a non - smoking room. Spent (wasted) over an hour of dead time waiting to be relocated to the smoking floor (20) - no apologies; it seemed like it was our fault - that was the most annoying 3. We were asked if we had shopping to do whilst we waited - we were shopped & lunched out by 3.00pm which is the check-in time 4. Avoid the smoking rooms if at all possible - it appears no or minimal attempts made to try & keep them fresh & we ended up with a smaller room without the piece of fruit & better bathroom. They surely weren't part of the hotel's makeover a few years ago! 5. On the positive side - the staff are all friendly & the breakfast buffett, particularly with the variety of juices & shots available, is the best I can remember in many years of hotel stays. It's a must do! 6. The location of the Hilton, in the heart of the city, is perfect. You can walk everywhere from its central locale 7. Would we come back? We stayed there in Dec '10 and so that's twice - for our next weekend stay in the city, which will be sometime in the next year, we'll find an alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute 5 star luxury”
Reviews.Author: ILikeLuxury87
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights recently in a Relaxation Room. Upon arrival we were assisted from our car by a distinguished looking concierge. Check-in was finalised by an Irish girl who is an asset to Sydney Hilton. The service she provided was exceptional. Her manner was professional, attentive and friendly. We were offered an upgrade to a room on level 40 which was wonderful. We have stayed in many 5 star hotels in Sydney & Melbourne and this room was without a doubt the most spectacular. The room was very large, had a gorgeous bathroom with marble spa bath & wonderful shower, the huge bed was both comfortable & looked divine, there was a leather love couch & separate chairs, a big glass desk with harbour views & a separate dressing room. The Executive Lounge was very good. Buffet breakfast in Glass Brasserie was lovely. I thoroughly recommend this hotel & room type (Relaxation Room/Suite) to both leisure & business travellers. Our stay was simply wonderful :))

Reviews.Title: “Great Refurb!”
Reviews.Author: Boyds_TSB
Reviews.Content: I used to live in Sydney for many many years and The Hilton in Sydney used to be a tired old relic stuck in the 70's, but the refurb done a couple of years ago has brought the place into the 21st Century and I think the best place to stay in Sydney. Modern decor, professional staff, super clean and tidy rooms. If I ever go back to Sydney, The Hilton is the only place Id stay!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny, non-family oriented rooms.”
Reviews.Author: jen131
Reviews.Content: Our stay started with us getting a room with 2 twin beds. It was supposed to be a double queen room. We are a family of 3. When we called the front desk, they came up with a roll away bed. After we told them this wasn't ok, they proceeded to zipper the twin mattresses together which made for a very uncomfortable "king" bed. This left no room for luggage, etc. The bathroom (and tables) were all glass, which may look nice, but is not practical for kids or sleeping if someone has a light on in there. My husband got up early for a conference and when the bathroom light is on, it lights up the entire room due to the glass walls. Also, if using 2 computer devices (laptops, ipads etc), you will get charged double internet rates-$29/24hr/computer. Our door did not shut behind us, so had to make sure to pull it closed. Also, at night, you could hear all of the hallway noise clearly in room. They have an indoor pool which they claimed was kid friendly, but had many people swimming laps and allow outside memberships to their fitness center and pool. No room in pool for small kids to play. There were many errors in our bill, but after two trips to the check out counter, they were finally resolved graciously.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Concierge”
Reviews.Author: Wachter
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Sydney for 4 days not knowing where to start. We were so impressed with the concierge, they are very helpfull, they made suggestion with tours, restaurants and night life and even made hotel booking for us to our next destination at Melbourne. Truly proffessional and a highlight of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: FlyingLowLDN
Reviews.Content: My second visit to Sydney but 1st to the Hilton. The location is fantastic and perfect for both tourists and business people. Service overall was very good, the executive lounge was also great with a good food selection for breakfast and evening snacks. Brekkie at Glass is a must, one of the best hotel breakfast buffets I have ever seen. Rooms are small however, some with good views. Also, none have openable windows which I dont like all that much. Nice bathrooms, but they have a frosted glass partition to the room, so if travelling with friends, you will see a silhouette of them in the shower! Was a great stay here, only reason it did not gwt 5/5 was the tiny room.

Reviews.Title: “Another pleasurable experience”
Reviews.Author: TerryR2
Reviews.Content: I travel to Sydney on business at least 9 times per year and have found staying at the Sydney Hilton makes the trip more pleasurable. The greeting you receive when getting out of the car is warm and friendly. Check-in is usually quick and hasstle free. The rooms are always neat and tidy and I have no trouble sleeping in the large beds. Housekeeping and room service requests are handled quickly and pleasantly by the staff. The service from staff from the time you reach the "Glass' room for breakfast until you leave is excellent, as is the choice of food and drinks. Finally, you can use express check-out when you have to leave to save time. I have stayed at several other city hotels and would not stay anywhere else now.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent return”
Reviews.Author: mekanoid
Reviews.Content: I just completed a fantastic 3 day stay at Hilton Sydney. I stayed in one of their relaxation rooms which is really the way to go if you can stretch your budget. The rooms are spacious in contrast to some other reviews which refer to the much smaller hilton guest rooms. From the friendly greeting by Hannah at checkin to the assistance offered by the concierge desk I was well looked after during my stay. I also enjoyed being able to run meetings, lunches, dinners and a cocktail function all within high quality facilities within the complex.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: vzm1904
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Hilton and it has become our place to stay in Sydney. The location is perfect: circular quay, shopping, public transport, dining etc everything an easy walk away. The rooms are modern and have a wonderful feel, bathrooms are beautiful. We've stayed in a king relaxation suite and exec room. The breakfast is the best hotel breakfast with plenty of options, especially if you're not into the standard bacon & eggs. On our first visit to the hotel we had to delay our travel as we were trapped in flooded rural Qld. The hotel was great, they allowed us to make changes to our prepaid rate due to the unforseen circumstances. We couldn't have been happier that they understood our predicament and with their willingness to accomodate us. Hilton Sydney ticks all the boxes and is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed it”
Reviews.Author: chris813
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel very comfortable and classy, and the location was perfect. The room was very comfortable and clean. My room rate didn't include breakfast, which was so expensive to purchase that I wound up walking to Starbucks instead. Last time I stayed at Sheraton on the Park and I enjoyed both hotels equally.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kempisonvacation
Reviews.Content: A good place to stay in the Sydney CBD. The location is the best aspect of the Hilton and i would want to stay there for more than 2 nights, where as i would in many of the other Hilton Hotels scattered around the globe.

Reviews.Title: “If a hotel is measured by it's staff, Hilton Sydney wins hands down”
Reviews.Author: BlindNinja
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Hilton Sydney to break a long (36 hours+) trip, arriving at 6am, Jonathan at reception was extremely helpful and patient, considering we've been travelling for almost 2 days and were a bit slow. Arriving Easter Sunday, Jonathan checked us in on the spot, technically we should have checked in 8 hours later at 2pm, this was a very nice touch that made our trip much more pleasant. Breakfast was fantastic, I have to say I am not a big fan of Hilton, but I am a big fan of their breakfast, there is something exceptional about it. I asked one of the waiters about the time the shops open (Being Easter Sunday) she didn't know and disappeared to ask. After 20 minutes I gave up thinking she forgot, only for her to return saying nobody knew so she went downstairs to check few shops on the main street and see if they have any notices in the windows. EXCEPTIONAL! That was the most amazing service I have received from a "Normal" (Non-Concierge) member of staff, she's not normal, she's Hiltons biggest assets, unfortunately I forgot to note her name down. The room was also excellent, clean and quiet. These little service details make a hotel visit exceptional or a flop. Hilton passed with flying colours.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: prozerran
Reviews.Content: 2 nights around Easter - $420 with Hilton Jan sale Pros - awesome location, 1 minute walk to the central shopping mall and 5-10mins to darling harbour, 10-15mins to Rocks/Circular Quay/Opera House. - recently renovated rooms were awesome. Very modern lighting and design especially the bathroom! - excellent buffett breakfast was included in this package. Unfortunately the restaurant was closed for dinner/lunch over the 2 nights we were there. - i am a big fan of the block out shutters. Cons - reception staff were efficient but did not make you feel welcome. No real emotion and didnt go the extra mile to chat with you.(only a slight gripe) - new minibar automatic deduction! At least they had big signs indicating that they would charge you immediately if you moved the item. -closing of the Restaurant and Zeta bar for 2 nights Overall great location and hotel. Exactly what you expect from hilton in a big city! Closing of the restaurant and bar was a little disappointing, but i guess it was over Easter. Would be interesting to see the Executive lounge, but then again so many restaurants/bar and things to do in sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Tip Top Stay”
Reviews.Author: ShalMay
Reviews.Content: I've travelled the world twice over and enjoyed many a fine hotels and resorts on my journeys. Since joining Hilton Honors several years ago I have become a loyal customer of Hiltons high caliber of Hotels throughout the world. I found the hilton Sydney with so much charisma, and my dealing with the staff I felt connected. The Concierge and the Cafe Cino Staff in particular were marvelous indeed. Upon returning from the Blue Mountains I had injured myself and they offered me wheelchair and assistance through out my stay. I will definately be back as I had a tip top stay!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing room”
Reviews.Author: StefR
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel because we figured we would be loyal to the Hilton brand (and it seemed to get good reviews here) since we are HHonors members. Now that we have stayed, I wish I had selected another hotel. To start off, this hotel is very well located if your intended purpose of the trip is shopping. Its right in the heart of the central business area and surrounded by malls and shopping arcades. Its also right next to the Town Hall stop on the subway (and airport link) so that is a very nice plus. If you are a first time visitor to Sydney as I was, it wasn't an ideal location as its about 20 minutes from the Rocks/Circular Quay area that has all of the tourist attractions. I was aware of the location so the walk wasn't an issue The room is where it goes awry. First off the room had a musty smell which I assume comes from the tired carpeting in the room. The room was very small, even by European standards and had some items that just took up space like a large glass cylinder lamp that provided nearly no light at all. The shades in the room were yellowing and stained. The bathroom is also small. It has a tub which is nice but I would have much preferred more space at the sink which barely had enough room to put a toiletry bag without falling into the sink. Also it should be noted that the bathroom door did not lock and there was an opaque glass wall between bathroom and room (which meant you can watch the outline of the person showering from the bed. The lobby is quite busy with a small concierge desk. The two times we stopped to speak to the concierge, we had a negative experience. The first time I was given bad information about where to buy tickets so that disrupted our plans for the day a bit. The second time we got a snotty remark when asking to borrow the umbrellas. The breakfast that was included in our room rate was at the hotels restaurant. This was very nice with good pastry, fresh fruit, etc on offer as well as some hot items I didn't eat. Service was very good here. The executive lounge was large but also quite crowded most times. Service here was also good. The hotel charges for internet use and it is very spotty - was difficult to use at times because it kept logging me off. Overall not terrible but for the rate charged, we could have stayed at a better hotel elsewhere in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in all areas”
Reviews.Author: GW78
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Sydney for a weekend away with my girlfriend. We stayed in a suite with a fantastic view, excellent furnishings and high quality service. The staff were helpful from start to finish, and the extra services provided made the difference. An example of this would be the access to the Executive Lounge - a wonderful addition and a great place to relax and still feel at home within the hotel when you didn't want to spend it in the room. The breakfast was fantastic, and the bar was all class, although I preferred some of the bars that were in close proximity. The location was fantastic for shopping and dinning, and the public transport nearby was very handy. I will definitely stay here again when I am next in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Its a Hilton....”
Reviews.Author: freeqwent_tvlr_0505
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice, big, and well positioned. For Sydney and access to most areas and activities, its a good place to stay. There are a few other hotels that are just as good, but are closer to Circular Quay - Opera House, etc. Check-in was very efficient and the concierge were particularly helpful. The Hilton customer service shone through at most staff interaction. The restaurant - Glass, is very nice. For breakfast, lunch and dinner, it never fails to impress. Room service 'create your own' pizza is a must try. Particularly good around the midnight snack time! The rooms let this hotel down. Small. Very small. Compact, but well appointed. Like a top of the range Corolla. The 'magic button' on the phone is a very innovative option in rooms. Press that and you can get someone that will help you with just about anything. The executive floor is worth it - particularly if you take advantage of the continental breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “Large modern hotel in convenient central location.”
Reviews.Author: centurymotors
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located within easy walking distance from Darling Harbour and Circular Quay.It's a typical large modern business hotel providing all modern amenities. The rooms are functional and provide a degree of comfort.The reception staff are friendly and knowledgeable. We were provided with a room on arrival even though we were 6 hours before check-in time. This was much appreciated! The restaurant is styled as a glass brasserie which suits younger visitors but maybe not those who prefer a more intimate dining experience. The breakfast buffet was excellent if a little expensive.The holel is directly opposite the Queen Victoria Buiding - well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “First time in OZ”
Reviews.Author: LMs2Cents
Reviews.Content: I was extremely pleased with my stay at the Hilton. Before booking I read the reviews on Trip Advisor and Expedia to help me make my decision which is why I decided to write one myself. When I booked there was a special on Executive Suites w/ access to the Hilton Executive Lounge... the best decision I made in planning my trip to Australia. Considering how expensive everything is in Sydney, including the food, it was great to get a continental breakfast and pre-dinner h'drvs as part of my booking. Plus the executive room had computers w/ free internet access....seems like a hotel with free internet is very rare in Australia. I booked the Twin Executive suite. The room was very small but comfortable and nice. The Hilton is located very close to Darling Harbor which has a number of really great resturants. It is also a short 15 to 20 minute was to Circular Quay...if you don't mind walking. I didn't b/c I figured I was burning vacation calories.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, staff, service.”
Reviews.Author: Virginupperclass67
Reviews.Content: Always take an executive room here when I'm in Sydney. Definitely one of the better Hiltons worldwide.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Kim B
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Sydney was a terrific hotel to stay at during our first trip to Sydney. The Opera House, Rocks area, Darling Harbor and Harbor Bridge are all within walking distance. There are also many great restaurants nearby. The room was very clean and quiet. They even had electronic blinds to make the room nice and dark at night and in the morning. I would definitely recommend this hotel. Definitely take the train from Sydney Airport into Sydney. It is only around $15 and it is so easy to do! Someone earlier posted to take the train from the airport and exit at Circular Quay. Don't do that! It is about a 20 - 30 minute walk from Circular Quay to the hotel with luggage. Exit Town Hall. It is almost right across the street!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service, super staff and a standard setter”
Reviews.Author: Junior13
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hilton was everything we could have hoped for. The staff were superb incredibly professional and went out of their way to be helpful. The entire hotel staff took great pride in their work and it was reflected in the high quality of service. Little touches everywhere made our holiday that much more enjoyable and I could not fault any aspect. Despite having a number of pre-booked activities and sights to see we could easily have just stayed in the hotel. I have yet to find a hotel in Sydney that has such a comprehensive customer focussed approach to looking after its guests. I highly recommend the Hilton to anyone wanting to stay in Sydney - you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: candrews53
Reviews.Content: The Sydney Hilton was great, location couldn't be better. Easy access to everything in the city. Service, Staff, Food (the Breakfast!), Executive Lounge were great. Rooms were very clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: profwho88
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, not the best i've ever been in. Kinda cheapy stuff in the room (light fixtures, etc). Too many mirrors to make room look bigger. internet charge is absolutely insanely high.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in Sydney!!”
Reviews.Author: Jusine710
Reviews.Content: We booked the suite on the 40th floor and it did not dissappoint. The bathroom was spacious and very clean with lovely Crabtree and Evelyn products. If booking ensure you book an executive package, we always find this good value for breakfast, afternoon tea, evening canapes and drinks are included, as well as all day coffee, non alcoholic beverages. Also by taking advantage of the lower cost upgrades saves you a considerable penny. The location of this hotel is excellent in walking distance to circular key, china town, and is directly opposite the QVB. We will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, reasonable rates, top class hotel.”
Reviews.Author: WATravellerPerth
Reviews.Content: Central city location is excellent, walked to Luna park across the bridge for a meeting which took 40 minutes, brilliant morning walk. A couple of issues, tried to send a fax at 7pm but the business center was closed, seems way too early for an international class hotel. Was directed to reception who couldn't help, and was told to call room service! Also found the restaurant Glass overpriced. Food was good buy walked out $200 poorer plus drinks for an ok entree and main. If you decide to go to Glass book and ask for a window seat, otherwise my opinion is that it is too expensive for what they deliver. One other comment, a restaurant special for $55 pp meal was left iny room. Turns out they have a separate crappy limited menu if you use the special. Thought that was poor form. The $55 meal menu looks like a $30 meal. So hotel good, not so impressed with restaurant Glass though. Value rating would have been 4 except for the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional in every aspect, location, service, friendliness, atmosphere and the very best breakfast..”
Reviews.Author: stfn03
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked in the door the staff were friendly and went out of their way to make our stay the memorable experience that it was. It would be difficult to single out a particular staff member as every person we encountered was equally friendly and helpful. Breakfast was included in our stay and everyone I spoke to in Sydney remarked on the magnificent breakfast on learning that we were staying at the Hilton. The rooms were very clean and well maintained each day of our stay. Just a tip though, if you request a twin room as we did be aware that the two beds are single beds and not king singles as I had expected. However, the location made up for lack of sleep. It is so accessible to everywhere. We caught the train from the airport to Town Hall and walked through the QVB to the Hilton's from door. It is also within walking distance of Circular Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Night's Sleep”
Reviews.Author: nicholas3801
Reviews.Content: If you do stay at the refurbished Hilton in Sydney, whatever you donâ€™t stay in the rooms next to the lift well as all you hear all night is the lift going up and down and what I think is some sort of belt slapping against the guides. Not a good nightâ€™s sleep but the room is nice and well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great if we had been told we'd been upgraded”
Reviews.Author: BelDan23
Reviews.Content: My husband booked a weekend away for our anniversary and he didnt hold back. I was amazed by the enourmous room, the great meal out, the exciting day adventures to the park. He felt quite happy with what he had managed on a reasonable budget until we went to check out. He had selected when booking to be give the OPTION of upgrading upon checkin, however when we checked in he asked if it was available only to be told that he was already in a top level suite so their wasn't much higher than the penthouse to go to. Ok, no worries, he'd done the best already. However, when we checked out we were being charged close to $200 more per night than originally quoted and upon investigation found that we had been automatically upgraded. Not offered, just upgraded and charged more for the privilage. Don't get me wrong, the room was lovely and we would have given the option most likely agreed to the upgrade charge but the issue was we were NOT asked. By the end of the heated discussion they didn't charge us for the upgrade, as we had never give consent for the charge. Good, but the whole experience really did leave a bad taste at the end of an otherwise perfect weekend. Be careful Hilton, your customers do still check their bills from time to time.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Hotel Sydney”
Reviews.Author: mice_046
Reviews.Content: Just had a wonderful stay at the Hilton on 6th March 2011, it is a wonderful hotel. My only problem that I have is, if you are travelling and book from WOTIF or any of the other online sites, you are not told that they take from your credit card $100 AUD for each night you stay to cover any costs. Now I have no problem with allowing any hotel to do a swipe of my credit card (and I would pay for anything I use) but they actually deduct the money in advance, then you have to wait 3 - 4 working days to get it back. So my friend was there 3 days, did not buy anything from the room (shops so close by) and had $300 AUD taken just in case !! why not take the amount if you leave and have an outstanding. It can be unfair or bad for a person who is travelling to have the Hotel keep your money for 3 -4 days before you get it returned, That just does not seem fair to me. It is a very nice hotel, but very pricey on meals and snacks and parking.

Reviews.Title: “Service and staff excellent. Shame about the room furniture.”
Reviews.Author: Pipoflux
Reviews.Content: We couldn't fault the service and attention to your personal well being by the staff. Every request was completed with courtesy and speed. My one gripe would be the room. We booked an executive room which gave us access to the exec lounge which was excellent, however I was expecting more spacious accommodation. On reflection the room needed some of the furniture removing and a smaller bed. There was no space for luggage and a desk, unnecessary lamp, and footstool though useful took up too much space and left no room for 2 people move about at the same time!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for seminars”
Reviews.Author: fernvan
Reviews.Content: I recently had to attend a seminar at the Hilton hotel in Sydney. The hotel itself is very easy to get to,.being in the heart of Sydney CBD area. once at the hotel, i was instantly greeted by the hotel's staff who directed me to the bank of lifts which would take me to Level 2 where the seminar was to be held. The catering & cleanliness at the place were both top notch. The hotel's catering staff were at hand to refill water and juice jugs, plates and platters etc seamlessly without disrupting the seminar. This is an excellet place to conduct seminars when you need to focus on the seminar and leave the logistics of the venue and catering to teh hotel.

Reviews.Title: “absolut outstanding quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: stef4975
Reviews.Content: right downtown Sydney, excellent location, exits on two important streets, great morning buffets, excellent gym with a superb swimming pool and suanas. No surprises on the bad side, very polite staff. Expensive internet access, buy a Vodafone stick instead.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton, Sydney, a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Hilton255103
Reviews.Content: The service at the Hilton was very professional and friendly. The room we had was very nice, gorgeous bathroom with the added touch of the Crabtree and Evelyn products making it special, bit of added luxury. Also the nice white bathrobes, which I actually purchased at the end of our stay. Comfortable bed, and overall the room lent itself to an enjoyable experience. The restaurants and bars were top class also. The Executive Lounge was a 'hit' with us, lovely food and drinks. The service was very good, not lacking in any area. Location of the hotel, you couldn't falt, very handy to everything in the city, walking distance to all we had time to explore.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressive”
Reviews.Author: brmusicman
Reviews.Content: I stayed here two times (multiple nights each time) in February, 2011 as business brought me to-and-from Sydney. The hotel impressed on both visits! I will definitely look at staying here on return visits to Sydney -- every facility was top-notch and the hotel delivered service that matches the high quality of its facilities. It's in a great location, right in the center of Sydney, steps away from the Town Hall train station and across the street from the great shopping and restaurants in the Queen Victoria Building and along Pitt Street. Circular Quay is about a 20-minute walk or easy bus ride, and Darling Harbour is also within walking distance. Bus lines to Bondi and Coogee beaches stop within a block o two. It was an ideal location for sightseeing within the city. The hotel's facilities were impressive. The lobby is a light-filled atrium with lots of modern elements and a good vibe -- modern, but not obnoxiously trendy. The hallways were all clean, well-lit, and stylish. The rooms were on the small side, but very thoughtfully designed to maximize the space; I really appreciated that, despite being small, there was still space to hang up clothes, set a large bag, and have a working area. Lighting in the rooms was also excellent, as were the automatic shades that provided total blackout at night. The bathroom had a walk-in shower and deep-soaking tub. The concierge lounge, to which I was provided access as a Diamond member with Hilton HHonors, was superb -- a very abundant continental breakfast each morning, tea and refreshments throughout the day, a cake/pastry service in the afternoon, and very heavy appetizers at night that, on a couple of nights where I had lots of work to do, were enough to serve as a light dinner. The lounge itself was large, with several seating areas; computers with internet access were also present. The staff in the lounge was consistently welcoming and helpful. The superb concierge lounge added a lot of value to my visit. Beyond the lounge, I was impressed with service throughout my stay. Housekeeping was thorough, with thoughtful touches; front desk staff was anxious to fulfill every request; the concierge was consistently helpful in giving directions and suggestions. Everyone was very welcoming and friendly; there was no hint of a snobbish vibe. All in all, this hotel was a true pleasure and delivered an experience worthy of its price and its 5-star labeling.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convieniant”
Reviews.Author: Nickvdw
Reviews.Content: I had an excellent stay at the Hilton Sydney and felt rejuvenated after a good nights sleep for the meetings I had planned. The position was fantastic and the staff were accommodating. I would definately reccomend this hotel to anyone looking for quality experience.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton - A high rise with a high”
Reviews.Author: detoxf73
Reviews.Content: Super hotel bang on the street where all the action is. The coffe shop at the lobby level is extremely convenient while you check in or waiting for a friend. Straight down the road is ferry ride/ water taxi to Torango Zoo....The rooms were a bit small. the location is poerfect and that is the hotel's usp.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, central location”
Reviews.Author: neraleek_travels
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton for 2 nights while on a business trip. The lobby is impressive and the room itself - faultless. Room and bathroom was extremely clean and well presented. There is a 'pillow menu' to allow selection of different pillows. Room service breakfast was very punctual, however I wasn't impressed by the quality of the food - I had scrambled eggs w hasbrown and tomato and found it tasted fairly average. The buffet breakfast was expansive with large selection of breads and pastries. Central location and I wished I could have spent more time enjoying the hotel amenities, and around Sydney. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra modern and cool”
Reviews.Author: oliver86
Reviews.Content: This is a belated post, but I keep thinking of what a nice time we had at the Hilton. It was for my boyfriend's birthday, and we were going to the theatre. We stayed at the Hilton because they had an amazing rate on offer that included breakfast. The room was immaculate with views over the city, it was so quite and had an ultra comfortable bed. I couldn't get over the fact that there was a TV in the shower! Did I use it? No. But it's still cool to say that you can watch the news in the shower! He had dinner at Glass Brasserie which my second visit and lovely! Although the thermostat was far to hot - my bf was only wearing a dress shirt but he looked at risk of heat stroke or dehydration... It was not an issue anywhere else in the hotel, and is but a minor quibble. Breakfast at glass was equally good, and I well and truely ate more than I thought possible for a small female. Staff were friendly and courteous - they offered us a complimentary late checkout of 12pm when I inquired - perfect for us!

Reviews.Title: “Love This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: gjtucson
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this Hilton. My first visit 6 months ago was great, so I chose to stay again even though the price had gone up considerably as the hotel was completely booked. As others have noted, the hotel is a very short walk (about 1 block) from the Town Hall train station, so it is convenient for those arriving from the airport, for example. My check-in was quick, and I was pleasantly surprised when the desk agent told me that my breakfast would be free at the Glass Brasserie because there were no room upgrades available. The room was fine for me - a bit on the small side, but luxurious by European standards. Also, the room design was very modern, clean, and efficient. The location is excellent - next to the monorail, a short walk to Darling Harbor or Hyde Park, and a moderate walk to the Opera House. I didn't have a chance to check out the Executive Lounge this trip. But, I did find that the breakfast buffet at the Glass Brasserie was spectacular! It is worth the price ($30) given that food prices in Sydney are so high anywhere you go. When I entered the restaurant, the staff told me that I was not on the "free breakfast" list. But, after I explained my situation at check-in, the manager, without hesitation, told me to be his guest that day. I offered to pay until I was able to straighten things out at the front desk, but he told me not to bother - excellent service ethic! Upon checking out later in the morning, I noticed that guests were enjoying a tray of pastries in the lobby. I asked what the special occasion was - it was Sunday morning. So, I helped myself and was quickly on my way. There was one negative aspect to my stay, which was not under Hilton's control, and is quite unusual at any hotel. There is a lesson here for anyone finding themselves in this situation. There was a loud screaming argument in the room next door that woke me at 2:30 AM and continued for about 20 minutes. I considered calling the front desk (which is what I should have done), but that would have implicated me to the screamers next door if anything bad happened to them. At checkout, I asked what my options were in this situation. I was told that I should have called the desk to get security on the floor. I also noted this issue on the Guest Comment Card and I received a personal email from the hotel manager apologizing for the problem. There was also a hotel feature I had not seen elsewhere before -- they offer a "pillow menu". The guest can choose from 5 different styles (type of fill and support) in soft, medium, and firm options. Just call the front desk or use their MAGIC button. I think the staff at this hotel all care greatly about their guests. Everyone was extremely helpful and pleasant, from check-in to check-out (Concierge, front desk, restaurant personnel) - my concerns were their concerns. I'd go back in a minute!

Reviews.Title: “Far below five star”
Reviews.Author: tribalinsight
Reviews.Content: I am not sure how this hotel rates so highly on TripAdvisor. My review is based on an expectation of five star, rather than whether this is a good or bad hotel. And, five star it is not. The rooms have been refurbished, but they are still the same rooms in terms of size as the old Hilton I remember from the 80s. Very small, dark, and noisy. The images that Hilton supply, are fairly true, but they don't give you a real sense of how small the room is. Nearly all the rooms have connecting doors with other rooms, and you can hear the quietest conversations from your neighbours. Asking to be moved doesn't help, because you are told that most of the rooms have adjoining doors. On top of that, the lift noise is constant - all night. So, don't expect a good night's sleep. Sydney hotels seem to be getting worse, while at the same time, more expensive. I haven't had a good hotel experience for three or four years. Charging $29.00 a day, after paying nearly $500 for a room, is just mean, and I do tire of this in Australia. Most hotels I stay at overseas, include free internet - what is the problem with Australian hotels? This is the first time I have stayed at the Sydney Hilton, and it is unlikely I will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugVictim01
Reviews.Content: such a shame I had the worst experience at this hotel, as I loved the location and the restaurant. Finding the hotel entrance is difficult, but once getting to check in, I was told It was my lucky day and received an upgrade. The room was freezing cold, and when I tried to adjust the thermostat, I could either have sauna hot or freezer cold. Not a great room, at least the bathroom was clean. Upon checking out, I was over charged, and when I argued the fact that I had booked online via their website at a certain rate (and provided the receipt) I was told there was an error and I had to pay the full rate - great service.... Not all negative though, there were some highlights. The restaurant at the hotel is great, could not fault a single item. Only reason I will step back into that hotel again is to visit the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: millionsofmyles
Reviews.Content: Love this Hotel. Nothing is an issue. Had some passport issues before an overseas trip I was leaving for the next day, they were extremely helpful.
