The Magic button is awesome and they even came to help out with a phone charger that I forgot. Glass Brasserie is great for dinner but the breakfast must be experienced. Concierges are brilliant. Always enjoy my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “One night stand in Xtesy”
Reviews.Author: LaosDarthVader
Reviews.Content: Afer a long flight with the pidgion carry that is Qantas and a horrible taxi ride with a drive I could only assune learnt his driving skill dodging bombs in downtown Bagdahd, walking into the Hilton Sydney was like a breath of fresh summer breeze. The Hotel was well light, the ambiance was subduded and the staff welcoming. Pretty much everything I could ask for. I am not usually one to write reviews, but the level of service that I recieved compels me too. Professional, quick and warm, without being obtrusive. The staff at the Concierge Desk really stood out. They could quite possible be the most genuine and knowledgeable staff members I have come across. Nathan in particular stood out in regards of serivce. Nothing that I asked was too much for him and he was more than willing to go out his way to see that all my leisure time was serviced to the highest levels. I really dont have to much more to say, as I wont get into the room or dining features, as they are typical of what you would find in most five star hotels. This review is more about the staff at the Hilton and how they are world class. There are numerous five star hotels in Sydney, but what sets Hilton above the rest is their staff. Any time I come back to Sydney, this is where I will be staying, as I feel the warmth of genuine service from people that care.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise birthday weekend away”
Reviews.Author: megs2travel
Reviews.Content: I surprised my boyfriend with a birthday weekend in Sydney and booked to stay at the Hilton Hotel. My travel agent had let the Hilton know that it was my boyfriendâ€™s birthday upon booking and to my surprise when we got up to our beautiful room the lovely staff at the Hotel had set up two giant Happy Birthday helium balloons and two boxes of gourmet chocolates with a personally singed birthday card from the manager. Every detail was perfect during our stay and I would not hesitate to recommend the Hilton Sydney to anyone looking for a special weekend away. All the staff were so friendly and helpful and they made our stay even more perfect. Thanks to all the staff at the Hilton Hotel Sydney for making our trip one that we'll never forget!

Reviews.Title: “friendly, efficient, professional, elegant, helpful, happy.”
Reviews.Author: JarrodHolland
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in a suite on the Executive Floor. The service was AMAZING. Every request we made was attended to with accuracy and speed. The room was magnificent, as was all our encounters with staff. The professional standards were the same whether we were chatting with a cleaner or a manager. .... wonderful. We recommend strongly that you stay at the Hilton. We are returning customers, albeit a long time since our last visit. We were married in the Hilton Sydney in 1989, and we returned this month to celebrate our daughters 21st birthday.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend at Hilton Sydney”
Reviews.Author: BryceQ57
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Hilton Sydney. Our room was spacious and from the moment we walked into the Hotel lobby everything was really effortless. King size beds also a big plus. Easy access to all in central Sydney. We will be back. Bryce

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel experience!!”
Reviews.Author: Courtney80
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently had the pleasure of staying at the Sydney Hilton! From the moment we stepped in the door the service was first class! We were able to check in early and were also given a room upgrade. The staff were extremely helpful and courteous and couldn't help us enough! Our stay also included full buffet breakfast which was second to none! Any possible breakfast item was available and everything was fresh and delicious! Serving staff were friendly and extremely efficent! We wouldn't hesitate in recommending the Sydney Hilton to anyone!!! Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our experience at the Hilton and

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Shelby047
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hilton through Wotif on a bed and breakfast deal. Due to the amount we paid we were expecting the rooms to be quite luxurious but was very disappointed. Room was very small and had a large desk which took up most of the space. Felt like a "corporate" room. The bathroom had evidence of a leak in the ceiling which made it feel a bit tatty. Breakfast was plentiful but almost cold and no decent coffee! Only coffee offered was filter coffee poured by the waitress. Car park was $45 per 24 hours and we asked what the extra charge was if we went ten minutes over and we were told $57!! When I stay in Sydney again I would be looking at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel - but be prepared for the construction noise”
Reviews.Author: Dustymiller44
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at the Hilton due to the flooding in Queensland which changed our holiday plans. The Hotel is great, we stayed on the 35th floor in a very stylish room. The downside was that at 0730 work started on the building site in pit street with heavy concrete breaking machinery which made sleep impossible. I guess if you are in Sydney on business this is not a big problem, but on holiday I prefer to sleep a bit longer. Staff were excellent and helpful, the facilities are great and the hotel is right in the centre of town. I only have two complaints. Free internet access is a must for any luxury hotel. If MacDonald can do it so can Hilton. My second beef is that by booking direct on the Hilton website the price is 60 dollars more than by booking through an agency, and you don't get Hilton Honours points unless you book direct.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great Location and Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: JuliePaulT
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everything we wanted. Great Location and fantastic staff. We had a problem with our bags not arriving on our same flight and the staff were great at providing toothbrushes etc and information on local places to go to get emergency backups. Ron and Steve on concierge were lovely. They book various restaurants for us and were professional and polite at all times. Breakfast was amazing! So much choice and the staff were lovely. The room was slightly on the small side, but we werenâ€™t in it much so it didnâ€™t matter. The bed was very comfy!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Sydney Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: emptynester44
Reviews.Content: We spent a little over 2 weeks at the Sydney Hilton. The hotel was beautiful and a great location. The staff was superb especially Jason the concierge. He was especially friendly, knowledgeable & very helpful. We stayed in a suite that was roomy and confortable. The open bathroom was great except when you need to get up in the middle of the night or early morning to use the facilities. No way to keep the light from waking my spouse. The night shades on the windows work so well that I had a hard time waking in the morning because it stayed dark in the room. Since we arrived early morning (7am) our room was not ready but they allowed us the use of another room to shower and change since we just arrived from a 14 hour flight from LAX. They moved our luggage for us into our new room while we were out exploring the city for the day. That evening the chef at Glass sent up a complimentary variety of desserts for us to try. Each day they slipped weather information and any specials the hotel was running that day. The executive lounge was open all day with breakfast in the morning and light evening food. There were a couple of nights we just ate in the lounge because we weren't that hungry but there was plenty of food to choose from: sandwhiches, hot appetizers, chips and dips, sushi, etc. Breakfast in Glass restaurant each morning was fabulous. Even though it is serve yourself they will make you other things upon request (egg white omelettes, cappucino, etc). It was so nice to sit overlooking the Victoria building for breakfast each morning. We had dinner in Glass one evening but the food was not really to our liking (very meat heavy which seems to be the Sydney norm). We enjoyed a comedy show (Chris Wainhouse) downstairs in the marble bar. We topped it off with a visit to the upstairs bar Zeta. It was a fun evening for sure. We also took advantage of the free access to the fitness club downstairs. It was vastly superior to other hotel fitness rooms as it is a full club. There is plenty of state of the art equipment, indoor pool, sauna & steam room as well as a full schedule of fitness classes. Location is great with a short walk to darling harbour or the harbour area. There were a couple of nights it was raining, I was in heels and did not feel like walking the steep rocky streets so we decided to take a cab. The cab queue at the hotel was kind of a long wait and since traffic is very heavy in the evenings it took a long time to get anywhere. It was worth it anyway just have to allow enough time to get where you need to go. We ended up purchasing an unlimited bas/train/ferry pass which was very convenient since the train station is right across the street at the queen victoria building. We rode the trains & ferries quite a bit but did not ride any of the buses. The monorail is a separate pass and we may buy that for that next time since it is the most direct route to darling harbour. We loved the hotel as well as the city. We are planning to return to Sydney in March and will stay at the Sydney Hilton again.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Sydney”
Reviews.Author: EdmundL
Reviews.Content: The hotel room I stayed in was a little bit small. However, the executive design of the compact room turn me on while I found out that I could 'black out' the room by controlling the blind. My room was over-looking the Sydney Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: bethoSydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton as a lucky dip on Wot If. It was an excellent stay from the moment we arrived and were greeted by a smile and an efficient receptionist, through to the beautiful room, which was quiet with crisp, white linen and even a TV in the shower ! Room Service was quick. The breakfast in the Hilton is one not to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “For me, the no1 hotel in sydney”
Reviews.Author: jetskijames
Reviews.Content: Perfect location as a tourist base in sydney or CBD for business this hotel has everything. Friendly staff, great modern rooms that do not feel impersonal. Good bathrooms. A full and extensive gym, two saunas, 25metre pool. Great breakfast with some quite luxury items sucg as superfood shots, smoked salmon plus all the usuals. If you have lounge access on level 36 even better...the on site hotel bars are also some of the best in sydney . I can not recomend thos hotel enough and cant wait to return this sunday

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: LKBrown
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel with some Australian friends on a short break from Melbourne. We loved it! We've stayed in loads of Hiltons but this really stood out. The location was ideal for getting to the main sights and places to eat/drink. You could easily walk to the Botanical Gardens, Circular Quay, the Opera House and The Rocks, and you're close to transport links for other places like Darling Harbour. You can also get there from the airport by train in around half an hour. The rooms were clean, comfortable, and modern in style with interesting features such as a frosted glass wall between the shower and the bedroom, and floor to ceiling windows with a great view over the city including the harbour bridge. The Marble Bar in the basement of the hotel was a real surprise, not your usual nondescript hotel bar, and a great choice of cocktails. I would definitely recommend this hotel. It wasn't cheap but it still felt like good value for money given the location and overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “No Worries”
Reviews.Author: accipitor
Reviews.Content: Great rooms with all the amenities you need. Concierge was excellent booking all the restaurants we wanted and the front desk staff were very helpful also. Only had breakfast there but the staff were fantastic and food choice and quality were excellent. The hotel is a ten minute walk from Circular Quay. As HH Diamond members we stay in a lot of Hiltons and this is a good one.

Reviews.Title: “If only home was like this!”
Reviews.Author: janebode10
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, our stay at the Hilton, Sydney was nothing short of sensational. The staff who serviced our room went that one step further and their attention to detail was greatly appreciated. The advice and recommendations of concierge staff was spot on and in accordance with our needs and interests. They were exceptionally busy (given the cricket was on) but always made us feel that we were the only people who mattered. The valet who attended to us on our arrival was quite possibly one of the most cheerful and helpful people we have met. He remembered us from our initial fleeting meeting and consistently asked if he could be of any help right throughout our stay. Our room was spacious, superbly appointed (and we only had a standard room) and had everything we needed and more. The location of the hotel is excellent. Everything seemed to be within walking distance including restaurants, shops, Circular Quay, Darling Harbour, Oxford Street, Paddington, Art Gallery and of course transport - ferries/buses to Bondi etc. Loved the gym - which we certainly needed after the complimentary cakes on Sunday morning! Can't wait to go back - our accommodation and the Hilton staff certainly helped make our holiday memorable. Great value for money - worth every cent (even though we did get a great deal on 'wotif')!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hilton I ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: geyes
Reviews.Content: IF you have to travel to Sydney, I would suggest to stay at the Hilton on George, Breakfast was amazing, rooms were clean, bed was very comfy. Great gym in the hotel. Location was great, 10 minute walk to the Sydney Harbour. Trains and buses very close by. The best part was the service, the people that worked there are top rated. I will be staying there next time I go. Best Hilton I ever stayed at. Canadian traveller.

Reviews.Title: “a good mystery deal hotel”
Reviews.Author: hipfunkgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Sydney for 1 night just for fun. We booked a wotif.com mystery deal and we were pleased to get the Hilton. The room was clean and plush, but the room and the bathroom were a little small. The shower head and the pillows were not the best, but other than that we were really happy, the bath products were geat, the reception and the concierge staff were fantastic. The buffet breakfast was awesome! fresh juice ect. I wont be dissapointed in my next mystery deal is at the hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: lukmi
Reviews.Content: Getting the free suite upgrade upon checking in made the stay even better! I can't fault this hotel, perfect location, views, great staff, yummy breakfast, modern and sleek design. The suite faced north, west and south, you could see across the whole floor from one side to the other, it was truly beautiful. I had to check in and out twice and both time it was swift and easy, no queue. The second night I stayed in a smaller room which was still one of the best I've stayed at. Overall it was much better than Shangri-La, Sheraton on the Park and Marriott at Circular Quay. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Very Average”
Reviews.Author: bnecpl
Reviews.Content: Stayed during a Saturday night in December in a Executive Room including Club Lounge access. 1. Room - very, very, very small rooms, if you're travelling with anyone and staying for more then a day or two the room will be very cramped. No couch etc. Room and bathroom are very well appointed though. 2. Club Lounge - we've used club lounges at a lot of hotels and this was by far the worst. The food selection and quality was plain poor. Afternoon tea was a cold scone with butter (not even cream). Evening canapes was a mix of poor quality cheese, oily pizzas and dried out pasta (no sauce). For breakfast we got there just before closure time and they litrally pulled it down around us as apposed to waiting for us to get something. I wouldn't bother with this club lounge again we were not at all happy with it. 3. Noise - the hotel has a night club under it, even on the 28th floor we got to hear the club music until the early hours of the morning. Staff were friendly but unpolished. Overall we wouldn't stay again nor recommend this hotel to others - if you want a real 5 star experience try up the road at The Westin - that's where we normally stay and where we'll stay again in future.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but terrible Concierge”
Reviews.Author: WestCoastRain
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel located right in the city centre and close to everything. Reception: was friendly and we were checked in quickly. The room: Fantastic! Nice views, comfortable bed and amazing rain shower. Glass Brasserie: We had the buffet breakfast every morning and it was delicious. Lots of selection, fresh fruit smoothies made-to-order, cereals, hot breakfast, breads, fruits, etc. The staff was extremely polite and it was the best service we received in the hotel. Zeta Bar: Modern and sexy. We really liked the atmosphere. There's a huge terrace where you can enjoy the warm evening breezes and great city views. The drinks were inspired but pricey. My one disappointment was that I ordered a Mai Tai which the menu described as being served in a pineapple. When it arrived it was in an ordinary glass. I was told after it arrived that they don't serve it in a pineapple anymore. Marble Bar: We expected a grand and opulent room but instead it was a dark and drab basement pub. The atmosphere was also drab. The staff was apathetic and the menu was boring pub food. It's too bad because this room could be something great. Concierge: The worst concierge service we've ever experienced!! They acted like they didn't want to be there and they made no effort to answer our questions or help us even though that is their job. The first time one of them gave us attitude, we just chalked it up to him having a bad day. When we experienced this every time we called or went to the desk, we realized they were just bad concierges. The hotel needs to spend some time training them. It was shocking and completely unexceptable. This is a five star property! The bellman need to be applauded though. They jumped in a couple of times when we were dealing with the concierge and tried to help us. It's obvious they see how bad the concierge service is. Why isn't management doing anything about it? Loved this hotel and would recommend it only if you never need to use the concierge service. Otherwise it's a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Another excellent stay at the Hilton Sydney”
Reviews.Author: BMW50_11
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Hilton Sydney during a number of business trips it was nice to take my partner with me so she can understand why I rate this hotel so highly. From the greeting as you drive up to door to the wonderfully comfortable beds and oh those pillows. The downside, in travelling the country extensively on business no matter how many hotels you try they never stand up to this one. Even though they spoil you for anyother hotel I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “sleep with a beat”
Reviews.Author: trav23
Reviews.Content: The Hilton downtown Sydney could be an excellent hotel. However, it should decide whether it wishes to be a hotel or a nightclub. Boom boom boom form the nightclub is not conducive to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Often very busy and full, drives the price skyward”
Reviews.Author: TimMelbourne_AUS
Reviews.Content: Really nice Hilton, but why is there only 1 Hilton in Sydney?? sydney is in need for atleast another Hilton location, because of this the rates can get very high as its often quite full. Get ur booking in early, otherwise you may have to pay top dollar or go elsewhere. I have to say I have stayed here twice and The Lounge breakfast is always great!! Hilton South Wharf Melbourne need to follow how they do it as the breakfast in the Lounge there is poor. Perfect stay when in downtown Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “The Hilton Hotel delivered on service, value, facilities & location!”
Reviews.Author: Jason290873
Reviews.Content: My partner & I enjoyed our time at the Hilton Hotel so much we're going back with friends sometime soon we hope! Highlights are: * Check in & out were extremely easy * Staff were extremely friendly wherever you were e.g. hallways, lifts, foyer etc. * Location is fantastic * We were upgraded to a room with a view of Sydney Harbour including the Harbour Bridge * The Glass Breakfast was excellent. They had everything you could ask for and great value for money. Regards, Jason

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: roger_10
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location, lovely hotel, nice pool, good view, good value for money and the magic button is great!

Reviews.Title: “great location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: simonSussex
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located within easy distance of both Darling Harbour and The Rocks,even though the hotel is located on the main street road noise is not too bad but noticeable on 37th floor due to windows only being single glazed. The hotel is modern and well presented,even thogh the rooms are a little on the small size ,they are clean bright and have all the ameanaties you would expect in this quality of hotel. Louge access is worth the cost with good service and great views over Sydney. Again as seems typical of most Australian hotels no free wi fi anywhere in the hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Hilton is a classy stay”
Reviews.Author: tiger1_10
Reviews.Content: Near all Sydney's attractions eg Opera House and Darling Harbour. Classy property with exceptional service in bar , eating, and room service areas. Staff very helpful and polite. New decore, comfy bed and pillows, nice amenities and bathroom. Views of either city or Harbour. Can recommend this hotel, stayed there many times. Doesn't disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “The best of times ,the best Christmas.”
Reviews.Author: Austrev_10
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect (& I am a bit hard to please at the best of times) this was all top quality & value for money. The Hotel is beautiful & constantly maintained by a brilliant team of really thoughtful & kind staff, they create a feeling of freindliness without being intrusive. I have been in hundreds of Hotels over the years, but our Christmas stay at the (new)Sydney Hilton was a stand out, the executive lounge was A+ & as throughout the hotel, the staff attention & genuine focus on making our stay special was outstanding. We had a really bad year-my Father passed in March- & we needed to get out of town at Christmas--so even at an especially sensitive time the Hilton delivered. We look forward to being gusts at Sydney Hilton again soon. Thank-You.

Reviews.Title: “A feeling of home away from home”
Reviews.Author: bobansett
Reviews.Content: From the moment I walked into the foyer after a busy day, I immediately relaxed. The 'check in' person was friendly and welcomed me back and arranged dinner for me at the Glass restaurant. As I had a number of meetings the following day I asked whether I could have a late check out which was accommodated. A great hotel with great people.

Reviews.Title: “The most polite, helpful enjoyable realaxing week all year !”
Reviews.Author: lisabranco
Reviews.Content: Staff were so helpful and friendly, polite and genuinely nice my whole stay ! this week was a delight with a gorgeous room and furnishings, with a perfect Sydney View! Clean and safe and cleanliness was maintaned my whole stay ! I travel alot and stay in hotels every other week, but this was an absolute treasure ! I can't wait to go back ! Room service was superb ! Everything was a pure delight !

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: Bruffy2010
Reviews.Content: Excellent service from this hotel. Concierge, room service and reception went that extra mile to my my visit enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Not happy.”
Reviews.Author: Migii_Traveller
Reviews.Content: I never to the Hilton in Sydney before prior to this trip so I had always thought of it as a beautiful property considering it holds a high reputation but I was extremely disappointed. I should have added my review earlier but did not join trip advisor until today. My partner at the time and I decided to celebrate our anniversary in style and decided on the Hilton due to conveninence. Close to shopping, entertainment and restaurants which were of importance to us because it was a Saturday night and wanted to make the most of our night. Upon making the reservation, the agent was extremely rude. She was rather snotty and it sounded as if she didn't want to talk to me at all. She only gave me one word answers and didn't offer to help when I enquired about the room facilities. I was rather upset because isn't Hilton meant to be known as a 5 star property with 5 star customer service? She didn't offer to send a confirmation so I requested however it never came. So I called back calmly and again it never came. I decided to leave it at that. Upon arriving, my partner and I were informed that the room type we had booked were fully booked and we had a choice for an upgrade but non smoking or a downgrade to a smoking room. My partner is a smoker and upon making a booking, the agent didn't note this so we had no choice but to downgrade and still pay for the same rate. One thing that my partner and I thought fantastic was the express check-out. It was wonderful because we dropped our keys and left very quickly. At least that went well because a month later, when my statement arrived, I realised the hotel charged me double which again, I had to call them back and explain that this is an impossibility. After much ping-ponging, the money was finally returned into my account. Overall, just dissappointed with the service. The name Hilton doesn't mean a thing anymore. Oops... despite all of this, we did go to Zeta bar and that was fantastic. Pricey but the cocktails were unique and worth every penny. Truly recommend the bar but not the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A business hotel but still great for leisure stays”
Reviews.Author: ustwo11
Reviews.Content: We knew the Hilton Sydney was very much a business hotel but still went ahead to book it despite traveling with our toddler. We chose this hotel mainly for its location as it was close to key attractions and shopping. It did not disappoint. Darling Harbour, Sydney Tower and nearby attractions were all a walking distance away. The train station was just a 2 minute walk & we had lots of shopping all around the hotel. Groceries were also available just down the street at Woolsworths. The rooms were not very big but clean, modern and well equipped. Service standards were great. Our request for an extra bed was promptly attended to, reception was friendly and efficient, concierge staff was helpful. Breakfast was excellent and made enjoyable by staff who were attentive and remembered our preferences for coffee and table of choice. Our toddler was kept happy with the great spread which was surprisingly toddler friendly and also kept occupied by crayons and coloring sheets. We had a great stay and would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: lavinalincolnuk
Reviews.Content: this hotel is right in the middle of sydney close to all amenties coffee bars restaurants night life very clean stunning views of sydney 10mintues to darling harbour 15mintues to sydney opera house getting around is very easy

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel central to downtown Sydney”
Reviews.Author: day123tripper
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in the best part of Sydney. Walking everywhere is the way to go and it is all very easy from the Hilton! Service at the hotel was superior! We had 2 issues happen that the Hilton helped us handle in stride and really set and keep the vacation on track. Thanks to Roger Brantsma and all the staff who made this trip great!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, A Five Star Hotel with Very Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: maconMouse
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful five night stay on my first trip to Australia here. I checked in around 11 AM, and my room on the 34th floor with incredible views of the city was ready. Bathroom & shower were wonderful as were the comfy beds & pillows. Had access to the executive lounge, and it was worth every penny. Had a wonderful breakfast & evening appetizer there each day, and the staff always had a smile, knew me by name, and provide outstanding help & service. I also thoroughly enjoyed their complete fitness center on ground level, one of the very best I've ever seen at a hotel. The best part of the hotel is the location right on George Street in the heart of the city. You're only a short walk from Darling Harbour as well as the Sydney Opera House. I also walked to various museums as well as the University of Sydney. Fabulous shopping center in Queen Victoria Building across the street.

Reviews.Title: “a place to remember, for comfort and great experience.”
Reviews.Author: stanley031
Reviews.Content: from the moment you drive your car in the enterance of the hilton hotel ,to the reception ,quick check in to your great room ,i recomend the 41st floor great views of the city .the bed and pillows are the best we have slept on ,all staff greet you with a smile ,and do their job very well.our company celebrated our work CHRISTMASS party at the hilton ,great venue ,fantastic food and plenty of varieties of drinks . great dj music ,loved the buffet breakfast .also liked the idea you can see the chef"s cooking all the foods.as john macathur said i shall return,thank you GOD BLESS colin & lulu reed

Reviews.Title: “Professional with class”
Reviews.Author: Camelx00
Reviews.Content: When inviting clients and members to an annual conference, you always worry about the delivery and execution of not just the conference arranger but also the facilities. I must say without hesitation, that The Hilton always out performs in its delivery. From the moment I arrive i am treated with a touch of class and professionalism matched by none. I have full confidence that all my guests and conferences members are treated in the same way. The facilities are superb and the Sydney venue is world class. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “best birthday ever”
Reviews.Author: dwrinsyd
Reviews.Content: This was booked for my wife for her birthday - the last night out without the kids before the third one arrives in January! Karlee declared it her best birthday ever! Hotel was great. I loved the casual and welcoming feel of the hotel while still maintaining that feel of exceptional quality. Staff were excellent throughout and the wine bar staff made us very welcome for a late night desert.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Sydney”
Reviews.Author: dreamtraveller65
Reviews.Content: I went to Sydney to attend a wedding and play golf. On previous visits to Sydney I have stayed at Darlinghurst, Haymarket and North Sydney. I chose this hotel because of a great value offer for the hotel quality and location during the time of my visit. The central location (directly across the QVB building) was great for walking access to the central shopping areas and tourist areas such as Chinatown, Darling Harbour and Circular Quay. It also made catching taxis to the beach, golf and restaurants very easy. The service at the hotel (check-in, concierge & room cleaning) was excellent. I stayed in a King room which had comfortable king bed with plenty of pillows, desk, sofa chair, TV but no coffee table. The bathroom facilities was clean, modern and spacious c/w with TV. The room was fitted with curtains and roller blinds which enabled natural light to be kept out in the morning. Noise from the main street traffic may be a concern to some but a good pair of earplugs will solve the problem. The gym and pool facilities was very good and open at reasonable times. The restaurant was okay but would recommend others in Surrey Hills, The Rocks or Circular Quay.

Reviews.Title: “The Hilton Sydney - simply the best”
Reviews.Author: Pamelaagnz
Reviews.Content: I normally stay at The Westin but on tips from colleagues changed to The Hilton. Everything was a 10 - the rooms, the location, the restaurant and bar options. Nothing was a problem to staff .....and from housekeeping up -fantastic service. I recommend an Executive Room with free acess to The Executive Lounge and The Spa !!! Also join Hilton HHonours for reward points

Reviews.Title: “Modern luxury close to Darling Harbor”
Reviews.Author: DonaldDawes
Reviews.Content: The staff is very friendly. Nice touches such as holding the elevator for you or delivering your bags to your room. Had a junior suite which had a great city view and was very spacious and comfortable. I am frequently disappointed when traveling over seas by the small and stark hotel rooms. But this one is nicely appointed, modern, and quite comfortable. Very close to Darling Harbor and not too far for a walk to the Opera House on a nice day. The BEST part of the place for me is the gym. I am almost always disappointed by the gym facilities in hotels. As a regular business traveler, I have been very upset with the poor response of hotels to the health and fitness needs of clients. But the Hilton Sydney has a regular gym (I think it used to be stand alone gym, but is now owned by the hotel). This is VERY rare and much appreciated by me. So, enjoy the nice rooms, get in a good work out, get your business done, and have a nice dinner down at Darling Harbor. I make a stop at this hotel for at least a day any time I go to Australia, even if going on to another city.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing breakfasts!”
Reviews.Author: MortimerUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the executive rooms, which was very comfortable. Although the hotel is a bit further away from the harbour than most, it was conveniently located for shopping and only a ten minute walk to the tourist attractions. The breakfasts in both the restaurant and in the executive lounge were very well thought out and catered for all tastes. We couldn't get over the range on offer - very impressed!! Our favourite bit was being able to take a slice of honey fresh from the comb for our toast! We also ate at the Glass restaurant one night, which was disappointing. Although the food was good, it didn't live up to the hype that it promotes itself with. The wine was very expensive and the service was nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “It was the perfect vacation spot!”
Reviews.Author: gupentz
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate to stay in the Relaxation Room at the Hilton Sydney and just loved the amenities and ambience! And the breakfast buffet was absolutely outstanding--better than we ever anticipated! Staff members were cordial and very helpful, and the location is perfect for walking around town or catching public transportation. On a scale of 1 to 5, this hotel is a 6!

Reviews.Title: “Very small hotel room with very average service”
Reviews.Author: Aviator42
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton for business and found that the rooms offered were very very small, for Sydney standard. Not only that furnishing was really simple without much decor for the rooms. The toilet had an extremly cramp basin unit, not something that you would expect of a 5 star hotel. Service was average, the reception counter folks were not the ultra friendly ones tt I have encounter. When checking out, counter staff told me the amount and after swiping the card, simply pass me the recipt for signing off, without even bothering to explain the contents of the charges or showing me the details of the bills. Only after requesting for the recipt, did he print out a copy of it for me. Bad attitude and service level. Rest of the folks that I have encounter were pretty ok, other then that unhelpful counter staff. I doubt I would stay there again and most defintely would not encourage this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully renovated hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: airportnut
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel recently for a conference. It was a nice surprise. I wasn't expecting the hotel to be so beautifully done - they have taken no short cuts in the lobby, restaurants, conference rooms and public area. The rooms were nice enough but not that big. The service was very slick and always with a smile. Breakfast was great. Loved the vitamin shots - first time I ever saw those at a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great but Small”
Reviews.Author: navindt
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Hilton Hotel and it was for work. I don't usually stay at 5 star hotels so loved the service. The Hilton has really lovely staff who were always offering to help and there was always someone at hand. Anything we needed done they did it straight away and with a smile! The food was amazing. The breakfast has every type of cuisine imaginable, and I enjoyed a gourmet sandwich from the cafe downstairs. Even the conference food was reallllly good- which you usually don't find!! The only downside to this hotel is the small rooms. While they are modern and classy, and very clean, they are quite tiny. The bed was so comfortable though and I had the best sleep! Another thing is that I would probably rather a hotel closer to the harbour than being right in the city. Popped into a drink at Zeta bar and that was great- pricey but definetely worth it, the atmosphere was incredible and the views lovely. Was nice for work, but I wouldn't stay for a holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: doncjones
Reviews.Content: Stay (with wife) of 6 days. Great location, staff was first class, helpful, and friendly. After 20 hours of flying, they worked with us for early check-in. Would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy Attitude, Giving Customers the Run Around”
Reviews.Author: Jzal
Reviews.Content: We tried to use our Hilton Honors points at the Hilton Sydney, it was our honeymoon and it's basically trips like this that you save and want to spend your points on. We got the run around from both Hilton Honors and the Hotel Reservations Staff about being able to use our points. They wouldn't let us use our points for the last night of our stay, despite rooms being available in the hotel. They made us pay for the last night or else we would have had to leave. Overall the hotel was fine, the location was quite good, actually. However, I don't recommend the service at this particular Hilton hotel in Sydney and I also don't recommend the Hilton Honors rewards program. There are many other hotel reward programs out there that allow you to use your points when and where you want to, and to indeed be "rewarded" by your loyal patronage. With Hilton, they seem loathed to allow you to use your points and have a haughty attitude to someone who may not be dropping thousands at their hotel.

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB service”
Reviews.Author: CricketAdvisor
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately my (very) new husband and I weren't able to stay in this gorgeous hotel, as our flight to Sydney on October 23rd was cancelled last-minute! Instead, we had to stay at a basic airport hotel that Quantas put us up in for the evening. We were obviously disappointed that we weren't able to stay at the Hilton on the last night of our honeymoon, and initially we were worried that the Hilton would charge us for our room regardless. The Hilton made an exception to their cancellation policy due to our special circumstances, and my husband and I are INCREDIBLY appreciative to the staff and managers for their understanding. We look forward to staying at more Hilton hotels when we travel in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly great stay”
Reviews.Author: fussyvoyager
Reviews.Content: We stayed recently at the Hilton in one of the Executive Club rooms. Although I gather there is no difference in the actual rooms, having Executive Club access is a real bonus. to our way of thinking. The club itself was spacious and well laid out. We stayed on a Friday and Saturday night and the Saturday in particular was very busy. The club became quite full but because of the layout, never seemed to be overcrowded. Staying in an Executive Club room, we were also entitled to a free turn down service which we utilised on our second night. The rooms are on the small side but well designed so it's not really an issue. Beds very comfortable and we requested firmer pillows from the pillow menu which arrived within 10 minutes. We chose to have breakfast in Glass Restaurant, the hotel's signature restaurant. Breakfast was part of our package and we could choose to eat in Glass or the Executive club. We were fortunate to be seated at the same very roomy booth on both mornings quite coincidentally and were served by a fantastic guy called Adam on both days who couldn't do enough to assist us. The food on offer was amazing and even though the hotel was very busy, we didn't have to wait for a table. Our overriding impression was that the staff seemed incredibly well trained and the whole hotel seemed to run like a well oiled machine. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Where is the service?”
Reviews.Author: hhvvgg
Reviews.Content: Spent two weeks at the Hilton, first week in a standard room and second week in an Executive room. There is no difference between a standard room and an executive room, you are just provided with access to the club room for breakfast and drinks in the evening. There is a huge difference in the experience you receive between these two room types, so I would suggest paying the extra (by estandby maybe) to get an executive room. Everything seems to be operated by button or dial in these rooms, and to have your room cleaned if you are staying in a standard room you must flip the clean room switch to have it happen (exec rooms are cleaned automatically). They shrunk my clothes when I sent them to the laundry, they did try their best to fix a pair of trousers but they were really beyond fixing. Room service was hit/miss, and usually cold even though it was always delivered within 30mins. No only are the rooms small they feel cluttered and with more than one suitcase in them they feel crowded. You can't beat the location, and the rooms are competitively priced, I just didnt enjoy my stay and was glad to be leaving.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing rooms”
Reviews.Author: cold_erin
Reviews.Content: I took my partner to the Hilton Sydney as a birthday gift. He loved it! We upgraded to a Relaxation Room, which was well worth the money. The room had an open plan living area and sleeping space, with couch, desk, bed etc. The bathroom was also open plan to the sleeping area. There were views, although I did have to stand on the bed to actaully see them. The TV in the bathroom - well, it's unique, although it's not something that I would require in future hotel rooms. The room was lovely and very spacious. My request via email (replied to in the affirmative by the hotel) for some rose-petals and tealights to be in the room on arrival was overlooked. A call to the very helpful Magic team ensured that when we returned to the room the next day, rose petals were strewn (yes, strewn) across the room. The finishing touch was a heart on the bed - we enjoyed this as much as the staff setting up clearly did! Magic went above and beyond the call of duty, recommending (or not recommending!) various video games to my partner when he rang to ask. The receptionist on arrival was very pleasant, and very natural. Room service was prompt and unflustered by my snoring partner. Well done for keeping a straight face. Breakfast was busy. It was quite difficult to get coffees, but service was very good for the amount of people in the resturant. Concierge must have been having a busy night the first time I tried to speak with them - no-one was at the desk, no-one even looked at us. When we did speak with the concierge desk next morning, they gave us incorrect information. The staff member I spoke to about this when we returned to the hotel seemed to think he had to humour us; perhaps he didn't realise we were guests. I guess not everyone in Sydney rides a bicycle while staying at the Hilton. The Executive Lounge team were fabulous, and remembered our names. The nibblies were good, and the drink selection okay. I will return to this hotel in the future, and have already recommended it. Thank you for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable Hilton experience !”
Reviews.Author: colwill_s
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Hilton Sydney was very relaxing. We were presented with some delicious chocolates and champagne to celebrate our anniversary. Our valet parking was hassle free and ensured our car was in safe hands. Our package included canapÃ©s and drinks, as well as a delicious breakfast. It was a very comfortable stay and we look forward to our next visit to Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “A Really Memorable Visit”
Reviews.Author: jblundell
Reviews.Content: From the doormen through the concierge staff to the front desk one could not wish to find a more cheerful and helpful bunch of people. The breakfast every morning in Glass was outstanding and the two lunches we took there were world class. The Executive Lounge on the 36th floor was among the best I have ever used. By my second visit I was greeeted by name and the whole staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel in the Heart of the City”
Reviews.Author: globalflyereal
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Sydney is a fantastic hotel. I stayed two different times as I had to take a one night trip up to Brisbane during the middle of the stay. As my room was not yet ready due to a 6:00am arrival, they gratiously gave me another room to use to shower and freshen up before my business meeting and then moved my luggage to the new room while I was away. When I returned the second time for a two night stay they accidentally gave my room away to a guest with the same last night. They were so embarrassed and gave me the Presidential Suite for their mistake. AMAZING! The food from Room Service was EXCELLENT! All employees were wonderful. I recommend this hotel and will again stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “I could not have chosen a better hotel for our trip to Sydney”
Reviews.Author: 4nel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Australia in September 2010 starting Melbourne where I visited my brother. Afterwards we invited he and his wife to join us in a trip to Sydney - we flew to Sydney with Quantas, big mistake!! We had previously booked two rooms at The Hilton. The service was excellent, the rooms super and ALL the staff were courteous, helpful and professional, The hotel is centrally placed and one can even walk to the harbour for a great choice of restaurants. Chinatown is also just a short walk away. If you need anything ask RON on the concierge he knows the answer to all problems - I nearly asked him to come home with us! The bars were lively and enjoyable and the team in the executive lounge were all fantastic. All in all a thorough recommendation from someone who has spent a greater part of his life travelling and staying in hotels. Thank you Hilton, Sydney. We enjoyed our stay so much we returned after ten days travelling in the Bush to spend a further three nights there before moving on to the Hilton in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Top Class”
Reviews.Author: SNight_10
Reviews.Content: Guys look no further...... This hotel is the best, We enjoyed the Hilton hospitality in all areas from Concierge to Reception to maids, our stay was most memorable.

Reviews.Title: “A night of Romance and Luxury...”
Reviews.Author: AliceSprings63
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Sydney on the last night of our honeymoon in one of the Executive/King rooms (not sure exactly but it was on the top floor). From the moment we walked through the doors, the service was amazing. The room was so good, we only left to go downstairs for dinner - at the Glass restaurant, which was also fantastic! The view was nothing special, but the huge spa with bath salts and rain head shower made up for that! Absolute luxury and worth every cent!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experience”
Reviews.Author: CarbonOffset
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms for the night, a King Relaxation room and an Executive room. The larger (King Relaxation) room was for my wife, young baby and myself; the other for my parents-in-law. Both had Executive Lounge access with continental breakfast included. First the good points: Both rooms were excellently presented and appointed. The King Relaxation room was large, the Executive room was adequate in size. Room service dinner was excellent. Minibar had a good selection, as did the room service wine list. Hospitality staff were friendly and responsive to requests. All these would be expected at a hotel of this quality, and generally make it worth the high price. The let down: the air conditioner in the King Relaxation room did not work. Supposedly repaired at 11pm by non-communicative engineer. Still didn't work. No engineer available at 2am when we tried to get help again. Room 27 degrees C most of the night. Slept max 3 hours. Very worried re: baby overheating. The bigger let down: The on site staff were very helpful, giving us a 'no charge' for a couple of items (total discount AUD20). Howeer, given that I had been willing to spend about 900 dollars at this hotel, it was disappointing that the later response from the customer service manager was to offer an upgrade on my next stay. With this kind of follow up service, there will be no next stay.

Reviews.Title: “hilton makes me feel like at home in a luxurious way.”
Reviews.Author: essie_03
Reviews.Content: we celebrated our 5th wedding anniversary at the hilton and upon mentioning the reason for our stay when we got to our room a cmplimentary champange was there waiting for us. the executive room was great as it had everything we need like Wifi and a nice desk to work on and not to mention the big flat screen tv to watch my fav. show. the glass brasserie offer a great menu and delicious foods that i even purchase luke mangan cook book to re create our dining experience. overall we had an awsome time. to all the staff of hilton i say thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Ohmigoodness, girls dream come true!”
Reviews.Author: Librepisces
Reviews.Content: I have to admit my fabulous friend snagged the relaxation room here as part of online holiday package deal AND what a deal it was! This hotel has first class customer service. When we first arrived to check in we got the wrong room. When we enquired about it they were pleasant did all they could to rectify the error, promptly found us the right room & gave us complimentary buffet breakfast for our troubles. You'd imagine from time to time they would encounter the odd error, how they handle it makes the hotel in it's class. Ohmigoodness is the only way I can explain how thrilled we were with our room. It was humongous! Huge king size bed, spa bath, couch, wardrobe, plasma TV, double shower and separate toilet. We made sure we checked out the bar on the top floors with superb views of Sydney CBD, to dining each morning for breakfast at their restaurant to kicking off a Friday brilliant night at the Zeta Bar. Best weekend, I have ever had in Sydney (& I have had a few) and this hotel played a key part in it.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton is Strategically Located”
Reviews.Author: slycow42
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location - Queen Victoria Building (QVB) shopping mall is directly across George. During inclement weather, one can reach the Town Hall CityRail via a tunnel below QVB - very convenient. Sydney Explorer stop is about 100 meters from the main entrance. I have stayed at many Hilton's around the world, and this is one of the best!

Reviews.Title: “Greeat hotel and location but...”
Reviews.Author: dk011
Reviews.Content: Thsi was my second stay this year and the overall feeling is the same as last time. The location is very good - central and easy to get to most of the attractions. However, the rooms are quite small and the bathrooms tiny and the executive lounge gets very busy at peak times - I arrived for breakfast one morning to be told that it was full and I could have a voucher for the main restaurant. The fitness centre is actually a Living Well club and the facilities are excellent. Also, make sure you have a drink in the Marble Bar, its lovely. Oh, and the hotel is still expensive and, of course, wifi charges are huge.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy on the outside but average on the inside (room etc) very pricey”
Reviews.Author: aussiemiss25yes
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hilton for a work trip. After reading the reviews I was most excited. The lobby etc is really lovely and I felt like a bit of a fancy pants checking in. When I got to the room I was surprised at the size, it was very very small (room cost $240 per night). I've stayed at lots of similar places of similar price and this was the smallest room for this price. In all it was pretty average. I ordered a steak from room service which was bland and over cooked. They charge $5 just to deliver any food to your room which I thought was pricey. A soft drink is $6.50 from the mini bar (geez)! I ordered cereal and coffee for breaky $17! I had room service on average twice a day and thought it was pretty average and to be honest - McDonalds wouldve been better. They stuffed up my breaky order one day which was frustrating after waiting for 35 mins to have it sent up. The first night I awoke to think my front door was open as it was so bright in the middle of the night to find it was just the large gap under the door. The highlight was the room had a tv in the shower - cool if you want to watch a movie while doing your hair (Im female of course). The location was awesome. The prices were not -for what you get. Pls feel free to ask any questions if you need.

Reviews.Title: “Its OK”
Reviews.Author: ilst
Reviews.Content: Modern comfortable room with smaller bathroom. The location is very good. We had a nice view towards the Chinatown. We booked a club room but werenâ€™t allocated on those floors. The club lounge was comfortable with smaller selection of food than the Westin or the Sheraton On the Park. We had breakfast at the Glass Brasserie and our egg dishes were misplaced. We ordered again and there was a hair in my poached egg. I couldnâ€™t be bothered asking for another one. Pity the restaurant has a great atmosphere. Sydney hotels are rather expensive but sometimes you can find a pretty good deal here. I will not stay here for the standard price.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best service experiences I've...”
Reviews.Author: jackofalltravel
Reviews.Content: One of the best service experiences I've had in some time. Staff was very accommodating and helpful. Room was spacious, stylish, and clean. The executive lounge area was well appointed and staff was super friendly. Highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: littlemommaEmily
Reviews.Content: My only complaint with this hotel would be that it took them forever to get our bags up to our room after we checked in, after that-- it was amazing!! The executive lounge was comfortable and the breakfast was of good quality. The views of downtown Sydney were gorgeous! Perfect location to walk anywhere around Sydney! We could not have picked a better hotel for our Australian second honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Sydney.. 5 Star Hotel? Perhaps if located in Kabul..”
Reviews.Author: cbsl
Reviews.Content: Lamentably a friend and I were recently guests of the Sydney Hilton. When choosing to pay a premium rate to stay at a 5 star hotel I am of the option that one has the right to have a certain set expectations. This hotel did in no way meet the lowest of my expectations. The entire experience on all accounts from arrival to check out was appalling. Upon arrival we were informed rudely by the front desk attendants that our room was not yet ready and our bags where taken. Upon our return that afternoon we were shown to our "Executive Room" to discover that there was no blind on the bathroom glass window panel to provide privacy between the bathroom (toilet) and the bedroom. This is certainly not ideal when you are sharing a room. After calling the hotel from my mobile (as the hotel phone was broken) we were left waiting in the room for over an hour before being moved to a smaller room that was not adequately cleaned and in addition was fragranced with the not so pleasant aroma or vomit/astringent cleaner. Upon complaining once more we were left waiting extensively again while the Duty Manager had the "Engineer" look at the blind in our original room. Another hour had passed and we were then informed that the blind could not be properly repaired however the "Engineer" temporarily repaired it. I.e.: erected a sheet to the glass panel with masking tape and paper clips! The next morning we woke to the toilet being non operational. Once more the multiskilled "Engineer" was sent to the room to apply his expert knowledge to solve the problem. Who would have guessed that this time he must have only applied a bandaid resulting in the reoccurrence of this problem 20 minutes later. After yet another discussion with the duty manager we were promised another room. While waiting for this room to become available we lounged in the executive bar where we waited 55 minutes for a wine and 1.5 hours for a cold club sandwich.. delightful! Once our room was finally ready (almost 2 hours later) we were pleasantly surprised to have been moved to a Junior Suite. This room was lovely, spacious with a great view over the city. We would have been satisfied in this room for the remainder of our stay if the shower head had not with force blown off the wall from the water pressure when turned on and further hitting my friend in the arm and leaving a hole in the wall. Consequently, I would not recommend this hotel to anyone whom I did not want to experience boundless discomfort and frustration.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Sydney - a little too big but still incredible service”
Reviews.Author: DKD2010
Reviews.Content: Hilton Sydney has a very nice location if you travel by taxi or feet because you are right in the heart of Sydney on George Street and can reach all major attractions or cool parts of town in no time. if you are on the way by rental car, it can be annoying with all the oneway streets to get in and out of the parking garage. And especially that parking at the Hilton is not free - the 'special' hotel rate is $38 per night - no matter how long you stay. the lounge is quite nice with a nice view over the city is located on the 36th floor of the hotel - unfortunately as the hotel is a little too big, the lounge is a little too small for all the people that are granted access to the lounge. But the gym is incredible, it is a full service fitness club that can also be booked without staying at the hotel Overall the service level of the hilton staff is above average.

Reviews.Title: “All-around excellence”
Reviews.Author: Tef5
Reviews.Content: At the risk of sounding like a shill, I can't say enough good things about this hotel. From the location to the staff to the quality of the rooms, everything was excellent. The only nitpicks I have are the prices for some things that aren't part of the standard room rate. From a long list of positives, the best things about the Hilton Sydney are the rooms and the location. As far as location, if you're staying in Sydney's CBD, it would be tough to be in a more convenient spot. You're a 2-minute walk from a major rail station that makes it easy to get pretty much everywhere in Sydney, and you're adjacent to the city's best shopping. The only thing missing in the area appeared to be a lot of dining options, particularly if you wanted something quick and less formal, unless you're happy with McDonald's or Hungry Jack's (Australia's Burger King). As far as the rooms, they're excellent. Stylish and contemporary, yet highly functional. Rooms are smallish (at least compared to American standards I'm accustomed to), but the space is very well used, and I never felt in any way cramped. I ended up having two separate stays, meaning I ended up in two rooms, and in both the beds were extremely comfortable (and the "pillow menu" was a nice touch, as I was able to ask for pillows that were more comfortable for me than the standards, which were already good). The rooms are extremely quiet, with no sounds at all from adjoining rooms or outside traffic. While the room rates were quite good for a quality hotel in the heart of Sydney, the rates for some extras were frankly pushing up against the line of being ridiculous. Even accounting for the fact that free wifi in hotels seems to be quite the rarity in Australia, the price here was twice of what I saw in any other hotel. And while the breakfast buffet is very, very good, it costs more than what I paid for most dinners. If the worst things you can say about a hotel are that the wifi and breakfast - neither of which you really need to buy - are spendy, you're staying in a good place. And this is definitely a good - no, excellent - hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and the most wonderful breakfast buffet ever”
Reviews.Author: washing2nian
Reviews.Content: This was our third time staying at the Sydney Hilton. The biggest draw is the breakfast buffet (which is out of this world with customized juice bar and anything else you can think of) but also the location and friendly staff. This time we had a relaxation suite since we had 2 children in tow and it was a good size with a partition, 1 1/2 bath and 2 TV:s. We also had access to the club lounge which we only used for before dinner drinks and snacks. (dont have breakfast there, take the elevator down to 2nd floor main restaurant). The staff are friendly and helpful. The only complaint I would have about this hotel is that you still have to pay for wi-fi. Next time we come, I will definately choose the Hilton again

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel that is centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Colway
Reviews.Content: It's a lovely hotel. Stayed in a Deluxe King Room on the 31st Floor. Unfortunately, the rooms are not sound proof and it gets noisey at night...slamming doors, blackout screens going up and down, neighbours bumping sounds.The room was also very snug. Nonetheless, it's centrally located and a good standard hotel. However, no wow factor.

Reviews.Title: “Good City side Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: global_traveller112
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Hilton Sydney and overall a gem of a business hotel in the middle of the CBD. Location wise its right in the middle of the CBD in George street, oppostite to QVB. Very convenient location if you want to get around the city. The one thing that stood up is the service level. Right from the moment my taxi pulled in and the bell boy took care of my luggages and to the time I checked out, the service was perfect. I got upgraded to the suite using the Hilton discounted upgrade which I think is a smart and great way Hilton is using the upgrades and the room was spacious and nicely laid out. The hotel has gone through some major renovations which you can easily spot by the exterior and lobby of the hotel, and even though the rooms have gone through the same facelift, it did feel the rooms are bit old and the bathrooms are not as nice as the bedroom itself. Overall a very nice business hotel and good service standards and in a central spot.

Reviews.Title: “More THAN I CAN ASK FOR!”
Reviews.Author: JerryH1680
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton Honors Diamond mamber and have stayed at the Sydney previously. This stay was 8 nights and from the moment that I checked in not only did the staff in the Executive know my name but they could not enough for me. My room was fully equipped sufficiantly to do my office work and when I needed additional printing, your Executive staff was there for me. I also needed the private room off the Lounge for an hour long meeting and that was arranged without any issues, at no charge. My room was in a great location on the 36th floor. The room size, while you always would like it larger, worked well for me. The bathroom was equipped with a separate showwer and all the necessary toilitries. The Hotel is located in the best location in the CBD, close to everything. I also must point out the the GYM is one of the best exercise facilities of any hotel that I have ever stayed in! Overall, on my next trip to Sydney I will stay at the Sydney Hilton. Gerald Hammond

Reviews.Title: “IMPECCABLE”
Reviews.Author: EmmaR0se
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hilton sydney in the Relaxation Room for our first wedding anniversary. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left I cannot fault one aspect of our entire stay. Staff were courteous, polite and made us smile. They went over and above what either my husband and I expected and we were pleasantly surprised with additional comforts they placed in our room for us to celebrate our anniversary. From the food, to the staff, to the room...every moment was impeccable. Our next trip we will definitely be checking in with Hilton Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Verdensklasse kvalitet”
Reviews.Author: gyldenhammer
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers a real good service and fantastic facilities - I would recommend all to stay there. Great restaurant, fantastic bar with live music, high speed Internet. What more would you need.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff, friendly & professional. A wonderful experience.”
Reviews.Author: lisajwilson
Reviews.Content: The staff were so friendly & pleasant, reception, valet & cleaners were just so lovely and professional. The room was so immaculate, clean and superbly appointed. The location was perfect, right opposite the QVB and close to the Opera House where I ws seeing a show that evening. I just wished I could stay there for longer. I will definitely stay there again. A truly wonderful, relaxing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Really Cool rooms”
Reviews.Author: romanzwriter
Reviews.Content: This hotel was right near all the downtown attractions such as the Rocks and the Opera House, Hyde Park etc. The rooms were ultra modern with a nice desk area, sofa and comfy bed. The bathroom was a little weird since the shower area was frosted glass that you could see from the room. Our son visited for one night and I had to send him downstairs so I could take a shower! Other than that it was great. Tip: for a great (and cheaper) breakfast, go to the cafe located in the lobby. The food is great and prices are very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ulladulla
Reviews.Content: The staff indeed made this stay a memorable occasion for our family thank you. Coordinating rooms for two sets of grandparents and our own all with different requests & needs was met with perfection on arrival. Executive lounge is by far the best in Sydney and kids are welcome. Staff I would have to say are far more switched on. Location perfect. Surprisingly is not the most expensive hotel in Sydney but is the best value by a long shot. The only place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a Sydney city excursion but geared for the business traveler”
Reviews.Author: camodoc9
Reviews.Content: The Sydney Hilton is a beautiful hotel in the heart of Sydney's Rocks and Circular Quay district. It is a wonderful place to begin a city tour of Sydney and the staff is quite friendly and informative. The hotel has a decidedly European appearance and an almost sterile hospital quality about it. The amenities are most certainly geared for the business traveler and not a family on holiday to Sydney and the surrounds. The rooms are immaculately clean but not spacious, and the restaurants are amazingly appealing but very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Staying here really made me feel like a special guest, made me feel as if they owed me"”
Reviews.Author: PhilipB_50
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with their prompt attention and how they made me feel that, they are genuine about making my stay there very pleasent - place that makes you feel special.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but very small rooms...”
Reviews.Author: AW99
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton Sydney for three nights. I normally stay at the Sheraton on the Park however due to availability, decided to try out the Hilton. It is a nice, modern hotel with ok service however the real downfall with this place is the size of the rooms. I have had the privilege of travelling all over the globe and this hotel room was one of the smallest I have ever stayed in. The quality of the furnishings was ok however the room did need a bit of maintenance. One of the coffee cups in the room had a big chip and despite leaving it out twice for house keeping, it still appeared back in the cupboard at the end of each day. As for other facilities, the in-house bars and restaurants are great. I used the gym a few times and whilst very well equipped, it is a public gym so gets very busy at peak times. All up, not a bad hotel however I still prefer the space at the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms and construction noise at 6:30am spoiled this for me”
Reviews.Author: timbo2002
Reviews.Content: The Hilton is in a great location and certainly has very stylish rooms - but the rooms are SMALL. They are some of the smallest rooms I have stayed in (at a proper hotel anyway!). I spent two nights there - the first was on a side facing the construction on Pitt St mall - and the jackhammers started up at 6:30am and did not stop - so any ideas of a small sleep in were abandoned. The second night I asked to be moved - I was hoping the next room would be bigger but it was identical. The general lack of light from the smallish windows is a problem too. The best thing about this hotel is the breakfast - it is one of the best hotel breakfasts I have had in Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Superb accommodation, hard to fault!”
Reviews.Author: Fourkiwis
Reviews.Content: Had three nights away from the kids for a bit of shopping/ sightseeing so booked a little luxury with the Hilton. Everything was pretty much perfect, staff were fantastic, location excellent, rooms lovely and the breakfast just plain awesome. Even had a TV in the shower which left me a little perplexed - how am I supposed to conserve precious water (as the leaflet in the bathroom advised) when I can watch TV while showering?? We would definitely use the Hilton again, as I said in the title - Hard to Fault!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: sharmadhananjay
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 8 nights AND WITH OUT ANY QUETION this lovely hotel was by far the best hotel in sydney , Once you saty for more than 3 nights you tend to know the staff members and there was an individual who really made a great impact on me and my partner, as I was away for meetings all day my partner ,my wife was in the hotel room all by her self and she truly has been the one using all the guest services ,she did mention about the lovely MAGIC service and how it had really helped her and this particular staff member by the name Ankur ,apart for the friendliness and good recommendation he also helps my wife organise a lovely dinner at GLASS restaurant . She did mention that while every one else use to call her Mrs Sharma ,Ankur was the only one who asked her for her name and remembered it always . He also recommended some good places to eat indian food and also went out of his was to make a reservation with the restaurant . Once we went to the restaurant the staff there treated is special because we where Ankur's friends, that's want they believed. All in all a good trip and a very lovely hotel .

Reviews.Title: “You forget just how good it really is.......”
Reviews.Author: Dinnersolo
Reviews.Content: Catch the train from Sydney Airport to Town Hall Station in around 20 min, alight and walk a few hundred meters to the Hilton Hotel George St, check in and be greeted by smiles, catch the lift, stow your bag and change and head to the best hotel best gym ever....workout and relax in the sauna. Dinner in the restaurant is as good or better than any of Sydney best, head to the either of two bars that again are as good or better than Sydneyâ€™s best.......sleep without noise or light. Awake and run down George St to the Harbour either to the opera House steps and or Cahill walk across the Harbour Bridge and you have experienced the best of Sydney.. Ps walk the block around the Hilton George and Pitt Streets, check out Josephs Men shoes window, see something you like but the store is closed, ring ahead of your next trip and make arrangements for the shoes to be awaiting you at the Hilton concierge, further check out the sushi place that has a conveyor travelling around the restaurant so you can window shop your dinner....great solo dinner place...

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY HOTEL IN PERFECT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Bibster2005
Reviews.Content: Whether you are on business or on leisure, It's definitely a hotel to check in...Located right in the city directly opposite QVB, with plenty of restaurants and shops around you. Darling Harbour and Chinatown is only a short stroll from here. If you are driving in, valet fee is $30.00 which is not too bad for city parking. The room is spacious, staff are friendly and helpful and plenty of space for you to relax in the lobby. It's a shame that they don't have Free WIFI for in house guests. Overall, thumbs up!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: oscar1982
Reviews.Content: Fantastic place if you want to be close to everything in Sydney city. Great spot, great service and so close to bars and restaurants. Will stay again. Rooms are small but what do you expect in the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “excellent helpful service in all areas”
Reviews.Author: imurdoch
Reviews.Content: The service from the time we entered the front door until leaving was excellent especially the team in the Glass Restaraunt. The room was excellent and properly prepared. Being on George St opposite Victoria Building was excellent for my wife. Taxis for me were readily available. I cannot find anything to criticise

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is well situated especially for business.”
Reviews.Author: mollybeagle1949
Reviews.Content: This is the third time we have stayed in this hotel and it wont be the last. Very well situated for the business traveller . The hotel is quiet, the service is great and the staff courteous. The Ececutive Lounge is quiet and a friendly atmosphere. We have stayed both business and vacation and would and will continue to reccoment this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Shame about the room”
Reviews.Author: LostKnights
Reviews.Content: The room was small and, although the bathroom had a separate shower and bath, it was tiny. Standing in front of the basin I blocked the shower door. And the basin itself had virtually no bench space around it. Fortunately I wasn't sharing the room. The bed was too hard so my three nights were some of the worst I've had in a hotel. And I could hear the chamber maids moving about in the corridor before 6:30am! On the plus side, breakfast was very good although the standard price of $35 for a continental breakfast was a little steep. The location is pretty central and close to Darling Harbour and Cockle Bay Wharf.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel and staff-exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: flmillertime
Reviews.Content: Premiere hotel in great location. Close to everything. One of the best properties we've stayed in all over the world! Executive lounge and staff is SUPER! Service was great! All requests met timely and courteously! Would definitely recommend to anyone, anytime! Will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home and a great business venue and retreat”
Reviews.Author: Narziss
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay - it has warm and friendly staff who actually remember who you are and has the best gym facilities in Sydney, or most hotels worldwide for that matter, for serious athletes and tired business people alike. While I usually fall into the latter category, it is always good to get back to at the end of the day - and the worse the day, the more I look forward to getting back.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hilton there is”
Reviews.Author: cmdevine
Reviews.Content: I stay at Hiltons more than 100 nights a year in New York and other US East Coast cities. This is the best Hilton I've ever stayed. Just beautiful, stylish, great food, great location, great amenities

Reviews.Title: “Great and relatively newly renovated”
Reviews.Author: tulsau
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay at the Hilton. What you expect with an international Hilton--clean rooms, nice executive lounge, great fitness center, and helpful staff. It is a little pricey but I thoroughly enjoyed it and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury whilst doing business”
Reviews.Author: jambsiz
Reviews.Content: I am a regular guest at the Hilton in Sydney. I started staying there a few years back and whilst having given over the hotels a go - the Hilton continues to lure me back. The rooms are modern and well appointed and always clean and fresh. The staff are friendly and helpful and will work hard to meet your requests however when required are not intrusive. The hotel has a great upgrade program where you can pay a reduced fee to upgrade your room if it is available on arrival. I did this last time and had the pleasure of upgrading to a suite which was fantastic. The other highlights are the fantastic Zeta Bar with its fantastic cocktails, the Executive Lounge and the buffet breakfast. Sometimes even if I am staying on an Executive floor where the breakfast is included I will stay pay to have the buffet. The buffet has everything and more importantly really good options for travellers who are keen to eat a healthy meal whilst on the road.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding !”
Reviews.Author: WabbitTwacks
Reviews.Content: We recently spent an evening at the Sydney Hilton to celebrate my wife's birtthday. From the moment we checked in, the staff made the event so special. At every turn we were surprised with thoughtful reminders that this was a special night with champagne, chocolates and birthday greetings. The Hilton people and especially the young lady who checked us in to the Hotel, really did provide the kind of warmth and sincerity that makes you want to write a review like this ! Glass Brasserie has to one of the best restaurants in Sydney. We had a fantastic night. Thank you Hilton Sydney! We are most appreciative of the outstanding service. Roger and Narelle

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel that provides 5 star service and hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Ivan_6722
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton in Sydney and found that the front reception area was very helpful and courteous. The rooms are clean and have thoughtful touches, such as a nightlight.
