The television has a good variety of shows. I also dined at the Glass Restaurant on the second floor and found the morning buffet to be delicious and nutritious. Drinks such as lattes, mochas, soda, sparkling water, juices are all available at no extra charge. One unique feature of the buffet that I have not found in any other hotel was the progressive menu, but which I mean that they provide a large number of healthy alternatives. There are plenty of shot glasses of beetroot, wheatgrass, carrot juices and also smoothies of fruit as well. The breads that are available are whole grain, rye, etc. The staff easily cater to those who are lactose intolerant or have gluten sensitivity. Overall, I greatly enjoyed my stay at this hotel and would go back again. One last thing. The hotel was also across from the Queen Victoria Building, a beautiful shopping arcade that is a must see for any tourist. It is definitely smack in the middle of downtown Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Superior and Excellent service - Be proud!”
Reviews.Author: hjc0709
Reviews.Content: The Sydney Hilton exceeded our expectations. All of the staffs were very well groomed and professional. Superior service with friendly greets. We did not experience one less from what we expected from Hilton. You must take advantage of the fully equipped fitness center with a huge pool, 4 steam rooms, and the Spa. You canâ€™t ask for a better location to explore heart of Sydney. We had our doubts to stay at Hilton because of the previous not so professional services we received from Hilton hotels in USA. However, Sydney Hilton had the professional customer oriented mind to serve their guests which it always makes a difference when you are away from home. Thank you Sydney Hilton, you made Hilton proud!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Getaway in Our Own Beautiful City Sydney.”
Reviews.Author: Beana38
Reviews.Content: The service was fantastic and the boys in the Valet are true gentlemen! Dinner at Glass was very romantic, and our waiter was nothing short of EXCELLENT! We'd been at the restaurant previously with a group of friends and equally had a fun night out so it's not just for the romantics. The room was very clean and comfortable and we just loved the electric 100% blockout shutters on the windows. The buffet breakfast was pretty good but on the morning we were there the custom orders were taking a while to be prepared and it took them a while to replenish the empty dishes but the quality of what was there was great. Looking forward to staying again :-)

Reviews.Title: “Why even look at any other hotel in Sydney, there is none better.”
Reviews.Author: raylouis
Reviews.Content: I had all my family including Children and Grandchildren staying over the weekend for our 50th wedding anniversary and we had an absolutely magnificent time. Thank You Hilton Ray S louis

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hilton I've stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: Reemanclark
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, amazing room and a wonderful time. From the minute we arrived, we were made to feel special. I've stayed in a lot of Hiltons and I have to say that some of them have been disappointing, but this has to be one of the best by a mile. Everyone helped, everyone smiled, the room was spotless... Thank you for making it so special.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for Central Sydney”
Reviews.Author: thefrequenttraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few times this year and it is now my choice of Central Sydney hotels. Modern, contemporary and central to shopping, it is a really nice hotel and at the weekends, a reasonable rate as well. Try the breakfast buffet if you are hungry! One of the best I have seen in my travels around the world. Can't comment on the food at other times as I use this hotel as a base for shopping and fine dining (at other restraurants!).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JayAdelaide
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Executive King room, got a really good rate there. In general we are happy with the room. The access to the executive lounge is a really good bonus. The only thing is there was a constructions going close to our room, the noise was really bad but it stop at night. The noise started early morning again! We also promised to get a daily newspaper, but we didnt get any. Not that this is the most important thing, cause there is plenty of newspapers in the lounge. Overall we still enjoy our stay and we were allowed to checked out at 13.00.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Euro-style room”
Reviews.Author: ShutterbugTraveler
Reviews.Content: This seemed to be the hotel of C-and D-list stars. While we were there we ran into Lou Ferigno, a CW actress whose name I still don't remember, a few big-talking Hollywood agents, a film producer who is working on a film in Thailand and an Australian band that I didn't recognize (but others did), all in the executive lounge. The room was very modern but small, very similar to European-style hotel rooms. I never quite felt at home...the staff were extremely formal for Australians. There were only two drawers for clothes, but a decent-sized closet. We had a king bed, but it was a split king and the bed was very low to the floor and not comfortable. The blackout shades in the room were controlled by a button and were excellent! There was also a night light in the bathroom that light the whole room enough to get there without blinding yourself with the general room lighting. This was all controlled from a panel near the bed. I'm not sure why they wasted room putting a shower separate from the bathtub, this room could definitely have benefitted from the extra 2 or 3 ft. the shower occupied. We had been upgraded to the 34th floor, which is executive level. Seeing how small this was, I was wondering what the regular rooms looked like. The tv had quite a few channels (though roughly 50% seemed focused on sports, paricularly rugby). The location was great. It's in the middle of George Street right across from the Queen Victoria Building and around the corner from the Sky Tower. There is a free shuttle that had limited hours that runs all the way to Circular Quay and both the Sydney Explorer and City Sightseeing tour buses stop just outside. The Monorail stop is right next door and Darling Harbour was a 15 min. walk. The hotel is known for the Marble Bar which is interesting and the Glass Brasserie which is it's restaurant that looks out over George St. Everything in Sydney is overpriced, this was no different, but it was on par with where it should be for a higher-end hotel. Overall, I wasn't particularly comfortable, but there wasn't anything really wrong, other than the lumpy bed. I would say that if you are looking for an American chain hotel with a cool bar scene and in a good city location, then this would be great.

Reviews.Title: “Just lacks the fine finishing touches”
Reviews.Author: nsw105
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last night and was ina relaxation suite which normally retails for around the $600 AUD mark I believe. Upon initial entry it was AMAZING. Massive lounge with powder room (second bathroom) and a big LCD TV. Blinds at the flick of a switch, massive king bed in a very large bedroom which can be closed off by a sliding door to the lounge. There is another large TV in the bedroom. Connected to the bedroom is a large bathroom with toilet, shower (rain, body massage and handheld in one) and a massive spa that would easily hold 4 people. There is also another smaller LCD in the spa. But then there are the little things that keep the Hilton Relaxation suiote from being one of the best in Sydney. 1 of the TVs (the lounge) didn't work at all. The TV in the bedroom had terrible reception, the shower door didn't shut properly, Poor 24hour room service selection etc etc. I still LOVED my stay at the Hilton relaxation suite but with a few tweaks here and there it could be so much more. Given more time I would have loved to eaten at Glass however I can fully recommend Zeta bar - Very trendy and cool.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional piece of peace and tranquility right on George Street Sydney”
Reviews.Author: fishemm
Reviews.Content: We were thrilled with the room, the views (of the top of the Queen Victoria Building) and the lovely comfortable beds, pillows, bedding. Also the automatic blinds that with a press of the button came down and blacked out the room - very useful for a sleep in! Would definitely come here again. The staff were very friendly - from reception to the very helpful concierge staff who helped us with everything. Oh, and the TV in the shower - our children are still talking about that! Will definitely be back when the opportunity arises.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, well appointed with great Executive Lounge”
Reviews.Author: HeavyMetalEngineer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sydeney Hilton for a week while I was there on business. We were greatly impressed by the entire experience. The room was comfortable, the staff was great, and the restaurants were pricey but excellent. We especially enjoyed the convenience and service of the Executive Lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Great and Comfortable Stay with Awesome Service.”
Reviews.Author: Ontheroad_ash
Reviews.Content: Great location - walking distance from Darling Harbour. Good food and great service from staff especially the lounge staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small room”
Reviews.Author: dozygirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as I was attending a conference at the hotel. Central location. Room was small but very well appointed. The bed was very comfprtable. Particularly liked to bathroom. There was a TV in the shower cubicle. The shower cubicle was large, There was a rainwater as well as normal showerhead. No bath but that didn't bother me. Room service was prompt and food reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property and Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: deanrob101
Reviews.Content: Spent a week in the Sydney Hilton with my wife and teenage son. As a Hilton Honors Diamond member we were upgraded to a suite and allowed access to the Executive Lounge. Hotel is in a great location near the train station and Darling Harbour. Staff was friendly and professional and went out of their way to ensure that we had a very pleasant stay. Would definitely recommend this hotel for travelers to Sydney who want access to all of the downtown attractions.

Reviews.Title: “The service was subperb and the CBD location outstanding.”
Reviews.Author: palm336
Reviews.Content: Professional and friendly staff from check in to check out. Room was spaceous and immaculate. The bed was very comfortable. We did enjoy the Executive Lounge and just a suggestion that the hot d'oeuvres could be upgraded.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, personable staff ... wonderful time.”
Reviews.Author: Andywizma
Reviews.Content: Location is fantastic: right in the heart of Sydney ... QVB, The Galeries Victoria, Pitt St, Martin Place are all within 5 minutes walk. Room was very comfortable, and the view south over the city quite amazing (the northern view is probably even better). Loved that the bathroom had bath & shower (separate), the robes were very snug ... Service (particularly the front desk) was above & beyond what I would expect. Very friendly, interested in the customers and the staff genuinely seemed to enjoy their jobs. Happened to mention (very briefly) in passing that it was my partner's birthday & a balloon was delivered to our room which really made the stay ...

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant visit”
Reviews.Author: sandra57Sydney
Reviews.Content: A nice touch when we were greeted personally when we got out of the car. Full points to the bellboy who must have obtained our names from our driver. Quick and efficient check in. Modern room with tasteful decor and tv screen in the shower which we meant to look at but forgot. Comfortable bed and pillows. Would highly recommend this hotel if you are staying in the city for a night or two. We do prefer to stay right in Darling Harbour, however, the Hilton is only a short distance by foot.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel, small rooms, superb location”
Reviews.Author: s1as
Reviews.Content: When we came for check-in. the reception can't find my booking, when he finally found it, it's short that what I booked. I have to get my laptop to show them my booking before the reception go to the back office to check. I booked 2 rooms, and asked for room with connecting door, or side by side, but they don't have it. Our rooms is put on separate floor. The room is nice, modern and minimalist furnishing, but really small. The bathroom is also small but comfortable. Since all the rooms include breakfast, the queue is a nightmare especially if you come after 8.30am. But the food quality and variety is great. You're really spoilt for choice. The Glass Brassiere staffs, where the breakfast is, are very helpful. The location is centrally located in Sydney CBD, easy acces to monorail, if you can get into the monorail, that is. Overall nice play to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hilton property yet !!”
Reviews.Author: USKiwiTraveler
Reviews.Content: My family & I had the pleasure of staying at the Hilton - Sydney for two separate stays (1 x week in April & 2 nights in early May), and I can say itâ€™s been the Best Hilton property yet!! - I should know as am a Hilton Honors Diamond so have stayed at a lot of Hilton properties over the past few years! :) We were very fortunate to be upgraded (twice) to their Relaxation Suites which was a lovely surprise. Both rooms were very specious, had excellent amenities and great bathrooms (superb Spa Bath & over head shower!!). We ate breakfast in the Executive lounge every morning. The staff are extremely professional, courteous & attentive which was certainly appreciated. In fact one gentleman noticed my son & I enjoy having a banana with our cereals, so the 2nd morning onwards made sure we were given one each â€“ thatâ€™s attention to detail ! We never ate at the restaurants as were visiting with friends almost every night, but our friends who live in Sydney say the food there is great. The location is excellent, with almost everything within walking distance. And if not, Sydney seems to have thousands of buses & taxis so transport is never far away + the monorail is right out from lobby on George Street. I could go on & on but think you get the message. Yes its not the cheapest place in town but you get what you pay for. Itâ€™s a very contemporary, plush hotel in the heart of Sydney with a truly professional staff that never miss a beat â€“ you too should try it out!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Not Cheap, but well worth the cost”
Reviews.Author: ToadSydney
Reviews.Content: We go there regularly for dinner at Glass and stay overnight As we said not cheap, but well worth the cost

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, but room a little below my expectations for the rate charged.”
Reviews.Author: Mia K
Reviews.Content: I knew the room (we stayed in a king deluxe) would be small, but I was expecting a little more in terms of luxury for the rate we paid. We were only staying overnight, but for guests with more luggage the size may well be an issue. The placement of the glass desk necessitated leaving a light on overnight to avoid a collision in the dark. I felt the room was lacking the "wow" factor usually experienced at a Hilton. The buffet breakfast at Glass was magnificant & surely must be one of the best in Sydney. Terrific location for those interested in shopping & easy access to transport to Circular Quay & other tourist hotspots. Be aware Hilton charge a 1.5% fee for paying by credit card.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good hotel if travel with family ...”
Reviews.Author: shahrin_haron
Reviews.Content: This is the only hotel in my entire life that gave welcoming items after 3 nights we stayed there and 2 more hours before we check-out ... I travelled with my wife and 2 little daughters .. what i can tell that this is not the right hotel for my trip .. for business and travel alone maybe yes ... it's all started when we check-in .. we were given very very small room which after i put baby cot .. no more space left between the beds .. and the toilet meant for disable .. no standing shower and bath tup .. so i requested to have another room and we have to wait about 2 hours for that .. the front desk staff should advice us from beginning .. not jst given small room after knowing that me already request for baby cot. there were construction site next to it .. so expect something will wake u up in the morning .. i asked for 5pm taxi to bring us to airport ... 5am in the morning they called me saying taxi is ready !!!!!! even to borrow cheap umbrella (because raining) .. we have to write down our name and room number .. park hyatt gave me 2 very nice umbrella just like that ... no shuttle services .. luckly park hyatt very nice to send us to this place .. we were in sydney for 3 weeks and we stayed at the different hotel .. four seasons, park hyatt and hilton .. reason for this hilton mainly for my wife where she want to do last minute shopping .. and this hotel .. overall far far far far behind park hyatt and four seasons .. i don't feel welcome here ..everyone seems doing their own part .. we, as a guest has to shout to get something ...

Reviews.Title: “It's the Personal Touch that counts”
Reviews.Author: gsc168
Reviews.Content: The Hilton is well located in the middle of the city. It is a few minutes walk to Hyde Park, 12 minutes walk to Darling Harbour. It is easy to get to the Hilton from the airport - just hop on any one of the trains that leave the airport every 11 minutes and take a quick ride to Town Hall station. The Hilton is just across the road! But, it is much more than the location that makes the Hilton a hotel to go back to. The staff were focused on my wife and I. After the second day at breakfast in Glass, the table staff welcomed us back. Domenic remembered which coffees we liked! It's the little things that count. All of the staf were friendly. Anika in the Executive lounge was great - always welcoming and friendly There are lots of nice hotels around - it's the staff that make the difference. All in all, a class act in a class hotel.,

Reviews.Title: “Been around the World and the service here is the worst”
Reviews.Author: superman_lover
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin with my gripes with Hilton Sydney??? Ok lets start at the top. After a seven hour flight from Singapore, We clearly committed a sin by landing in Sydney at 7 o'clock am. We reported to our Hotel and explained that we were newly arrived and tired. All we get is some guy on the front desk telling us that we should have paid for an extra night.....Let me explain. The hilton wanted us to pay for the night before and check in at 7am in the morning....Yeh, it doesnt make sense to me neither. After getting lectured for 10 minutes about the benefits of booking for a night when i'd arrive in the morning. The idiot on the front desk realises that there was not availability to do this anyway. Therefore what was his point? So there i am, half way across the world from home, tired and exhausted and i'm greeted by someone who does not have the ability to make a logical point. After all this, we left our bags and our mobile numbers with the idiot and asked him to call us once a room became available. we left at 7:15am (by the way he lecture an american couple straight after us about the same subject matter) we made our way to the harbour to kill time. Anyway, by 10am we;d had no fonecall and went back to Hilton. our rooms were now ready.......So were was the fonecall?? Last point, on our last day we paid $2 AUS to send 3 post cards from the Hilton as their staff convinced us that the post office was too far. This was on 9Th May 10. It's 28th May 10 and 0/3 postcards have reached their destination. Worst Hotel I've ever Been too

Reviews.Title: “This is regards to my stay at the lovely hotel during Jan 2010,”
Reviews.Author: jasminharvey
Reviews.Content: This is regards to my stay at your lovely hotel on the 30 Jan 2010, My name is Jasmin and me and my husband had booked a room useing the advantage of the 50 % weekend off , i must say that it was worth every single penny we spend, Your staff made us feel really welcome and the best part was that it started even before we could set foot in the hotel , we had a long drive all morning and using the GPS we managed to reach the city at around 1 in the afternoon , but where lost and the GPS took us round and round which was very frustrating then i called up the hotel and spoke to this lovely person (i am sorry i don't remember his name) this guy was so polite and so patient i cant tell you . because when i called i was very hyper as i was running late , but he really charmed us by his polite tone and friendliness , the best part was we could fell his willingness to help us in his voice , he even called us back on our mobile and stayed with us till we got to the hotel entrance. i have stayed is some of the most lovely hotels in the world but i have to tell you he was THE most polite person in your team , i only wish i remembered his name , he did have an indian accent and his name was something like koor ,he is truly a plus to your organisation , if your could by any chance pass on my thanks to him as i dint get a chance to do it myself . Kind Regards Jasmin

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pinkpink2
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Sydney for holidays in April on our way to New Zealand. Stayed at the Hilton Hotel in town. It was very comfortable, modern, a bit expensive, but quality decor. No views as such, good restaurant, and great brekkie.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, if expensive”
Reviews.Author: dk011
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 6 nights on business in March and the location is excellent. Darling Harbour and Chinatown are easy walks away. Its possible to walik to Circular Quay and the Rocks in about 30 minutes. I stayed in a business room with access to the lounge. The lounge is excellent, although access at very busy times can be a problem. My room was comfortable and quiet, surprising for the location, but a little small, as was the bathroom. Service is good. Overall, a good hotel for business although it is a little expensive.

Reviews.Title: “You must dine at the Glass restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Flyingwelshman
Reviews.Content: Central location, near train station and QVB. Fantastic food at the Galss restaurant. Elegant night club attached to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Edmonds1725
Reviews.Content: I needed a room for a business meeting on short notice. Hilton staff organized a suite on 2 hours notice despite being almost 100% occupied and fitted it out with projector, screen and refreshments for guests. The service before, during and after the meeting was first rate.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Sydney, in the thick of everything”
Reviews.Author: 4Noels
Reviews.Content: I loved this Hilton. We have stayed in many particularly in London and around the UK, but this one was rather special because it was so up-to-date with a really contemporary feel and ambience throughout. Staff were helpful but always busy. Fab rooms with TV in the shower rooms (although we were upgraded) so unsure if they're in all. Beds huge, clean, rooms big enough to unpack and relax in. Gym was enormous with plenty of facilites. Breakfast overlooking the street but interesting watching the hussel and bussel of Syndey life in the mornings. Easy to walk to most of the iconic views, Harbour Bridge, Opera House, Darling Harbour, Ferry Stops, Aquariums, shops etc...Car Rentals. Exceedingly good experience.

Reviews.Title: “A Hilton Hhonors Diamond's recommendation: Stay away”
Reviews.Author: MichaelSMunich
Reviews.Content: Being a Diamond with Hhonors, the Hilton reward program I have a lot of experience with the Hilton Group and the quality of their hotels. In 2009 I slept 110 nights in one of their Hilton or Conrad brand hotels. I am sorry to say, but the Sydney Hilton is not a gem in the catalog of the Hilton Group. The rooms are to small, the aircondition is too noisy, the windows resemble loop holes, the service is inadequate, do not disturb signs are ignored. If you have one of the rooms surrounding the elevator, forget about sleeping, room service food quality is sub par and the guys at the concierge desk are not helpful and seem to be annoyed when asked to do a reservation at a restaurant. The internet is far too slow for the 29USD charged per day, wifi coverage is a hit and miss. Also, you are only able to log into the wifi with one device per room ( do not get me wrong, even when you want to pay for it extra, it does not work - one mac address per room, insane) This is the first Hilton, that ended up on my no go list. If you are a business traveler with certain expectations towards quality and service, really check your options in Sydney before booking the Sydney Hilton. Because this hotel is not living up to the promises the Hilton brand is giving.

Reviews.Title: “As noisy as a warzone!”
Reviews.Author: clefsd0r
Reviews.Content: Bang bang bang bang! That's the noise every morning of my stay (including weekends) as I was awoken by construction and demolition within the local area. The location is really great for being in central sydney, but I have had better nights sleep in a backpackers. I felt in also worthwhile to note the distinct lack of famous Hilton service. Whenever I returned by taxi no-one opened the door for me. I only received a warm smile once at breakfast and at check-out - the rest of the time I was largely ignored, even when being pro-active in my good-mornings to staff. For a business traveller who needs good facilities and doesn't mind an early start to their day the Hilton Sydney is great. For anybody else, I would recommend the Westin or Shangri-la.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Personified”
Reviews.Author: Natasha F
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last week (7-10th May) on a special deal we booked over 6 months ago. We had a Junior King Suite on the 32nd floor and paid a very very cheap $250 a night - with breakfast included. The check in process was efficient and quick - we arrived about 1pm and the room wasn't ready yet so they took our luggage and recommended places to go while we waited. Once we got our room keys our luggage was delivered to our room. The suite was very nice. There was about 50sq metres. There was a large wardrobe, a powder room, sofa and lounge chairs and also king size bed and full bathroom. The views were pretty spectacular. There are 5 or so narrow windows with mechanised blackout screens that are controlled by switches near the bed. They blocked out 90% of light so if you like to sleep late they were fabulous. There are also 2 separate toilets - one in the bathroom and the other in the powder room. The TV was a flat screen and had regular channels as well as Foxtel (CNN, W, Fox8 etc) There was a DVD player and you can borrow DVDs from the hotel. They have a high-tech mini bar that is pressure sensitive. If you remove an item it is automatically charged to the room account. They will provide you with a 2nd fridge if needed. We accidentally knocked a few items - but they took the charges off our account. The bed was very comfortable and they have a 5 option pillow menu - if you need it! There was a large 2 person shower and a bath. All the Crabtree & Evelyn amenities were divine! We used the spa/gym once and they have a full gym as well as 2 saunas, 2 steam rooms, spa and a 3 lane lap pool. It was very well appointed. Breakfast costs $45 pp but it was included in the room cost. We only took advantage of it on the Monday morning and were so full we could barely walk - they have a full hot buffet with made to order eggs, pancakes, waffles & French toast. There were about 9 different types of bread, plus doughnuts, muffins and cereals. Overall this hotel was 99% perfect and I would recommend it to anyone who wants a bit of luxury. The only bad thing we have to say about the stay, although through no fault of the Hilton, was that construction noise woke us on the Friday & Monday mornings.. A building was being demolished behind the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: Bambi_kimber
Reviews.Content: The service was great and the room service was fantastic and the staff so courteous. The staff at room service even changed a specific dish for me without any hassles. Check-in time was very quick, professional and welcoming. My only criticism would be that my bags were not taken to my room and I had difficulty finding my room because I wasn't told what floor it was on. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect anniversary location!”
Reviews.Author: madkat16
Reviews.Content: We went for the upgrade option, and had a room on the club floor - the room was better than expected (we'd heard some negative press about the rooms). There was a small sitting room, an enormous and inviting king bed, and for the first time in about 10 years, I indulged in a bath! You can choose from a pillow "menu" but the ones on the bed were very comfy. We had canapes and drinks at the Club Lounge - only choice of beer was Hahn or Heineken. We then moved to Glass for dinner and had a fabulous meal - the food and service were beyond reproach. Only small whinge was the majority of entrees were all seafood,otherwise gnocchi, which can be too filling. Breakfast was slightly more frantic, as you expect on a weekend. The food was a good choice, but would rather a big bowl of bircher muesli than a shotglass. Coffees took over 45 mins to arrive, after a 2nd request. We would definately recommend this hotel - the QVB and major department stores are within 50metres.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed in hotel and services, though great location”
Reviews.Author: 1307boss
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay in Sydney at least once a week on business, we normally stay at the same hotel however this time I thought it maybe a good idea to try a change. So we booked into The Hilton on George on the "Executive floor". The whole experience was so dissapointing. Our room was small and cramped, with no to very little "Executive" feel about it. We a had to wait to late afternoon to check-in, a thing that would had not happen at our usual hotel! I asked reception for a late checkout as my husband was a speaker at a conference in the hotel on the day of check out, I was told this could be arranged for a cost of $30.00 extra!!!!! The actual "Executive"lounge was pretty ordinary and quite loud we could hear all conversations around us. As there seems to be no dress code with people were wearing shorts and jeans we felt we could had been in a local off the street bar. Not to mention a rather noisy child who enjoyed the sounds of it's own screams!!!! And with each scream Mum, Dad and staff thought this worthy of a round of applause! So the concept of a quiet place to go and do some work was lost at the Hilton!!!! The facilities however were very good, great gym, the superb "Glass Restaurant". The position was fabulous, you are central to all city attractions. However for us and our company we will head back to our normal hotel on the Harbour for true corporate service, a good view and a practicle size room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jac02
Reviews.Content: Hotel in a really good location with a 10 minute walk to Darling Harbour and all its fantastic restaurants (I recommend Hurricanes Bar and Grill for their ribs), monorail, train and bus stations all right outside the door. It is quite a long walk to Circular Quay however. Apparently there is a free tourist bus that stops very close to the hotel and stops at circular quay and other places. Unfortunately we did not know about this until our last day. Room was a good size for a couple however we found it a little cramped with 2 children under 4 as well. The furnishings in the room were of a high standard. The pillows that come with the bed are way too soft. We picked firmer ones from the pillow menu. What I did not like was the bathroom which had frosted glass walls and a lovely spotlight in the shower at shin height so those in the room got a nice silhouette of the person taking a shower. BEWARE THE MINI BAR; if you pick up an item and hold it for too long you are automatically charged for it as there are sensors on the shelves. The staff are quite happy to fix this up on the bill, but it is a bother. The staff were wonderful and most helpful. We were travelling with a 6 month old and getting high chair anywhere was no trouble and the staff all stopped to smile and comment on how happy he was. My husband called up the day before we arrived to order something special in our room for our wedding anniversary. The hotel had no record of our reservation. This was rectified without any dramas (as we had the booking receipt) and our room was upgraded to a higher floor (floor 39). They also provided a bottle of champagne and strawberries and chocolate at no charge. Food at the restaurant was superb! We had tapas in the Glass Brasserie Bar the first night. Although the actual menu was not huge, the quality was unbelievable! Breakfast was included in our room rate. Although the range, taste and quality were indescribably good, it was expensive at $42 per person. If it was not included I would not have bothered for that price as there are plenty of other places around that offer meals at a much lower price. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comtemporary, romantic, excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: joolsmajor
Reviews.Content: The package we chose to celebrate our anniversary (dinner at Luke Mangan's Glass Brasserie, accommodation and full buffet breakfast) was superb both in terms of quality and value. The manager gave us a gift of champagne and chocolate dipped strawberries, with a personally written card! The room was an excellent, contemporary design, very comfortable, with cool views across the Sydney CBD to the harbour. The ambience of Glass Brasserie was magnificent, altering its mood to suit times of day and occasions. The menu was creative and delicious, with special praise to the French macaroons with their delectable fresh, creamy fillings! At the breakfast buffet, the service was personal and a huge range of hot and cold food was available. The concept of serving almost a 'tapas' style array of bircher muesli, stewed fruits, fresh juices, fruit infused yoghurt all served as "shots" was wonderful. All the staff, from housekeeping to 'Magic' room service, restaurant and reception were really warm, friendly, attentive people, without being obtrusive. All in all we will certainly return, and highly recommend a stay at the Sydney Hilton to others.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Room Size for the price”
Reviews.Author: maglil55
Reviews.Content: Don't think it's a bad hotel - it's not, but I have to say the room size was a let down for the price we paid. Let's start with the positives though. Location is excellent for the shoppers, right across the road from the QVB Shopping Arcade. Set in the heart of the hustle and bustle of Sydney it is well placed for sightseeing. Our purpose was a little different. We had just arrived off a long haul flight and wanted just one more peaceful evening/day before travelling on to visit relatives. By the time we got in from the airport it was too late to eat and I didn't find the room service menu too inspiring so we didn't bother in the end. We were on a high floor and the hotel is very imposing in it's size. I've been in Hiltons of this size (and bigger!) before but somehow this one just lacked something. I just did not feel at ease. Large hotels can still have a "homeliness" about them but this one didn't have it. Anyway, we had an Accessible Executive Room. I am disabled and the wetroom was excellent. Plenty space to move about plus a seated wet/shower which was ideal for bathing. Well positioned grabrails which is just as well as the floor tiles once you moved out of the shower area were a bit slippy to say the least. You need something with a bit of grip when your mobility is impaired. It is such a shame that having blessed the room with such good bathing facilities they had to spoil it with such a cramped bedroom. I am afraid that cramped room and accessible are not words that go together. It was difficult to find the few things we needed in our cases and manouver around the room particularly with a crutch. Tired and hungry, we decided to get some sleep and see what the next day brought. Still suffering from jet lag, I was up early and into the very busy gym by 6am. Gym is well equiped, clean and even although it was busy it was pretty easy to get on all the equipment I wanted. Also very helpful trainers. Had breakfast in the lounge. It was undergoing some work at the tiime we were there. Selection was reasonable but there was a lack of staff to assist and the coffee machine took a little working out. A member of staff could have made it so much quicker. Porters are very quick when you request luggage to be moved. There is also a very good coffee shop on the ground floor of the hotel but again very busy. So, location is great for sightseeing. It has a very good gym. Room we had was very, very cramped and overall we found the hotel impersonal and quite expensive for what we got. I'd say this is one for the business traveller. I'd recommend for business but not for the leisure traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: Cromeris
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful anniversary stay at Sydney Hilton. Booked an executive room and had check-in upgrade to a relaxation suite. Suite was a large corner room with great views to the harbour bridge and also to the heads of the harbour. Suite had all the amenities you would need for a romantic, relaxing stay. Great service at the executive lounge and staff could not do enough for us. We also had a great dinner at Glass. No hesitation to recommend this hotel. Only issue in common with many other hotels is high cost of internet use, if you need it.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: NickersSydney
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed for 1 night on Saturday 3/4/10, I have stayed in other Hiltons before and the service has been excellent, i just found with the Sydney Hilton, it had nothing on the others, At check in we were left at the counter whilst a girl at reception who wasnt serving anyone said to us "wont be a minute" then walked off about 1 minute after that away from reception, we were then left to be served, so my impression from the start wasnt that great. The room was comfortable and clean, I had to call reception at 3.30am after 2 hours of noise from the people upstairs, they offered to send security up so I didnt have the best night sleep, then when headed to breakfast I couldnt belive it when there was at least 20 people in a queue in front of us (they dont take bookings for breakfast), my partner and I are appauled that a 5 star hotel can make guests wait like that (a few people in the queue were laughing because there is a sign that says the restaurant sits 300 people), not to mention there were avalailable tables inside they just didnt have enough staff to clear, reset or escort you to a table. After all that the breakfast was great, as was our dinner the previous night at Glass and the few hours we'd spent predinner and afterdinner at Marble Bar.

Reviews.Title: “excellent 5 star service”
Reviews.Author: kimbraddylan
Reviews.Content: booked for easter wkend for our anniversary, they gave us a free upgrade to a king suite which was double the size of our original room, free champagne, choc dipped strawberries and turkish delight, a lovely card and balloon. you must upgrade to executive lounge access its a must. no complaints whatsoever quick check in and out, magic button, every request was granted and given with a smile :) by far the best hotel experience we have ever had. room szervice food was delicious and generous servings

Reviews.Title: “5 star stay! Looking for romantic getaway? This is a perfect spot!”
Reviews.Author: Vikii5
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed in Hilton Hotel in Sydney for our wedding night.. We received upgrade to beautiful room for freshly married couple.. our one bedroom apartment have amazing views at the city and QVB and XXL size spa.. After well rested night we have buffet breakfast in the Hilton restaurant.. We loved variety of the food (so fresh!) and first class service.. I will recommend this hotel to everyone - you have city at your hotel steps, great bar upstairs and minutes to Myer and DJ.. Enjoy..

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: dcribb
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best Hiltons I have stayed in (on par with Tokyo) and in fact one of the most pleasant hotel stays in the last 24 months. The room was okay, but what made the hotel special were the restaurants, bars and cafe and other amenities. We had an absolutely fabulous dinner in the glass Brasserie and were very impressed with the breakfast. At AUS$ 220 incl. breakfast this was excellent value. The hotel seemed to attract locals as well, who used the bars and restaurants, which made it a lively place and less sterile than many hotels. Compliments to the Head Chef and Food & Beverage Manager, we were impressed.

Reviews.Title: “I will never go back!”
Reviews.Author: Bluspot
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were very dissapointed with the Hilton. On our first night the air-conditioner was broken (set to 21.5 degrees) so it was very cold. The bathrooms (we stayed in two rooms as we were moved due to the air-con problem) were mouldy and the beds were very unshapely as if in need of replacement. We stayed in the Guest Room Plus - this room is very small and cramped, I would not recommend this room if you would like some time to kick back and relax in your room. We found the service to be average - certainly no welcoming smiles at check-in. We did find the breakfast to be pleasant and the waiters to be a lot more friendly than the reception staff.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: manykids8
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hilton for my mums birthday, as a special treat. First off, we walked in and got booked in quickly.. We then walked up to our room on level 28. And we were taken away not only by the view, but the room it self... It was very clean,tidy.. Although the room was alittle small it had everything you needed- very good use of space. Plus, a good location for the shopping we did! The staff were happy to assist in any matters or request!! For breaky the following morning- we had bacon and eggs.. Although it was alittle expensive, it was worth it! very nice! I will be coming back to this hotel again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Compact but very nice”
Reviews.Author: CoreyandSarah
Reviews.Content: Just stayed the one night. Room was small but ultra modern and very well appointed. King bed was very comfy. Overall the facilities are great with large pool and spa and large gym with a lot of equipment / cardio machines. Buffet breakfast was a treat and staff were very courteous. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Sydney - an oasis in a concrete desert”
Reviews.Author: spunkyryan
Reviews.Content: Everything from when I checked in to checked out was brilliant. The check-in/out process was quick, the room very well appointed, the cheese platter delivered quickly and better than many others. My only regret is that I wasn't able to stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and clean hotel in CBD”
Reviews.Author: Petteri
Reviews.Content: Rooms: Modern, clean, nice views in all directions. Beware of the rooms right next to elevators, the noise from elevators is horrible (receptionist kindly warned us since during our early check-in the only available room was next to elevators; we thought we give it a try and soon decided to request another room). Service: Good, front desk staff helpful, concierge ready to assist, breakfast room service very friendly. Location: Middle of everything in CBD, easy access to Circular Quay, The Rocks, Darling Harbour etc. The only con is that there are not so many dining opportunities right next to the hotel in the evenings. Other: Beware of the outrageous prices for internet connection. Overall: Would stay again and can recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “serial disappointer”
Reviews.Author: choopsie
Reviews.Content: over the last year my partner and I have stayed in the Hitlon on 4 separate occasions and while it offers sentimental value to us (the reason we went back), i can't say that we would stay again. On two separate occasions (in two different rooms) we had air conditioning problems. While responsive to our complaints (they sent up a handyman who spent 3hrs!!!! in our room trying to fix it) we still spent two nights in unbearable heat and were not compensated one bit (this room isn't cheap and we were very disappointed). In the more basic rooms the walls are paper thin, so hopefully you have some quiet neighbours when you stay (we unfortunately did not on our last stay). They also do not have doors wide enough to accommodate room service tables. Both dinner and breakfast they tried to get the table into our room with no luck (you think they would know this by now). As the table did not fit in we were then requested to take our own plates outside when we have finished - not 5 star service if you ask me!!!!!! Overall the hotel is ok but the little things are frustrating. Every time we ring the "MAGIC" room service button it is not so magical; in-between being on hold every time you ring up to taking hours for room service to bring up requests. The TVs have minimal channels and are very frustrating to use (you literally have to click 3 times to change each channel!). You would think the Hilton would treat their repeat customers a little better. to them, we are just another number who they donâ€™t really care about PS not their fault, but they are located on one of the busiest streets in Sydney - expect to hear traffic all night ...a very noisy hotel both internally (thin walls) and externally (are the windows even double glazed?)

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Nush7
Reviews.Content: Late, but had to log another fab Hilton experience. Great location, walked everywhere every day, and great for late evening stroll as well. Good shops nearby. Staff were excellent, I had a 'situation' they were very helpful phoning around for doctors on a Saturday and called around to book appointment, then even asked me how i was. We stayed on the Exec floors, accessing Exec lounge - breakfast and cocktails were one of the best we've had; not to mention the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning, but crowded”
Reviews.Author: mgips
Reviews.Content: I agree with many of the 5-star reviews. The facility is beautiful, the location is central, and the service is excellent. My two favorite features were breakfast at Glass (the restaurant) and the gym. The restaurant had fresh eggs made to order every day, plus a wide variety of delicious fresh fruit, some of which was made into a variety of fresh juices/smoothies. The gym is fantastic: it is essentially a standalone membership health club that happens to be in the hotel. It has a lot of equipment and a range of classes such as Body Pump. I would love to give this hotel 5 stars. I have to deduct, however, for the lobby and elevator experience. The lobby seemed always to be crowded, with few places to sit. Gangs of flight crews would mill about in the lobby, making it tricky to get to the elevators. Speaking of elevators, there were too few for all the traffic, especially when the flight crews arrived. If I wasn't out of my room by 7 in the morning, I might have to wait 10 minutes for an elevator. The only stairs were alarmed emergency stairs, so walking was not an option.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, how to be impressed.”
Reviews.Author: teabo
Reviews.Content: To stay at the Hilton Sydney is excellent, all the essential boxes are ticked. When you leave home to take break you want to be able to relax, regardless whether its for business or pleasure. Hilton Sydney is located in within walking distance of everything that make Sydney one of the best cities in the world. The staff are all exceptionally well presented so helpful & courteous. Rooms have been tastefully done in modern comtempory style, absolutely giving thought to make ones stay sheer enjoyment. The restaurant & room service is first rate, five-star.

Reviews.Title: “I think we've found our new Sydney base!!!”
Reviews.Author: AdelaideArchitect
Reviews.Content: After a weekend of family commitments we spent a short 24 hours at the Hilton and dreaded checking out as we had so much fun. We had a room on the Executive floor (which included some great drinks and canape's in the Executive Lounge) which despite us asking for one (admittedly only day's before we checked in) away from the lifts was immediately adjacent to the Lift Lobby. I was a little concerned - but didn't need to be. With the comfortable bed, the brilliant blackout blinds and the firmest of pillows from the Pillow Menu we slept like babies! (I am a little guilty of over analyzing hotels from other's comments on Trip Advisor). We upgraded to the Hilton Breakfast that was brilliant too! (Although I'm sure the included continental breakfast in the Executive Lounge would have been good too!) The Glass Brassiere is a beautiful space. As two Architect's having stayed in lots of hotels in Sydney, and in lots of 'boutique' hotels around Australia and the world we think we've found our new Sydney base. It was spotlessly clean, beautifully designed and finished and the staff were brilliant. Couple of minor things - the room seemed a little small when we first arrived - but we quickly settled in nicely. The 'glass bathroom' is one of the better one's we've seen (as it was all 'frosted glass'). The night lighting was an excellent touch - as was the lack of 'direct' lighting on the ceiling - all lamps and recessed 'mood' lighting - brilliant! Who would have known that you could get such friendly and personal service in such a big chain hotel - obviously aesthetic considerations are not the only consideration in making a customer's stay a pleasant one!

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: lizmatthews45
Reviews.Content: We decided to opt for the Hilton after having stayed at one or two other Sydney hotels which we didnt particularly like. Everything about this hotel was lovely - from the "Pillow Menu" to the lovely buffet breakfast. On top of that it was in walking distance to the Opera House, bridge and shopping district. We shall certainly stay there next time we are in Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Great service & location in an amazing room! Only wish we could have stayed longer.”
Reviews.Author: MudgeeWinelover
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in other Hiltons and not been that impressed. Our stay in the Sydney Hilton was possibly one of the best hotel rooms we have experienced as seasoned travellers.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: mariovsky
Reviews.Content: We ended our australian tour by staying two nights at the Hilton Sydney. It was the perfect ending: a flawless hotel, the room was superb, everything worked, the staff was fantastic. We will certainly be back!

Reviews.Title: “Be aware of the rooms next to the lifts!!!”
Reviews.Author: 27L09R
Reviews.Content: Arriving early morning to a room I had paid for from the night before. We were allocated a room on a high floor directly behind/next to the lifts. When these were in use the whole room shook and the noise very loud. No way you could rest or sleep through that. While this room was clean and nice - it wasn't the upgraded room I had actually booked and had paid a bit more for - no bathtub or TV in the shower as advertised. When I complained the reception stated a similar story to an earlier reviewer with a problem with lift noise - that the hotel was fully booked and they could offer us a disability room. To try and have a good stay we accepted this - only to find the disability room was only the 2nd room away from the lifts. The noise could still be heard and the room still shook when the lifts were in use. It seems a disability rooms equals lack of taste in decor as the bathroom was all white and bland unlike the other room. The room still had lots of items up high - light switches, glasses, ice bucket, hangers etc so if you were in a wheelchair you would struggle to access these. Also the bathroom door was more like a heavy fire door again not good if you were disabled. Very heavy to open. This room wasn't as clean as the first and had some previous guests hair in the sink. After a long trip from the UK all I wanted was to chill out in my room for a while. I decided to write a letter to the hotel manager stating all the issues we've had. To his credit he did upgrade us to a relaxation suite for the remainder of our stay - this was lovely. Open plan living area, bedroom and huge separate bathroom - with large spa bath, shower and toiler, the suite also had an additional toilet in the living area. Great to watch the sun setting over the city while in the spa bath. Shame things couldn't have been sorted out in the first place as a Hilton Honours guest it was in my preferences to have a room far away from lifts. On checking this - it seemed to have been "reset" Very unsettling to have to pack and unpack for 3 rooms in 4 days! Hotel charges $29 for 24 hour Internet access. While this time my rate didn't include breakfast. I would give the thumbs up to Vivo on 388 Geogre street - great options for vegetarians and good big portions. Reception areas were all very clean. The hotel is in an excellent location for wandering down to the harbour area or over to the botanics. Just don't accept a room near the lifts unless you can sleep through anything!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Chaj
Reviews.Content: We were greeted with a complimentary room upgrade and champagne, chocolates and strawberries which was a pleasant surprise considering it was our wedding anniversary. The Hilton hotel staff were really friendly. Apart from the upgrade and compliments, the Hilton breakfast was a highlight, we have never seen so many food options to choose from for breakfast. Only minus is the rooms are quite small but cozy!

Reviews.Title: “Hilton real Quality and great location”
Reviews.Author: Nath85
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay at this hotel,really clean, great bathroom and very helpful staff and the bars attached were great, only problem was that we were put on a room on the top floor next to the lift which although gave us a good view it was noisy and annoying seens as i booked the room 6 months earlier.

Reviews.Title: “Best Breakfast We Had in Oz!”
Reviews.Author: Robinson-Crusoe
Reviews.Content: This is a really good standard Hilton hotel with everything you'd expect in terms of a quality bedroom and bathroom (and a good powerfull shower). The location was fine - close enough to all the main tourist attractions. What made the hotel stand out for us was the high quality and huge choice of food for breakfast and the attentiveness of the very friendly breakfast staff. The concierge team were also particularly friendly and happily helped us with information on a couple of occassions. We would definitely go back - even it it was just for breakfast !

Reviews.Title: “Divine!”
Reviews.Author: KDKay
Reviews.Content: Great location, fabulous decor, friendly impeccable service, awesome breakfast. Our room was a bit on the small side, the twin beds were a little bit closer than I would've liked. And the frosted glass door and surrounds on the ensuite aren't the best for privacy when you're staying with a friend. But those small gripes aside, the Hilton was divine. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: swim54low
Reviews.Content: Mom,dad, 22 year old daughter. We arrived in Sydney at 6:00 AM following a 17 hour flight. Immediately checked in at the Hilton and they held our luggage while we showered in the hotel fitness center. After spending the day touring the town we settled into our room. We had a standard king room with a roll-away bed for our daughter. The room was somewhat small for two persons and adding a third made it cramped, but we weren't in Australia to spend time in a room ... The greatest attribute of this hotel is the staff; every single staff member we encountered was fabulous. The front desk persons were helpful and friendly, and the concierge desk staff were extremely friendly and their directions and suggestions invaluable. We went for drinks and snacks in the Glass Brasserie in the evenings and the staff was outstanding. The staff in the lobby cafe were the same, unbelievable. Breakfast in the Glass Brasserie is amazing. Down side was $20AU for 24 hours of broadband; at the hotel rate one would think this would be included, especially in this day. Would love to return to this hotel, can not say enough about the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Look No Further”
Reviews.Author: Jerome-Swiss
Reviews.Content: If you are thinking about the Hilton Don't!! Stay here as I dare!! you will enjoy your stay.... Location and ameneties are top class. The best asset of this hotel are the Concierge, they will serve and guide you to the right path!!

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel let down by some property and service faults”
Reviews.Author: Jauntingman
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night whilst attending the Military Tattoo in Sydney. We had booked and prepaid through Wotif and whilst aware we had to show photo ID cannot understand why Hilton needed to take a photocopy. That issue aside, reception were polite and helpful on a busy day. Lifts were a big issue, long queues and waits for a full hotel of guest. The room was a reasonable size with a great ensuite. The bed was very uncomfortable, very disappointing compared to 4 star hotels we have stayed at, and the pillows were no better. We were surprised to find we could only get a hot chocolate through room service when we returned from the Tattoo, and that was very expensive. We enjoyed a great breakfast with lots of choice and good service. However, our big disappointment was the arrogant concierge who was totally unhelpful in assisting with transport arrangements to the airport. He treated us as fools for not knowing what he knew about the airport connect shuttles and did not volunteer any information about the train service. This was a real contrast with the concierge who dealt with us the previous night, very helpful and courteous and knowledgeable. This was our first stay at a Hilton and the experience has not encouraged us to select Hilton again.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable luxury”
Reviews.Author: TravelingCelt
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel because it seems to offer the best value from the 5* hotels in Sydney. We would have preferred a hotel on the harbour, but they were much more expensive. The Hilton has a reasonable location, being surrounded by a large shopping area and some interesting restaurants. Room was typically Hilton:so modern and well equipped, but not huge. We had a room on the executive floor, which I would recommend as the lounge served good food and drinks in the evening. Service was good everywhere. The sports centre is well equipped with a reasonable sized swimming pool. There is a large selection of bars and restaurants, but when we visited many of them weren't open, presumably because of lack of business. I'd certainly consider staying there again next time I visit Sydney (which I hope is soon, because I think it is a great city).

Reviews.Title: “Reliable and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: blogfoguk
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several times now and I think it's great. Stay on the Executive floor to enjoy the lounge. The rooms are ok in size but the beds are very comfortable and the bathroom well appointed. If you're on the early flight from London, you might get your room from 10am, perfect to catch up on some sleep. Pool is nice as is the Sauna and gym. Location is good for everything. Recommended

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and I will be back”
Reviews.Author: shane68
Reviews.Content: The Hilton team was tremendous and a great place to stay, very central to everything in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Without a doubt, the nicest hotel I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: Lyn-Leeds
Reviews.Content: I can honestly say that this was the best hotel that I have ever had the pleasure to stay in. We holidayed in Oz Dec 09-Jan 10 and treated ourselves to 3 nights at the Hilton checking in Christmas Eve. The staff were all very professional and attentive, as is no doubt how the Hilton management wanted judging by the comment cards handed out at breakfast when being seated. And talking about breakfast, all I can say is "wow". I have never seen anything like it, I could have spent all day there! There was so much food to choose from, and they seem to pride themselves in catering for all tastes/diets. On the mornings I wanted to be healthy, I headed straight to the cereals, fruits and yoghurts. When filling my stomach for the day ahead, I enjoyed a fry-up from the buffet, I could have also ordered pretty much anything else I could possibly want from the chefs I could see cooking in the kitchen. From omelettes to waffles, the Hilton catered for everyone. But without a doubt, the most indulgent part of breakfast was walking up to the employee whose sole job seemed to be to make fruit smoothies! What an inventive way to encourage me to get some of my 5 a day! With regards to the room, it was absolutely perfect! A huge double bed, sofa and a good amount of storage space which is always a bonus. The bathroom was a very good size, and very modern. The quirkiest thing about it was the frosted glass wall of the shower which meant that I could see my partner's shadow when he was in there and I was lying in bed.... surprised me the first time, amused me from then on! With our stay being over the festive period, the bars weren't always open, but this didn't bother us as we were out a lot anyway, but I do feel like I've missed out on a treat having read about them. Writing this review wishes I could stay there all the time!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible stay at the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl2783
Reviews.Content: An impromptu visit to Sydney to celebrate my birthday on a long weekend was always going to make finding a hotel difficult. The Hilton was one of the few hotels not booked out so we booked an executive room, not quite sure what to expect. We arrived from an overnight flight at the hotel at about 9am, hoping to leave our bags and perhaps check out the surrounding shops. The loveliest person checked us in, advised we had been upgraded to a king suite and that it was ready - also that we had been upgraded to evening drinks at Zeta bar and breakfast at Glass! We could hardly believe our luck and upon entering the room, used their 'magic' button just to check we had been given the right room - it was amazing! Had a beautiful day lazing in the hotel - room service was delicious and we ordered champagne which came with complimentary chocolate strawberries and truffles. Drinks at Zeta were a treat and breakfast at Glass delicious. Contacted housekeeping to have a top pressed just before breakfast and by the time we came back it was hanging in the wardrobe - great service. All in all we can't wait to go back - but can't imagine that we would be so lucky ever again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent ....”
Reviews.Author: Dman72
Reviews.Content: Excellent The hotel is located at the heart of the shopping district (Market street and George St.); the room and the ... bedding were excellent for a good night sleep. Service with a smile from the staff and the prices were very good for the 5 star services.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service. Courteous staff. Service oriented.”
Reviews.Author: VNKS
Reviews.Content: Excellent service. Courteous staff. Service oriented.

Reviews.Title: “Great holiday, the hotel was fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: jadescool
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sydney Hilton for 3 nights as a little midweek getaway from Melbourne. The hotel itself was fantastic. Very clean, modern, great views, great staff. We spent our first night in the Marble Bar which was the highlight of our trip. The cocktails were SUPERB, the staff were so professional and so friendly, making sure we were attended to the entire time. The Marble Bar is a must for pre-drinks, or even drinks after dinner. I may have had one too many cocktails but that only made the stay more fun! The only thing I didn't love was the room was a little small- but it was compensated by lovely mirrors and decor and the bathroom was nice too. The small room is fine when you look out to the view; you're in the middle of Sydney. Great hotel for business stays, and also wonderful for holidays. Great location and the Glass Brasserie is gorgeous. Worth every cent.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: boomer165
Reviews.Content: We used the benefits of our Hilton Honors membership to stay 3 nights at the Sydney Hilton 29-31 December 2009 and then we purchased a one night overnight visit 3 days later after a jaunt to Ayers Rock. We booked our reward stay via the Hilton Honors website and a friendly Hilton Honors customer service specialist over a year in advance. Because we are Diamond level in the Hilton loyalty program we had access to the executive lounge and it is a perk we cherish. Three complimentary computer stations allowed access to our internet world and communicating with our family back home was convenient and greatly appreciated. The morning breakfast is diversified, substantial, and very satisfying. The afternoon/early evening wine and nibbles can substitute for a dinner out in town. The people who staff the lounge are friendly, a joy to speak with, and helpful. Anika, Anke, and Bobby stick out in my mind but all of the folks in the lounge were extremely congenial. The concierge staff graciously looked after our two bigger pieces of luggage for 2 days whilst we departed from Sydney for a few days prior to embarking on the longest part of our holiday. Overall, a top notch experience.

Reviews.Title: “What a hotel, good”
Reviews.Author: sanosagara
Reviews.Content: I love the entire location, especially the undying caring of spirit from the front desk and staffs around the lobby, room is great, hilton's bathrooms I visited always impresesd me, for instance, KL Hilton's.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless customer service, modern rooms, central location and great food.”
Reviews.Author: clownshoes
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hilton was fantastic. In fact, we almost spent less time with friends as we wanted to hang out in the hotel it was so good. The doormen, front desk, concierge are all eager to assist with absolutely anything. We were fortunately upgraded to a suite on the 43rd floor, which also gave us access to the excecutive lounge. I can not recommend this more highly. Manhattenesque views, and a good range of quality foods at the breakfast buffet made it a must every morning. What I liked most about the breakfast is the unashamedly Australian nature of it. I like to dine on local fare wherever I go, rather than stubbornly insist on hometown comfort foods. The Hilton provided an array of fresh fruits, fruity yoghurts, salad leaves with an assortment of olives, smoked salmon, tomatoes, cucumber, capers, dressings etc. The usual cereals, milk, coffee (an espresso machine), tea, green tea. An selection of juices, toast, preserves, croissants and other delicious pastries. Absolutely no consideration was given to British, German or Japanese guests, as is normal in international hotels, and I loved it! No huge selection of pressed meats, no "full English" breakfast, no miso soup or pickled vegetables, and no American waffle machine or donuts. Just great, healthy, Australian food. Our suite had great views (although not the postcard views you get from the Shangri-La or the Potts Point Holiday Inn), an amazing shower, open-plan bathroom, a king bed, pillow menu, walk-in wardrobe, mini-bar fridge, cable broadband (about $25 per day), a bath with spa-jets, and loads of towels, bath salts, quality soaps and shampoos. Location: Walking distance to Queen Victoria Building and Pitt St mall (for shopping types), to Hyde Park, and to Town Hall station. Not in a very good restaurant district, you need to go to Kings Cross, Chinatown, The Rocks, Newtown or elsewhere for a good range of dining options. A very comfortable stay and we will return for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Funky, modern, great location and great value”
Reviews.Author: love2travelTokyo
Reviews.Content: Definitely worth checking out discount websites for hilton rates - some can give fantastic bargains. Pre-paying also gives substantial discounts. Stayed 2 nights in December 2009 and we had a great stay. It is definitely our choice for Sydney. Some other hotels (Sheraton, Shangri-La, Four Seasons, Intercont) may be more opulent and/or have views, but none will beat the location and funky modern cool decor. Likes: - Great modern clean rooms with all amenities. Very clean, modern bathrooms including TV in the shower. Rooms are small though. - Location - for a tourist, it is perfect. Right opposuite QVB and next to Pitt St for all the shopping - but will need a long walk to get to the harbour. Also right between the 2 biggest supermarkets in the CBD - Breakfast was great - not as extensive as asian hotels, but still good - Gym / spa - like some other Sydney hotels, it does not have its own gym / pool, but has access to a commercial one. But the gym next door has a great small indoor pool, large jacuzzi and plenty of steam rooms, though opening horus could be longer - Service was generally very good - Value - we pre-booked and also had discount internet rates....was well worth it - Zeta is a pretty trendy bar Dislikes - No views: it is just not at the harbour like shangri-la, four seasons etc - Front desk was just overrun at check-in and check-out times...understaffed Definitely our place of choice for our next Sydney visit. In fact, have already booked there!

Reviews.Title: “I felt spoilt”
Reviews.Author: Ruffles33
Reviews.Content: From checking in to checking out my stay at the Sydeny Hitlon was faultless. The room was amazing with a spa bath in the middle of the room, just what the doctor ordered. Fantatic breakfast that cant be missed, Staff that truly look after you, I will defiantly be staying at the Hilton again.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Sydney - The best hotel in Sydney's CBD”
Reviews.Author: GuessGal
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Sydney is definitely the most luxurious hotel I have stayed at in Sydney's CBD. From the lovely welcome at the reception desk to the amazing room (with Crabtree & Evelyn bath products) - I was stunned from the beginning! We stayed at the Hilton for our 1 year wedding anniversary. It was over Christmas 2009 for 3 nights. Breakfast in the Glass Brasserie was beautiful and the variety of food was amazing!! The fruit smoothies were to die for!! And the watermelon juice was sublime. Note: They also also gluten free friendly and were able to provide me with GF toast for each of the 3 mornings we ate breakfast in the hotel. We also ate dinner at the Hilton on our second night and the dessert I had (Chocolate Assiette) was the most delicious dessert I have ever eaten! The hotel is located right opposite the QVB which was the perfect location for attending the Boxing day sales. I was even able to get back to the hotel with ease and drop off my shopping bags so I could buy more things! We thoroughly enjoyed our time and I highly recommend the Hilton Sydney. I'm sure you will love it as much as we did and we will definitely stay there again :-))

Reviews.Title: “Great location with people who care.”
Reviews.Author: ros74
Reviews.Content: Great location in George Street. Close to all the sight seeing areas, eg. Darling Harbour with its Imax theatre,Aquarium, Wildlife centre, Restaurants, bars, bowlingmuseums, etc. Chinatown & Paddy's market just minutes away. Circular Quay with the ferries,the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House about 20minutes walk away. Directly opposite the hotel is the shopping centre and the train station and round the corner is the monorail. Lovely hotel with staff that helped us celebrate our 40th Wedding Anniverary in style. Thank you for some great memories.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel with effecient and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: johndborg
Reviews.Content: A good hotel with clean room. We stayed in a executive room so had use of the executive lounge with free afternoon tea and evening drinks and canapes. I highly recommend booking an executive room. The only thing that we were disappointed in was the dinner in the restaurant. There was a limited selection, poor presentation and our salad was far too salty.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: LawsonT
Reviews.Content: Great service, fantastic buffet, great TV, clean rooms. Helpful staff, good view.

Reviews.Title: “There are better places to stay”
Reviews.Author: Seiryra
Reviews.Content: Well, the only things i am dissapointed with this hotel are: - Noise: I can hear ambulance or police's siren in the middle of the night from 39th floor. loud and very clear. my goodness, i wonder how clear is that for people on the floor below me. - Service time - counter desk: it's the longest queue i have ever waited just to check in and chek out. The staffs work very very slow. It took me 45 minutes just to check out, 2 hours before the predetermined check-out time. - customer service via phone: one word, Terrible! - value: it's too high for what they offer. room is so small, not worthy of the amount we pay (even for standard room). have to think twice to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just not worth it”
Reviews.Author: kellymua
Reviews.Content: Overpriced for very ordinary room. The Room on exective floor was nothing to be called exective. Had access to exective lounge but we are refused to enter because they were too busy. We are told to go to another bar for a while and come back later. When we went back there again an hour later, the blonde female manager gave us a dirty look and said to us "oh you came back again. we are still busy" with full of fake smile on her face. We even did not get a chance to sit down and paid extra for the club lounge. Next morning we went to breakfast to Glass restaurant which was great but we had to pay for that because only the breakfast at the club lounge was included. It was a total rip-off. Never go back there again and I won't recommend to anybody. There are more better options in Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: shoeladyLondon
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel in a prime location in central Sydney. We had a room on the 25th floor and had a great view of the city, including the AMP tower. The room was very modern, with a minimalist feel. The facilities in the room were great with a powerful shower which had a tv in the shower cubical. There were also black out blinds a must for jet lag sufferers!! The staff were very helpful with bags and city maps etc. There is a seven eleven about 4 doors down for room snacks and coffees if you don't wnat to pay the hotel prices. Overall a fabulous stay and would absolutely stay here again. It cost about $35 in a taxi from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “OK, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: NettieB
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night. Hotel right in city centre opposite the Victoria Building, so convenient for exploring the city. Room ok, little dark and dismal. After checking one of the towels, it was found to be dirty. This was replaced fairly promptly though. Cases took quite a while to arrive at room, and eventually had to call down to see when they would be delivered. Had stayed at the Westin a month earlier and found this, the Westin to be a far superior hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay, good price-quality ratio”
Reviews.Author: FDanvers
Reviews.Content: Room and bathroom were probably half the size than the Westin where I had stayed for 5 nights, but amazingly my satisfaction was at least double: none of the annoying service and food issues I had experienced at the Westin were present at the Hilton. The room rate was vastly lower but included breakfast (unlike the Westin) and consisted of a vast spread that left me spoilt for choice. Right round the corner from David Jones (food hall in basement) where very affordable and very tasty lunches and early dinners can be had. Sure, this hotel was less luxurious and rooms smaller than the Westin but it gets my vote when it gets to very good price-quality ratio for hurried business traveller who will essentially sleep/shower/have breakfast at hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place In Sydney”
Reviews.Author: TheBoatingMan
Reviews.Content: We loved the Sydney Hilton. Our room was modern and clean. Absolutely loved the lcd tv in the shower. The location was tops! You could walk all around sydney without any hassles. The staff were great, overall this place was excellent. One concern was the pressure point operated food and fridge. If you simply moved any bar snacks or opened the fridge you got charged to your account which was a little disappointing. Overall, this place is great for a romantic getaway or just a weekend away. We highly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Poor effort from staff made our stay less than pleasurable.”
Reviews.Author: MsDistress
Reviews.Content: We spent the night to celebrate our first wedding anniversary and we dismayed by the poor service. After checking in and leaving our bags at 1pm, we were told a room wasn't ready - back at 6pm to be told our room had been given to someone else. It took them 1/2 hour to ready a room for us, and we discovered it had two twin beds pushed together, not the king size as per our request. Amenities boxes were empty in the bathroom, only one bathrobe and there was a constant electrical buzzing noise all night. Also had to wait in line for 1/2 hour for breakfast in the morning - my husband travels a lot for business and was really disappointed with the all round service.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney Hilton King Relaxation Suite Stay Exceeded All Expectations.”
Reviews.Author: GotToGetAwaySoon
Reviews.Content: Our weekend in a Hilton King Relaxation suite exceeded all our expectations. The suite was clean, extremely spacious, quiet and very comfortable. The Hilton staff were excellent. The Hilton is perfectly located next to Pitt St Mall and is within easy walk of The Rocks. Living only a short distance away, we had a fabulous time 'holidaying on our own doorstep in our own City' and are looking forward to returning soon for a longer stay to take advantage of the in-house beauty treatments and swimming pool. Glass restaurant didn't disappoint, with excellent food and service at dinner and the extensive breakfast buffet was one of the best breakfast buffets I've visited. Use of the public executive lounge for a light breakfast and all day refreshments was marvellous. I can't recommend The Hilton highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “awsome hotel, anything you want at the touch of a button”
Reviews.Author: gencap
