Reviews.Content: The Hilton is in a central location. Train, monorail & bus services right outside the main entrance or just a short stroll away. All staff made you feel extremely welcome and were there to help. Rooms had all you needed and were very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: cyainhawaii
Reviews.Content: Excellent maid service and concierge. Location is excellent. We were able to walk to most of the attractions in Sydney. Friendly staff and helpful in giving directions.

Reviews.Title: “The worst 5 *hotel i have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: BYC_9
Reviews.Content: Firstly our room was next to the lifts and there are 43 floors in this hotel, the lift was so loud it sounded like an plane was taking off every few seconds. I phoned magic and explained that i would not be able to sleep, they explained half the lifts were switched off from 10.30 pm to 6.30 am. They also told me they were fully booked so i could not move rooms but they would give me ear plugs or i could move in a room which was designed for wheelchair access, i chose one of the top end rooms and after looking at this room , it did reflect the price of my top end room option. I also picked this hotel as i thought the glass brasserie looked really nice and i love wine and they have a huge selection, although i never got to have a drink in there as it was always being used for private events. All i ever seemed to hear from the staff was- No. Or they did not have a clue what was going on. I think the problem with this hotel is that it is too big and no one really knows what is going on. The rooms were really small. I will never stay in a Hilton again after this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Pampered”
Reviews.Author: Chocol
Reviews.Content: Fantastic full buffet breakfast at Glass Brasserie Great to have access to the Executive Lounge area Staff were welcoming, professional and helpful Handy easy access to shopping in the city

Reviews.Title: “Whoa the ancient tall buildings with the modern shopping inside plus the weekend markets”
Reviews.Author: susanGibraltar
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, staff were efficient and friendly. It was within walking distance of all shops, some attactions and transport, the Monorail was just 5 minutes walk and the QVC building was just in front of the hotel, it had shops, cafeterias and train station. The bathroom has a TV with remote control!!!! Good hotel

Reviews.Title: “Not great at all”
Reviews.Author: AusAdvisor123
Reviews.Content: Really not impressed, expensive, small rooms, slow staff, stupid conceirge system. Stay at the Westin or the Sofitel, this was a really bad 5 star experience, the lobby smelt like pino clean and was constantly full of non guests just congregating in the coffee shop they really need to lift their game will not be recommending to any travellers, stayed in many 5 star hotels in aus and this was not the pick of the sydney ones, did not feel welcome at all either. the executive lounge is depressing too, sorry this really tarnishes the hilton hotel brand...

Reviews.Title: “Is this a hilton or an ibis!!!”
Reviews.Author: JKF13
Reviews.Content: I spend my life travelling for work and regularly stay at Hiltons, this one on Pitt st is a total pit! The rooms are tiny, the walls are so thin that I could hear the drawers opening and closing in the room next door and the bed is two hard single beds shoved together covered by a sheet. And the "stylish redesign"... it looks like an ikea catalogue vomitted in the room. All of the facilities and service are good but the rooms ruin the whole experience. Great gym, restaurant and bar are the highlights.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very stylish redesign with 'compact' rooms”
Reviews.Author: DiboTraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Sydney Hilton for a 3 day business trip after admiring its beautiful and bustling lobby and bars as I wandered through on past trips. The 25 meter lap pool in the hotel was also a big attraction for me. I got a discounted deal on expedia for a Executive King room which included access to the executive lounge on floor 36 for a no more to pay breakfast, afternoon tea and evening drinks and canapes. I took a train from Sydney airport which was a quick way to get to Town Hall station. If you follow the malls to the Galleries Shopping Center you can emerge right next to the hotel. As expected the hotel was very busy in the lobby so I went up to the executive lounge to check in. I was greeted by a courteous Hilton staffer called Anika who seemed to be running the lounge and training two staff members at the same time. This was the first hint that the competent Hilton staffers were perhaps being asked to stretch a bit thin for what I would learn was a fully booked hotel. I was checked in efficiently to a non smoking room that instantly hot me with the not too stale stench of cigar smoke veiled in room deodorizer. Back to Anika who was apologetic and managed after much advocacy with colleagues find me another similar room which only differed in that it was disabled accessible in the bathroom. The Executive King room has a range of pros and cons. The hotel rooms are in the upper half of a 43 floor tower. It was clear that the Hilton had been refurbished around an old businessman's hotel sized room; that is small. The king bed had 10 cm clearance from the desk chair as one sat down. A small glass desk looked cluttered and there were no other chairs in the room. This made one need to edge around the bed avoiding sharply designed furniture edges. The look of the room was modern and clean with white, chrome and glass details. There were a set of windows with a meter wide wall in between, set in a very thick external wall which meant you had to lean into the window alcove to catch a sight of the splendid city and peak of water views. The windows did have very good black out motorized blinds. The sound insulation in the rooms was poor, you could hear the next room's blinds being lowered and listen in to normal volume conversations in the corridor as people stood opposite your door. The hotel minibar was one of those horrible ones which have a trigger which bill you as soon as you remove a local beer and then think, no i really want a Hein... damn ! I cannot comment on the bathroom design except to say that people with disabilities still have a sense of aesthetics and designers need to get a bot more creative with shower chairs and rails. Having said that the access features were new and bright and did not remind me of a run down public spinal rehabilitation unit as some disabled bathrooms do. The lobby was very busy and had a great feel to it. A range of travelers, beautiful young sydney things and dodgy looking C.U.B.s (Cashed Up Bogans) moved around. The Glass Brasserie is worth a splurge for its food and fantastic floating light and glass design. Zeta bar is also a hot spot and has good cocktails. The Marble bar is some sort of 15 year old bakers lair with beautiful marble art works. The location of the Hilton cannot be beaten. Close to trains, right in the best shopping areas, walk to the Convention Centre and Darling Harbor and the Opera House. So if you are alone and want a compact stylish room in a hotel with a real buzz and great location consider the Hilton. If you are with partner of any size above 6 then consider the Sheraton on the Park, splurge at the Westin or head to Circular Quay area.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent - a truly great experience”
Reviews.Author: LizzyLeeton
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived to the moment we checked out was a tremendous experience. Staff are sensational, room was magnificent and while it is not budget accomodation, it was not that expensive. It is a great place for a special night or event.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent city centre hotel!”
Reviews.Author: silver_squirrel
Reviews.Content: An excellent city centre hotel fully deserving of its superior status. Using the Executive Lounge, we made full use of the extensive buffet breakfast, complimentary afternoon tea and early evening canapes and drinks from the bar. The staff being extremely professional and attentive at all times. I would highly recommend this hotel and would certainly use it again, should I return to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: eaglebob
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I was expecting a really small room, have stayed in much smaller rooms in other countries esp Asia- say Hong Kong also Rome etc. Was tempted to book a larger room but only stayed 1 night Sat so room size was not relevant.The room is modern, very clean. Thanks for fellow reviewers mentioning the mini bar & automatic charging. Stayed in normal room executive club,The Club is not as good as Langham Hong Kong, not open 24hrs & shortened hours over the weekend!! Little offered during the day only coffee, tea& a few biscuits. Hotel very central for tourists, business & shopping. Definitely stay again, rates very good if book 21days in advance for Sydney. I live in Sydney, have stayed at many hotels, Sofitel Wentworth the rooms are larger if size is important for standard room but not central- closer to harbour also Jameison rooms are bigger. Do not like staying Darling Harbour as hotels are not 5* only 4

Reviews.Title: “Booked a month in advance - room was unavailable!”
Reviews.Author: womgoos
Reviews.Content: I can't believe such a hotel chain can deliver such poor customer service. We had booked a suite room (valued at $750) on 24/10/09 to stay for one night on 21/11/09 for our first wedding anniversary and was shocked to receive a phone call from Hilton at 5pm on 21/11/09 that room had electrical issues and was unavailable for us. The only reason I can think of for the late notice was they conceded one customer was going to miss out due to the issues and we happened to be them as the hotel staff decided to check -in the other customers as they arrived to get maximum occupancy. Very disappointed and we are left without any accommodation on our first anniversary night as all the other hotels are all booked out at this late notice. We were looking forward to this night so much and this has been a very bad customer experience. The offer of 50% off to stay in a standard room just didn't sit well with us as that would still be $375 for a small room which would further add to the disappointment. No thanks for the non-memories, Hilton Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “A couple of shortcomings.”
Reviews.Author: reboi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great, in a fabulous location and is a pleasure to stay in. When we arrived and shown to our room it was wrongly configured - one large bed instead of twin singles. They didn't have another room so they offered to reconfigure that one which we agreed was fine. To compensate for this mistake we were given complimentary breakfast for the duration of our stay. (May have had something to do with the tradesmen working on that floor too (40th). I felt that the room, although beautifully appointed, was on the small side. Flat screen tv with the most annoying remote ever made. The bathroom very nice, yes it is glass but very opaque still allowing privacy. The automatic charge mini bar to be wary of, if you move something in the fridge it goes straight on the bill. Fortunately they will supply a small secondary fridge for your personal use, no charge. Good air con control, easy to adjust. block out blinds are 99.9% very easy to oversleep. Concierge service excellent. Thought $45 per night car park as a guest was pricey though. Room spotless, smoking and non-smoking rooms available, room service no problems. Magic button a great feature on the phone. Overall experience was enjoyable, I just don't know if it was "value" for money at $270 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel right in the city centre”
Reviews.Author: Cookiewatermelon
Reviews.Content: Location is the top reason why you should choose this hotel, close to everything. Room modern and huge, bathroom clean, bed comfortable, quiet room. The only complaint would be the rather slow room service, been waiting for almost 1 hour for the staff to arrive to change my room card. Testing my patience to the limit. So the magic service is not so magical afterall.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel..”
Reviews.Author: AdamKottler
Reviews.Content: Very large Hotel but Great staff and service, Would stay here again..

Reviews.Title: “Very poor service”
Reviews.Author: Mary_Jay247
Reviews.Content: Warning think twice before you book at this hotel. I booked the so called "Romance package" for my sister's wedding night as my gift to the bride & groom. It was supposed to include all the extras such as buffet breakfast, wine, chocolate dipped strawberries, late check out etc. . . I called several times prior to their stay to ensure all was in order as I wanted it to be a special night that was hassle free. I was told all was in order, however when they checked in they did not get any of the things listed on the romance package. They had to go back to reception on their wedding night to sort things out & to make sure they got what we paid for. Had we known they would not get these things, I would have booked just the room wich would have been cheaper. It was eventually sorted out however I expected more from a fancy hotel like "The Hilton"... Im very disappointed & would not stay or ever book this Hotel as a gift for family/friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing worse than any other Hiltons I've been”
Reviews.Author: hematoma
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights and just returned home. I was not able to rest in my room construction noise all the day! I called MAGIC! to hear that "Renovation! and will end next week!". When I moved to another room, I found the bathroom tap was out of order. Water did not stop. MAGIC! said that they cannot fix it till next week. What a terrible experience? I've been stayed at Hilton many times but the Sydney Hilton is the worst of all hotels in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney”
Reviews.Author: MichaelK13
Reviews.Content: great location, hotel gets crowded and noisy on the weekend

Reviews.Title: “Great location but parking nightmare”
Reviews.Author: hildaPerthWA
Reviews.Content: Hotel has great location for shopping and scenic tours. It's right in the centre of sydney, across the road from the Queen victoria Building, one of Sydney's iconic shopping areas. The rooms are good and the breakfast is excellent but parking is expensive. The entrance to the hotel is easily missed if you are driving. prices vary depending on time of year but an occassional bargain can be found, just keep checking the web sight. A five star hotel in a five star location.

Reviews.Title: “noisy rooms”
Reviews.Author: timetotravel66
Reviews.Content: we were booked in for 7 nights but moved after 3. Acoustics were terrible. we could hear the electric blinds being used from adjacent rooms. doors opening and closing. drunks in the hallway, probably returning to their rooms from the night club downstairs. it seems half of George Street use the lobby on a saturday night. The rooms were stylish but pokey. there was little room in the bathroom to unpack your toiletries bag - especially if there two in the room.

Reviews.Title: “The Staff is the Hotel's Best Asset”
Reviews.Author: Roxi7
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Sydney is one of the nicer Hilton properties. It is aesthetically pleasing with its modern European decor. In fact, the entire hotel has a more European than American feel, to me. Its location is ideal, as it is a close walk to the major tourist attractions . My favorite part of the hotel during my stay was the hotel staff. During my stay, I dealt with two different concierges, two different members of the front desk staff, three of the bellmen, and several of the Executive Lounge staff members. Each person went out of his/her way to assist me and make my stay enjoyable, and they were genuinely nice. The gym was a major plus. It is a gym that allows public membership, so it is shared with non-hotel guests. The gym's facilities were clean, the equipment was up-to-date, and the hours were convenient. I have no complaints about the hotel, other than some incredibly loud music on Saturday nights that I could hear on the 33rd floor (I stayed two Saturday nights and experienced this on both). When I called to complain, neither the hotel staff nor I could figure out its source, but we assumed it was coming from a club near the hotel. Overall, my stay was quite pleasant. I felt safe at this hotel, as well. I would definitely stay here on my next Sydney visit.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing couple of days!”
Reviews.Author: TheSneakyWaiter
Reviews.Content: After a long and trying contract, I decided to treat myself to a few days in Sydney, in a nice hotel, where I could relax and feel pampered for a while - and the Hilton did not disappoint! I checked in to find not only a bottle of sparkling wine for me to begin to relax with, but also a cheese platter which I was grateful for as I had arrived quite late and had not eaten. The bed was huge and very comfortable. On closer inspection the next day, I was amazed to find a huge bathtub with a TV facing it - and it was well used! I made an appointment for the 2 and a half hour 'Stress' treatment in the spa and recieved the BEST massage ever! The concierge was lovely - and managed to make a reservation for me at Glass Restaurant where the food was sensational and the service was excellent. I had a fantastic few days, and would not only recommend this hotel, I look forward to staying there again next time I am in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: ulladulla
Reviews.Content: Perfect Position for the shops Great service, MUST have the executive lounge KING SUITE huge 72mÂ² faultless for a little more The best pool and spa, steam rooms x 2 and sauna Great Value for money indeed

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location, Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BucsFanNVA
Reviews.Content: We arrived for a short trip to Sydney early in the morning and the hotel accomidated us by allowing us to check right into our room. After the 14 hour flight from the U.S. we both wanted showers and to change cloths. We reserved a King Relaxation Suite and that is what we got - A big beautiful room on the 42nd floor with great views of downtown Sydney. This was our first trip to Sydney and it was a great start. For our 4 nights the hotel took care of all of our needs and they have this nice little button on the phone called the "magic" button that you push and whatever you need they will take care of. Every time we saw an employee at the hotel we were greeted with a smile and a hello! On one of the days we went whale watching and I lost my wallet on the boat and didn't realize it until our return to the hotel. The hotel concierge went out of her way to help me retrieve it and made phone calls to the company that ran the tour, the dock and even the harbor operators (I got my wallet back including the $600 in cash and credit cards!). Our room had a great bathroom with a 2 person multi jet tub with bath salts that were replenished nightly, shower with multi showerheads and a 1/2 bath near the entrance to our suite. Every night we received turn down service and a little treat on the pillow! The furnishings were modern, neutral paint scheme and 3 TVs (including one next to the tub â€“ all flat screen HD TVs. Oh, the tub has a picture window you can look out of while you soak and enjoy the city views! The morning of our check out there was a slight error in the billing, but was taken care of with no questions! Also, the Glass restaurant provided us with a great meal on our last night â€“ the food was excellent! We ate in the executive lounge every morning for breakfast and found it to be superior to other executive lounges at this hotel chain. Thanks to the staff who made our short stay very enjoyable! On our next vacation to Sydney my first choice will be the Sydney Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “What you expect from a Hilton Brand”
Reviews.Author: spudgt2
Reviews.Content: I'm a member of the Executive Club and stayed here using points and money. The hotel is everything what you expect from a Hilton, service is very friendly, upgraded to a very nice room called the 'relaxation' room. It had a spa bath, open plan next to the bed and had a walk in shower room and was very well equipt! It has a fantastic gym although very busy as it is open to public but very well equipt too. The executive lounge is large and staff are friendly. I was surprised in Australia to see that the staff serve you the drinks and canopes and it isn't self service. Breakfast was amazing, very extensive althought the staff are too pushy with the 'Spot someone who gave you great service' cards! The location is great for shopping and sightseeing and is very near Town Hall station for ease in getting to airport.

Reviews.Title: “ok but not really impressed”
Reviews.Author: grumptomato
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights. Location is good. A man outside to take care of cars was very nice and helpful. He helped us a lot. Walked in the room, that was small but we knew it so we were just happy to be in a proper hotel...nice, modern and clean. But I went to the bathroom to wash my hands and noticed a plug of the basin was down and couldn't pull it up. It was basically out of order, broken. Why? I really wondered how they managed to clean and not notice that a plug didn't work. Talked to the reception, they sent someone straightaway to fix it up while we were out so that was ok though I was bit disappointed with Hilton missed something like that. Then at night, I was going to use a hair dryer but then the power outlet on the wall in the bathroom didn't work. Couldn't put a plug in. This gave me as a huge disappointment because this showed me that they don't really maintain the bathroom...I had to use the one which was in the mini bar to dry my hair, looking at the mirror in the bathroom. I couldn't be bothered to tell them but left feedback so they will know if they read it. You don't really want a repairman all the time in your hotel room, do you? Well, anyway we were still happy with the nice room. Unfortunately, the last night there was horrible. We had a very early morning flight next day, we were already sleeping at around 2 o'clock of course, some guys on the same floor were badly drunk and talking so loud and walking around on the hallway, their room door banging...woke us up. Eventually someone from the other room went out and told them to be quiet it seemed like, but that showed this Hilton's customers level and no hotel staff actually came up to take care of it. It might be hard to know unless someone calls the reception or something but I wasn't really impressed with this. I'm not sure if I recommend to my parents but I might say to my friends it's ok to stay here though you might find something better around there. Rate is for both a nice and clean room and all disappointments I had. Will say here I recommend just because we actually enjoyed our stay and I can't choose the one in between.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation Room - Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: UncleTung
Reviews.Content: I called in advance to check-in early at 1pm, they said if it's available then sure. I came at 1:30, there was a few people in line but i was a HHonor member so i skipped they line. I checked-in, quick and fast. They asked if my luggage would like to be brought up to my room but since i was already going there i said no thanks. Nice elevators but you have to scan your card to be able to get to your floor. My relaxation room was next to the service doorway so a bit of noise was heard throughout our stay but it was not a problem. The room was spacious for 2 and very nice and clean. The open washroom was nice, with the spa of course. I had ordered sparkling wine + chocolate strawberries + plate of fruits which was booked for 3pm. Since i can early, they had to make it and then send it up. Perfect timing of use dropping our stuff, and heading up to the Executive lounge with free drinks and small snacks and FREE internet. When we headed back down out order stuff was there. Perfect. The staff is friendly and nice. The MAGIC phone button was awesome. Anything you want to know just ask. Even in a non-smoking floor they brought me matches for a few candles i had. Good sleep, king bed was too big! Which is a good thing. The blinds open/closing needed to hold the button, not a simple press of a button. Cool showers with EVERY amenities you need! We got room service, not bad. We made a mess and when house keeping came in, she said no problem, dont worry. Late check-out was good at 1pm and they kept our luggage till the late evening with no charge. 24 hours of the relaxation room and executive lounge and the privilege of hilton with room-service dinner, $600 was not that bad. If your going to stay at hilton, don't be cheap. If want to play, play hard!

Reviews.Title: “Good service, good location. No much else needed.”
Reviews.Author: TzctlpcLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located bang in the middle of Sydney's business district, which means most guests are business people (and lots of airline crews, I identified at least different airlines personnel staying there). I can't fault the service received: front desk was fast and efficient, concierge was helpful and knowledgeable (they saved us hours by suggesting best routes to explore Sydney by foot) and polite, room cleaning people accommodating. My only minor complain on this regard would be that we could not get to extend our check out time by one hour, but that is hardly something serious. The room was very nice, clean and comfortable, albeit in the small side, if you smuggle a cat inside please don't swing the poor thing, it will bang his head in the walls in no time :-) The bathroom was quite modern, including a TV in the shower! (which was of no use since the speakers were out of the shower, so you could not hear what you were watching like showering :-/ ). The only major fault was the lack of proper night table in one side of the bed, where the hotel decided to put a flimsy and very small glass table. I used the ample window swill as an improvised night table, but this should not be necessary. Also very few hangers for your clothes. You have a good safebox and good ironing facilities. The Internet service cost in the room is extortionate, you should not use it, even if you can afford it, it is simply not fair and hotels charging so much should not be encouraged. There is free internet service in the vicinity (via well known burger joints) or much better priced in a nearby supermarket or well known coffee shop, so leave you business attire behind, enjoy a greasy burger or overpriced coffee and use the Internet at your heart's content elsewhere. Unfortunately the swimming pool was closed, so I can't say how good or bad it was. No arrangements were made for using a different one elsewhere, which is something I have seen in other hotels. The breakfast was very good, but the service was a bit complicated (getting an egg involved a somehow complicated procedure), the best feature being the fantastic view of the Victoria Building across the street (the whole wall is clear glass). The location can't be beaten. you are a block away from Hyde Park and the museums, 2 train stations (or short walk) away from the Circular Harbour for great views of both Sydney's Bridge and the Opera House (both can be reached walking) as well as access to ferries and tourist boats. China Town and Darling Harbour are a short walk away or you can catch the expensive Monorail, of which you have two stations just around the corner. You are in the middle of shopping paradise, take your time and you will find little by little all the great shops in the area, start across the street in the magnificent Victoria Building, even if you can't afford the top prices :-)

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are pokey and concierge down right rude”
Reviews.Author: Beresford_Bear
Reviews.Content: If you think that being looked in the eye and communicated with more than a grunt, then this is not the hotel for you. Sure, it's swish and new but the standard rooms are tiny and characterless.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Fowler4
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights during the Bledisloe Cup weekend and had a fantastic time. Great location for shopping, dining and transport. We where upgraded to the executive level when we checked in which was a lovely surprise. With the upgrade came free breakfasts - we travel alot and I can honestly say it is one of the best breakfasts we have had. The gym is very well equipped with lots of different classes that you can do - great spin classes. The rooms are lovely and modern, great beds, storage etc - if I have to have one gripe it is that the bathrooms are really small with a very tiny vanity.

Reviews.Title: “not a bad word to say”
Reviews.Author: Buddenz
Reviews.Content: Checked in early, no problems booked via wotif mystery 5* deal room was brilliant, blackout blinds were great, tv in shower was pretty cool. was nice and close to everything I would definitely stay here again on trips to sydney (if i could afford it!)

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hilton”
Reviews.Author: jellybean006
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during New Years 09 and several days after, but have just got around to writing this review given its worth the effort still! We thought the hotel was just great - not only for the brilliant location being just across from QVB and the various department stores, but the rooms were ultra modern, clean, quiet and comfortable. For the price we paid (booked through Expedia which offered a special at that time) it was fantastic value. We'll definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased with Sydney Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Chuck-in-SC
Reviews.Content: My 9 year old son and I stayed in the Sydney Hilton for a couple of nights, and we simply loved it! The price was excellent, the breakfast was fantastic, the room was very clean as was the entire hotel. The view from room 3921 was suprerb, and the staff were very friendly. I highly recommend staying here when in SYD.

Reviews.Title: “Dream proposal”
Reviews.Author: downtown5000
Reviews.Content: I rang before I got to the hotel and explained that I would be proposing to my now wife and that I was interested in a relaxation room and wanted to know what they could do to help me out, they were incredibly helpful and helped me pull off an amazing proposal. We checked in around 3 and just had the bags sent to the room I talked to the staff and let them know I was there and that I would like everything ready for our return at 5. I got a quick call from the super helpful concierge letting me know that he was collecting tulips I ordered and that the colours I ordered were not as bright as other tulips availalbe due to season, and asked me if I would be ok changing colour to improve the quality of the flower, or if I wanted to change to something else. I told him I would trust him. After a lovely walk around darling harbour we returned and the front desk gave me a thumbs up to let me know all was ready. We went up to the room, it was covered in rose petals, the bathmaster package I ordered meant the bath was freshly drawn with essential oils and more rose petals, Robbie Williams angels was playing, the lights were dimmed the large arangements of tulips were perfectly arranged. My now wife was blown away, I asked her to sit down and proposed, she said YES! We wanted to take some photos of the ring so my wife could send them on but had no film I rang and asked if they could get film they said yes, but why don't we just lend you a digital camera and then we will send the photos on for you. How helpful was that all at no cost. And I notice noone has talked up the baths enough I am over 6 foot tall and have ample room to lie (yes lie) in the roman style spa bath (relaxation rooms only)something I have never experienced before, something taller people will appreciate. We have since been back for anniversary's and shows and though the guest plus rooms are on the smaller side we still find them great. The service is what you are paying for though, it is always amazing, on top of the service we got on the proposal, on our first anniverssary when my wife was pregnant they immediatley had extra pillows sent up to our room and the waiters at glass also had pillows for her to rest on and ensured she was in a booth style seat so she was comfortable, they even went down to letting us know what meat was and wasn't likely to be ok for someone who is pregnant (rare cooked meat can be bad for an unborn baby). Last but not least location is fantastic, the best in Sydney I think, and unlike another reviewer I have never had trouble completely blocking out all light or had any trouble sleeping ever, I have had some of my best sleeps at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Where has the service gone”
Reviews.Author: tom_oz11
Reviews.Content: Having booked a suite in advance and at the time notifying the hotel that I would need to check in early and even provided my flight details when I arrived after a 9 hour flight I found my room wasn't ready. There is little to do in Sydney on a Sunday morning and when I returned every hour as asked I continued to find my room was not available. In the end I waited in the foyer for more then 4 hours. No apology was provided. The rooms are over priced and the service is below expectations. There are plenty of better hotels in Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Good location,great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: irishindependent
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sydney Hilton for four nights August 2009. Got great value with a "two nights for the price of one" offer as otherwise would not have considered this hotel. The offer included a fantastic buffet breakfast. Staff were pleasant and the atmosphere was relaxed (not always so in four star hotels). The room was not very big but then you only sleep there. The decor is typical of hotel chains but again this does not bother me. The location is excellent, walking distance of city attractions. Minibar prices exorbitant as usual - they would sell stuff if they were reasonable - don't know why they don't cop on to this or maybe people do make purchases?

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location.......”
Reviews.Author: John5259
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent in Brisbane, and during my career I have stayed in 226 hotels in 97 cities, in 37 countries. The majority of these hotels being 5 star, so I know my hotels. We only stayed the 1 night, and I realise that a hotel cannot really be fairly judged on just a 1 night stay. Check-in was friendly and efficient. It was 11.00am, and we still got our room straight away, which is always a bonus. We stayed in a King Hilton Deluxe on the 40th floor, which obviously had fantastic views, even though the windows were not that large. The room was clean, though quite small. The bathroom even smaller. The only meal we ate was breakfast at the Glass Brasserie, on the morning of our check-out. The only downside was that they advertise that they open at 7.00am, it was a Sunday, but they were not ready to let anyone in until ten minutes past seven. This may seem a bit petty on my behalf, except that we had a 9.00am flight to catch, so that 10 minutes was quite critical, having to scoff down our food at a quick pace. The breakfast buffet was typical "Hilton", and we certainly had no complaints. Check-out was easy, taking advantage of the "Express" check-out, that did not involve waiting at reception, just handing over the Express Check-out envelope that had been put under our door the night before. As per my title of this review, it's all about location. Situated right in the centre of the city, everything is within walking distance. Generally speaking, a fine hotel that probably meets its 5 star rating. I would recommend this to the tourist and business person alike.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you don't ask for the 'cheap' menu”
Reviews.Author: Tavare
Reviews.Content: I think the redevelopment of the Hilton has been very good. It has turned a dowdy, old beast into a very shiny and stylish hotel. While I live less than 10km from the hotel, my wife & I decided to stay one night mid-week because we had to attend a city function. The hotel itself is very pleasant, though I think because I got a good deal I got one of the more compact rooms. That was fair enough because the room was fine, but what wasn't fine was when we had lunch the following day at Hilton's much-vaunted Glass. I have eaten there before and thought the food and service was good, but then again I wasn't paying. On this occasion, it was my bill and the reason we chose Glass was because it had a special $45 for two courses plus a glass of wine menu option. When we arrived we were greeted pleasantly, sat down and presented with the full menu. An impressive menu but I then asked for the "special" menu and the mood changed noticeably. It was almost reluctantly brought out and the service almost disappeared at this point. We had to virtually stop the snooty waiter (very LA attitude) and ask for service. The food was OK, without being special, but the "selected glass of wine" was appalling. A Luke Mangan chardonnay (talking about keeping it in the family) was one of those terrible over-oaked yellow Hunter chardonnays that have destroyed the varietal. We barely drank it and, instead, ordered a bottle of wine from the impressive wine list, which was a good selection if (typical of hotels) rather overpriced. I still enjoyed the overall experience, but this "look down your nose" attitude to anyone who takes advantage of special packages offered by the hotel itself is unacceptable and very unappealing. It soured an otherwise good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel With Room For Improvement”
Reviews.Author: NoWorriesCalifornia
Reviews.Content: First family visit to OZ and selected Sydney Hilton for arrival (2 nights) and departure (2 nights) stays. Highlights. Positive: - Baggage Porters very friendly, efficient, and provided warm first impression welcome. - Morning check in reception well staffed, prepared, and helpful. - Nice rooms with excellent views and automated blinds. highly recommend Jr. suite (spacious with well appointed quality furnishing), Deluxe Room (feels like 1/3 size of Jr. Suite but comfortable). - Exec. Lounge facility and food/bev selections is comparable to Far eastern luxury hotel offerings. - Fine dining experience at the Glass brasserie restaurant. - Location is PERFECT...in prime shopping area walking distance to all need to visit Sydney experience sites. (Opera house, Darling Harbor, Paddy's Market, Botanical Gardens w/ singing cockatoos , Chinatown etc.) Room for Improvement: - Understaffed/poorly trained Night check in staff. (ie. Late check in at 11pm on departure leg, patiently waited in line to be assisted by only 1 available staff who allowed others to cut in line and requested connecting rooms was incorrectly assigned by the apparent fatigued and poorly trained short staff.) - Exec. Lounge reception staffs' poor understanding of HHonors Rules. (ie. denying entry for Gold/Platinum level members not staying in exec. rooms) - Lack of rooms available for upgrades. Fine Finish: Found the ear of the Manager on Duty, Mr. Alistair Tweedie, who apologized with asssurance that the necessary improvements will acted upon. Mr. Tweedie personnally greeted my family and provided complimentary dinner to remedy the inconvenience. Overall our experience at the hotel was just fine!

Reviews.Title: “Top Quality City Centre hotel”
Reviews.Author: PhyllisMH
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sydney Hilton for three nights at the end of our holiday to Australia and it was all that we thought it would be. We think it is the best Hilton we have stayed in. A pity that it is at the other end of the world for us though! We had a room on the 40th floor so great views out to the west and south. The rooms were well kitted out, if a little small (I know big city hotels seem to be always like this). We didn't spend a lot of time in the room anyway as we were out seeing Sydney. The breakfasts were of a pretty good quality and there was a lot of choice for all tastes and we tended to stuff ouselves and head out and walk it off around Sydney. The hotel also had a good bar which felt pretty modern and had a roof terrace on the fourth floor looking over Pitt Street. The location is also excellent. Opposite is an underground station (Town Hall) with direct links to the airport and within minutes is the main city centre shopping area. A 15 minute walk takes you to circular Quay where you can see the Harbour Bridge and Opera House and less than 10 minutes is Darling Harbour. For a good quality city centre hotel in a prime location this one takes some beating. Evern better that we got a 3 nights for the price of 2 deal on the net, presumably as we were there in low season. It is worth huntin around for this as only one or two sites were showing this deal.

Reviews.Title: “Now THIS is the way to run a Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: Global01
Reviews.Content: It's been a long time since I stayed in the Sydney Hilton. I have not stayed there since they underwent a sorely needed major refurbishment a number of years ago. The hotel looks great, but even more impressive is the incredible polish and precision of the staff and management of this property. This was a long stay for me - 24 nights after all of the extensions - and the quality persisted throughout. Since pretty much EVERYTHING worked as it should at this property I'm just going to go over some of the highlights; The check-in was great! I know, all they had to do was get you in the right room... but this was somehow a cut above. I was met the Hilton Honors Rep - she got me into the room I wanted without delay (at 6:30am!) and gave me a pleasant efficient run-down on everything I needed and nothing I didn't. She asked me a couple of questions about what I would like to do while in Sydney and handed me an envelope with "goodies". The goodies turned out to be truly useful! Not the usual touts and shills for touristic crap, rather there were drink coupons at high-end watering holes, a couple of film passes, and other useful items. She also quickly provided a great solution for internet access for the longer term. The bellman also had useful info on what was going on at the moment in the city. The concierge staff were truly superb - actually reminiscent of the concierge in 5 star European hotels. Each individual showed tremendous follow through and what I can only call pride at being affiliated with a very well run organization. My highest compliments must be reserved for the staff of the executive lounge. Those of us fortunate enough to be be able to utilize the lounges at various hotels around the world normally have very positive feelings towards the staff. The women (they were all women during my stay) who staffed the lounge at the Sydney Hilton were universally excellent. Throughout my stay they made me feel truly welcome every morning and evening that I visited the lounge. I also had a chance to observe how they dealt with all types of guests and if this isn't where Hilton does management training, it should. The location of this hotel was always great. Its right in the heart of everything - major department stores, theatre, cinema, food, drink, supermarkets are all within a few hundred meters. The room itself would be the only place for improvement in my estimation. The bed was excellent, modern flat panel lcd tv with plenty of choices, electronic controlled blackout shades are excellent. The only real issue was with the size of the bathroom. The shower stall and the vanity were on the small side. More on the slightly annoying side, certainly not a dealbreaker. I think I was in one of those "special" room categories that Hilton seems to be experimenting with lately. I had the opportunity to visit a different room type and both of the concerns were not an issue. Final note - There were a lot of deals offered on this property through various websites, but not on the Hilton site. I took the trouble to call the property directly and they matched the best deal I found. I only mention this because rooms book via discount sites don't accrue Honors points.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: M1azza
Reviews.Content: Cannot complain about anything here. Location great, just around the corner from darling harbour and easy 15 mins walk to circular quay. Room very nice, clean and nice little touches. Great service from staff. Good food on room service. Lovely reception area.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: RNOFlighty
Reviews.Content: Fourth stay at the Hilton and as usual excellent service and location, and a very comfortable room (although small). The Hilton is very well positioned within Sydney CBD, it is right next to the Town Hall train station and right next to a mono rail stop, as a consequence you can get anywhere you need to go quickly and easily. As others have indicated, the Hilton Breakfast in the Glass Restaurant is excellent, for those staying on the executive floors, you have a choice between eating in the lounge or in the restaurant. The health club is excellent and has a very nice lap pool, hot tub and a number of steam rooms and saunas.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic cosmopilitan loved it!”
Reviews.Author: dannyglennon
Reviews.Content: We managed to book the Hilton for 3 nights through Lastminute.com and got a really good deal. The reviews on tripadvisor were good but we really got lucky with this hotel.The only issue is location which is not perfect for tourists being on the other side of the central business district but walking round Sydney is hardly a chore! Front desk was busy with check ins but after a little confusion we were allocated our relaxation room on floor 28. The room was superb, stylishly appointed and in some hotels would be sold as a junior suite. The whirpool bath was a centrepiece and was a joy. The bed was very comfortable and my partner needed different pillows which were delivered within minutes. We had an upgrade so had use of the business lounge on floor 36 where snacks and drinks are provided free of charge. We went up there on the second evening but were told it was full (everyone tucking into the freebies!) However no problem as the more than obliging hostess gave us a voucher to have a drink in the swanky Marble Bar downstairs. The gesture was appreciated although the bar was a bit lively with the after work crowd on a friday evening. Breakfast was first class. Breads, pastries, fruit, juices, smoothies, bacon , sausages, pancakes, miso soup, you name it it was available. The staff at breakfast could not have been more helpful and friendly. Overall we found the Hilton Sydney to be a genuine 5 Star Hotel. It had a really good buzz/vibe about it. I think that is down to the well trained, highly motivated and friendly staff and have no hesitation in recommending this hotel

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: zalhazmi
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms good view very nice breakfast high speed internet clean rooms

Reviews.Title: “Modern and you can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: MrDBP
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a lot but not since it's refurbishment and I was impressed. It's now super modern and minimalist but still comfortable. Memorable touches include plasma screens in the shower(!) and futon style beds. The location - right on Pitt st just can't be beaten if if you want to be right in the city. Service was fine, it's a pretty busy place so there's no personal touch but that's fine by me.

Reviews.Title: “so-so”
Reviews.Author: chrisman48
Reviews.Content: This place's best asset is its location and its breakfast buffet. The room itself, even though on the executive floor, was very problematic -- from a broken ventilation system, to leaking water pipes, to a toilet that didn't work properly. They gave me a modest break off my bill, but what they really need do is regularly inspect and maintain their rooms, especially if they're to charge such high rates.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: Geebee2
Reviews.Content: After a recent harbour cruise in Sydney we spent one night at the Hilton. Booking well in advance, I got a great rate which made it all the sweeter. The room was just lovely - light, bright, modern, airy, nothing in-your-face, just a beautiful place to relax. The bed was comfortable in the extreme, as were - a big factor - the pillows. The location of the hotel is fantastic, being opposite the wonderful Queen Victoria centre containing some superb shops and also easy walking distance down to the Quay and the Opera House. The only disappointment came with the in-room tea and coffee making products. There was no fresh milk in the fridge and so you need to phone down for that. It took ages to arrive, and then it was simply a cup of milk, when I had asked for a jug, which made it very difficult to pour. The same thing happened the next morning - we received a glass of milk instead of a small jug, with the consequent spilling of milk onto the bench. Also, ad this really surprised me, the coffee was just simply those skinny sticks of Nescafe, not quite what I would have expected in a Hilton. Other than that, check-in and check-out were seamless and the hotel did not disappoint. A definite next time we're in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Superb - as long as you book the right room at the right price!”
Reviews.Author: sandluc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in late June and were thoroughly impressed by every aspect of our stay. We decided to stay here after contacting the hotel directly and being offered a fantastic rate. They were running a special offering rooms at half price and including a free breakfast. As per other reviews, the standard rooms here are very compact so we decided to stay in a relaxation room which would hopefully offer more space. We checked in early on a Saturday morning and our room wasn't ready as expected. When we did return at check in time we were greeted by a bottle of sparkling wine and a platter of choc dipped strawberries - what a great start! I had organised a separate fridge when we checked in (to overcome the annoying auto-charge mini bar fridge) and this was plugged in and cool when we arrived. Our room was 3826 and was next to a fire exit and a service room so was generally very quite. The only complaint I had of our whole stay was that some hallway noise did come into the room (I was glad we weren't on a busy floor). The room had a good sized bathroom with spa bath, jet shower and LCD tv. The whole room was very open-plan and was very clean and comfortable. The main area had a 42" plasma and very comfy king bed (proper one - not two singles). Our rate included access to the club lounge which was very pleasant and we enjoyed drinks, canapes and free internet access here. We didn't have breakfast here as the rate included it in the main restaurant Glass. As other reviewers have mentioned, this breakfast is amazing. The key points I enjoyed were proper espresso, juice bar, cooked food to order and the "bakery". It is simply the best buffet breakfast available and makes for a great start to the day. The cafe in the lobby of the hotel "Cino" makes great coffee and has some excellent snacks as well. We also had room service one night that was well above average. We found all of the staff exceptionly friendly (especially those in the club lounge) and there was always a lot going on in the hotel which made for a great atmosphere. The location I think is perfect for accessing all of the main highlights of Sydney - very central and right next to the train and monorail station. In summary, I would say if you can get a good rate, there is no better central hotel to stay at. Also, book the larger relaxation room over the standard or club ones as they are far more comfortable. It pays to ring (or email) around as I found there is pretty fierce competiton between the hotels at the moment. I have stayed at the Westin, Sheraton, Radisson, Marriot Harbour, Swissotel and Intercontinental in the CBD and this would rate as the best (at the half price rate). If you had to pay full price (over $500) then I would say the Sheraton or Swissotel is still a better option. I would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints - good all round”
Reviews.Author: mraL
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, well done. Modern, boutique styling. Comfortable, great gym, a home away from home. Would have liked a free movie channel, but really no complaints. Brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay on wedding day”
Reviews.Author: lipaustralia
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on our wedding night - she picked it and I booked it. Everything was superb from the booking to the quick check-out. All the staff were friendly and helpful. They even upgraded us to a luxury room without asking. The good: - huge room with all the creature comforts you could want - massive bath with viewing window over the city - champagne and chocolates waiting in our room - good breakfast - valet parking...very quick and easy - fast check-in (granted it was after midnight!) - late check-out (requested) The bad: - absolutely nothing I have been to Zeta Bar at the hotel separately and despite the drinks being pricey it is a great place to relax and enjoy. Also, friends have eaten at their restaurant 'glass' and spoke very highly of it too.

Reviews.Title: “One of Hilton's Better City Hotels”
Reviews.Author: Divehpu
Reviews.Content: This is a great Hilton property. The rooms are clean and modern. The location is within easy walking distance of the main tourist areas in Sydney. The staff is knowledgeable and helpful. The room rate offered excellent value for the type of accommodation offered. For those of you looking for great food this hotel has the Glass Brasserie restaurant, which is rated as one of the best in the city. It also has The Marble Bar, a long time Sydney landmark. An added benefit for those US travelers that arrive in Sydney in the early morning is that upon arrival at the hotel we were offered keys to the health club where we were able to shower and change after the long flight.

Reviews.Title: “What an excellent bargain and very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tas-wanderer
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed in Sydney for two nights- got an excellent deal on Wotif which included breakfast for 2 on both days. Our room was on the 30th floor with good views from the windows- admittedly we looked into a large office block but as can be seen from the night time photos it was still very pleasant. Check in was very speedy and the staff were most amenable and helpful. The room was not enormous but most adequate- very nice bathroom with bath and shower, good toiletries (as always with the Hilton), in room safe, the beds were really singles(not king singles in size) but were comfortable. The windows had blinds which were operated using switches beside the bed closest to the window as well as having sliding screens which covered the windows to reduce sunlight or to give privacy. All very nice and tasteful. There was also a very comfortable sofa as well as glass desk, leather chair and all the normal things one expects from the Hilton. Decided to eat in one night and the meal was delivered on a dining table, which had collapsible sides (which could be brought up to make the table round). The food was stored in a small warming oven under the table- food was excellent, service also- well done!!!. Breakfast was excellent- very good selection and if you could not see what you wanted you could ask the chefs - the staff in the Brasserie were unobtrusive but when you needed them they were not far away- cappuccinos were excellent! The Breakfasts were so much better due to Wotif deal as I believe breakfasts are not cheap! The location in George Street, Sydney so close to the main shopping centre was fantastic and made our trips to the many shops such as Queen Victoria Building, David Jones, Myer etc made our time in Sydney very enjoyable especially as the weather was overcast and drizzly but that did not stop us at all. Check out was excellent also, used the quick check out system and it worked wonderfully. So well done Hilton you provided very good accommodation, great location and excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Big business hotel - loved the executive lounge”
Reviews.Author: Northerntraveller73
Reviews.Content: Very big hotel with lot of conference people. Easy access with train or monorail. Hotel is quite expensive one, but if you get access to exec. lounge it pays back. At the lounge great breakfast, coffee service during daytime and canapees at evenings. Many airline-crews sleep there...

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: gbodis
Reviews.Content: - Superb service as you would expect from a hotel of this kind - Average room size, noisy a bit - Perfect location, just in the centre - Disliked: in-room dining (poor quality & taste); expensive parking - Liked: great customer service

Reviews.Title: “amazing!”
Reviews.Author: suchitakapoor15
Reviews.Content: it is a beautiful city..amazing hotel..

Reviews.Title: “I refuse big chain hotels”
Reviews.Author: MRonsonMark
Reviews.Content: They are so boring its ridiculous.. My friend Julie, from Belgium she lives in AU so many years ago, she almost an aussie, and she booked me in this hotel, it was good, the pillows were awesome and so was the breakfast but what ever happened to creativity

Reviews.Title: “Love the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: podgirl2
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hilton Sydney previously a couple of years back and had the pleasure of another overnight (only) stay in May when passing through. I just love the location, right in central CBD Sydney close to monorail and a minute walk to the Pitt st Mall. The rooms are modern, bed to die for (love firm beds ) with beautiful, fresh white linen, plasma TV. The bathrooms have been renovated since I was there last and I can honestly say that it had the best shower I have ever showered in, in my life. Fittings were beautiful and there is a TV screen in the shower no less!!! Awesome listening to Channel V Max while showering at 4.00am (early flight). I booked on the net and got a 'basic' room at $220.00 per night which to my mind was great value for central Sydney. I want to go back ASAP!

Reviews.Title: “solid business hotel”
Reviews.Author: MiniMarshmallow
Reviews.Content: There's absolutely nothing wrong with this place, it's a good hotel in a great location if your office is in the CBD or darling harbour. Amenities are great, breakfast, gym and 25m swimming pool make it a solid hotel. The rooms are small, but nice and modern (make sure you ask for an renovated room, there are still some old ones which aren't great). I would say if you're looking for a nice weekend away, this place might be a little sterile, but still okay... it's definitely a business hotel The only drawback is that after spending week after week at this place, no one remembers my name?!?!?!? But I haven't experienced too many hotels in Australia that do...

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, small bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Ozzieflyer
Reviews.Content: We booked a Romantic Package through the hotel's website which included valet parking, breakfast, champagne and chocolate-dipped strawberries, and VIP access to Zeta Bar. Valet parking was very efficient - both on arrival and departure. We were made to feel welcome right from our arrival. Our room (3520) was neat and clean, however, given the package was sold as a "romantic" one, the size of the bath is barely enough to fit one average person. As others have written in previous reviews, beware of the fridge. We're reluctant to pay over the top prices for drinks, and given Woolworths is a 2 minute walk away, it's not the sort of thing we would need the use of. The electronic system in the fridge is designed to keep people honest, however, it is rather embarrassing when you check out and have to explain to the reception staff that you've accidently taken things out of the fridge to make way for your own goods, not realising that you can't put those things back. To be fair, the staff at reception were very understanding, and in fact, said they get that a lot. Makes you wonder if they made a mistake installing this whizz-bang system. Bed size was good, the blinds keep a lot of light out of the room - nice when you want to sleep in. My last (and first) visit to the Zeta Bar was a really cool experience. Unfortunately, the same can't be said for this visit. Even though we had VIP passes, we were still treated the same as someone who'd walked off the street. The "VIP" therefore means, "Free Entry before 9pm". Within half an hour of our arrival, the place was full, and there was nowhere to sit unless you had the foresight to reserve a private booth. The smoking balcony was full of people, so if you're a smoker, you had to get really personal with other patrons to stand outside to smoke. The other gripe we had was the quality / dress code of those being permitted entry - the place very quickly felt like just another Sydney bar. One of the biggest disappointments was the noise - what seemed like stiletto's on tiles from about 0500 onwards. We could not determine where this noise was coming from, nor why it went on and on and on for hours. As it was the day we were to leave, we could hardly ask for another room, and without being able to determine without doubt where the noise was coming from (we suspect from the floor above), we couldn't do anything about it. Shame that we had a wonderful king-size bed, a very dark room, but were not able to sleep in due to this noise. Breakfast at Glass Restaurant was enjoyable, with very friendly staff assisting guests - just what you want the morning after the night before! Check-out was friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “a pretty good stay at the hiltons with some small exceptions”
Reviews.Author: Sydney_Aussie21
Reviews.Content: hi all, heres a quick review about our stay and hotel. Location: The best I'd say when it comes to sydney city cbd, personally i think its right in the heart of the cbd. you can go anywhere and its within walking distance from the hotel which is good. we paid for our hotel through a website (can't remember but they send me specials) and it was $165 for a room, upgraded (all it was was a higher floor .. ), 2 for 1 breakfast which is ok but then when you add the price of parking, then yeah it adds up. We arrived via car and when you park downstairs, it costs $35 so yeah! Valvet parking is $40 and it wasn't included in our initial price, so its already jumped up ot $200 now.. Foyer is ok although we took a while to be served. Upon checkin we tried to ask for an upgrade (free of course) but i think on our upgraded package, we just went to a higher floor. Got to our room and it was not bad.. Overall it was good. Main Pro: Liked the shutters that close the windows, pitch darkness! we came back from breakfast and closed it and feel asleep hard even though we were supposed to only have a nap coz it feels like its nightime and we nearly missed our checkout lol Main Con: Watch out of the fridge because they have sensors which when you take out a drink, then they charge you automatically.. if you want another fridge to put your own drinks and stuff, you have to request it, which was free anyway but just the hassle of getting another fridge coz the one they give you has sensors so yeah. i've never seen that from a hotel before so yeah Breakfast: well in our package it was 2 for 1 so we paid an extra $21 for the breakfast. Overall the brekfast is pretty good so that was alright. Overall on the room and price, it was good though wish the total price overall would have been less than A$200 but oh wells. [i'll add pictures soon]

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms!”
Reviews.Author: BradMumbai
Reviews.Content: Great, comfy rooms and views across Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but no, I will not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: karin stockholm
Reviews.Content: I stayed in an ordinary room with upgrade access to executive lounge. The room was cool, minimalistic and not very convenient. The integrated bathroom/ toilet have glass walls so it is all lit up if someone goes to the bathroom during the night. The sliding door to the bathroom makes a terrible noice when you close them and you just cant do it quietly. The vanity area around the sink is also very small and it is all together very strange layout. Disliked: That in all the eleveators the buttons to press for your floor was at a new position so from the moment you had slided your card through for acess and before you found your floor someone else might have pressed before you and you headed off in a another direction ï�Š The service from the executive lounge was very uneven. One of the ladies was one of the most helpful and cheerful staff I have met while others bragged in front of each other how they had lectured guests that have not noticed the sign â€œwait to be seatedâ€� and dragged them back behind the â€œqueuing lineâ€� sign. They also made fun of previous guests which is human but should be done in the galley and not so other guests could overhear their conversations. One out of three computers and the printer were out of order the whole week I stayed there. The fitness club was well equipment but avoid peak hours as it is mainly a club open to public with access for Hilton guests. The over all atmosphere was a bit too laid back for my taste and it goes for everything from that the luggage would take " at least 25-30 minutes to be delivered to the room " upon arrival to parts of the order in the Glass brassiere was forgotten ( food ok but not so fantastic as you can think when reading tourist information) . The ending of my stay was also a bit stressful as I was escorted to the taxi , the door was opened for me and I sat down and my luggage was stowed in the trunk of the taxi- or I tought it was. A glitch between the driver and concierge and I found one bag missing when I arrived to Sydney airport. Luckily I had time to have it sent in another taxi from the hotel ( I paid it- no excuse from the hotel) and I learned a lesson â€“ always stay and check that all your pieces of luggage are loaded despite you have porter service.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, very inconsistent attitude to Honors members”
Reviews.Author: farawaymum
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 3 times in the past few months due to the central location of the hotel, and have come across some really inexperienced staff who don't seem to be well trained or professional, particularly in relation to the Hilton Honors system. There is a great Honors Lounge but the staff who work at the desk seem very inexperienced and confused about the benefits for members (upgrades,newspapers etc). As a diamond tier member I have received a wonderful upgrade on one occasion , but for other visits had to argue and debate with the check in clerk to get the standard benefits.In summary, I don't find them welcoming at all. The standard king rooms are very small and compact but nicely appointed and comfortable.I would not book a standard room unless travelling alone, not even for 1 night. The furniture arrangement in these rooms does not allow you to watch television from the lounge - only from the bed.The restaurant breakfast is excellent but can get very busy with long lines. If you have access to the Honors lounge the breakfast has less choice than the restaurant but is still very nice.The lounge also has computers for free internet access. There are great urban views - of lots of other high rise buildings and the location is right in the heart of Sydney's CBD, and an easy walk to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but the bed was below par.”
Reviews.Author: Freewheelan
Reviews.Content: I booked a room online and requested a king bed. For some reason I was given a room with two small single beds. I was running late for an important business dinner so I didn't have time to change rooms. No big deal I thought but I found the single bed difficult to sleep in. The bed was just too small for an adult and nowhere near as comfortable as the beds at the Four Seasons at the Rocks, where they actually give you what you ask for. Apart from that it's a great location, it's very clean and the staff generally were very good. I would stay here again but I would make sure when I checked in that I was getting a decent sized bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Indiantraveljunkie
Reviews.Content: It was a gr8 experience staying at the hotel. The location of the hotel is a plus point. Though it seems more like a business hotel.. we had a nice stay for our honeymoon. The stay was as we expect from a Hilton service.... excellent

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: triss84
Reviews.Content: We had a travelzoo package stayed at the Hilton for 1 night with 2-1 full buffet breakfast and late check out at 1pm. Staff at Reception were professional and friendly, got a room on 32nd floor. Loved the blind in the room, total darkness which was great for me. The room was a bit too glassy for me. Everything was glass, I guess it was their theme. Room was very clean with modern furnitures, thought the bathroom sink was a bit too cramp/small. We also ordered dessert through In Room dining and it was a bit pricey cost us $39.50 please see pic. The passionfruit souffle was nice but the chocolate cake fudge was not worth $14 At the Glass Brasserie they had an excellent juice bar where the chef makes you fresh juices and shots of beetroot or something else as well. IMO very healthy bfast choices available put aside the bacon and hash browns, but found it it way too expensive, $42 for full buffet breakfast... Overall, very good stay, friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: perthpom
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hilton Sydney for 4 nights and had a fabulous time! Check in was efficient, and our rooms, although small, were well furnished and modern. The best thing about the rooms though, in my opinion, is the brilliant 'blackout blinds'! Such a good nights sleep! The only thing I would mention is that maybe guests should be told about them, as it's not obvious and we only found them by accident. Livingwell health club was great too, never too busy, with a big jacuzzi, swimming pool, and several saunas/spa, great for chilling out before we hit the town! Had a few drinks in the Zeta bar. The cocktails cost around $20 each, this bar has a great atmosphere, and definately worth a visit. All in all, a great stay, will certainly be back!

Reviews.Title: “Comfotable but very Impersonal”
Reviews.Author: Barbarasnell
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a brilliant location right in the middle of George Street so everywhere is easily reached on foot and for the suburbs all the stations are nearby. The rooms are lovely, very spacious and comfortable and everywhere is kept immaculately clean. The staff at check in are helpful but that is where all human contact ends. There is no interaction or any sign of interst in you after that. Questions are answered politely but it felt very much a business hotel, it was a great shame as it does not reflects Australia's normal friendliness and warm welcoming approach to their visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Business Ethic”
Reviews.Author: DTNPROMAN
Reviews.Content: I knew I would be arriving to Sydney early in the morning, and after a very long flight, I knew I would want to get to my hotel and get some rest. I booked a room for the night BEFORE my early AM arrival, to guarantee that a room would be ready for me. I even called the hotel directly to verify that by booking the room the night before my arrival in the early AM the next day, I would have a room. All was confirmed. On my arrival, guess what? I was told they had 100% occupancy the night before and so had given my room away and did not have a room ready for me. I was left standing in the lobby. As a Diamond VIP, I was told that breakfast was free. On my final bill, I was charged for breakfast, and had to get it removed. I went to use the health club, which I was told would be complimentary with my stay. I found it very crowded with "members" and was questioned about my presence there since I was not a "member." The room at this hotel, was decorated nice enough, however, the large mirrors on the walls had not been cleaned for some time, the carpet in the room was dirty. I expected better. I am giving this hotel an average rating, however, compared to the Hilton in Bangkok that I had just came from the night before, which was fabulous, I probably should rate this Sydney hotel less than average in comparison. I told the manager that I thought it was "Bad Business" not to honor the reservation I had confirmed. The staff at this hotel could certainly learn from the fantastic staff at the Hilton in Bangkok. Daylight and Dark difference...

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel in the heart of Sydney.”
Reviews.Author: dmc37
Reviews.Content: I had some Hilton hotel points we used to stay at this hotel. We were upgraded to a corner junior suite upon check in. It's a very elegant hotel. We had a little trouble finding the driveway entrance to the hotel and downtown Sydney has a lot of one way streets. The room was really nice. Being at the corner meant we had two walls of windows with good views. The room had a large bed, a study table with internet hook ups (for a fee),a sofa living room area and two bathrooms (1 full, 1 half). The hotel is close to shopping with Queen Victoria Center across the street and taxis are always accessible. I recommend taxis if your trips will be only be around Sydney. No need to pay for parking. Just pay for airport shuttle. The lobby area can get a little busy. The gym and indoor pool with sauna were great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, terrible service”
Reviews.Author: cattynet
Reviews.Content: The Hilton on George Street Sydney is in the perfect location. Right above the shopping and a stone's throw from Darling Harbour, and 10 mins from Circular Quay.. the rooms are nice and the built in tv in the shower was amazing :) The service however left something to be desired. There were so many things that was wrong with the service, I can't even list them here, but that is my only and biggest complaint. Enough that I probably wouldnt stay there again, despite it's location.

Reviews.Title: “Supurb Hotel in Central Sydney”
Reviews.Author: roundtheworld4me
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night in March 2009. Overall the hotel is great - very modern rooms with lots of amenities. The rooms have many things that i have not seen at other hotels before - i.e. electric window blinds, do not disturb and make up room lights on the outside of the door (buttons are near the inside of the door), modern IP phones. The service that I experienced in the hotel was great. I ordered room service for Dinner and it arrived very promptly. I also order breakfast for 7:30 and it arrived at about 7:28am - which was impressive for such a large hotel. Can't really say too much else since I checked in around Dinner time and checked out the next day after breakfast to go to a meeting down the road. I will say this however - I would definitely stay here again as it is in a really good location to explore central Sydney and the Hotel is top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Great overall”
Reviews.Author: OzEnigma
Reviews.Content: The rooms are not huge, but the size is perfectly adequate. There are nice little touches throughout. It was a great stay overall. There are better views in similarly priced hotels further north near the harbour, but I like the design and location here too. The design of the public areas is cool. The Zeta Bar has a Manhattan feel (where I live) during the week when it has a glamrous lounge feel. It becomes a nightclub on Saturday nights - a dressy young crowd and uninspiring house music. The breakfast at Glass is one of the best I've experienced. The variety of offerings is vast, delicious and thoughtful.

Reviews.Title: “okay hotel for business”
Reviews.Author: KT785
Reviews.Content: I stayed 1 night 17 March using free Hilton Honors points redemption. I got a rooom just beside the lift shafts as no other room was available when I checked in at 11am (the normal check in is at 3pm), so it was constantly noisy - never heard the rumbling of lifts this close and this long ever before - I first thought it was traffic, despite being on the 28th floor! Thankfully, they shut the lifts nearest to the rooms midnight to 7am, but you will wake up at 7 am! Make sure you stay away from the lift shafts!!! The gym downstairs is great, though.

Reviews.Title: “A pretty disastrous experience”
Reviews.Author: HilaryLondonUK
Reviews.Content: We were checked into a relaxation room which is in theory one of their best room types. These rooms are fairly large but very open plan with a sitting area, bedroom and the bathroom all in one big room. The bathroom is supposed to be separable from the main room by a huge glass screen. When we checked into our room we found that the screen had been broken off so there was nothing to separate our bath from our room - meaning when you sat in bed you were staring at the bath. When I rang to complain the staff member denied that there was supposed to be a glass partition and insisted that the room was supposed to be like that. It was only after lengthy pushing that I spoke to a manager who admitted immediately that the room we were in was faulty. If thats the case why did they sell us it - greed I guess. We were then told that they had no other rooms that night and we would have to wait until the following day to move. The following day every time we phoned us they promised that the room would be ready in 10 minutes. It eventually took an hour and a half. Thus 2 of our 3 day stay in this hotel were messed up. Once we were in the room was OK. A good comfy bed, nice spa bath but the rest of the furniture was just weird. The worlds most uncomfortable sofa. A weird leather swivel chair. Location-wise the hotel is OK - 2 mins from the park, Darling Harbour and the shops but in my view there are better hotels at better prices in Sydney. The hotels only upside was a truely fantastic gym and pool. Proper upscale gym. Final straw was check out. We had access to the exec lounge but it just wasn't properly staffed. After breakfast when the reception was busy all but one of the staff were hidden in the kitchen clearing breakfast. Not a favourite we would not go back

Reviews.Title: “A Modern Hilton in a good Location”
Reviews.Author: Marlboro_7
Reviews.Content: This Hilton has been refurbished from top to bottom. The public areas are very nice and certainly merits the 5* rating. I actually stayed twice at this hotel on my visit to Australia. The first time for 5 nights where we were upgraded to Executive Room due to my Diamond HHonors membership. Then we returned for a final night stay before flying back to the UK. I must add that I thought the Executive floor rooms were quite small. Don't get me wrong it was furnished nicely, and we had no problems, but both my partner and I commented that it was a little on the small side. On our second stay at the Sydney Hilton we got upgraded to a King Suite and its probably the largest room that I'll ever stay in.
