It had a seperate hallway with attached bathroom, a massive living room complete with dining table, a bar area, massive spa bath, huge shower and a bed which was fantastically comfortable and there were large plasma TVs in every room.. All staff were very attentive throughout our stay, and no request seemed to be a problem. The Zeta Bar is great for pre/post dinner drinks, and has some wonderful cocktails! I would return to this hotel, and thoroughly enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: buckhursthillboy2
Reviews.Content: Exellent hotel. Centrally located and very pleasant/helpful staff. Breakfast is very expensive, but well worth it. Swimming pool was fantastic and the bedroom very bright with an outstanding view. Recommended,

Reviews.Title: “Very average”
Reviews.Author: physioT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night. We are Sydneysiders so know the area well. We parked at the hotel ($39 overnight), and checked in without any dramas. However, once we exited the lift on the 23rd floor, we encountered a really funky smell (smelt kind of mouldy) that extended well into our room. We had a standard room which was small but adequate. The king size bed was really two singles put together which we were not impressed about. The bathroom had been refurbished but not to great quality. I was a bit disappointed as I expected more from a brand like the Hilton. We had dinner at the Glass Restaurant. Our meal was superb. The only annoyance was that we were seated really close to other diners ie. tables of 2 were parallel to each other so we had diners to the left and right of us ? half a meter apart. So, if privacy is what you want., book ahead and request a better table than what we got. Overall, we had a good night out, emjoyed our meal and had a reasonable night sleep. However, I will not be returning to the Hilton for a standard room. Perhaps, we will pay more for a better suite, or try a different hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: le_nomade
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property using hotel points for 2 nights after a transpacific to Australia. On arrival around 11 am our room was not yet ready but they informed us we could use the gym to clean and change. The gym was very clean and modern with good shower facilities. They also informed us that we were given a room upgrade (it was on the top floor, but was the same as a room I had last time, so I'm not sure what the upgrade was). Room was very modern with glass walls separating the bathroom. We got the breakfast in the Glass bar - very nice breakfast with lots of options. The gym is well equipped with free-weights, cardio machines and a variety of strength training machines. Also has group fitness classes.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: nicocut17
Reviews.Content: The hilton was a great hotel. It's located in the Central Business District (CBD) and is about a 10 minute walk to Darling harbor, probably 20 down to circular quay, but I bused that! It's what you would expect from the Hilton. Nice clean, modern rooms. Nothing spectacular, but will please. Food was good. We ordered both breakfast and dinner once. It's huge, lots of rooms so if you're looking for something smaller and more intimate try something else. If you're staying for business, you can't beat the location. I'm from a city where all you do is mass transit and walk so 10-40 minute walks on nice days don't bother me!

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: lee168
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 5 nights during christmast, really loved this place, the location is second to none, really strategic. Loved the aquavision in the bathroom , and really recommend to anyone to eat in the glass braserrie, great restaurant, however very pricey, cost AU $ 200 dollar for two person. However this hotel is lacking in small details, such as toothbrush is not provided in my room, and the room services is a bit slow ( room for improvement here ). Would definitly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “gotta love the gym”
Reviews.Author: howhardwasthis
Reviews.Content: Other reviews have covered the room, the food etc. I want to add that the hilton has the best health club I have come across on my business trips. The latest in exercise machines, good selection of free weights and best of all, access to group fitness classes. This alone makes this hotel worth a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Hilton”
Reviews.Author: mobogo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this newly refurbished hotel for only 1 night as we had a function to attend in one of the many meeting/ball rooms on the property. The hotel itself is a well established hotel in the heart of Sydney and walking distance from any part of the central city area. The main entrance is from Pitt Street, and as we drove there we used the parking garage below. $30 for overnight. Reception is fairly small but open and does have a kiosk but on our check-in the staff were very slow. 15 minutes standing there. We were located on the 42nd floor, standard room. This was very clean and new, good bathroom and shower with separate bath. Toiletries were 1st class. Room was a little on the small side, but good bed and flat TV (with bad reception). Overall a good but not great comfortable hotel. It also has the famous (in Sydney anyway) Marble Bar which is most impressive in it's art decadence and the Zeta Bar which is one of the most popular nightclubs in town, although staying at the hotel doesn't give you any advantage over the queue that streaches the length of the property. Breakfast is the usual buffet affair which is quite nice but expensive. Oh, and the function and the room it was in was great, including the food and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “5th visit and will return for a 6th”
Reviews.Author: steveofcanberra
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hilton in Sydney many times while visiting family in Sydney and will return many times again. I continue to return for 3 reasons. 1. This place has the BEST breakfast you can imagine. They have EVERYTHING! Ive stayed at many 5 star hotels and nothing has come close to the selection and outstanding service you receive. (make sure you get breakfast included in your booking) 2. The rooms. Although sometimes perhaps small, they are extremely clean & comfortable. Nice plasma TV screens, really confortable beds and funky modern bathrooms. Those who complained about the bathrooms in other reviews should gain some appreciation for modern living. 3. Service. Overall service is outstanding, including the "magic" button in the room and helpfullness of reception and the friendly staff at the front door. I have nothing but good things to say about this hotel. Absolutly fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: Spinner8
Reviews.Content: Readers may wish to know that I am a diamond card holder with the Hilton group (which gives me upgrades). Furthermore my wife and I are fairly well travelled and neither of us will see 50 years old again. This hotel is more of a businessperson's resting place than a traveller's. The bedrooms are small and any more than 1 suitcase becomes a problem in terms of hanging space and space in the room for case storage. The bathroom is , for me, bizarre : built of frosted glass it affords no privacy or discretion, but the shower cubicle is great. Sound insulation to the outside of the bedroom is not brilliant , and you will hear doors slam. The hotel is well located in one of the main city centre roads and is close to most things. The outstanding Victoria shopping centre is immediately opposite, Darling Harbour is a 10 minute walk and Circular Quay,the Botanical Gardens and the Opera house about a 20 minute walk. The hotel has a really good, large gym and spa with regular classes for men and women, including a dedicated spinning room. The breakfast room is good with a reasonably good variety of food. Zeta's bar is a magnet for the young , and Saturday night is quite simply a parade of beautiful girls in refined clothing waiting to pay AUS 40 just to get in. The Executive Club room is ok, but gets very crowded at happy hour time and the food variety is boring. The general service level is high (but not in a Hong Kong way) and the Concierge desk is well managed. Would I stay there again? Difficult to beat the location, but I would want more bedoom space and a discreet loo !!

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Sydney Hilton”
Reviews.Author: 40ish
Reviews.Content: Great location, clean, quiet and prompt check in and check out. Looked after us very well

Reviews.Title: “Executively Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Jessejones
Reviews.Content: My Partner and I spent 3 days 2 night at the Executive Suite. It was Fantastic. At first I was a bit worry after reading so many bad reviews. But they were all wrong. The Executive Suite we stayed in was magnificent. The staff at the front counter and the concierge were very friendly and was willing to have out luggage checked in first before the check in time at 3pm. When we arrived into out suite, we found our luggage nice placed in the room. It was spacious and gorgeous. The bed was so comfortable and the pillow was as soft as the cloud. We had full access to the Executive Lounge and the service was even better.

Reviews.Title: “great business hotel”
Reviews.Author: fobmark
Reviews.Content: If you are trying to mix biz trip with tours, this is the hotel for you. A room was quite small but acceptable. Try to book a room with an executive lounge pass. Go get free drinks between 6-8:30 if you happen to be staying at the Hilton on Thursday and Friday. I was happy with my bar experience there as I was too tired to drag my feet to go to a bar outside of hotel. Would definately stay here again for biz trip. But for honeymooners, I recommend Park Hyatt and for family trips, try hotels at Darling Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “great stay Morehu n.z.”
Reviews.Author: morehu
Reviews.Content: we had a great stay here at the Hilton, check in smooth although reception forgot to give free vouchers for Marble Bar ,loved the magic button on the phone to ask questions about anything you needed friendly service from the staff loved the Hilton breakfast although toast and doughnut selection too far away from the rest of the other breakfast foods. The fridge is connected to reception so as soon as you lift a drink it is charged to your account.Also I found the reception desk staff had unbecoming uniforms both in colour and design quite morbid .

Reviews.Title: “Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: T-A-UK
Reviews.Content: A group of four of us stayed at the Hilton in Sydney in early November. The rooms while small (which wasn't a problem as we were never in our room) were nicely furnished and the bed was very comfortable. The only odd thing was the light switches which were hidden away. The bathroom was very small and had a odd layout, shower and a tiny bath, they would have been better off getting rid of the bath and just having a shower. Our room included breakfast which I would have to say is probably the best breakfast spread I have ever seen. In a large room there is everything from freshly squeezed juice, egg bar and then a large display of breads and pastries. The room was large and will lit and the staff were excellent. The only downside is entering the hotel later in the evening. There are two night clubs in the hotel and as the main doors are locked at night you need to walk through the night club crowds to enter the hotel. Which is not what you would expect from a hotel of this callibre. The check in staff were lovely, but the rest were pretty distracted. We got the impression they were there to hang out rather than to work. We were very surprised when we were told that not only had they lost one of the keys to our car but that they had lost our car as well! Luckily they found them eventually but once again not what you would expect. This was followed up by being told that they had lost two of our bags and could we please describe them. Turns out when they went back and had a closer look they found the bags. Overall it was a nice hotel, I am glad that we got a good price and the breakfast was amazing. However if it was a choice between staying here or spending the same money at the Radisson I would probably stay at the Radisson.

Reviews.Title: “Heart of the City.”
Reviews.Author: Ellemay
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days whilst hubby was running a conference. Being H/ H members we were placed on the executive level 36th floor where the Executive Lounge is also located. The EL is excellent with complimentary evening drink and canapÃ©s and free breakfast served daily. Location : The hotel is located across the road from the stunning Queen Victoria Building which leads to Town Hall Station. Itâ€™s also just a quick 3 minute walk up to David Jones Department Store and Pitt Street Mall. A perfect location for the ladies who wish to do some serious shopping. For getting around Sydney the Town Hall Station is just 2 minutes away connecting through the QVB, the train connects to Circular Quay and all other major lines in Sydney. Room : Our room was on the small size typical of all Hilton Hotels we have stayed at. However, the rooms are stylish and modern with great city views. The bathrooms again small but extremely compact and modern. A mini bar / plasma TV / CD player / coffee and tea facilities. Restaurants : The Glass brasserie is Hiltonâ€™s signature restaurant which offers fabulous food. Itâ€™s opened for breakfast, lunch and dinner. It has won many Australian awards which also includes â€œOne Hat â€œ from the SMH Food Guide 09. To experience this restaurant at a reasonable price go for the special 2 course lunch menu with a glass of wine for $35.00AUD. Breakfast : We had breakfast at the Glass Brassiere once as the Executive Lounge was booked out. The choice of food was varied and the fresh juice bar being the best. Bars : The Hilton has the icon Marble Bar which is located on the lower basement floor. A fabulous place to have cocktails and listen to some live music. The Zeta Bar is located on the 4th floor and is fantastic winning numerous awards for being the best bar in Australia. However, the bar is only opened at 5pm which was a huge disappointment for us especially since we were entertaining overseas guests. There is another bar attached to the Glasshouse which is okay. Health Centre : Huge with every machine imaginable with steam/ sauna rooms and a 25metre indoor swimming pool. Overall : The Hilton is extremely popular and busy hotel. It has fabulous restaurants, bars and the staff are delightful and all are a credit to this establishment. We enjoyed our city stay and recommend it for people who want to be in the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nicx
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sydney Hilton for a conference weekend, and overall the entire stay was fantastic. It is extremely classy, everything being refurbished and remodelled recently. The service was great, however a little more warmth with the front reception staff wouldn't go astray! We had room service one evening, the service, value and food being excellent. The buffet breakfast is an absolute MUST, get in early to get a table with a fabulous view of George St. Will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Best sleep-in of my life”
Reviews.Author: ChicTraveller88
Reviews.Content: We booked as a Secret deal on Wotif and got the place for $189 a night. I would stay here again just for the Pillows, they were AMAZING. Also the black-out curtains mean you can sleep in undisturbed and in darkness until whatever time you please! Its a very central location and within walking distance to the train station which takes about 20min to the airport. The staff are very proffessional. Good for a getaway weekend, not so much for business as the glass wall between the bedroom and the shower is opaque and casts detailed shadows as you shower!

Reviews.Title: “Great modern central city hotel”
Reviews.Author: bmhnz
Reviews.Content: Well located clean, modern hotel. Fantastic staff all very friendly and helpful. The glass brasserie is a great spot for breakfast, a glass of wine or main meal. All the brasserie staff could not have been more helpful and friendly and i was very impressed with the trouble a certain staff member went to to help an elderly man select his buffet breakfast. The check out staff were not remotely interested in the fact that my Hilton Honors card had expired, he really could not be bothered offering any suggestions as to what I might do and I was reminded that I would not accrue any points given I had booked online with Wotif.com. This was the only disappointing experience.

Reviews.Title: “A Hilton break”
Reviews.Author: emstar3
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights here on an interstate jaunt. I chose it because 1 night was paid for by business and we decided to make a weekend of it and paid for 2 extra nights. The internet price was very reasonable compared to some other 5 star hotels. The hotel's had a recent makeover, a massive makeover apparently. Our room was smallish but very comfortable and what you'd expect from a Hilton hotel. The decor followed the current minimalist fashion - lots of white and glass everywhere, with a large timber bedhead to add some warmth. Lovely huge comfortable bed. But when will interior designers in this country be a little more adventurous and do something off the main page? There was a glass desk and chaise lounge so perhaps that was the design break out. The hotel service was excellent and the health club had great facilities, very spacious unlike some hotels which cram their gym into a pokey basement or other area. We enjoyed the pool which had saunas and steam baths and was not over fussy. We ate breakfast at the cafe in the foyer area, fine for coffee and muffins. Good helpful service there and nicely casual. The foyer is massive with about 3 mezzanines and a giant metal sculpture which twirled up through a couple of the mezzanine levels. My brother referred to it as the giant poo, and after that I was unable to regard it as anything else! It did bear a resemblance. Also I noticed a pleasant aroma wafting around the foyer, always there and always the same (and same as their Crabtree and Evelyn bathroom products) so I suppose the Hilton must have been pumping perfume through the vents somewhere. A couple of niggles. The telephone system, called Magic (for some reason, who knows why because it was infuriating not magic at all) made it complicated to call reception. You had to press a screen and half the time it didn't work properly. I didn't read the instruction booklet, but what's the point of a phone that you need an instruction book for? Dial 0 would've been good. The other thing was the TV/movie remote didn't work very well. This may've been because the batteries were running down, I don't know but we had a few frustrating moments trying to change and find channels. Oh and the elevator's numbering system!! It's hard to read the numbers which are laid out horizontally and were differently displayed in different lifts! Guests usually commented on it as they got in the lift, as it seemed to be a common problem finding the correct floor number! There was a panel with a vertical (more usual) layout but these were also hard to read and there was something about their layout which didn't flow. Apart from that we enjoyed our stay - great location in the centre of Sydney and close to transport and everything you'd want to visit. And check out the lovely old Marble Bar, underneath the hotel if you stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Big Reputation with Major issues in every department”
Reviews.Author: JasonFSydney
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights but decided to cut my losses after 3 nights. My review is as honest as i see it, some people might have different experiences but i am a guy who spends approx 50-60 nights per year in hotel rooms and expect quality service for what i pay for. Good Points * excellent executive lounge, free drinks for 2 hours at night and free internet (3 terminals) staff were nice and different to everyone else in the hotel. * Room service was quick and fast, tasty club sandwich. * Great location right in the middle of sydney * Glass Brasserie has 100's of wines to choose from * Gym is top notch with spa, sauna, steam rooms Bad Points * Checked in, staff seemed not interested and bored, didn't seem to care if i was a a Hilton Honours member or not. * Porters seemed confused and i had to prompt them to get my bags from the car. * Asked for Newspaper got nothing, had to call for a paper 2 days in a row. * Rooms are very small, properly the smallest i have ever come across in any Hilton globally. * Hallways smelled of bad odour not sure what the problem was? * Went to the Zeta bar for a drink, Spent $179 on 1 round of drinks than was told we had to leave due to a private function. Bar Staff did not make me aware of this when i walked in and were happy to take my money than made a group of 5 feel uncomfortable by telling us we had to leave. * Zeta bar and Marble bar seems to be externally managed by another group of people. To get access to these bars you have to exit the hotel and than line up with everyone else. I felt i was treated like a second class citizen, asking me for proof that i was staying at the hotel and cross examining me on what bars i go to in Sydney was disgraceful. I found out later that it was the manager's birthday and he had the entire place booked from 9pm onwards. Not sure what is more important, the Hilton's customers or and employees birthday. I ended up going to the Ivy down the road. *Went to book a massage and was told they were fully booked for the next 5 days, staff made no effort to fit us in. I assume they are managed by an external company too. * The beds feel like 2 single beds put together, seem cheap to me. I stay at the Hilton in Perth and Melbourne and have a different experience in these hotels, there beds are excellent and 5 star. To sum it up i think you can find better hotels offering bigger rooms and less headaches.

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: BrightonandHove
Reviews.Content: Great central location, ideal for my 9 year old daughter and I. Room small but clean. Staff really friendly. Breakfast looked impressive, but food poor. Would recommend (not sure about 5 star though).

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mr-Big-Cat
Reviews.Content: The Hilton is a great modern hotel in the heart of Sydney's CBD. We stayed on the 33th floor in a deluxe room. The room was quite small but I found it to be an acceptable size. The room is nice and modern and minimalistic, which I like. Same for the bathroom. Minibar is one of those automatic ones where you get charged if the bottle moves one inch, however it states they will bring a second fridge up for you if you wish to store your own items in there. Location is perfect. Right in the CBD. Entrance off George and Pitt street. 5 minute walk to Darling Harbor, 10 minutes to circular quay. Staff are all great; door/reception/house keeping. Breakfast was a bit up and down when we were there, sometimes great, other times just ok - service was always excellent though. Health club is first class, great facilities - everything you need. Do yourself a favor and head down to the Marble Bar in the basement. Its one of the best bars I've been to, nice and relax, looks great - not open Sunday. Overall a great hotel with great service. Perfect for the business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but with reservations”
Reviews.Author: Aviron
Reviews.Content: The location is great. The staff is friendly. The housekeeping was a bit inconsistent. I had one of the renovated rooms on the 42nd floor with great views. The shiny glass bathroom with separate shower and tub was beautiful but on the small side. The mini-bar is one of those â€œgotchaâ€� types where if you move anything they charge you, but they offer a free mini-fridge if you request it. Bed was full of fluffy pillows. Lots of electric switches to control lights and window shades but in fact they were not located in a particularly thoughtful way. Some on one side of the room, some on another. The health club is quite nice, but you need a $2 coin to activate the lockers. You get it back when you are done, but that was inconvenient, as I wasnâ€™t carrying any money to the pool and had to go back up to my room. All in all I guess I am giving the Hilton a mixed review. But overall I enjoyed staying there.

Reviews.Title: “I stay here every business trip to Sydney”
Reviews.Author: oc629
Reviews.Content: I'm an HHonors member so stay in Hilton's all over, but this is my favorite. (Tokyo Hilton in Shinjuku is a close second.) I try to book it every business trip to Sydney. Minimalist modern rooms; motorized blinds, glass bathroom, flat screen TV. This appeals to me but might not be everyone's taste. Some earlier reviews describe this as sterile and I can see that some people might see it that way. Location is good for business and holiday; close to Town Hall train station, walk to downtown area, Darling Harbor or Circular Quay. I can use the executive lounge which serves complimentary cooked and continental breakfasts, snacks and drinks during the day until late. Comprehensive gym in the basement. Zeta bar is a good place to invite colleagues for a night out - long lines on Friday night so it's popular with the locals as well. A friend with an assistance dog shared the room last stay. The Hilton accepted this without any drama; one staff in the exec lounge was at first unaware of the hotel policy on assistance dogs; one cleaning woman seemed to be terrified of the dog, otherwise Pema quickly become a favorite with the other hotel guests. Seems people are i) surprised and delighted to see a dog in the lift ii) perhaps missing their own pets. We asked a lot of the staff during the week and they graciously accommodated every request. Professional and personable.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we didnt have to pay for this hotel accom”
Reviews.Author: col5353
Reviews.Content: We were put up at the Syd Hilton by Qantas after they cancelled our flight to the USA during the engineers strike at the end of June 08. The service by the checkin staff was great, the room small but ok. The bathroom had a broken door, getting room service meals took 2 hrs, on complaining to the duty manager he said 2 hours was optimisitic. The following morning there was no hot water! Other pax checking in at QF that morning said their meals took 3 hours, and also no hot water. I'd suggest staying there only if they werent full. Location is great, and its looks ok. But overall I'm glad I didnt pay to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Li_Li
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here last weekend for a night, just to get away. I had booked on the hotel website and I assumed from all the press and descriptions that the whole hotel had been renovated. Not so! The room that I had booked was apparently a Guestroom which meant that it was refurbished but the bathroom was not renovated. Also, though I booked a King room, they gave me a tiny room with a double bed. The website was very misleading (and I do extensive research before I commit to a booking). I would not have booked to stay at the Hilton if I had known that I wasn't getting one of the new rooms. Anyway, after several conversations with reception, they eventually put us in a renovated room, which I believe is the Deluxe room. If they had not done so, it would have been an extremely disappointing stay. The hotel itself is very minimalist (which I normally like) but it was quite cold in atmosphere. The lobby and cafe are not very inviting. The health club is pretty good - a big pool and spa and 2 saunas and 2 steam rooms. However, the whole atmosphere of the hotel did not feel 5-star. The best part of the stay was the buffet breakfast at the Glass Brasserie. Highlights were chef cooked-to-order omelettes, a juice bar, very good expresso coffees to order, a large variety of breads and pastries, the atmosphere and view. I would not stay here again but would consider returning for the breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Central "Up Market "Sydney Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yukios
Reviews.Content: The price is a bit hefty but the position opposite the Queen Victoria Building in George St. is ideal.The rocks is about 20 minutes walk away and it is about 4 minutes to the Pitt St . Mall and about 20 minutes to Darling Harbour. The staff are friendly and efficient as one would expect and the hotel has two wonderful bars.The "Zeta" and "Marble" and in the lobby "Cafe Cino" isa good place for light meals and coffee etc. The standard room on floor 43 the top had a view and there was enough space for 2 but a wee bit small! I would go back there again except for the cost..but if you can afford the rates then you should be well satisfied.I might add that it has recently had a complete and thorough makeover, so everything sparkles and shines.

Reviews.Title: “Beauty is only skin deep”
Reviews.Author: antipodienne
Reviews.Content: I travel constantly for business, mostly overseas but also within Australia. Despite being a high level Hilton HHonors member I've started moving my international business away from Hilton earlier this year due to a range of concerns. I thought I'd try the Hilton in Sydney on a recent business trip just to see if it was any better at home, especially after a multi-million dollar renovation. Short answer: NO. I think this hotel has targetted itself very much towards Asian visitors. The bed was very low and ROCK hard, much like what you'd invariably find in Singapore, Vietnam and other major Asian business destinations. And as a previous reviewer pointed out, the king size bed is two singles pushed together with a thin veneer of a cover over them. Hideously uncomfortable. Mine were slightly different heights to boot! The decor was very edgy and chic - glass desk, lots of odd angles and interesting features - but totally unintuitive. Two examples: 1. The blinds open with a push button that's on the bed head, but clearly most people can't find the button because there is a great deal of bending and lifting on the sides of the blinds where people have obviously tried to pry them up manually (take the hint, Hilton....). 2. The towels hang nowhere near the shower and you can't even rest them on the toilet because the shower opens the wrong way. So you have to leave them hanging across the room and then drip water all over the floor on your way, making for a slippery walk back. Bathmat you say? Nice idea. But the shower door is too low to open over the bathmat, so when you open it, the bathmat is pushed way under the sink. Ridiculous. My worst criticism is that the food was the most ridiculously priced I've ever seen in all my years of four star and above travel. A basic cooked room service breakfast is $40 (two small eggs, two pieces of toast, bacon, some cereal and fruit. A curry with rice is $35. Wedges - yes potato wedges, not wedges of pure gold - were $22 a bowl! I was mortified by the price, and didn't feel any better about it when I saw the quality. Made without an ounce of care . Tepid food slapped unlovingly on a plate. My travel is not greatly constrained by budget, but I do expect value for money and most certainly comfort from a four star international hotel chain. This hotel delivers a chic edgy look that photographs beautifully but does not offer a pleasant accommodation experience. This hotel should be ashamed to charge what it does. It's certainly justified my decision to move the majority of our company's accommodation spend to the Marriott chain. Haven't stayed there in Sydney, but around the world they've got Hilton beat by a mile.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant city centre hotel”
Reviews.Author: pfz
Reviews.Content: My son & I stayed here for 4 nights in April. I have been to many large city big chain hotels in Europe & Asia and have to say that this is one of the best. The decor is minimalist, urban chic. The rooms are excellently renovated, every touch has been thought off eg no tags to hang on your door knob for do not disturb, just press a button and a small light lights up outside. Motorised blackout blinds make sure that the morning light does not wake you up. Smartphone with onetouch dial for everything. Staff were friendly & helpful at every touchpoint - check-in, the concierge. They even took the trouble to tell me which door of the hotel to use to avoid a few steps with our cases. Nothing was too much trouble and they gave the sense that they were proud to work there. Location is reasonably central, about 15 mins walk down Pitt Street will get you to the harbour front. Only downside is that many tall buildings block the harbour view - I was told that some of the rooms are unblocked but most would seem to be obscured. Restaurant was lovely - an Aussie friend bought us dinner and the service was personalised - they thought of everything, suggested what items might be suitable for a 13-year old and the steaks were excellent. Will definitely stay there on my next visit to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in a great location”
Reviews.Author: MarkLaurence
Reviews.Content: I had to find a Sydney hotel for an overnight stay due to business commitments. I went on to the Qantas website and booked through it. The price was fantastic because it was a Sunday night which is always cheaper. The buffet breakfast was included. It was easily the best buffet breskfast I have encountered in any Australian hotel. The room had been recently renovated and while small, included a king size bed and spa bath. In the late afternoon a fruit platter was delivered courtesy of the hotel. The hotel is in an excellent location right in the centre of the city. It is an easy walk to the harbour, opera house as well as all other central attractions. STaff were all efficent, friendly and courteous. I arrived on an early morning flight and they successfully found me a room and let me check in.

Reviews.Title: “A touch of class”
Reviews.Author: brucehannay
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel over the New Year period (Dec 2006/Jan 2007). The hotel is situated on the busy thoroughfare of George Street which runs directly down to the main harbour area (Bridge and Opera House) about a 20 minute walk but is also just a short 5 minute stroll from Darling Harbour, so in an ideal situation for exploring the city. It also has a red tourist bus stop immediately outside the main entrance so is ideal for that method of exploring the various city sites if you don't want to do too much walking. The hotel itself is a newly modernised facility inside. The reception area is a shrine to marble - floors, reception desk, walls etc, all being built in marble with an abundance of glass surroundings also. We stayed on the Executive floor which gives you access to the Exec Lounge throughout the day. Breakfast is served their for Exec customers and they also have a "happy hour" between 5pm to 7pm where alcoholic drinks are served along with snacks and canapes. Being honest you could almost "have dinner" with the food that is served during these 2 hours - it is that good and plentiful. The staff in this lounge are very friendly and go out of their way to make your stay as pleasurable as possible. The rooms themselves are a bit on the small side as far as space is concerned but not enough to make you feel cramped. This is hugely compensated by the modern technical feel of the layout and equipment spec. LCD TV, wireless internet (charge payable though) , and also the "One Touch" phone which you can use to ask for anything (Room Service, extra pillow, book table in restaurant, etc, etc). The batroom is large with usual amenities. Highlight though is a funky walk in shower that you could have a game of 5 a side football in !! We had dinner in the Glass Brasserie. Food was excellent. Service absolutely superb. Not used to "poshing it up" but this was an experience I won't forget. In and around the hotel there are plenty shops, bars and restaurants to choose from. Hotek is deirectly opposite the Queen Victoria Shopping Centre which as the name suggests is an old Victorian building but very tastefully laid out inside with some excellent boutique style shops. The highlight attraction whilst we were there was the Swarovski Crystal Xmas Tree that stands the full 3 storeys of the building. Stunning to say the least. Would highly recommend a trip down to the Darling Harbour restaurants in the evening. One of the restaurants we tried served the best tasting King Prawns I've ever tasted. It was almost as though they had jumped straight out the water and on to my plate (via the kitchen of course !!). Apologies can't recall the name of the retaurant but I would imagine they would all be of a similar standard, as competition for them being side by side, must be huge. All in all an ideal location to base yourself for a tourist visit to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Unrenovated rooms apalling”
Reviews.Author: Szikora
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Sydney for 5 days while attending a conference. The room was booked through conference organisers for a "reduced rate" of $299/night (room only). I discovered afterwards that I could have got a cheaper room through wotif. Whilst the webpage states that the hotel is newly renovated, only some of the room have been renovated and I received a unrenovated room. Overall, the room was tiny and not what is expected from a delux "newly renovated' hotel. The bath-tub was stained. The toilet flush worked intermittently and then continued to run water after flushing. The wardrobe door fell off its runners. The block-out blinds were sticking and wouldn't shut properly. Whilst the location was good (opposite QVB), there are plenty of other hotels in central Sydney that would offer better value for money and higher quality rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Top class - perfect if you want to spoil yourself”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaAndDavid
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hilton Sydney on the Easter long weekend 2008 and it was one of the most extravagant hotel experiences we have ever had. The service was unique, with the staff managing to pull off cool, hip and highly professional at the same time. On the Saturday night we had the hotel's famous 'Provocateur' package, which is no more innocent than it sounds. The package, that included lots of little surprises, also includes a selection of sensual foods in your Relaxation Suite and a bottle of champagne. We spent one night in a standard room, and two in the Relaxation Suite. The standard room was finished to the highest standard and every attention has been paid to the details, from the furniture to feature walls. It was on the smaller side, but still had room for a work desk and large bathroom. The Relaxation Suite was an absolute treat and is absolutely worth the price-tag. It provides lots of floor space and corner views of the city skyline. The bathroom in the Relaxation Suite was fit for Hollywood, including an amazing shower with 5 jets (a rain jet from directly above, three body jets that sit vertically on the wall, and a hand held shower head). The bath was the biggest two person spa I have ever seen, and you could easily fit more people in there if that's your thing. If you stay in a Relaxation Suite or on the Executive Level, you get access to the 36th Floor Executive Lounge. An intimate breakfast, refreshments throughout the day and cocktails in the evening make the lounge a perfect addition to a stay. Overall, the service was truly 5 star, the internal architecture is breathtaking and the rooms are the best in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Better hotels in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: SamfromSyd
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night in October last year. My friend made the booking and asked for a non-smoking room. When we entered our room, the first thing that hit us was the stench of smoke. We both became annoyed. Once my friend made a call, our request to change to a non-smoking room was granted. A person was sent to help with our bags, however he did not take any of our bags. Admittedly we had guests with us at that time - four girlfriends - however he should at least have taken the bags of my friend and I - those paying. I had packed an overnight bag and had been given gifts that day, so I had additional things as well (My lovely friends helped me move). My room key also did not work so I had to return to reception and get another. The room itself was small in comparison some of the other comparable hotels I've stayed at in Sydney. It had the usual things you'd expect from a five star hotel. I liked that the mini toiletries were La Source by Crabtree & Evelyn - my favourite out of the hotels I've stayed at. Aside from the room error and non-existent service from person that came up, we enjoyed our stay. The gym was the best one I've used in a hotel. It had a variety of machines, a mat work area (for stretching etc.), group exercise studios and a pool suitable for laps, as well as large steam rooms. Unfortunately the jacuzzi was out of order when I stayed there. Buffet breakfast was included in our package (which was about $300) and there was a lot of variety on offer. I quite enjoyed one of their custard donuts. My friend and I were also happy that check-out was 12. Would I stay at this hotel again? I'd recommend other hotels to those who want a five star stay, such as The Observatory Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BILLJ_GA
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 2 nights and really enjoyed it. The other reviews are correct about the size of the rooms, but they are quite functional. I used points to stay there, but would not have paid the asking price of $375/night. The location is great and staff was very professional and accomodating. One nice feature are the automated blackout blinds. I woke up one morning around 9AM thinking it was 2 am. When I raised the blinds it was a very sunny day. The beds are very nice too! If you were paying, you can probably find a hotel with a bigger room, but not as nice. If you are using points, I would highly recommend using them at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Central location and re vamped hotel”
Reviews.Author: Londone11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice during a recent visit to Australia Re-vamped rooms and excellent central location. Business / Executive floors get additional service and the Executive Lounge for the complimentary breaksfast and pre dinner canapes and drinks is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, so-so location for a tourist”
Reviews.Author: Califdavid
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel over New Year's so it was completely full. I had an executive room as a Diamond but it was tiny and more like what you'd expect at a Motel 6 than a Hilton. Executive lounge was packed, again because of the holiday but the staff did a good job at keeping the food and drinks replenished despite the crowds. The buffet breakfast downstairs was a better choice because of the crowds. The location is not my favorite as I would prefer to be closer to Circular Quay.

Reviews.Title: “stylish and good value”
Reviews.Author: annieo15
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an executive floor room. The recently refurbished hotel was very stylish. The room was modern and beautifully arranged, also very clean; the bathroom had a superb shower, but there was little space around the basin area. The executive lounge had free internet access, and provided generous canapes and drinks early evening, and a good buffet breakfast. We stayed over New Year and found it very good value compared to hotels located in the harbour area.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Cortleigh
Reviews.Content: Located in the middle of the shopping district and close to Hyde Park but about a 20 minute walk from the harbour, this is very much a business hotel with a really busy, noisy lobby. Hotel has recently been gutted and rebuilt and our room was very hi-tech and stylish but fairly compact. We did not like the bathroom which was cramped and had walls of semi-opaque glass! We found breakfast in the hotel expensive and would suggest you pop across the road to one of the cafes in the elegant Queen Victoria Building. This was our first time in Sydney and we loved it. We had a great views from our room but would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Rooms”
Reviews.Author: SamW_DC
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Sydney, in the heart of the CBD, is a well-located, well-furnished, comfortable hotel that has very good features and excellent staff. We stayed for 3 nights in Dec/Jan over the busy New Years period and the hotel, while busy, served our needs. We had a room on an Executive level. The rooms, while small, are ultra-modern, clean, and have good amenities. The standard ipod-compatible Hilton alarm clock is here, but so are LCD TV screens, a good minibar, ample desk / working space, and great bathroom amenities. The bathrooms are a strong point - great bathtub, a smartly lit shower (the light is waist high), and a decent vanity. Soft, fluffy robes are included. The views are good - we had a high-floor view out of two windows of Sydney's Town Hall. We were able watch the hustle & bustle of downtown Sydney as well as get some great jet-lag rest by blocking out the windows completely with the useful electric blinds. A big strength of this hotel is elite member access to the executive lounge (for HHonors members) - every morning there was a fantastic hot breakfast (eggs, sausages, toast, etc), including a wonderful display of fresh fruits, drinks and Australian jams. This was a big plus and avoided the hassle of us having to find breakfast places across Sydney every day (newspapers & free internet access are also available). Check-in and check-out were a breeze, the hotel staff seemed eager to assist and the hotel, located off two of Sydney's busiest streets was quiet, safe, and secure. The access to the lower-level LivingWell gym (which was fantastic, with a pool too) was very useful. As I stayed using HHonors points, I can't comment on value in terms of price per night (it appears on the expensive side) but for this particular trip, we had an excellent time at a fully-refurbished, perfectly located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: CCRP
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over New Years Eve with my partner (for 4 days in the end). It was a great hotel for exploring Sydney - both the shopping and harbour areas. The hotel was extremely clean and the room well equipped, comfortable plus modern. We got quite a good deal online and cost us Â£125 a night including NYE, which was a bargain considering other hotels were charging in some cases Â£500 for NYE and less than Â£100 for the other nights. The gym and swimming pool were also very good (and free). We didn't use the restaurants because they were too expensive. It was over Â£15 just for breakfast. Neither did we use the bars - did try and go to the marble bar but it was far too noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton - Exactly what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: SurfCoastJill
Reviews.Content: You can tell when a Hotel is well managed - This one is. I was there on a business trip, clean room, valet parking a bit pricy though at $40. A bit dissapointed Glass (Restaurant) was closed, still found breakfast in the temporary space good. The food was fresh and the reception staff above average.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hilton”
Reviews.Author: skiathite
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, in a great location in the heart of Sydney's shopping district. Yes the rooms are small but comfortable and well sound proofed. I' ve noticed that a few of the reviewers have complained of the room prices and would agree that they are quite high. But I checked the hotel website over several days and found that the prices change almost daily and inclusions also change. We ended up in one of the executive rooms with breakfast and pre dinner drinks and nibbles included in the price which was a considerable saving. The best experience of the stay was lunch at Glass restaurant where Luke Mangan is the resident chef/owner. The food was excellent, the service impeccable and the wine list impressive. It will be interesting to see the impact of his restaurant expansion into Japan and the US.

Reviews.Title: “Love that Remodel - Hate that Price”
Reviews.Author: theseatsaretooclose
Reviews.Content: The Sydney Hilton has a great central location, which is why I booked it on my first trip to Sydney many years ago. It was in really bad shape then with small rooms. Well, the rooms are still small, but after a remodel down to the studs, they are nice too.The beds, the bathroom (with translucent panels between the bedroom) the flat panel TV and the always appreciated blackout curtains (automated - pretty slick) make for a great night of sleep. The monorail to Darling Harbour runs in front of the hotel and the underground mall beneath connects you to the Town Hall subway station that can take you to the airport (if you don't fancy a taxi) or the main train station for a day trip to the Blue Mountains. The main shopping streets and pedestrian zone are also a block away, love that David Jones food hall for a quick snack. However, with the new fanciness comes a new fancy price. Prices in Sydney have certainly gone up over the past few years and the American dollars precipitous fall isn't helping. Taking that into consideration though, the Hilton still seems overpriced, depending on when you book it. Yet it will offer a good nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: squirrelone
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for 2 nights over a weekend. Overall it is a great hotel but I would probably not stay here again. Room: I have to agree with others that the design is slick and gives the best use of the space. The bathroom was nicely fitted out and it had nice modern features. Another big plus was the blinds made it really dark and if you were arriving from overseas and want to sleep during the day this would be no problem. However, the room is small and really only works for one person. I was upgraded to an executive room and have to say if I had not been I would not have been happy. I have satyed at the Westin before and even though last time it seemed a bit frayed I would return there as the rooms are much bigger and the bathroom is 10 times better. Staff: A nice touch when I arrived was the guy looked at my bags and then welcomed me by name. Check in for me was fast however on other days when I walked past reception the lines were quite long. Housekeeping was good, however we were surprised that turn down happened at 9pm and I heard housekeeping next door at 9am (as long as you have do not disturb should be ok). Then on final morning they vacummed the hall at around 10am which is fine if you don't plan on sleeping in but noting the number of do not disturb signs in other rooms we were surprised. Food: We had breakfast at Glass. The buffet was great however it is a bit odd that you get all your hot food but then order eggs or pancakes and this is delivered to your seat, so you if you want to combine then order and when the plate is served then go back to buffet. Also the service in here was not really attentive at all. It took a while to be seated and both times we went tables had to be cleared whislt we stood waiting. The atmosphere here is really nice and if they ironed out these issues it would have been excellent rather than good. Overall: In an excellent location downtown, great for shopping as across from QVB and other main shopping strip. Good if you were a business traveller staying alone. However if I had to choose a hotel to go back to I would return to the Westin, it has just as good a location, better rooms and better service. A great hotel, popular with overseas visitors just missing the X factor to make it an outstanding hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, awesome location”
Reviews.Author: JUDITHbristol
Reviews.Content: A great stay again. The hotel is located close to CBD, Circular Quay and Darling Habour so is great for business and tourists. Everything is within easy walking distance. Unlike many Hiltons it has a unique design element so you get the top class service expected of a Hilton but without the same old design. The designers have done a fantastic job. The gym, pool and spa are excellent, really big and never too busy. Glass, the restaurant is great although a bit pricey and they've got a very trendy bar on the 4th floor. The rooms are excellent, large and well serviced with turn down as well as normal service. I'm a Diamond member of the Hilton Honors scheme so was fortunate to be upgraded to one of their suites on the 31st floor which was agreat. I'm due there again in December so hope the service, hotel and everything else is as good as this visit! I'd reccomend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Designers have done a good job”
Reviews.Author: vague travellers
Reviews.Content: We loved the Executive room we had on the 38th floor. A bit on the small side but the hilton revamp has done a good job making good use of space and comfortable sleek furnishings. Very comfortable bed, easy to work and relax in and good service from check in, room service and elsewhere. The executive club was great in the evening --although I agree with the review that mentioned there was quite a bit of fried finger food. At breakfast though they couldnt cope with the numbers they had. While that happens sometimes, there was no call for back up or extra food or to quickly clear away plates for newcomers. A few businessman in more of a hurry than us were pretty unhappy. But overall that was just a wrinkly and if I wasn't looking for a big room or a harbour view I'd go back for a comfortable night.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stampy587
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel room + service. Highly recommended for a weekend stay in Sydney

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Mel P
Reviews.Content: free stay from my work. room fantastic,service also fantastic. food in the restaurant to die for. (dinner and breakfast.) close to everything. went to local pubs for drinks and a little shopping. few bars also in the motel,very nice. couldnt knock the stay would stay again and pay! great relaxing time. didnt expect anything less from the hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jrman66
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing hotel in an amazing location. The service, room quality, restaurants, bars and location could not be beat. I had a newer room with the bathroom re-furnished on the 40th floor. I slept like a baby the entire time because they have these electric blinds that block out all outside light. I loved the glass enclosed shower and the tub was deep enough to take a long relaxing bath. The restaurant on the 2nd floor serves an amazing (expensive) breakfast. The Zeta bar was world class and always attracted a good looking, affluent clientele. The hotel was located close to everything. Nothing was more than a block or two away. I also enjoyed having the coffee/food stand in the lobby. Overall, a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: dgbinpc
Reviews.Content: Our 30th Wedding Anniversary stay at the Sydney Hilton could not have been better. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the room was perfect, and our dinner at the Glass Brasserie was most memorable. A special thank you to the concierges. Their recommendations were perfect, even the "take the gloves for the bridge climb" even if you think it is warm out.

Reviews.Title: “Really Loved the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Public_Dave
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Sydney for 3 nights while attending a friend's wedding. It was a wonderful experience. The Hilton is very centrally located, right next to the Town Hall station (take the train from the airport, it will take you literally 3 minutes from the station to the hotel). It is also just opposite the Queen Victoria Building, and next to all of the great shopping in downtown Sydney. It boasts the Marble Bar, surely a tourist landmark in its own right. It is probably the most chic mainstream property I've stayed in for some time, and obviously takes pleasure in its own sense of designer-ism. The rooms are beautiful, glass, beautiful materials, very comfortable beds, and even a slightly naughty mirror facing the bed. I loved the automatic blinds which worked a charm - I got my best night's sleep in a long time in the room. Service was also excellent. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent hotel with very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Travelerr101
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of a kind. The rooms are goergous and the staff go out of thier way to make you as comfortable and happy as possible. This hotel has an exeptional restraunt and great breakfasts in the executive lounge. But if you just take a 10 minuite walk out the hotel you will be taken by the absolutley magnificent harbour topped off with the beautiful opera house and the great bridge. If you are going to syndey there is nowhere else to stay but the Hilton! It was a vacation to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent modern hotel with fantastic executive lounge”
Reviews.Author: lisak12
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Hilton Sydney using Hilton HHonors reward points and enjoyed our stay very much. The location in the CBD is pretty good although we would have preferred being a little closer to either the Rocks or Circular Quay. There is not much of a view to speak of other than nearby buildings, but we were given a room on the executive lounge floor and enjoyed the lounge a great deal -- the buffet breakfasts there are outstanding (scrambled eggs, bacon, pastries, yogurt, cereal, fresh fruit, cold cuts, etc.) as are the evening wine/cocktails and heavy hors d'oeuvres (samosas, dumplings, satay, vegetables & dip, cheese & crackers, chocolate mousse, cookies, fruit, etc.). Our room was very nice, with a flat-screen TV and a beautiful bathroom with separate shower and top-notch amenities. Staff in the hotel were extremely helpful. I highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Expected better”
Reviews.Author: JNW
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Sydney is a clean hotel in a good location. With that said, the staff at the front desk (on several occasions) were unhelpful, if not downright rude. I would not claim that I would never stay there again, but for the price I have no doubt that one can find equally good, if not better, accomodations elsewhere in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Very Central, Well Appointed”
Reviews.Author: hitlong
Reviews.Content: I frequently stay at the Hilton on business, somewhere in the order of twice a month, 5 to 7 nights a month. I find the hotel well appointed, although the room quality/size can vary depending on what you booked. I also find the staff exceedingly helpful and friendly. Being a Diamond Hilton Honours member probably doesn't hurt the rooms I recieve nor the service, but still one of the better Sydney hotels (and I have stayed in quite a few). Try the Zeta bar and also the Glasses restaurant, both I recommend. I have stay at the Hilton both with my wife, and with my kids and all members of the family love it too.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney Hilton”
Reviews.Author: MichaelNewZealand
Reviews.Content: A very plush experience, but... at checkin they kept on putting back the time at which my room would be available, the dried fruit provided (at quite a cost) in the room was rancid, and the room itself, while very glassy and beautiful, was overly technological with the touch-screen IP phone being the worst aspect -- oh so slow! -- and the downstairs Marble Bar seemed always closed when I needed it...

Reviews.Title: “Quality over quantity”
Reviews.Author: JudyfromBoise
Reviews.Content: We are Gold Hilton Honors members, and chose this hotel to rack up points, and in hopes of an upgrade. We did get upgraded to the executive floor/lounge. All of my comments are colored by this fact. I am sure i wouldn't be as satisfied if I payed the rate I did and didn't get the upgrade! PRO's: first class room furnishings including bedding, towels, great "La Source" toiletries etc. Innovative room design fabulous location with an easy walk to Darling Harbor or Circular Quay. Great gym, dry and wet steam rooms Very nice concierge lounge with a bountiful selection at breakfast and "dinner", and top shelf liquor. Staff very professional and friendly Good housekeeping and turndown CONs: Pool nor hot tub where heated to a comfortable temp, no real loungers at the pool. It is very much just set up as an exercise facility. Rooms are very small

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: dinnikate
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 days at the Hilton - it was great! Loved the blockout blinds - great for jet lagged guests. Convenient location for tourists too.Thought the bathroom was great. Small fridge, and if you move items to put things in, you are charged. We disputed the charges on checkout, & had no problems getting the costs removed.

Reviews.Title: “I like this place - but there are a few annoyances”
Reviews.Author: pommie01
Reviews.Content: I have no stayed here a few times for business - and there is no doubt that this is an excellent hotel all round. The rooms are very good - if a lttle on the small side. You've got to love the electric blinds.They are modern - and the beds are huge and comfy. It's certainly worthy of 4*s if not 5*s. A few quibbles - look this may just be a pet peeve of mine: - The staff insist on asking your what breakfast combination you want (ie hot or continental) before you sit down - how on earth do I know before I have been able to see what they have on offer. And when I refuse to commit - they get very agitated and keep asking me (around every 5 minutes) if I have decided yet. - The staff seemed to be trained to make very false "small talk" at every opportunity - and while that might work in the US - it's kindof inappropriate in Australia unless it's genuine. And this "chat" is in no way genuine ! - The inroom internet connection is a bit unreliable - and a bit slow by other hotel standards.

Reviews.Title: “a decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: dlwalt
Reviews.Content: I am just completing a six night stay at the Sydney Hilton. I booked my room through a conference website that I am attending. I am HH Diamond and was given a room on the Executive Floor. Nice room, nothing to special. The Excutive Lounge is nice, would like a little more variety when it comes to the breakfast choices - pretty much the same every day. Internet access in this hotel is horrible. They charge $29 a day for wired and $59 for wireless. The speed is slow and the connections log off. I used the free internet in the lounge but that was down for a couple of days as well. The health club is nice. Overall, this is a decent hotel. My main reason staying here was that I am a Diamond.

Reviews.Title: “Not worthy of five stars.”
Reviews.Author: wategos
Reviews.Content: Booked on Wotif for the weekend of 14/07/07 - 16/07/07. We were looking forward to seeing the refurbishment as we have stayed here many times over the previous years. The location is in the centre of the CBD and is a quick walk or bus ride around town and the wonderful Queen Victoria Building directly opposite. We drove to the Hilton and opted for the valet parking which turned out to be $40.00 per day. We were allocated a room on the twenty sixth floor with a nice view towards harbour if you stand directly at the window. The room was suprisingly small, the bathroom appeared to be unrenovated which was dissappointing. A large comfortable bed, thank goodness,as we needed to sit on it to do some computer work as the desk provided was a little too small. Internet access was $29.00 per day. We had in room dining, delivered by very pleasant staff. Room contains a bar fridge that charges for any item moved. You can obtain a tiny loan fridge. The breakfast at Glass was outstanding. Do not forget to use the "Do not disturb sign" as housekeeping was knocking on the door at 7.30am

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel, but could do with some tweaking”
Reviews.Author: poosie
Reviews.Content: I'll admit, I had very high expectations of the Sydney Hilton and by the by, the Sydney Hilton delivered but with a few small changes, it could be a truly brilliant hotel... Firstly, the good points: 1. Glass restaurant - we had a fantastic meal! 2. The room (standard room) - it is a decent size for Sydney hotels and had a great view. The windows block out all light and the bed was fantastic. Also, there was a good selection of cable channels and the decor was quite cool. 3. The staff were great - very friendly, down to earth and not pretentious. 4. Zeta Bar - great cocktails! What could be better? 1. Remove the cover charge for Zeta Bar for hotel guests - we stayed on a Saturday night, but couldn't quite believe that we had to pay a $20 cover charge!! 2. A make up mirror in the bathroom would be a handy addition. 3. The water pressure in the shower could have been a bit stronger, with hotter water. The toilet didn't flush all that well, either. 4. Get rid of 'automatic' mini bar - take something out of the fridge, and you're instantly charged! Not fair, but at least they left a little bit of room for you to put something in the fridge. In sum, I'd recommend this hotel - it is in a great location, the staff were fantastic, but with a few minor changes, it could be truly great!

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: TheImproperBostonian
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Sydney on the first night of our trip to Australia in mid-March 2007. Overall, we had a great - short - stay. Compliments: * good location in the middle of the city, across from Queen Victoria Market (10-15 minutes walk from Circular Quay and Darling Harbor) * very stylish decor in the rooms and comfortable bed * very helpful concierge staff * really nice gym Room for improvement: * bathroom could have been cleaner (I was too tired to complain) * no "early arrivals lounge" - we were arriving from the states and were able to shower at the gym instead (but it was difficult with our luggage) * mini bar items on a motion sensor - we accidentally knocked over a water and ended up getting charged $5! * not the ideal location for tourists as it is a 15 minute walk from other things

Reviews.Title: “a very stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: digger2
Reviews.Content: as mentioned in other reviews the new sydney hilton is light years better than its predecessor. It is hard to recognise it as the same hotel. the new entrance & lobby is stunning & the rooms are euro stylish & very comfortable with flatscreen tvs & great beds. my wife also found the spa treatments very good, if not a tad expensive. we have stayed at this hotel a number of times & really like the style & location. The breakfast is worth the money as it has a juice bar, with made-to-order juices, including wheat grass. They have a chef on hand to cook your eggs (as you would expect). Also they offer barista-made coffee such as latte, caps etc., not the usual push button machines. overall a very nice hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent city hotel”
Reviews.Author: Blankii
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel 2 weeks ago for a couple of nights on business. The hotel itself is nicely presented, with good attention to detail in the rooms and public areas. The rooms are a little on the small side, but they do exude a sophisticated and modern feel that generally makes them a nice place to be. I think given the shortness of my stay, it didnâ€™t really bother me that the rooms are a little cramped. I think itâ€™s worth noting however that a longer stay might put greater emphasis on this design deficiency. May be worth upgrading to a larger room? Service levels in this hotel were a highlight - certainly up to the Hiltonâ€™s high standards. I found every staff member to be polite and helpful, particularly the people manning the room service hotline. Room service was quick and efficient and the food was generally of a high standard. The breakfast selection was also excellent and very well presented. Access to broadband internet was also easy and the pricing structure was actually sensible for a change â€“ I canâ€™t stand it when Iâ€™m forced to pay for internet access I donâ€™t use, like hotels that require you to purchase access for 24 hours just so that you can spend 15 minutes checking your email. Fortunately, at the Hilton you only pay for the time youâ€™re actually accessing the internet. Overall, a very good city hotel ideal for business stays. If youâ€™re planning a short stay in Sydney then I would highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic as always!”
Reviews.Author: dogcowzz
Reviews.Content: Absolutely central location to Sydney's best attractions. Right in the city Centre, one block from Pitt street Mall. Nearby to the Monorail station and two city rail stations. Across the road from the Historic Queen Victoria building. Everything always goes well at this hotel. i have stayed there many times over the past few years. It's worth it to stay on the executive floors. Breakfast included on level 39, canapes and drinks before dinner complimentary newspaper and crabtree and evelyn toiletries. Room service is a bit pricey, but very tasty. Chocolate mud cake with raspberry sauce. YUM! Valet parking is also pricey, but ALL parking in Sydney is dear. The hotel room is very tastefully decorated in modern style. The room light dimmers are very romantic as is the large showers/bath. Loved the pillow menu! Will definately stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great way to end a honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: nyc2006321
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hilton after spending 4 days up at the whitsundays and it was just what we needed. Walking into our room we found some sparkling wine and chocolate covered strawberries. The room was so tranquil, modern, chic, and overlooked the QVB. Separate bath and shower were great. Booked a great deal through wotif for 295/night. Included buffet breakfast and drink vouchers at the marble bar. That night we went to marble bar and used our vouchers. It was a Saturday night and so the place was pretty packed. Live music, great cocktails, excellent time. Then stopped by a kebab place right around the corner. yum! Location is okay. Earlier in our trip we stayed at the mariott sydney harbour, which was much closer to the rocks and circular quay. However, this was a good change for us. It does get really quiet on a sunday night and most of the restaurants in the area were closed! Buffet breakfast was excellent, but we missed it the 2nd morning b/c the check-in guy told us breakfast went until 11am, but on weekdays, it only goes to 10am. When we informed the restaurant though, they recommended we just order room service on the house. That was a great gesture and we were so happy to eat. However, food was mediocre AND the australian breakfast would have cost us $40 per person! Outrageously expensive for the quality, especially when the fab buffet breakfast is only $38 per person. Overall, the stay was excellent and would stay there again in a heartbeat! Staff was very helpful and room was amazing. Marble bar was very fun.

Reviews.Title: “Sydney Hilton nice but expensive”
Reviews.Author: cegille
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very nice and conveniently located across from QVB shopping complex. Internet was easy to access. Room is very nice and comfortable, staff is unobtrusive. Love look of marble bar. We used all our hotel points to stay here for 3 days but they wanted $500 per day from a friend last night (she ended up booking a very nice room for $200 at the Sheraton 2 blocks away). Buffet breakfast is 34 Australian dollars. Even coming from London, we are finding Sydney prices high.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: k_lawton
Reviews.Content: We are nearly through our stay at the Hilton Sydney. We have been here now for nearly 2 weeks. Upon our arrival we were welcomed by name, a nice friendly touch. We were allocated our room and had been upgraded to a slightly larger room than we booked. We have been allocated a room on the 30th floor of 45. It is a large corner room facing downtown and with views of Hyde Park and Pitt Street from our room. The room serivce was excellent with the room cleaned and freshened every day, and on an evening turn down service with a nice touch of chocolates and a weather forecast card for the following day. (Even if it some times was slightly wrong) We were also given access to the Executive Lounge on the 36th floor, for breakfast and drinks and canapes in the evening. The staff throughout the hotel have been excellent. All staff were very friendly and helpful. Nothing was too much of a problem for them. From posting your mail to sorting out and evening meal reservation for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: markrandom
Reviews.Content: I am a HH Gold member. Was upgraded to the executive floors - perks include free breakfast + pre dinner drinks. Had a problem in the executive lounge with one of the staff. Appeared to be friendly at first however then blew it and did something completely stupid. We ordered two drinks, he asked my partner if she'd like to finish the bottle of wine. She replied yes. The idiot proceeded to fill the glass up to the very top until it overflowed. I complained so he came back with a straw! What a joker. Made an immediate complaint to the hotel management, asking for this employee to be removed from duty. Never ventured back to the executive lounge for the rest of our stay so don't know whether Hilton carried out their promise. My partner was really upset by the employees actions, it was a very embarrasing experience. Anyway, moving on to the review... The hotel is in a good central location within the city. Everything is walkable. Observation Tower is just at the back of the hotel. The hotel decor is very contemporary. All services are excellent. Friendly staff. Great concierge. Good room service. Zeta bar is worth checking out on the 4th floor. Won Australia's best bar award. Marble bar is worth visiting too on the ground floor. Has live bands. Fitness area is first class. 25 metre pool. Spa. 2 sauna's/ 2 steam rooms. Couldn't wish for better. This is a fantastic hotel, a perfect base to sample the cosmopolitan nightlife of downtown sydney. Experience would have been perfect if it hadn't been for the afforementioned incident.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish & sleek”
Reviews.Author: Member3
Reviews.Content: After spending six nights at the Hotel Ibis Darling Harbor, the Hilton was a welcome surprise. As Hilton Gold members, we were put in an executive floor room with access to the lounge (free breakfast & hors d'oeurves). The room: Room was sparkling clean, a good size, and the shower had great water pressure. The water temperature fluctuated a bit, never too hot nor cold, but enough to be noticable. Amenities were the usual Crabtree & Evelyn La Source. Requested a king bed but we got two twin beds pushed together with a visible line down the middle. One of the few hotels with sufficient reading lights. Mood lighting and night lights were a nice touch. Had difficulty getting the room cool enough. The lounge: Couldn't locate the spring water & hors d'oeurves on the floor as described in the exec floor booklet. Lounge was nice but there were too few tables (or too many people) and food was not replaced quickly or often enough. The staff serving drinks were friendly and helpful. Hors d'oeurves were typically fried bits or dried out quiche, breakfast was diverse with a great juicer. Miscellaneous: The elevators were inconsistent needing the room key inserted before moving. Didn't get to the pool or bar but heard that they they are excellent. Location: Well-located, across the street from the Town Hall train station in the Queen Victoria Building. You can take the train two stops down to Circular Quay, the hub of the ferry system. Lots of restaurants and shopping. Summary: A great stay in a sleek and stylish hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Sydney is excellent”
Reviews.Author: davepb
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights and loved every minute. Admittedly, the room was not large but very comfortable and contemporary. The Magic button service works a treat and enquiries were dealt with very efficiently. All the staff we encountered were brilliant and friendly. Nothing seemed to be a problem for them. We don't usually have dinner in hotels but decided to try the Glass Brasserie on our last night and was not disappointed. We had the degustation menu which was excellent with the waiter explaining everything we were trying but not being intrusive or condescending. The pool, jacuzzi and steam rooms were great. We went on Sunday afternoon and had the place to ourselves. Although the views are not brilliant the location is convenient and everything is within easy walking distance. Having also stayed in hotels in Hong Kong and Singapore on this holiday, the Hilton was all we expected it to be (from the website) and more. Thoroghly reccomended.

Reviews.Title: “style but no function”
Reviews.Author: ethelman2
Reviews.Content: Rooms tiny and designed to irritate. Why do Hilton hotels like frosted glass bathroom walls? Tiny bathroom had nowhere to put things- no surfaces that is. Hence you put things on the floor. When you need an aspirin in the middle of the night you put the light on, and wake your wife. On the way back to bed you collide with the hard edged glass table. A splendid remote control is provided, but it works the DVD player, and you have to try hard to operate the TV. When you want to dial abroad, you look in the oh-so-stylish book for help, to be told to look at the card by the phone. There is no card. It is in the back of the book. Staff OK, location fine. As a Hilton Gold member, I'd still avoid it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; too small rooms”
Reviews.Author: SingaporeGirl
Reviews.Content: A great location but the rooms, and especially the bathrooms, are way too small. If you're standing at the sink, you effectively block the entrance to the bathroom so no one else can enter or leave. (Nice amenities, however.) And despite the great location, no views aside from the neighbouring hi-rises, which seem to yield 1,000 voyeurs staring in your window (who knows if they can see in or not?). On the plus side is the location, close to Castlereigh Street, David Jones and Myer, not to mention Queen Victoria Building. A good taxi rank right outside the main entrance is a real plus. But despite having booked a non-smoking double room, having called in advance to ask for early (Noon) check-in, we were kept waiting three hours for the correct room upon arrival at 2 PM. Not very impressive for two Hilton Honours gold card holders.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Travellers99
Reviews.Content: We really couldn't have been more disappointed with our stay at the Hilton in Sydney. At check in we weren't asked whether we wanted a smoking or non-smoking room but when we walked into the room there was no mistaking it was smoking room. The smell was terrible, especially since we are two non-smokers.
