We proceeded back down to reception and asked to be changed to the non-smoking room which we had requested at the time of making the booking, only to be told that the hotel was completely full and that we could not be moved. The hotel staff offered to place a machine in the room while we were at dinner which was supposed to remove the smell. While we were sceptical we agreed to give it a try. As expected the machine made no difference whatsoever. My husband and I decided there was no way we could sleep in a room which smelt that bad - we felt we had no choice but to check out. There was no apology or offer of a refund despite the fact that the hotel had failed to deliver on our booking. We've stayed in a great number of Hiltons around the world and have generally been very impressed with the standard of the properties and the service. It's a pity the same cannot be said about the Sydney Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Just so cool!”
Reviews.Author: Saskia1976
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend staying at Hilton Sydney. I stayed there in February and was lucky enough to be upgraded to one of their Relaxation Suites. Apart from a wonderful room that I wanted to move into (it had an enormous bath in the middle of the room, and a huge flat screen TV in the living area) this also meant I had access to their Executive Lounge where pre dinner drinks & canapÃ©â€™s were free and in the morning a fantastic breakfast was served. All room telephones have a Hilton Magic button, where anything you want at any time of the day will be organised for you. Now this really worked, I was very impressed with the hotel's service. At night the coolest place to go out is the hotelâ€™s Zeta Bar, itâ€™s full of beautiful people (so wear your best clothes!) and every now and then youâ€™ll find a celebrity at the bar. People line up to get in, but as a hotel guest you have your own access lift which means YOU donâ€™t have to queue with the common people, which is always niceâ€¦â€¦ In summary: stay at the Hilton Sydney if you get the chance (and pay extra for the Relaxation Suite as it is stunning!)

Reviews.Title: “loved it!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sahr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton for the final two nights of my honeymoon in Australia and i have to say it is the best hotel i stayed at on our three week trip. We arrived two hours early for check in and it was not a problem, we were able to check in straight away. The concierge service was great (it is called the magic button), they were very efficient at getting us restaurant reservations. All the staff were great especially the bell boys, we never had to wait for our luggage. The room was really nice and modern with a really comfortable bed and good city views. There was everything in the room that you would need that other hotels don't think of .The bathroom was really nice and modern, it had a lovely shower and bath and a good selection of toiletries. The hotel is in a great location as it is central to the QVB, the rocks and darling harbour; it is also right by a monorail station so you don't have to walk if you don't want to. We did not eat there as there are so many other great restaurants near by that we wanted to try. The only negative was, that they made an error charging champagne that was a gift to our bill, however once it was mentioned it was removed straight away with no fuss whatsoever. I would recommend this hotel, to anyone who wants a lovely hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Upmarket, glossy, new Hilton is great.”
Reviews.Author: nzbased
Reviews.Content: We had 2 nights in an Executive Floor room in May and were very impressed with the decor. One downside is that due to the excellent Downtown location, room size has been sacrificed compared to most other Hiltons we have used, and the luxurious trappings just about managed to make up for the slightly cramped feeling. Very business-oriented with a smart workstation and leather chair provided. Electric window shades took a bit too long to close, while keeping your finger on the switch! Bathroom was very flash but could only be used by one person at a time, unless one was actually in the bath! Glass Restaurant was beautiful and a great place to see and be seen if you are a Sydneysider! Delicious and well-presented food. Its opposite the QVB and an easy walk to David Jones and all the other great shopping. Exec Lounge lacked atmosphere though, and the food was not as varied and substantial as other Lounges we have used. On balance, we would stay again, just hold back on the luggage!

Reviews.Title: “Slick and sophisticated”
Reviews.Author: ABD119
Reviews.Content: Everything you'd expect from an ultra-modern top-end hotel. We had the "relaxation room" - a junior suite with a large spa bath, amazing views of Sydney and all the amenities you can imagine (although we heard other guests complain that the regular rooms are too small). The staff was extremely attentive, much more than the usual chain hotels kind. Location is great, within walking distance to the Rocks and Darling Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Choose Another”
Reviews.Author: frombrissy
Reviews.Content: This is a large 5-star hotel that re-opened mid-2005 after a full refurbishment. While I don't hate the hotel, I certainly don't recommend it, as there are dozens of little things they didn't get quite right. Before I start, I should mention that I attended a function at the hotel, but did not try any of the bars/restaurants/other facilities. My opinion is therefore about the room only. My room was a reasonable size, although definitely not large. The fitout was very clean, new and contemporary with lots of glass and steel (which isn't really my thing but many people do like this style). I was on the 41st floor with my windows facing directly at the Citigroup building. I must complain about the size of the tiny bathroom. Prior to refurbishment the room must have had a shower over bath. They have now installed a separate shower in addition to the bath, resulting in a cramped bathroom and ridiculously tiny vanity. There is very little room to place your own toiletries. And where is the hairdryer?? In a cupboard under the luggage rack in the hallway! Why do I have to search in obscure places for everything in this room? Another example is powerpoints. I made my tea and ironed my shirts in the midget bathroom as I couldn't find convenient powerpoints (I called to find out where they were later, and the operator kindly told me what I had to move so I could find them). The pillows here were absolutely horrible - I am never fussy about pillows at all, but these were truly dreadful. Having said this, there is a pillow menu, but I would prefer not to trouble myself to obtain decent pillows. I also prefer a genuine King bed rather than two doubles pushed together. The bedside telephone is way too far from the bed which is just silly. Lighting is bad! There are lots of feature lighting and a lamp - so you have to turn on about fifteen different lights and the room is still dark! Very trendy but not so functional. I need full length mirrors to examine my appearance before I leave the room, and in this room there are two. However both have furniture obscuring the bottom half! Importantly - my room had terrible mobile phone reception - forcing me to make telephone calls on the hotel phone (and as expected, my four short calls cost over $50). The blinds take way too long to open and close, and you have to hold the button the whole time. This is annoying. My request for a late checkout (which was granted) must not have been recorded as I was interrupted in my room TWICE by housekeeping wondering when I was leaving. My office authorised a credit card for my stay - which for some reason was only applied to the first night of my stay? I HATE when the billing isn't right. To me it's the little things that matter. Individually, none of the above are worth complaining about really, but when you have so many little things that aren't quite right, you don't enjoy your stay. Oh, and there was a fire alarm early in the morning, which I suppose can't be helped but it was a bit much after I had been annoyed so many times. Sydney has many fine 5-star hotels and I will try a different one next time.

Reviews.Title: “A business hotel”
Reviews.Author: dbasha
Reviews.Content: I spent 7 nights at the Hilton recently. As a business hotel, I had no serious complaints about the Hilton although the service was disappointingly average. The Hilton's location was good, and all the necessary facilities were present. However, I would not recommend the Hilton for couples/families on vacation. The rooms are very small and are a tight fit even for couples, let alone families. Furthermore, the prices at the Hilton are very steep, and meals can cost the earth. My take on the Hilton is that it is focussed on business travellers rather than tourists. If you are in Sydney on vacation, there are far better options for the price than the Hilton, such as the Shangri-La, the Four Seasons and the Intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “Pure class”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Pure Class is what defines this superbly rebuilt Hotel. It is obvious that the a great deal of thought and planning went into this property when you first walk into your room. The rooms are extremely well appointed and space maximised. The decor is striking and there exists a good mix of modern colours with natural wood. Being a very frequent traveller (predominantly for business but also for leisure) I am very particular about where I stay. I can safely say that the beds and pillows at the Sydney Hilton are second to none. Another defining point is the "magic" call button on your phone. There is no need for you to figure out which extension to dial for any of your in-room requests - one button and they're at your service. That alone is enough for me to be impressed however the Hotel is the complete package; with the Glass Restaurant and distinctly different bar choices (be sure to check out the Marble Bar in the basement). Lastly, the location is spot on - basically close to absolutely everything that you need to see in Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “birthday treat -great room”
Reviews.Author: docduke
Reviews.Content: We visited the Hilton hotel in Sydney last year and we still have fond memories of the trip. we have visited many sydney CBD hotels and this has come out top since it was refurbished. We had beenwatching the building of the tall hotel on our frequent trips to sydney in the months before and kept saying how we would like to stay when it opens. so i organised a weekend away and upgraded the room package to one with a large plasma tv and big spa bath- and it was well worth it - it was the little touches that counted. all the staff were friendly and helpful- even when there was a staff member in the lift with me she said hello and asked how my day was in a nonobtrusive way. we didnt explore many of the facilities out of the room except for the wine bar and had some canapes there which were very enjoyable. we also used room service3 when we came back late from a show and were impressed with the soup and club sandwich which arrived on a heated trolley with white table linen etc. the breakfast was fabulous- if you wanted something you could probably find it on the display there in the buffet- all types of egg were freshly cooked there wase ven one member of staff to make up frash juicesof any combination... we would highly recommend this hotel and it's location is so central it is very usefuland it is great seeing the QVB building lit up at night...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ray Goldberg
Reviews.Content: The revamped Sydney Hilton shows the class Hilton can exude. While the rooms are fairly small (bathrooms even smaller) they are extremely well appointed. Great choice of bars from the quiet and relaxing Glass bar to the thumping Zeta Bar. Excellent restaurant. if you love wine, the Glass Restaurant caters for every conceivable taste. One HUGE wall of wines. Breakfast had a great choice and was well presented and tasty. NO canned beans and powdered eggs and decent coffe. Staff attitude is absolutely first class. we had a really relaxing weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Space”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a new Sydney landmark! I love the sense of space they have created with the use of glass in the public areas. The staff sport trendy Russian-vogue uniforms and are suitably helpful. The buffet breakfast in Glass restaurant is a foodies delight - try the bircher shots, they'll get you going! The rooms are very comfortable and trendy with all the mod-cons. Great bathroom products! The hotel is located across the road from town hall so is very handy to catch the train to and from the airport. Also close to the Pitt Street Mall and QVB for shop-a-holics.

HotelInfo.Name: Hilton Sydney
HotelInfo.Address: 488 George St, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
